author: {'steamid': '76561199652762098', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1868, 'playtime_at_review': 3237, 'last_played': 1712434218}
review:
Art of Rally is one of those indie gems that comes along every now and then that reminds us that less equals more. Within the sparse indie racing scene it's a true standout with its stylized visuals, top-down view and synthwave soundtrack. Just like real rally there is a simplicity to the game with few goals in mind other than racing to the finish line in the quickest of fashions. The physics engine is surprisingly competent, which in turn creates a demanding driving experience. There is also no co-driver to guide you along the stages, so you need to have razor-sharp focus and pay attention to the road ahead. At first, I found it strange and a bit daunting to be without a co-driver, but thanks to the wide camera view and long draw distance it's understandable why the feature was neglected.

The career revolves around a classic progression system where you move up the ranks and get access to increasingly better cars and more demanding tracks. The race events have randomly selected tracks, which helps to keep the racing action on edge at all times. With no way to tell what track will come up next, and no time to memorize them, you really have to risk it all to beat the AI (especially at higher difficulties). The locations themselves offer great variation both in terms of visuals and characteristics, and this of course adds to the challenge.

When you work your way through the career you will eventually unlock the outstanding Group B and A cars. These are the real icons of the golden era, and by the time you've worked up your skill to handle them the game truly transforms into something special. Long after I finished the career mode I found myself doing time trials for hours on end just because I had so much fun driving some of these monsters (especially the roaring Das Maestro).

All in all I can't recommend Art of Rally enough to anyone who has the slightest interest in racing games. It takes a while to warm up to due to its punishing nature and unique camera perspective, but once you get the basics down and become one with the car and track there is great fun to be had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198864384942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 61, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1711999204}
review:
AoR is my go to game for chilling out and jamming after a long day.  The scenery is beautiful, the music is excellent, and I swear, after a while you can feel the weight of the car when you turn.

It does have a pretty decent learning curve, and until you unlock vehicles with 4 wheel drive, can be a bit frustrating, but it is worth the initial difficulty hump.

The only thing this game is sorely missing, is a random rally button.  Right now, my options are replaying a career rally, which has the potential to upset your "showcase", or custom rally, which is great, except you still need to pick the region and courses.  If I could hop on, decide how many rallys and how many courses each, and let the game decide the rest for me, that would be amazing.

Either way 10/10, take a gummy and vibe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037429842', 'num_games_owned': 4858, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1694633264}
review:
Fantastisch, die ersten paar Stunden können durch die frühen Fahrzeuge etwas rough sein, aber da das Game einen starken Fokus auf Vibe, Atmosphäre und Feeling legt, kann man sowieso mit jedem Ergebnis das Kapitel abschließen und weiterspielen

Ich würde nicht empfehlen mehr als 1-2 Stunden am stück zu spielen, da es doch recht schnell monoton werden kann, aber ein perfektes Nebenbei-game um es alle paar tage mal 1-2 chapter weiter zu progressen

Würde mir aber tatsächlich NOCH mehr fokus auf den fantastischen Vibe wünschen, visuals und musik sind weltklasse - Rallyfans würden das bestimmt bescheuert finden, aber für mich wären abwechslungsreichere Maps und "out-there" Umgebungen der perfekte Bonus gewesen

8/10

a lot more ambitious than the previous game "absolute drift", i feel like the handling got a lot stiffer in this game, the cars are more responsive but the camera doesn't compliment the response. i love the environment, visuals, car models, but i feel like the handling is somewhat lacking or difficult when you start reaching high speeds and gamble on greed.
theres a lack of "feeling fast" with this game, but it is still wonderful to play with the beautiful worlds to rally in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997464220', 'num_games_owned': 1462, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1669745491}
review: Lo jugué hace ya un tiempo, pero el recuerdo que me dejó es el de un juego que engaña. Su apariencia amable y low poly esconde un fantástico y exigente título de conducción en el que no resulta complicado atisbar un amor incondicional hacia el arte del derrape. Fácil de jugar, difícil de dominar, es el típico juego un tanto áspero de entrada pero que agradece cierta insistencia por parte del jugador. En mi opinión, su gran mérito consiste en que con las limitaciones que entraña el desarrollo independiente, da con una fórmula capaz de satisfacer tanto a los usuarios más alejados del género como a los más exigentes. Aquí desempeña un papel fundamental la posibilidad de configurar la dificultad a través de diferentes parámetros (daños, estabilidad del vehículo, posición de la cámara, etc.) para adaptarse a todo tipo de paladares. Una pequeña pero auténtica joyita motorizada incluso para alguien que, como un servidor, nunca se ha llevado demasiado bien con el género de la conducción.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078001443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 97, 'playtime_at_review': 2572, 'last_played': 1711533401}
review:
This is one of the most stylistically refined games I've ever had the joy of playing. It's like stepping into the gold-tinted daydream of a kid from the 80's who grew up watching rally stages on TV. All the little details from the satirical sponsors to the parting crowds of spectators just fit in so perfectly, with this wonderful air of nostalgia to the whole thing. The overall aesthetic is incredibly well thought-out, and the result is something that's genuinely beautiful in its simplicity - it doesn't try to be more than it needs to be, and I love it for that. 

Gameplay and car handling actually has a lot of depth and weight to it. It's a very nice balance of arcade and realism, but it's also *much* more complex than I expected going into it for the first time, with what feels like actual weight-shift simulation as the cars drift and corner. It's tricky, with a bit of a steep learning curve, but overall immensely satisfying and very manageable with time. 

It's not all perfect - Group 4 cars in particular feel very slippery, but once you make it into Group B everything feels twenty times better (and it becomes clear where the dev's heart lies). It runs well but it's not incredibly well optimised, which is strange for a low-poly game, and tends to stutter occasionally if you play for too long. 

But the complaints are minor. It's a genuinely beautiful game with a surprising amount of depth and a pleasant complexity to the handling. Plus the soundtrack is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349959858', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 348, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1711917412}
review: very fun game if you enjoy rallying. and especially if you have a weak spot for underrated rally cars. but of course the most iconic race cars are here as well

author: {'steamid': '76561198093493679', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 102, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1711485680}
review:
I wanted to try some rally driving but lack wheel and pedals, so more serious games were out of the question. Bought this because of the good graphics, all the famous cars and good review on Pelit-magazine.

The cars are recognizable and they feel different to drive. What might work with FWD doesn't work with RWD, and AWD cars are in league of their own. Learning the courses take some time, and you better not to push too much if you want to make good times. As they say "slow is smooth, smooth is fast" =D

Great driving game that really catches the soul of "art of rally".

author: {'steamid': '76561198991154074', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 70, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1712212748}
review: if you want a simple rally game that is cheap and or easy to get into, this is where you should be. the game is quite fun. The Proverb of "Easy to learn, but hard to master" rings very much true in this game. now when it comes to the soundtrack. If you love synth, disco and eurobeat. The album is right up your alley. I first heard about this game shortly before release and had been keeping an eye out ever since and I have not regretted this purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986558772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 289, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1712444610}
review:
Such a good game. It's difficult for sure, but it sucks you in and doesn't let go.

I play it after work to clear my head, and it really just forces me to concentrate super hard, all the worries of the world gone the moment you hit the gas pedal. And when you get things right, it's so rewarding! Just driving around in free roam mode is phenomenal by itself. After I'm done, my mind is clear and I feel awake and alert.

The game controls are well put together and once you start to understand the physics, it just keeps getting better and better. All the cars handle differently, so you kinda need to try them out and give them a test drive before you jump into the career race. A good analog controller is a must. Also works on steam deck, solid 90fps if you drop some graphics settings. And it's gorgeous.

I love the fact that I'm only racing against myself, and how far I'm willing to push the limits. Then at the end you see how you compare to the ai opponents.

It's truly magnificent. Got the DLC already. *Chef's kiss*

author: {'steamid': '76561198357399164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 351, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1711425273}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969767972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1712103819}
review:
One of the most aesthetically pleasing games I have ever played. It is my favorite rally game, ever; its 'simple' and stylized design pair well with excellent sound design and drifting physics that belie a much more intricate game.

Don't let the cutesy looks deceive you: this is a game that rewards technical mastery, but is one that eases you into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199519549259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1710916843}
review:
このゲームは一貫して空からの俯瞰視点でラリー車を操作するもので、慣れるまでは若干とまどうが、コースの見通しはきくので、コドラなしで十分いける。
ただし、鳥の視点なので、走行中のラリー車が小さいことから、スピード感や迫力にはやや欠ける。エンジン音や走行音などはまずまず。
個人的意見だが、このラリーゲームの醍醐味は、プレイ後のリブレイ鑑賞に尽きると思う。当然カメラ視点の変更も可能で、いろんな画角から走行リプレイが楽しめるほか、スピード感やエンジン音も迫力満点で、見た目のカジュアルさとは正反対のド迫力ぶりに、思わず何回もリプレイを観てしまうほど。特に、後方に吹き飛ぶ砂煙や塵、減速時のバックファイヤーはラリーの臨場感をいやが上にも高めてくれる。
なお、ラリー車の操作感は決してカジュアルではなく、シム寄り。最初はアクセルベタ踏みはおろか、コーナーをドリフトで抜けていくのも困難だが、慣れてきてコツを掴むとシム的な操作感で飛ばせるようになる。ゲーム内のコントロール設定とハンコンの設定が重要で、これがうまくいけばとても楽しくなる。
なかなか奥の深いゲームだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026976069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1710928210}
review:
ポップな見た目に対してかなりシビアな操作を求められる
挙動はGTシリーズのラリーより明らかに難しく、Dirt Rallyシリーズのリアル寄りに感じるレベル
アクセルを踏み込むのを溜めに溜めて、連続コーナーを抜けきってようやく踏み込むような
正真正銘のラリーゲーム

author: {'steamid': '76561198360707210', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1710740519}
review: 我直说了，尘埃拉力赛2最低19块钱，打折的时候豪华版也只要贵一点，这破游戏的价格甚至还能先买2.0再买尘埃4.玩这个游戏的首先是愿意休闲的，其次是看得上这个卡通美术的。美术很好，休闲也不错，但是能对得上这么多钱？车也是答辩驾驶体验，低组别提速蜗牛爬，刹车直接粘地上，这无视路面的刹车效率隔壁F1都哭了。狗屎分段转向，摇杆打死前轮会分两段转，先慢慢的转一点，然后突然打死，有这转向大马力后驱别开了，根本救不回来，很难想象制作组自己怎么开这B车的。如果你和我一样喜欢这个美术和音乐（对，我全款买了音乐包），我建议你买来体验体验，然后考虑下要不要退款。如果你对游戏感兴趣，但是觉得不值这个价，那太好了直接无视这游戏。祝您游戏愉快~

author: {'steamid': '76561198010279008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1703977789}
review:
very accessible driving mechanics and a beautiful art style.  i was hooked as soon as I saw you can unlock the AE86.

Also there could be a LOT more pedestrians on the track when you race in Group B, to emulate those iconic photographs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961095794', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 93, 'playtime_at_review': 6320, 'last_played': 1712446281}
review:
My favorite racing game bar none. If you love sim racing / rally games but either can't afford a sim rig or don't want to break out a wheel, pedals, and e-brake setup every time you want to play, this is the game for you.

There's a steep learning curve, but it's 100% worth it. I didn't truly love the game until I switched to manual transmission and learned how to manage my throttle / braking levels on different terrains / elevation changes (and when to use the clutch / ebrake), but once I did the driving was incredibly rewarding. The amount of control you're given in Art of Rally ruined other simcade games  (Forza / GT) for me.

Also the visuals and soundtrack are fantastic! But the driving mechanics are the star of the show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131011916', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1709487926}
review:
Jeux interessant et mignon mais je n'ai pas accroché à la physique et la POV.
Je le recommande quand même car il est très mignon et retrace l'histoire du rallye

author: {'steamid': '76561198059704717', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 120, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1712085078}
review:
Just finished the main career after 18 hours, had a blast. Highly recommend playing without traction or stability control assists on. I'll be going for 100% achievement completion now

The developer clearly knew what they wanted to achieve, and they did it am impeccable job of doing it. This game's identify is as solid as a rock, it's a no-frills rally experience that doesn't seek to simulate rallying, but rather capture the essence of the excitement of rallying. The art still fits this goal perfectly.

author: {'steamid': '76561199028260980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1711259650}
review: Great racing game. Really fun game play! The history behind rally, the cars, the car manufactures, the race records, are given though out the career mode, and it is super interesting to read. A great touch to an already great racing experience. One part arcade, one part sim. This is game a little gem with, a kickin synth soundtrack. I bought this as a gift for two other friends...don't miss it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056528607', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1710607277}
review: A cute little love letter to Rally Racing with a pleasant style. It does not hold your hand with the driving parts so don't feel too bad if it seems like you suck for the first handful of hours. Progression isn't locked behind winning, so sit back and enjoy the scenery and cars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047021673', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1710559081}
review: Infelizmente não vou poder recomendar esse jogo, aparentemente ele tem uma incompatibilidade com o meu setup, que é simples, mas roda jogos bem mais pesados sem problemas, mas nesse aqui a ventoinha da placa de video vai a milhão, coisa de 3000rpm,  a temperatura sobe pra casa dos 80+, e a utilização da gpu vai pra 100%, com isso meu pc fica parecendo que vai explodir a qualquer momento e do nada perde o video, aí eu tenho que fazer um desligamento forçado e quando eu ligo denovo tenho que reinstalar o driver de video, zuado viu, f0da que queria poder desfrutar do jogo, mas não consigo

author: {'steamid': '76561198056971848', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1709795782}
review:
[h1]『無料だったら遊んでもいい。金を払うほどじゃない』[/h1]
　45%セール時1540円(2024/03)です。手軽に遊べてあまり深入りしないので、パパッとゲームを済ませたい方にはいいです。が、このゲームを極めても現実スキルに反映するわけではないのが微妙なところです。せっかく見た目もいいんだし、コンセプトや収録音は素晴らしいので、きちんとリアルシム化して欲しい。
　ともかく、買ってまでやるようなゲームではないです。いいゲームなんですけどね、もうちょっと・・・ワンコインになるくらいの価格じゃないと強くオススメはできません。

[h2]極限までシンプルなレースゲーム[/h2]
　程よいサイズ感のオープンワールドコースが何種類かと、キャリアモードで攻略することになるレースコースが用意されています。
　オープンワールドにはアイテムが設置されているので、それを見つけて集めるのが目的。（攻略サイトを覗いたら1ステージあたり15～30分で全て集め終えます。）
　レースでは、リトライをしないようにリザルトで1位をとれると、車の隠し塗装などが手に入る仕組みです。コンプリート具合がわかりやすいのもいいですね。

[h2]ゲーム的な操作性[/h2]
　操作性は、正直もっとリアル寄りにして欲しかったです。重力係数が異様に軽く設定されていて、マシンがふわふわと浮き上がります。チョロQをそのまま運転しているかのような軽さ。（チョロQシリーズとは操作性は異なります。）
　一応、初見でもそれなりに運転ができて、難易度ノーマルならクリアもできていたので、程よい調整はされているようにも思います。ただ、全体的にゲームライクを抜けてはきません。軽さの影響でしょうね。ここばかりは、重力をいじれるMODでもあれば大きく変わるような気もします。
　もしくは、もっと初心者に向けてPS時代の初期チョロQシリーズレベルの操作難易度にするべきではないかと思いました。カジュアルとリアルシムで振り分けがあってもよかったんじゃないかな？

[h2]総評[/h2]
　ゲームデザインはとても優れているのですが、どうもいまひとつ。。。という感想です。走ってるときの爽快感や力強さが無いんですかね。「うおりゃああ！曲がれ～～！！」と言って案の定コースアウトorスピンしちゃう。「うっしゃー！スピード乗せて飛ばすぜぇ～～！！」と言って脇道を踏んで飛び上がりすぎてしまって横転。繊細に操作すれば勝てるんですが、もっとこう、ダートを走っているときの少年心をくすぐるものが欲しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198060681159', 'num_games_owned': 1575, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4544, 'last_played': 1709583484}
review:
It's gonna be a maybe yes from me.

To begin with the positives.
The general graphical style is pleasant and easy to read.
Car physics strike a good balance and cars definitely feel different from one another as do FF vs FR/RR vs AWD and different surface and conditions
Audio is great for the most part (with one major exception but I'll mention that latter)
The campaign portion is nicely paced, though slightly lacking at the upper end (wouldn't mind a super expert one with all 12 stage rallies and free choice of vehicle)
The car selection isn't perfect but it's so damn good I think it's easily the best I've seen in a rally game.

Now the less good part
From how the game is presented it would seem it's targeted at people not really that familiar with rally games and aims to introduce them to it in a slightly different way, while still retaining a certain level of interest for people familiar with rally games.

However the game is actually really punishing to anyone not actually decent to good at rally games and by design makes some parts of that harder.

First the camera, it's not nearly as bad as you might think even if you come from even a hood / bumper / cockpit camera hardliner perspective, takes a bit of tweaking and getting used to but definitely decent, except for one single thing, you cannot gauge with any reliability that your wheels have lifted off the ground, this leads to some crashes / rolling over not being really avoidable, coupled with the artstyle masking bumps on the side of the road it leads to you having to learn stages to a degree.

Second is the auto transmission being absolute trash, it's the worst I've had to play with, literally losing seconds to the game deciding to not downshift when you're at a speed that would be fine two gears down is infuriating, lack of semi auto doesn't help here.

Third is the AI being extremely inconsistent, you can have top 1% times, and come second, you can have top 50% times, and wipe away the competition by a decent margin, unless there's some sort of autotuned AI difficulty the normal AI should not be that extreme, it's unpleasant for me but I'd assume a less competent player might actually feel really bad to see he still got beaten when he drove the best he ever has.

Fourth, the auto recovery when you go "too far" off track is fucking absurd in some corner, as in it's way too close to the actual road, in some case you almost have a tire on the road and still can get reset.

Fifth, Finland is disgustingly easy, yes I'm that upset about that, Finland in any other rally game I can think of is at least among the hardest rally in the game if not the hardest by far.

Slightly more minor nitpicks include the turbo flutter on some car sounding like someone scratching paper with a pencil, some track, camera and conditions leading to you getting flasbanged by the sun in some part, the RWD cars in Group B are just there to make you feel miserable when you chose them over AWD cars and might deserve a category split just for that.

In conclusion, if you're fine with getting a bit roughed up by the game and really like the different approach to rallying then go ahead and get the game, if you wanna get introduced to rally, do yourself a favor and wait for Sebastian Loeb Rally Evo to go on sale, nab the deluxe edition and 100% it, it's not flawless, but it does a far better job at easing you into rallying on top of being 3 bucks only, and you get the second best car roster of the rally subgenre on top (not counting modded games obviously).

author: {'steamid': '76561198356884804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1620, 'playtime_at_review': 18186, 'last_played': 1712072327}
review:
Suprisingly realistic physics under the hood for the artstyle.
Looks good, feels good, shifting manually is better than auto (and auto is realistic)

Hour count got to 300 bc its just good to hop on and relax 
Instant recommend if you want a racer you can just hop on and drive but also get serious about

Whats really smart from typical racers is that perfection isnt demanded, you dont race like a time trial. If you mess up, recover and continue quickly. That is seriously missing from most racing games where the long term is too short for mistakes to be forgiven.

author: {'steamid': '76561199557013275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1708573964}
review:
First you must finish. 
This game is great at frustrating you over nonsensical turns and bumps, but it is predictable and it is lots of fun once you "get" it. It took me 10 hours on keyboard to stop spazzing out, and now I cannot stop polishing my best results and going full throttle through some really convoluted sections. I love you, Finland; also, **** you, Finland.

Highly recommend.

*And Linux performance is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561199179203731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 315, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1711638290}
review:
刚上手，过来留念(*^▽^*)

硬核但好玩的开车游戏（我用的手柄
花个几小时适应，你会窥见《拉力的艺术》

刚接触的时候各种推头，拐个弯得花一年
现在稍微熟练一点了，感觉还会有很长的陪伴时间

我甚至开始看真实的拉力比赛实录来模仿专业车手的操作
开始接触wrc

感觉这个游戏又点燃了一个男孩的赛车梦

author: {'steamid': '76561197970547021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1707593272}
review:
Almost gave up early but glad I didn't. 

First starting out, it felt like the controls were wooden and stiff, the cars were unresponsive, and the camera angles were always messing me up. I couldn't control the cars, kept crashing into things, and generally wasn't having any fun.

Having stuck with it a bit longer, I came to realize that the game is closer to a sim than an arcade racer and the physics model is heavily focused on vehicle weight transfer. After that, the rest fell into place.

Hints:
- Control problems? You're probably using too much throttle and not slowing down enough for turns. The physics engine punishes you for constantly flooring it and rewards you for easing into the throttle and using part throttle in a lot of situations. 
- The brakes are exceptionally strong on all cars on all surfaces. Use them!
- You don't need to Fujiwara Takumi every single turn.
- Understeering in a slow corner? Lift off the throttle entirely to get the weight back over the front tires.
- The game punishes you for crashing. Even the lightest collision almost always results in a 180 spin. Avoiding offs in the first place is the best strategy. 
- Loss of control and pendulum-ing all over the place? The camera lags behind the car's movements, and amplifies the situation. Lifting off the gas prevents the pendulum effect.
- There are no pace notes and sometimes you can't see the hairpin or decreasing radius turn coming up ahead. Discretion is the better part of valor.
- Hate the rainy stages? They're the perfect place to practice your throttle control and tons of fun once you get it down.

Things I like:
- Charming aesthetic
- Nice variation in levels and cars
- Music selection
- Once you get a hang of the physics model and start putting it all together, it becomes super rewarding to chain together an entire stage of perfect corners. Stick with it!

Nitpicks:
- Camera lag / sometimes you can't see what's coming up ahead
- Occasional performance problems / FPS drops
- Cuts are allowed but sometimes the game questionably resets your car when you're only a few feet off the road

author: {'steamid': '76561198448089042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1707198913}

author: {'steamid': '76561199502560738', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1711552698}
review:
[h1] Amazing visual style, good handling (in my opinion) and great soundtrack. This game is a good arcade rally game. [/h1]
Please note, I played art of rally on a controller with default assists and with vibration off.

[h2] Graphics/Visual style [/h2]
This game is pretty simple graphics-wise compared to other games, but it fits the style of the game really well. It's different from other racing games, which is a good thing when almost every other racing game looks the same. I find the graphics of the game very nice to look at.
One thing to note is that this game has massive pop-in.

[h2] Difficulty [/h2]
This game has some difficulty settings, and I found this game relaxing and often played on a easy difficulty compared to what I could manage. The game doesn't give rewards for higher difficulties as far as I know, and that's fine with me, because that allows me to play on a more relaxing difficulty. I often played on the "novice" difficulty, when I still was able to win a rally on "master" difficulty.

[h2] For the wheel players [/h2]
If you didn't know yet, art of rally DOESN'T have any force feedback. When I tested the game on my G923, I didn't feel comfortable with it. I do play a lot of "realistic" driving/racing games, often in interior view. With no force feedback and the camera being far away from the car, I didn't feel a good connection with the car.

[h2] Camera [/h2]
Art of rally DOESN'T have an interior or hood camera. The camera is far away from the car, and works well at what it's supposed to achieve: seeing the road and upcoming turns. 

[h2] Performance [/h2]
Art of rally doesn't seem like a very heavy game to run, but for me, the game had some bad performance at the start. If you start to have performance issues after playing for some time (for example 1-2 hours), set the vegetation renderer to instanced. For me it fixed the issue, and the game runs pretty well.

[h2] The Artist's view, photomode [/h2]
The photomode of art of rally is very good in my opinion. It really has everything I would want from a photomode. I enjoyed taking pictures of different moments when driving. You can enter it by pausing the game at any time while driving and choosing "Photomode".

[h2] 2 important things to know [/h2]
[b] At the time of writing, art of rally doesn't feature a co-driver nor pacenotes, nor multiplayer. You can drive a stage with a ghost, but no players you could crash into. [/b]

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Art of rally is the best arcade racing game I have tried, and I don't have really have anything to complain about it.
I would give art of rally a [b] 9/10 [/b]. The game is pretty short, at the time of writing this I have completed the career mode and gotten all the collectibles in freeroam, other than australia, which is dlc, and I am 1 achievement away from perfecting this game. I do recommend checking some other reviews, since most of this review is just my opinion. Thank you.

Edit: After 24.6 hours of playing, I have now gotten every achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035541919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 33, 'playtime_at_review': 2425, 'last_played': 1711673244}
review:
If you love Rally games this strikes the perfect balance between Realistic rally driving and arcade. It is the perfect rally game to tune out and decompress for me.

Unfortunately the most recent updates have introduced a mechanic that causes most unstable/peaky vehicles to randomly oversteer, seemingly out of the blue (even on straight sections). Its random nature introduces a really unfun mechanic to the game. (I hope the devs see this and fix it in the future). 

Otherwise one of the best rally games I have played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030828820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1710680547}
review:
Juego muy divertido, Pasas varias etapas, primero quedas fascinado por el arte y vas chocando con todo porque es precioso, más tarde cuando quieres empezar a ir rápido te das cuenta de que es más complicado de lo que piensas, y por último y después de mucho jugar y a medida que vas conociendo las etapas empezarás a hacer trazadas y derrapes del mundial de rallies. 
El control en mojado es muy divertido, baja el agarre muchísimo y con los coches mas potentes tendrás que ir a medio gas para controlar el coche, un acierto total.

Lo no tan bueno:

Este apartado es a título personal. Sé que es un juego arcade, pero eso no tiene que significar que puedas hacer cosas inverosimiles, me refiero sobre todo al freno, el coche los puedes poner de 200 a 0 en una fracción de segundo, yo he tenido que bajar la capacidad de frenado hasta el 20-30% para que no parezca un para y arranca. En mi caso con un gamepad de xbox one tb he tenido que bajar la sensibilidad del volante al 20% para poder ir por el sitio y que el coche no se vuelva loco al intenta contravolantear.
Como último apunte negativo he de decir que el sonido de los motores es quizás el peor apartado del juego, un sonido sintetizado bastante feo.

Conclusión:

Un juego que va directo al corazón de los amantes de los rallies, tiene pruebas míticas del mundial como el rally Safari (llamado kenia), otras mas nuevas como el rally de Alemania, cerdeña, japón, suecia etc, todas muy bien localizadas y los que podrás reconoces los tramos más característicos de cada localización.
Tramas en seco, mojado, nieve, con niebla, de mañana, tarde, puestas de sol, nocturnos, todo hecho para el deleite del aficionado, Tiene detalles buenísimos como ver al público haciendo fogatas por la noche para calentarse, como ese publico invade la carretera y se aparta en el último momento como en los años 80, un sin fín de detalles que hacen de este juego un imprescindible para los amantes de los rallies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985065894', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1705745889}
review:
A game that strives on it's handling alone and still gets a reccomendation from me despite:
UI being the laziest programmer art imaginable. Not hard to make car specific gauges and it would add a lot.
Level design being literally a road put on with spline, terrain conformed to it and maybe some random buildings, trees and impossible cliffs put around the map without a thought 
Gameplay wise level design feels practically the same as locales track really doesn't feel too different nor have any personality. If you removed all names, art assets and only left the road, tracks wouldn't really be identifiable.
Some menu and UI bugs, but nothing gamebreaking

Despite all that, still worth it cause the cars drive good. 
Use that money to hire a damn artist, dev.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333977799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1706547687}
review:
A competent racing game, just not a very good [b][i]rally[/i][/b] game. The irony is thick.

Pros:
+ Physics. The cars are weighty and different enough from each other based on rally class; they are a joy to maneuver over the many terrain types
+ Graphics. The neon pastel colours fit the minimalist aesthetics of the UI / cars / terrain perfectly
+ The sense of progression. Unlocking cars and new liveries while advancing from one rally class to the next is satisfying
+ The cars. Most of the iconic rally cars from the '70s up to the '90s are in the game, easily recognizable (although with silly names and cringe descriptions that subtract from the immersion)
+ The music. There is a variety of styles that suit the arcade-y nature of the game well
+ Custom car liveries

Cons:
- No keys rebinding. This, along with the next two points, is absolutely inexcusable in this day and age
- No pace notes, either as audible or visual indicators. In a rally game. Let that sink in
- The dev obstinately refuses to allow for custom car and driver names, invoking the ROI (!) and the mess it would make on the online leaderboards. Quickly and easily debunked by the next forum reply:

[i]'Every car should have it's unique ID internally, let's say the 'meanie' goes by ID001, you change the name of your car as wanted, so ID001 should be now 'mini' and so in leaderboards you'll see the score of the ID001 name (mini for you, meanie for others that didn't change the ID001 name).'[/i]

Shows that not everyone falls to the dev's egregious gaslighting attempt. He said numerous times that people come to the game with various expectations, and it's on them to adapt to the game's 'vision', therefore everything should be taken as-is and accepted unconditionally. To that I say that maybe it is him the one who is confused by what he wanted the game to be vs. what rally racing actually is. When you call your game 'the art of rally', people come with the clear expectation to play a rally game, not the dev's own vision of what rallying is, or should be

- Inconsistent physics. Employing real-world rally techniques will not get the fastest times (despite the presence of [i]rally[/i] in the game's name and even having the [i]'good drivers have dead flies on the side windows'[/i] achievement hinting to this effect). Instead, touring-car type cornering is the way to go, as advised by one forum user:

[i]'Sliding is fun, but slower. No matter the car, no matter the surface, try not to slide too much during corners, even sharp ones. Brake early, hit the apex, be patient on the exit and hit the gas once the car is fully settled. Slow is smooth, smooth is fast.'[/i]

- Inconsistent physics. Side-swiping the guardrails will turn the car 180 degrees. On purpose, just to fxck with you, courtesy of the dev
- Inconsistent rules in regards to corner-cutting. On some you need just touch the grass to be auto-resetted while on others cars are allowed to pass through unpunished. This, in turn, leads to the next point
- Uncurated online leaderboards. Instead of promoting fair-play racing - in the spirit of rally-racing which the dev claims he tries to emulate - people are encouraged (through non-intervention) to find how much they can cut corners without penalty. As a result, the leaderboards are populated at the top only by 'cheaters' and no-lifers
- No multiplayer of any kind. No online servers, hot-seat or split screen, nothing. Daily / weekly challenges are no substitute for head-to-head rally racing
- Weak, buzzing, unconvincing engine sounds, particularly the Mazdas' rotary ones which verge on the unbearable
- The camera. Only external cameras are allowed during gameplay. No optional hood or bumper views, let alone car interiors and view
- Extremely short stages that average 6-8 Kms / 2-3 mins, with the longest being about 13 Kms / 4 minutes long. Again, not very rally-like (hillclimbing would be a more appropriate description but I don't think the dev loses any sleep over such trivialities)
- While on the subject of rally stages - the dev has a strange way of choosing new countries to be added to the game. Indonesia and Australia (outrageously priced for what it offers) are in, but no Monaco's Monte Carlo, France (Tour de Corse), Greece (Acropolis Rally) or Great Britain (RAC Rally) to name but a few

author: {'steamid': '76561198082764480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1706188950}
review:
Art of Rally starts out strong but as you progress, you start seeing all the cracks it has.
To sum up the game, art of rally is a top-down semi realistic rally game that requires you to sigh-read the tracks since there are no callouts.
It has a distinct and in my opinion beautiful to look at artstyle, atmospheric soundtracks and decent amount of content.
At first the handling and the physics seem incredible, especially since by only looking at the game, you expect an arcade racer. Then as you climb up the groups and get used to the game, you realize how inconsistent and janky it feels to play.
I'm used to playing simulation games yet i found it impossibly hard to not slide out on every corner. It feels as if your tires are always covered in ice. Controlling the slides with your throttle makes no difference at all. Then there is also the ridiculous hitboxes and crashing physics that don't make any sense. Barely scraping the rails makes your car come to a complete stop most of the time. 
Most of the cars feel awful to play because of how they handle. The auto recovery system is needlessly punishing. The game suffers massive fluctuations in FPS and i encountered multiple bugs in my playthrough.
At first i was in love with the game. I was ready to recommend it without any hesitations. It is a unique concept that could become a must buy with enough polish. But art of rally unfortunately lacks that polish and slowly turns into an infuriating experience that i looked forward to be done with as quickly as possible.
I will cautiously recommend the game since when it works properly, it is one of the most enjoyable games i have played and i had such a great time at the begining that it made me instantly buy the other game the devs have released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256922007', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1710815081}
review:
recent DLC added the gen 1 Ford Focus rally car, amazing. The overall game is a lot more enjoyable than many big racing games out there. It doesn't have the graphics, it doesn't have the complete realism. What it's got is enough simulation to be mechanically challenging and an enjoyable progression with a roaster of varied unique tracks that you get to cycle over randomly throughout your rallies.
With this game, I feel like I am going somewhere more than any other racing/rally games I have played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960568657', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1708238961}
review: Do you like arcade games? Do you like racing?  What about rallying?  Sweet music to go with it all?  Then this game is for you!  Old school arcade, rally racing, with an amazing soundtrack (which you can purchase, download, and listen to separately), leaving you relaxed, and just having an amazing time.  It's simple, fun, and pops out visually in ways I cannot describe.  Buy it.  Buy it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116818974', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 1634, 'last_played': 1712342933}
review:
Una oda a épocas doradas de los rallies. Estilo gráfico encantador, música que a veces uno escucha fuera del juego... La verdad que prefiero jugar en modo libre y simplemente conducir, y me cuesta más de lo que debería pillarle el tranquillo a conducir derrapando rápido y sin salirme, pero es la mar de entretenido y relajante.

Recomiendo desbloquear todas los escenarios y jugar en modo libre a buscar los objetos especiales perdidos por los mapas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067812918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1704494653}
review:
Art of Rally is a survival game where you play as a car trying to make your way from one point to another without exploding and maybe, just maybe, getting a better time than the other self-driving vehicles.

I mostly enjoyed this game. It's a very rewarding feeling to perform with no mistakes, but the handling of the car is often not fun because you can't just cut loose with zero restraint. I went from feeling like a rallying savant elegantly carving up every corner. Then in the next stage, I was driving like an old man trying to find a parking space at Tesco, and it has to be said, the rainy stages are about as fun as slipping on a dog turd at five o'clock in the morning. It's not like Trackmania, where driving the car very quickly becomes second nature and you're just confronted with the track and how best to improve your times. I felt I was constantly battling the car to get it to just stay on course.

Overall, this is an excellent, well-packaged game. Stylised to the point of disarming you into thinking it's a cartoony romp in the countryside. My only real disappointment is that there is no option to play as a Volvo 240 GL. Shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187977709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5962, 'last_played': 1706377061}
review: This game aims to capture the satisfying feeling of driving a great rally stage. It does this in a unique art style with fitting music and lots of distinct cars to pick from. Its initial learning curve is similar to that of other rally games (especially RWD cars take some time if you're not used to them) but it's very fun once you get into the flow. I've spent a lot of time just casually driving events while listening to podcasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108547133', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1705032605}
review:
The first time I felt at peace when playing a rally game!

The artstyle and music is absolutely breathtaking and the devs did a great job finding the balance between arcade and sim driving physics. I do wish they did a better job with the car sounds because they are very dull and get annoying quickly. 

Either way, I highly recommend to anyone who loves going sideways

author: {'steamid': '76561198330459669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1707059085}
review:
I am dissatisfied with the following aspects of this game. 

[h3]The game‘s Camera [/h3]

It is not good at rendering the terrain ups and downs, but the vehicle grip in the game is greatly affected by the slope. The grip on the bottom is very great, and the top of the slope is easy to take off or oversteer. 

[h3]The vehicle dynamics are not easy to be sensed in the aerial view, [/h3] player needs to constantly change the focal point. the dashboard is at the bottom. the car is in the 1/4 bottom of the screen and the coming corner is on the top 3/4 of the screen, Compared to the traditional racing game camera, in which peripheral vision is useful to handle vehicle dynamics.
Unfortunately, the game requires a relatively high vehicle dynamic perception ability and vehicle distance judgment ability around you. There are many obstacles set at the edge of corners around many tracks. It is easy to hit them with just peripheral vision in aerial view. and in terms of colour palette or landscape design, obstacles are hidden in the grass or blocked by the crowd and hard to be seen. only after playing many times. 

[h3]The game gives me the feeling that the side of the vehicle has more grip than the tires of the vehicle, which feels strange. Hit the barrels and this round is down. [/h3]

PS, one can increase the control of vehicle dynamics by increasing the Camera rotation.

[h3]Handling[/h3] is generally fine but when the car is in R gear and using a handbrake to do 180 turn, it feels like the rear tire fraction is off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327652634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1704087569}
review: I want to love this game, I really do. The soundtrack is incredible, the graphics are smooth and fun, the car designs and sounds are great, but the physics just makes no sense to me. The car has like 100% grip, until it doesn't, and then just slides wildly out of control. Throttle control in slides is almost nonexistent. If you are on the gas in a corner without grip, you slide straight sideways off the road. Coming out of corners or when regaining control after a slide, the car pendulums back and forth without staying straight. Your car reacts wildly to camber and elevation changes on the road, but most of the time you can't even see those changes because of the graphics and camera angles. Its like halfway between an arcade game and a realistic driving sim and just never feels right. It is fun for a while but eventually the frustration of your car never doing what you want it too kinda ruins it. Group B was especially hard to manage which unfortunately are the cars you most look forward too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996089255', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1703960515}
review:
Amazing concept, decent music and visual style, comfortable and fun arcade driving
But it feels in a very strange way
More time you play > the more unfinished this game looks like

Just two small gamedesign changes can significantly improve the entire gameplay for all racers, for those who purely loves driving.
This changes are extremely logical and lie on the surface, but these changes were not implemented.

Firstly, this game have the weirdest implementation of automatic recovery system

You dont want people to cut corners? Okay, it is normal wish
Just add some rocks\decorations\difficult terrain (hummocks and ravines) something that will destabilise and slow the car, on the cut line, or even make this line impossible to drive.
This is decent and not very hard task for level designer who understands the basics of racing line.

Want a penalty for cutting?
Just mark the cut area, provide information about this to the player, and add the 5\10\whatever seconds penalty if the car croses this "marked" cut area.
Another easy task for level guy.

But the zones are not marked, which is just ridiculous for any type of racing with penalty times applied

Not counting penalties problem, there is shitty auto recovery system, with same unpredictable area of work.
In one corner player can cut the line with 4 cars width inside or even more, in other corner it is impossoble, because the car will be resetted and penalty applied for smaller amount of cutting.

Going with wide powersteer exit from the corner on the cliffs edge?
Boy, dont try doing this with style, btw we will reset your car and add a penalty time
Cmon, if you go tooooo wide > you are dead, because the car will fall from the cliff, so why do you need this restriction in this situation? Just why?

Same thing for racing in the gorges and near fences, if there is no legal wide exit or safe zone in the corner exit, why do the leveldesigner moved this hillside or fence a bit further outside, for what purpose? For resetted car and penalty?

This is shitiest shit that you can even think of
You can't be adequate and do such game mechanics

Racing is about cutting, finding other lines, it is about going fast, fast but legally, within specified limits, not within the range of the horoscope or the moon in Mercury

Also there are another wierd things, that defy logic

- colision and damage system
you can get lite side contact between cars rear door and tree, and the engine becomes dead, on the front mounted engine car, wtf? :D
you can crash into the big rock at 120km\h and there will be no damage
you can crash at 149km\h and there will be one-two random damage tokens
but if you crash at 150km\h there will be terminal damage 

- lags
even with 144+ fps, 40% cpu load, 30% gpu load, and 40 GB free ram you can achive lots of lags and game freezes after changing countries in the game
for example if you go from 3-5 stages of sardinia, german or japan rally to stages in finland, sweden or Indonesia, there will be lags and freezes

- puncture repair system, and damage tracker
made so unobviously that it was discovered after beating the game
just make hotkey for this, whats the point to go into the menu to use this
same for damage tracker
you can notice when the suspension is dead, when it is dirty, when car is smoking or under fire, and the pincture
but for radiator and gearbox it is difficult to notice amount of damage

Also if you play automatic gearbox, even if the gearbox is okay and there is no damage, it can get stuck and the reverse gear may stop engaging

- light car, sticking
car is unreasonably light even by arcade standards
at 40km\h on a small hummock it can skyrocket to the moon
when hitting a sheaf of hay, the car behaves as if hitting a concrete wall, but when you hit big rock, hit feels more softer and natural on the rebound 
but touching iron fences work like magnetic stuff, the car doesn't bounce, it just sticks, every time, even light rear bumper contact will result lossing all speed with unnatural direction change
also it is wierd that you can ride fullspeed through some wooden stalls and send them in the sky, but when you litely touch sheaf of hay, it is gg, car will stop in a same way as with iron fence contact

Summing up all of the above
It's just unpleasant to drive after 1-3 hours of play, because defects become more obvious and intrusive

author: {'steamid': '76561198037619835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1704006515}
review:
Art of Rally or: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The Gamepad

This game is arcadey for a sim racer and simulatory for an arcade racer.

i bought this game, tried to play it with a wheel, then tried with a keyboard. then i refunded it.
when i bought my steam deck i have it another chance, and it's has not disappointed!
it's my favorite game on the steam deck.
it does most of the things you expect in a sim racer, but they are all a bit smoothed-over. i don't think that's a bad thing. more on this later.

art:
beautiful! you can see the pictures for yourself.
the music is also great. interesting tracks and a good tempo for this sort of driving.

levels:
pretty good. there are definitely enough (though more is always better).
different locations all have their own feel and style. differing amounts of elevation etc. different tracks in the same location are pretty varied too.
the terrain is made with a pretty low resolution heightmap. it shows in a few places. driving over it can fuck you up.

sound:
i have mixed feelings.
the good: it's detailed. you can hear all the parts of your car; tyres, engine, brakes, su-tu-tu, (you can even hear clunks from the dog box as you shift!)
the bad: the engine sound is disappointing: seems like it's one sound sound for go, and another sound for engine braking.
to my ears, it seems like the go sound is modulated in volume based on engine load. then rpm changes pitch and a filter (or maybe it's just a second high pitched sound)
I've been spoilt by the sound in dirt rally 2. maybe that's an unfair comparison, but that game gets it right. just a the engine in a naturally aspirated car from that game has tons of detail. 

graphics:
the game mostly runs smooth 60fps on the steam deck.
very occasionally it will stutter. when that happens, it's goes away after a couple corners and generally doesn't happen again for the rest of the play session.

damage:
generally very forgiving (although this depends on the car)
some cars you can throw into walls all day, others one nick will set your engine on fire.
there are no catastrophic failures as far as i can tell. tires don't blow, engine doesn't blow up from a money shift. you can finish a rally with your engine on fire the entire time.
generally it's pretty detailed:
radiator damage will damage your engine slowly, suspension damage effects steering, gearbox damage makes shifting slower
i think over revving does damage the engine.
my only wish is for the clutch to get damaged.


nits:
these are all really minor tbh
heightmap terrain
you can't click through the end of rally results quickly.
playable boundary is inconsistent.
i wish there was a mod to add the real car names.
sometimes the camera doesn't let you see very well. (generally this is not a problem but it does happen sometimes)
some obstacles are concrete that shouldn't be: eg kenya has orange plastic fences that don't break. 
animals don't run out of the way, instead you hit them and they are made of concrete. (i don't think they should snap like twigs either, since hitting a large animal will fuck you up)
only the driven wheels make skidmarks


simulatory:
there is no co-driver. i wish there was for sometimes but your view us pretty high up so it's not bad. a co-driver would also ruin the music so i understand.
going up/down is stimulated pretty well. if your wheels are pressed against the ground you get super grip, if you are almost flying you have very little grip.
wheel lock-up from breaks does not happen much. i have the anti-lock breaks setting at 0%. it does happen sometimes but it's uncommon. this may be intended.
all cars have one setup. you can't change that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071332268', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1704134882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198175978745', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 1831, 'last_played': 1711835301}
review:
[h3] TL;DR [/h3]
A game with very unique, rewarding and fun driving mechanics
Had a lot of fun and would probably play more
However the game has plenty of bugs, and the framerate sometimes is really unstable
Would overall recommend on discount

[h3] Full review [/h3]
The graphics are super beautiful and cute, the weather and day/night modes are great and atmospheric
Really liked the map design. There are not too many maps, however none of them are boring

I played with a controller and really enjoyed the driving mechanics
Driving is different from any other game, which combined with a top-down view provides a very unusual experience. I takes some time to get used to it, but then it is super satisfying

Car design is surprisingly good
Each car feels very unique and is different from other ones. The game gets better with time as you unlock more and more cars (especially when you unlock all-wheel-drive cars, these are extremely fun)

There were a lot of minor bugs, mostly - menu freezing, weird car spawn positions and visual glitches
Alt tabbing sometimes just crashes the game
But I would not say it is a big deal

The worst part for me was that the game started running at ~5 fps each time after ~1 hour of gameplay (on RTX 4080), which made the game uplayable and basically killed the current race
Closing and relaunching the game fixes the problem and the game runs super smooth again
Tried reinstalling, different video settings, nothing really helped to fix the problem permanently

This review really is a tough one for me because I loved the game, but this framerate glitch was really messing up my experience at some point
I would overall recommend getting the game on discount if you are into rally or racing in general, I think you would have great time

author: {'steamid': '76561198223014460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 893, 'playtime_at_review': 3696, 'last_played': 1712334844}
review:
What can I say about this gem...

Well art of rally is an arcadish rally game that reminds you that even if you think you're going fast someone is faster than you, either on a local scale or a worldwide scale. This game has been developped by Funselektor, the game Studio behind Absolute Drift and you can feel the studio's knowledge and experience about racing games and going sideways.

You start in Group 2, the year is 1967 and you have a sole goal: to go [b] FAST[/b]. As time and rallyes go by you will unlock other groups (Group 3,4,B,S and A).

Starting from Group B, some fictionnal cars will be present, and Group S is nearly all about fictionnal/prototypes. 

The game is well made, the sound design is great and the music is really nice. The maps and cars are a blast to drive, from a BMW 2002 to a Ford Focus through the Monsters of Group B like the Peugeot 205 T16 and the Audi Quattro, you wil have a wide array of cars to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255070297', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1683430176}
review:
Dejamos Podcast completo en CronicasGoomba, a continuación un resumen:

BUENO 
- Es divertido, los controles, el desafío, el contenido es amplio. 
- Artísticamente está muy bien logrado, es simple pero muy atractivo. Es un juego elegante. 
- Homenaje a los fanáticos del deporte, los textos, los autos en rally tenían apodos que el desarrollador aprovechas. Como no puede poner la licencia pone los apodos. El mini es en Meenie, EL BMW 2002 das220, AL skoda 130 le decían pebble,  

MALO 
- Tuve que parar un poco a mitad del modo carrera y dejar descansar el juego porque si bien es muy divertido las pistas se me empezaron a repetir porque el generador aleatorio hace cosas parecidas si es el mismo país y la misma temporada. 

FEO 
- Tuve un par de fallos técnicos, pero nada grave. 
- La cámara se puede ver afectada en zonas con edificios o se eleva mucho si pasamos por un cañón... pero es puntual. 

Jugado en gran parte en Steam Deck

author: {'steamid': '76561198083355996', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1711314129}
review: Love playing this game from time to time. It looks really good and it plays really nice, especially with controller. Would definitely recommend if you like racing and/or rally!

author: {'steamid': '76561199584309818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1703703648}

author: {'steamid': '76561199130483241', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1703677766}
review: От этой игры я ожидал больше. Эту игру надо назвать не "art of rally" а "ДРИФТ НА СТАРЫХ РАЛЛИЙНЫХ МАШИНАХ 60Х ГОДОВ" ведь игра не про ралли, а про дрифт, вот тебе просто надо дрифтить ведь в этой игре трассы это просто шпильки. Вот ей богу если в этой игре был бы штурман то он умел говорить только "Шпилька в лево" и " шпилька право" Может иза этого игру не добавили штурмана ну либо же разработчик простой ленивый хyй который насмотрелся всяких аниме про дрифт в Токио в 90х годах под фонк, подумал то что дрифт это круто, для пацанов и сделал игру абсалют дрифт в 2015. А потом он подумал то что в ралли тоже есть дрифт, и спустя 5 лет он выпускает этот высер. Я нечего не имею против дрифта, пусть те кто хотят подрифтить пусть идут на форзу либо же в гта5. Либо же на дешёвых поделках на юнити. Но эти вот мрази дошли до святого до Ралли, зачем было так уродовать Ралли? Что он вам сделал? Почему? Зачем? Я просто хочу забыть тот ужас который я увидел тут. Просто забыть как страшный сон.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195034943', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1704627476}
review:
Art of Rally is wonderful, the visuals, the music, the vibe, the beauty of it all. 

It is an ode to a bygone era of rallying and even a bit of a look at one of the biggest "what ifs" in motorsport. There is a wide variety of classic rally cars throughout the decades, including monsters that sadly never got to see the dirt.

Would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys arcade racers or even just rally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025503239', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 73, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1712281737}
review:
Art of Rally is an odd but enjoyable game that does a lot of things right, but also gets a few things wrong. Let’s go over them.

First of all, let's go over how it looks. Personally, I think it’s beautiful. It’s gorgeous to look at, doesn’t really matter what car you pick or which track you're driving, it is consistently stunning to look at. In an age where driving games are all about photorealism, this is a breath of fresh air. I know it might not be everyone's cup of tea, but aesthetically I think it’s right up there with some of the most striking games I’ve ever played.

Sonically it’s also very well crafted. The cars sound good, the effects from driving on the various surfaces provide feedback as well as sounding great, but the real star here is the soundtrack. It’s nothing short of phenomenal. It’s perfectly pitched to those real life broadcasts where you’d see Subaru’s and Lancia’s diving over crests and kicking up gravel as they sped past. I’d go as far as saying the soundtrack to this game is immaculate. Even if you don’t buy this game, go check it out on youtube or spotify. It’s fantastic.

Gameplay is mostly good. You have the general options you would have for rally games, as well as a story mode that sees you rally across stages and rallies that gradually get longer and harder with faster and faster cars over the space of when rallying emerged as a sport right up to the mid to late 90’s when Subaru, Toyota and Mitsubishi vying for podiums.

There are several maps of which stages are built from, all of which can be modified so that the races can take place in the rain (or snow), in the fog, at various times of the day and night. It’s what you would expect really.

Surfaces include dirt, gravel, snow, ice and asphalt as well as wet versions of all of these. They all drive as you would expect. A personal preference is that I’m not keen on the tarmac based ones, I have the least fun driving these rallies but I can see why they would be someone's favourite.

One thing I do not like at all is levels that have rain on them. I think they are a tad difficult and could do with toning down. I groan whenever I see them in legs of a rally I need to complete. They are like driving on skid pans with how slick they are on top of having puddles liberally scattered that make them a complete chore to play. These levels should be a bit harder but should be an exercise in seeing how sideways you can keep the car rather than struggling to keep the car on the road.

Another down I’m going to give the game here is that going off the road sees you reset and eat a 5 second time penalty. Rally is about cutting corners wherever you see them and the game feels so inconsistent on where it will nab you for going offroad and will not seem a little harsh. I think if the driver wants to go off road where it looks like they can, they should be able to. If you do not want the driver to cut, prevent them from doing so with obstacles.

Speaking of which, there’s very few obstacles in this game. Roads narrow and widen, but it’s not often you see ditches either side, or have to go through gates or anything like that. There are things like hay bales to slalom through but it would be nice if there was more variation to the scenery.

Talking of the scenery. Some of it is destroyable and some of it will bring you to a dead stop. This also seems very inconsistent. If a car looks like it should smash through it, it should be able to smash through it. Yes orange plastic netting barricade, I’m talking about you.

Also on the track are spectators, which add a well needed bit of texture to driving. It’s very exhilarating to drive through a crowd and watch them narrowly avoid being hit by a 150kph chunk of metal, but there are occasions where they obscure a corner and it can lose you time, especially as this game features no pace notes.

I am sort of bewildered why there’s no mud to drive on, sure you have wet dirt, but it’s not the same. Effects for driving over certain terrains are missing as well. It would be lovely if driving in the dirt of the deserts you kicked up a huge dust cloud behind you. I think this may have been cut to maintain performance? Seems a bit odd it’s missing.

Car selection is great. All your favourites are here and present. You can even mod in decals for them. I am sad that we don’t go any further than the 90’s as there are some classics that came after that era, but it’s really hard to be disappointed at the vehicles that made it into the game, as well as the cleverly named “off brand” names. Same goes for the real life parodies of the drivers from each era you’ll go up against, a lot of love and care was put into a knowing nod to past legends both vehicles and drivers. It’s clear to see a lot of knowledge about this wonderful sport has been captured with a tongue in its cheek.

Finally I want to talk about performance. For some reason this game runs like butter for the first 30 to 60 minutes of you playing it, and then it starts to micro-stutter and get unsustainable to play as it chugs about. I think it has to do with the game loading between rallies or something, but it really shouldn’t be doing this and it can and will hamper your enjoyment, especially in those long play sessions where you start to get into the zone.

Overall I give Art of Rally a thumbs up, it’s a nice game to play while you wait for friends to come online or for a quick 20 minute hit of gameplay, but it doesn’t come without its problems and you should consider those when making a purchase.

I do hope that Art of Rally makes a sequel and squashes a lot of issues I mentioned, because overall I think it could be a fantastic skill based time waster if it ironed a few of its kinks out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030914592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1706210013}
review:
The target group for this game are rally enthusiasts from the very beginning. There are historic cars, there are lovely details and the game design in the style of graphic art - almost Art Deco - is very appealing, indeed. The gametitle is therefore almost appropriate. 

Almost? Because the Art of Rally should also be about the art of driving. As an adult, I expect a game that is everything but not arcade. It can't be that I drive against a house and actually gain an advantage. It can't be that I drive through a cornfield with almost no drag. It can't be that I can only drive with a bird's eye view. This is arcade! 

I don't want that! I can't get a feel for the speed, the different surfaces, bumps and damage to the car. It can't be that a game from the year 2000 (Colin McRae Rally 2.0) was much more immersive and beats this game from 2020 in this respect.

I hope that this game will be developed further. It has potential and the fact that it runs on my Mac is great! I really hope for a reply. It might change my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168447825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1703555245}
review: This is a must have for any rally or racing fan out there. I honestly wish I picked it up sooner. The graphics are simple but have that loving detailed touch, a large variety of famous rally cars to drive, tracks are enjoyable and fun to race down, but what really makes this a wonderful game is the amazing soundtrack. I can listen its synthwave music all day if I could.  Really the only issue I have with the game is that the tracks, even in career mode, are random. If you leave a rally to restart and go back into it, odds are the tracks and the country will have changed. Making it hard to use certain rally cars that might be better on certain terrain. So if you are even thinking of picking this up, do it! Especially if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210342840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1703599918}
review:
[h3]Urodziłeś się w latach '80-'90, a może po prostu uwielbiasz rajdy samochodowe?[/h3]
Nie będzie to miało znaczenia, bo Art of Rally to wspaniały hołd dla wyścigów samochodowych i klimatu tamtych czasów.
Wszystko tutaj spaja się w jedną piękną całość: samochody (jedyne czego szkoda że nazwy modeli nie są na licencji ale rozumiem dlaczego tak jest i traktowanie tego jako minus byłoby absurdem),
muzyka - jest świetna!
kolory i grafika - już nawet nie granie ale samo oglądanie tej gry to czysta przyjemność.
gra - czysta frajda

Czuć klimat dawnych wspaniałych lat dla tego moto-sportu.. [b]złote czasy, złota gra.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198192131107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1703357173}
review: This is one of the best racing games I've ever played.  I've tried all the Forza and Dirt games but I keep coming back to this one.  The rush of hitting a series of turns in a row perfectly in this game is without equal.  It takes a bit to get used to the timing but once you do, its awesome.   Trust me, you won't regret getting this one

author: {'steamid': '76561198154190604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1705260398}
review:
Played this for free on Game Pass for Xbox a while ago and had to purchase for the Steam deck! Delightful little game with a lot of depth. Easy to pick up and play casually, but also offers a lot for the simmies who want realism. 

The art style is nice and each area is so unique, it shows how much effort the developer has put into this game on a limited budget. I usually rail off a pros and cons section on my reviews but on this occasion I would just say it's a must have for any car fan and on the current sale it's a total no-brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043763060', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1702803632}
review:
Играл в первую игру этих разработчиков - Absolute Drift, игра была выполнена в минималистичной стилистике и предлагала увлекательный аркадный геймплей, который внезапно затягивал.

Art of rally целиком и полностью посвящен раллийным гонкам со всеми легендарными машинами + группа концепт каров, куда входит раллийная Lada Samara под видом T22.

Со времен Absolute Drift игровая физика стала только лучше, вес машины чувствуется лучше чем в dirt rally 2.0 и новом WRC.

Так что, если хотите на чиле покататься по интересным минималистичным трассам - эта игра ваш выбор. Мне очень понравилось. Так что - одобряю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198850672136', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1702558959}
review: Very good game

author: {'steamid': '76561197964109913', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1702503041}
review: I am a huge fan of old/retro styled racers and wherever I went Art of Rally was constantly being used as a benchmark of excellence or a standard of the genre. So finally I decided to bite and get it. I cant even begin to state how over hyped and overrated this game truly is. The vehicles handle like half melted sticks of butter. Its ridiculous. Your car slides out of control if you even glimpse at a blade of grass off the road. They also may as well have wings because they seem to glide/float through the air whenever you hit a jump or bump. I cant even begin to say how disappointed I am with this after what feels like years of people talking this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396163030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1701724766}
review:
This is a game with graphics that would be considered rubbish even on a 30-year-old PC. And the handling of car movement is really bad and rough: it's not fun, it's not realistic, and it has nothing to do with rally; it's just frustrating. Also, it's all very monotonous and sloppy. 

In short, it is a definitely bad and low-level game, don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044300315', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1682, 'last_played': 1705925471}
review:
Eines der besten Top-Down-Isometric Racing Games die ich bisher gespielt habe. Die Story ist.... nun... es gibt ne Story, aber warum braucht man eine Story, wenn man sich einfach eines guten Rally-Spiel erfreuen kann.

Man muss sich zwar etwas an die Steuerung gewöhnen, aber auch jedes Fahrzeug steuert sich etwas anders, und besonders der Unterschied zwischen den Rennklassen ist spürbar. 

Overall - ich mag Rennspiele, ich mag einfache Konzepte, und besonders mag ich es, wenn sie gut umgesetzt werden. und mit Art of Rally kann man eigentlich nichts falsch machen,
