author: {'steamid': '76561198343698263', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1708414199}
review: I absolutely love this game. its amazing if you just want to chill or if you actually want to be competitive. This game tells the story of each cars nicely in the description of every vehicle. as well as gives each car its own feel when it comes to handling in my opinion. The atmosphere of each stage is phenomenal the lighting, colors, dirt, tarmac each aspect of visual enhances the entire experience. The photo mode in this game is also amazing you can change many details while it is very simple to understand and use. This game is a must by especially for the price tag 10/10 indie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184122406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6454, 'last_played': 1703312140}
review: If you enjoy rallying at all in real life, this game provides an amazing experience as far as control of the car and how it moves, as well as the ambience. Theres a learning curve but once you click with the controls, this game is so much fun. The environment is truly beautiful, from stage design to the sound of cars i thoroughly loved every moment. I have already put over 100 hours into this game and will continue to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108494442', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1701183362}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
☐ Molto originale come titolo, è uno di quei giochi la quale non ti stanchi mai di giocare.
☐ Abbastanza originale e divertente da giocare; consigliabile se si è in compagnia di un amico.
☑ Anche tematiche classiche e semplici ma ben sviluppate possono trasmettere divertimento.
☐ L'idea del gioco non è male, anche se deve essere un po più approfondita.
☐ Giocabilità non ad alti livelli, di certo quello che ha da offrire è molto poco.
☐ Gioco monotono, gameplay e divertimento quasi assenti.

[h1]Storia[/h1]
☐ Storia impressionante, questo gioco ti trasmette molte emozioni, ti fa entrare nel personaggio.
☐ Ottima storia, riesce ad immergerti come un libro.
☐ Storia originale e ben fatta, si vede l’impegno degli autori.
☐ La storia in se è carina, ma va approfondita.
☑ Storia già vista e rivista, ne carne ne pesce.
☐ Storia mal gestita, quasi inesistente.
☐ La trama è inesistente; non è quello l’obiettivo del gioco.

[h1]Audio e colonne sonore[/h1]
☐ Sono colonne sonore che non te le toglieresti più dalla testa per un bel periodo, inimitabili.
☐ Incantevoli, originali e ben studiate, le ascolterai volentieri.
☑ Combaciano molto con il gameplay, molto carine.
☐ Mediocri, la melodia della musica può anche lasciare a desiderare.
☐ Qualità audio scarsa, e colonne sonore non adatte allo scopo, poco curate.
☐ Gestione audio e musica a dir poco imbarazzante, veramente mal riuscito.
☐ Il gioco presenta audio, ma non colonne sonore.

[h1]Chi può giocarlo?[/h1]
☐ Età dai 18 anni in su
☐ Età dai 16 anni in su
☑ Età dai 12 anni in su
☐ Età dai 7 anni in su
☐ Età dai 3 anni in su
☐ Adatto per tutte le età

[h1]Requisiti di sistema minimi[/h1]
Sistema operativo: Windows 10 o migliore
Processore: Intel Core i5 3.6 GHz or AMD similar
Memoria: 8 GB di RAM
Scheda video: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD similar
Spazio disponibile: 8 GB

[h1]Difficoltà[/h1]
☐ Impossibile, devi avere già molta esperienza di base generale per capirlo.
☐ La pazienza è la virtù dei forti, occorre studiarlo.
☐ Molto meglio farsi spiegare le basi di gioco da un amico se non giocarlo in singleplayer con un possibile tutorial.
☑ Intuibile, con meno di mezz’ora saprai giocare.
☐ Abbastanza intuibile, non occorre nessun tutorial.
☐ Facilissimo da capire, manca solo un po di Skill.

[h1]Livellaggio e progressi[/h1]
☑ Hai da compiere delle missioni e dei obbiettivi.
☐ Hai da compiere diversi obbiettivi.
☐ Hai da sviluppare un rank.
☐ Hai da compiere missioni, obbiettivi e sviluppare il tuo rank, buona fortuna!
☐ Nessun progresso, missione, rank o obbiettivi da compiere.

[h1]Bugs[/h1]
☐ Nessun bug presente nel gioco, perfetto.
☑ I bug sono rari; diventa una sfida beccarne uno.
☐ E' possibile causare dei bug, durante il gameplay dovrai prestare attenzione.
☐ Bug costanti, gameplay poco perfezionato.
☐ Completamente ingiocabile, risparmiati.

Voto: 8

[h1]Giudizio aggiuntivo:[/h1]
[b]Anche se ai giochi di rally non ci ho mai passato troppo tempo questo titolo mi ha fatto venire la voglia di giocare a titoli della stessa disciplina.
Questo gioco mi attrae molto dal suo level design e dai suoi colori pastellosi, dalla telecamera posizionata in alto e dalle colonne sonore... diciamo che questo gioco è quello che si può definire un'opera d'arte. Non nel senso che è uno dei giochi migliori di macchine, ma nel senso che ha alcune caratteristiche che lo rendono unico.
Il gioco in se non è difficile, poi dipende sempre dalla difficoltà, e l'handling può diventare una sfida nelle prime gare, però poi ci farai l'abitudine.
Non è neanche tanto lungo da finire, in circa 15 ore lo concludi senza problemi (o 20+ se sei un collezionista come me).
L'unico bug che ho riscontrato è quando a volte nel menu della selezione veicoli prima dello stage quando clicco per andare avanti non succede nulla (è successo solo 3 volte), ma del resto non mi ha mai dato problemi tecnici.
[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198022479760', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1709521289}
review:
[h1]Une lettre d'amour à l'histoire du rallye automobile [/h1]

art of rally est une lettre d'amour a l'histoire du rallye automobile comme le témoigne son mode carrière qui vous fera progresser au file des années et des différents groupe de rallye qui se sont succédé. Le jeu propose plus de 50 véhicules mythique aux caractéristiques et comportements différents ainsi qu'une vraie variété dans les spéciales qui, au delà du coté esthétique des différentes locations, propose des challenges différents en fonction des surfaces, météo et tracés rencontré. La physique des véhicules répond de façon cohérente en fonction des modes de propulsion et des surfaces de course et même si la prise en main peut être un peu difficile le plaisir de jeu se trouve décuplé une fois que l'on arrive a dompter les monstres de puissances du groupe B. Le jeu offre aussi une bonne courbe d'apprentissage en mode carriere en nous mettant entre les mains des véhicules des années 60 dans un premiers temps pour terminer sur les montres des groupes B, S et A.
Le jeu propose une bonne re-jouabilité  avec son leaderbord, ses défis quotidiens et hebdomadaires ainsi qu'un mode free roam qui permet par ailleurs de débloquer quelques titres supplémentaires de la superbe OST synthwave.

review:
Enjoyable rally experience, covering different rally class and distinctive rally locations. Good art style and detailed car models, results in game that easy to jump into. Really enjoy the photo modes, where I could tinkered to get gorgeous picture. 
There are some performance hiccups and graphic glitches, but not really affecting the overall experiences. The games keep getting updates from the devs and still getting a dlc years after releases.
Score: 8/10

review: Very fun racing game! They took what they had from Absolute Drift and applied it very well to rallying. Driving feels nice, the graphics are very stylish, and the whole thing feels like a love letter to rally. It's an excellent game if you're looking for a more chill racing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097422691', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2703, 'last_played': 1679173339}
review: This is the best arcade racer you can get in Steam. The physics are very good, more realistic than some "rally sims" out there, while still being very playable even on keyboards with the assists provided in-game. The art style is simple, yet very well executed, and the scenery is well crafted and beautiful to look at. The stages are fun to drive, whether you're pushing the limits of the car or just cruising for fun.

I highly recommend it for Steam Deck players especially because it allows the device to achieve its best form through its simplicity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050920723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1690622931}
review: A really fun and relaxing driving experience - the game is all about reaching this state of "flow" in which you'll drift the car continously from turn to turn without thinking about it. While it may sound difficult, with a little bit of practice, it becomes truly relaxing. I really like that the game content is so focused on the driving experience and that it does not push hard on the competitive side of racing. Of course racing is competitive by nature, but this game is all about an enjoyable driving experience and enjoying the drive along the stages. The cartoonish art style and music gets you very well into that "not so serious, but focused" mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273760495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4212, 'last_played': 1706349844}
review:
Pick up and play goodness.

I play what I classify as casual driving games and simulations. I don't mean the difference between simcade driving games and so on, I mean the difference between actual rally sims of various kinds and a top-down racer like this one. 

I've seen some people say this is a rally sim, but I have this in my casual driving games. I don't class it as a sim personally, though there are some very nice rare cars in there, though unlicensed, you can obviously tell what they are. They don't really handle like their real versions, you get a selection of cars for each category, including some fantasy ones after Group B, but that's ok, as you probably know from the blurb, this game tries to capture the feel of Group B before it got banned and tries to continue that vibe on into the 1990s.

But you won't wrap the car around a pole or kill any of the blocky bystanders, which is also not a bad thing in this game by me. This is because it's a relaxing game with the gorgeous colour palette and exotic rally settings. The previous game these developers made was a drifting game, and I would say that the drifting provenance shows through in this game.

I don't really like drifting games and stages much in other games, but in this for me it's tolerable, because it's in the context of rally driving, often on loose surfaces using twisty-turny roads in places. Just find a car in the relevant class that you find easiest to drive, have a go, improve your times.

I got the Australia DLC the other day, but because I've completed the game, could only use those on Free Roam to get the collectables or on custom rallies to get my stage score up to a Thousand and get the last achievement.

I am personally not that disappointed by that, because I know it would play much better in the career mode when playing it through the first time. I do therefore recommend you getting it along with the game first time, if it's in your budget. If you've completed the main game, then there's that, which I personally did not mind, because of the price point and having a good impression of the developers.

I've got gold and stars in all the classes and don't want to risk my scores in Career mode, but I'm sure the Australian stages will pop up there. There are set tracks, and I like that. There are so many of them by now, it's hard to just learn them all straight away. The rouguelike element that other reviews mention is the track generation for the stages. Well, they are not generated, the stages are set and you can practice them in the time attacks and time trials. The locations and which particular stages are generated randomly when you take a particular rally in career mode based on the group.

You can terminate a rally year and start it again to get a different set of stages, but each time the locations and particular stages, time of stages and weather are all randomised again.

Definitely a good candidate to keep on a Steamdeck too, IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995101647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 73, 'playtime_at_review': 3921, 'last_played': 1711569206}
review:
Art of Rally is undoubtedly one of the best gaming experiences I have ever had. That being said, its philosophy is very idiosyncratic and if you approach it expecting a 'typical' racing game experience, you may be in for disappointment. Art of Rally is not a game about racing - it's a game about passion, about mastery, about expression, about nostalgia, about art, and above all else, about flow. 

The entire experience is [i]singularly[/i] focused on simulating the joy and freedom that inspired generations of rally drivers and fans, while stripping away absolutely every possible distraction. It's the kind of game you sometimes catch yourself grinning like an idiot playing - as you're taking a corner perfectly at warp speed just inches away from the fence that wiped you out dozens of times before, with banging synthwave blasting over a gorgeous acid trip of colorful visuals.

Every single part of Art of Rally's design is purpose built to get out of the way and distill rally down into as much of that brilliant fun per second as possible. The cars all have distinct personality - each era, manufacturer, even national origin has its own quirks and feeling, from extravagant but unruly earlier French sports cars to nimble and precise Japanese supercars to quirky and idiosyncratic Italian art cars - without getting bogged down in statistics and sliders. The tracks give a wide range of racing styles - from twisting Japanese mountains that require patience and technique, to German highways that test your consistency and offer high-risk, high-reward barrier patterns, to Kenyan mountains where you're free to go flat out for long stretches at a time - each with its own aesthetics.

I have been playing this game for years and there is, simply put, nothing else like Art of Rally. It is the pure distilled joy of going fast and feeling cool. Break free from narrow ideas of what a racing game 'ought' to be and I promise you'll be in for a hell of a ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176833189', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1706806071}
review:
I love this game but i write this review to bring light on the biggest issiue i have with this game. I just cannot stand this invisible hard reset zones. If you want to go fast you, NEED to cut cornerns (open any world record to see how often they go of the track). Somitemes you can cut fine, and in the others you will get hard reset and lose 5 seconds. And there are no visiual indicators to tell where you can cut and where you cannot. I underestan why they exist but don't understand why they were implemented this way. I have 2 solutions for this problem. Either keep reset zones and place visual indicators on where they are (some bilboard or cones) or get rid of them and place physical barriers on their place. Please fix this 
Funselektor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023053412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3009, 'last_played': 1700658586}
review: Great racing game!  It's not a simulator, but very enjoyable and predictable handling that works well with a controller.  It's also a wonderful tribute to rally racing and includes some humorous references.  The gameplay and visuals make it a great choice to zen-out and keep going for that perfect lap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116788216', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1700519466}
review:
Don’t let the artsy low-poly graphics and the gorgeous colors fool you; Art of Rally has quite the learning curve and skill ceiling. Cars handle differently  and the terrain affects the driving as well. 

The game features a standard racing-game car and track unlock system through the career mode, but I’ve also had fun cruising around the tracks in the free-roam mode, and there’s a challenge mode and time attack mode to round it out.

I loved driving through the stunning environments, although I found the game pretty challenging; but then I suck at racing games, something not even careful editing can hide => 1 Minute Review https://youtu.be/bxwR839vI-Q

author: {'steamid': '76561198058770842', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1709237927}
review:
I've had this game for a while, and let me tell you - it's really good. Driving physics are not bad, but they need some getting used to. But the art style and music is what makes this game shine. Career mode is about 15-20 hours, depending on how skilled you are. After career you can take a challenge in daily and weekly events, and make custom rallies for yourself. 

I really liked this game, and I recommend it to everyone who likes driving games.

review:
I've never played a racing game with a more frustrating camera. It's very far away, which makes it difficult to tell where the car is pointed or how fast you're going. Also, they somehow managed to get the physics to feel like a paddleboard with an outboard motor. It's insanely hard to keep any car under control, plus there's no map or course notes. 

Art style, music, cars and rally history nerdiness are wonderful, but it just feels awkward..

author: {'steamid': '76561198084268449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1710705096}
review: Art of rally is a brilliant game that can be as casual or as competitive as you want to make it. The selection of cars is very good, but even better is that they all feel different to "drive", allowing them to cater to your way of getting through the stages and giving alot of replay-ability. The art style and soundtrack add to the atmosphere of the well designed enviroments.   The leaderboards mean that if you want to sit and grind out the best time, there is plenty of room for that, but at the same time, this game is perfect for when I want to chill out with a controller rather than sit in my rig, but still scratch that rally itch. 10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082582503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3431, 'last_played': 1700699190}
review: This game does an incredible job capturing the spirit of rallying in a beautiful setting.  The cars handle and sound great, the crowds mob the track, and the soundtrack is the perfect backdrop to flogging a car down a narrow dirt road.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984011981', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1656341899}
review: This game and its predecessor Absolute Drift are true arcade racing  gems. They have crisp handling, charming graphics, interesting gameplay, and most importantly it's clear the development team have a passion for the project. I'm glad I tripped across Absolute Drift many years ago at a PAX East event - both games really are "hidden gems".

author: {'steamid': '76561198010776458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 70, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1712344214}
review:
Therapeutic gaming at its best.

If you're the kind of person that loves rally, or finds himself smiling when seeing old clips of turbocharged behemoths racing through the forest, then this game is absolutely for you. If you're an appreciator of stylized polygonal art, then this game is for you. Even the music in this game is incredible, with Tatreal producing a soundtrack worthy of driving to during your morning commute.

No game that I have played has brought as much simple, pure joy as this one. Whether I have 10 minutes, or a couple of hours to dedicate to playing it during a session, I always close 'Art of Rally' with a smile on my face, and usually with a new wallpaper or two (since the game is very photogenic).

The learning curve is real, but absolutely doable. The stage design manages to be challenging without feeling deliberately vindictive. The cars all behave differently, and you'll earn great joy as you learn to handle vehicles that strike your fancy.

I would happily purchase new AoR course DLCs in perpetuity given the quality present in this game.

I never would have thought that a game like this would crack my all-time top 5, but AoR is safely in that group.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046035878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 10090, 'last_played': 1711423209}
review:
[h2] A work of passion and stylistic vision [/h2]
Art of Rally is a colorful window into a bygone era of unhinged, unfettered competition. It’s a satisfying, mechanically complex racing game that hooks you into the mindset of “just one more race.” It’s also a tribute to rally history, and the developers clearly let their knowledge and interest of the sport’s past influence the game’s every facet.

It’s minimalistic in the best way— you, your iconic car of choice, and challenging roads. An exceptional synthwave soundtrack aids in achieving the perfect flow state when you’re chaining corners together at high speed. 

If you’re on the fence, I’ll try to convey why I think the small team at Funselektor has earned your money with Art of Rally—and importantly, why this game deserves your time.

[h2] Physics, handling & controls [/h2]
This aspect is deeper than you might expect. It’s not a full simulation—but the handling model is no slouch either. Weight transfer is key, as well as speed conservation and grip limit. Utilizing real knowledge of car behavior and racing techniques will help you place first. There’s options for vehicle damage—the strictest of which will incentivize you to learn every corner and pick your driving lines thoughtfully. Certain cars you will naturally mesh with. You’ll wonder if you can push those cars further. In fact, at some point in your quest for speed you might actually find yourself wrestling with the controls. You may feel like they’re holding you back in some way, you may get frustrated. 

[b] I’m here to tell you there’s a solution to this. [/b]

I personally had to adjust some game settings in order to fully bend certain cars to my will. There’s no vehicle-specific tuning options, which I think was the right choice. But there [i] are [/i] meaningful adjustments you can make, to change the responsiveness of the cars.

[u] In gameplay settings: [/u]
[list]
[*]Stability assist - In lower classes, I use 0%, faster classes 20-60%, depending on the car.
[*]Countersteer factor -  I recommend 100% to start with, increase or decrease as needed.
[*]ABS - In lower classes, I use 0%, in faster classes I use 20%.
[/list]
[u] In advanced controls: [/u]
Consider changing the deadzones/steering sensitivity if needed.

[b] Find what settings work for you! [/b] Some players claim the handling is outright bad. That’s an unfair assessment. The game requires you to understand it. The different driving surfaces demand your attention. Changes in terrain elevation are to be respected, as are puddles in the rain. Each car feels distinct. Each [i] class [/i] feels distinct, and you’ll need to adapt to the changes that come with higher horsepower and the advent of AWD. It’s [i] incredibly [/i] rewarding and satisfying to master a car in Art of Rally.

[h2] Car variety [/h2]
There’s a wide selection (62) of vehicles to choose from. Each car is lovingly modeled, with several livery options. They are based on real rally cars with a few easter egg vehicles thrown in the mix as well. They all have written descriptions, which are a blend of humorous and fact-filled.

I’ve spent most of my time in career mode. It begins with the early days of Group 2 in the late 60s, and culminates in the era of Group A—which ultimately became the basis for modern rallying. However, the horsepower of Group A in-game is much higher than in reality. I’m ok with this for the sake of gameplay progression, and it results in these cars feeling like the pinnacle of what you can drive within the game.

At the center is the mythical Group B. Car manufacturers and racing teams spared no expense in creating some of the most insane machines that were constantly pushing the boundaries of what was possible for vehicular development, within the confines of extremely loose regulatory restrictions. During this time in history, drivers contended with many obstacles. They had to tackle dangerous roads at near-inhuman speeds. They had to race the clock, and set competitive times against their peers to make their mark on the rallying world. And, they were also navigating through crowds of spectators—hordes of motorsport fans and photographers encroaching on their path for a chance to see the action up close. A perfect recipe for some of the most memorable moments in motorsport history, and an era that—despite its extraordinary danger and eventual loss of life—is looked upon fondly by rally enthusiasts and former Group B drivers alike. 

Art of Rally gets this era spot-on. As soon as you get into those cars, the feeling of pushing the limit of your vehicle is heightened. The stages you’ve been learning in the previous classes now seem more daunting, and you begin to morph your driving style to suit the new capabilities of your car. Taking things further, the game allows you to set foot into the realm of Group S. It’s often forgotten in other rally games, as it never saw the light of competition after Group B was canceled. But, the vehicles slated to compete in Group S are some of the most interesting and unshackled 4-wheeled machines ever developed. It's great to see them!

[h2] Locations [/h2]
You'll race across 7 countries in the base game. Each is varied, and feels handcrafted and engaging to explore—and they’re inspired by real-world rallying locations. They strike a balance between technical challenge and high-speed segments, with their own intricacies to learn. There’s 42 unique stages in the base game, and they can be driven in reverse which adds more variety. Elevation changes and multiple driving surfaces will keep you on your toes. Weather/time of day variation keeps the stages feeling fresh. 

[h2] Sound [/h2]
The cars sound great, and have fairly distinctive engine notes. Details include turbo flutter, gearbox whine, exhaust crackles, and the thunderous staccato of anti-lag. Subtle ambient noises, such as the cheer of the massive crowds or the sound of gravel hitting the underside of the car add to the atmosphere. The game’s soundtrack is [b] top notch[/b] and extra songs can be unlocked via free roam collectibles. The soundscape as a whole works wonderfully in pulling you into the world, making you feel like the hero driver at the starting line we all wish to be.

[h2] Visuals [/h2]
The graphics are simple, but there’s robust detail and endearing care taken in the art design. The lighting and shadows at sunset are stunning. The stylistic choices of the game work really well, from the charming yet accurate appearance of each car model to the cube-like spectators which congregate along the roadside. There’s a full-fledged photo and replay mode which I’ve spent a lot of time in. Your screenshots will be displayed on the 5 polaroids in the main menu, which is a nice touch. I wish there were even [i] more [/i] of those polaroids to show off my ever-growing album.

[h2] Conclusion [/h2]
Racing games are often misunderstood. Sometimes they get categorized with the likes of football or basketball games—but they aren’t like those. You don’t control a team of athletes. And in rally racing, you are alone on a stage with no other cars to consider overtaking. You aren’t looking at other competitors and trying to outwit or outmaneuver them directly. Instead, your fight is through the intermediary of the track. It’s driver versus road, and the one ally you have in that fight is a monstrous machine which isn’t interested in behaving. You must tame it, convince it. Become one with it. The best racing games allow you to feel a fraction of what it’s like to really be behind the wheel. They emulate what it is to extend yourself into the car, acting as if it is a part of you—and masterfully controlling it to the limits of human comprehension, all the while you’re gripped by the creeping sensation that it could all be lost at any second. That is what makes all motorsport compelling. And in my opinion, despite its simplistic looks, Art of Rally manages to capture that in an authentic and rare way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987555969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1712480942}
review:
The art is really beautiful, the ambiance is perfect. The camera placement really lets you experience the game's beauty, but it's also functional as you'll need to look far ahead if you're going to be fast.
There's a huge variety of cars and they're unique and incredibly rewarding to drive. When you learn a car and a track you can really get into a flow where you can constantly find improvements to your racing line. The better you get, the more confidently you can throw the car around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310446091', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1706660285}
review:
En el sentido más literal, este juego es una obra maestra.

Los gráficos minimalistas son muy bonitos a la vez que mantienen la claridad en el gameplay. Las físicas son ciertamente exigentes nada más empezar con el juego, pero están hechas para (y desde luego logran) ser extremadamente divertidas: resumiendo, los tramos rápidos son *muy* rápidos pero las horquillas y escuadras siguen siendo bastante técnicas, esencialmente lo mejor de ambos extremos del espectro.  No tiene los requisitos más bajos del mundo pero, asumiendo que tu máquina llegue, el juego corre muy suave, sin trompicones ni bajones repentinos de FPS.
Y uno de los grandes puntos fuertes del juego: el sonido. El rugido de los coches es, en la mayoría de casos, bárbaro, transmiten una energía que pocos juegos logran, y la música techno-synth da un contraste interesante con la premisa misma del juego, que es un viaje a un pasado alternativo.

Cuando un juego está hecho con amor, se nota. Y mucho. Merece este dinero y más.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102707335', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9174, 'last_played': 1710934834}
review:
Art of Rally is one of the most enjoyable games of the past decade for me. On the surface it seems incredibly simple, but get down and dirty with it and you discover there's an incredible depth to the game. Sure, it's no master pf physics simulation, but it certainly has more than you'd expect, and more than enough to make the game feel more than just a no-name phone app, if you know what I mean.

The game's art style is incredibly fun and pleasant to be in, and the toy car theme definitely has a vibe to it that I haven't experienced in any other game so far. And it's not cheesy either. There are a ton of tracks for you to race on, and all of them can be played in various weather conditions and even in reverse, so the game certainly has a very respectable amount of content to it. Even the music is nice to listen to while driving around in free-roam or whatnot.

Racing is definitely fun on its own, but to me the real fun in this game comes from the challenge of getting mega fast lap times (I'm a bit proud of my world records I used to own haha). I suspect in order to find replayability past 100 or so hours in this game, you will also want to find something fun to focus on, like going for records or mastering all the cars in the game(of which there are many). But even if you don't, the game is still very worth whatever money you pay for it.

On PC, this game 100% benefits from playing it on a controller. I actually have it on the Nintendo Switch as well, and it's certainly playable there, but the lack of analogue triggers for gas and brake force a different driving style. I'd recommend playing the game on PC over Switch, but can't deny that it makes a perfect game to play on the go with a handheld. Why not both?

author: {'steamid': '76561198121755715', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1687865758}
review:
Pure and simple arcade rally game. It's got a chill vibe, and it's very tongue-in-cheek. 
You'll like this if you want rally racing in bite-sized chunks unlike the AAA games.

And 'arcade' doesn't mean easy. You can adjust the level of driving assistance in-game, or turn it off and get in the zone.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995553060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1681168584}
review:
I originally wrote this in April 2023 but didn't upload it. I wasn't sure how to approach this game from the perspective of a reviewer because it's so bloody perfect, and a lot of these sorts of games I class as "unreviewable". As an example of what I mean, other games that would fall into that category are arcade classics that are still talked about and played over 40 years later such as Pac-Man or Space Invaders, or games with ridiculous amounts of memetic discussion surrounding them like Half-Life or the original Doom. Like, how the hell can words do enough justice for this level of quality and discussion? To be honest, a better review is simply a gameplay video. A picture can say a thousand words.
---
I haven't had this much fun in a driving game for a long time. It's incredibly hard to put my Deck down, like it was made for it or something. It's relaxing yet satisfying once you get into the flow state, and more forgiving than the developer's drift title. 10/10 soundtrack too. They didn't put "art" in the title for nothing either - this is one of those games that can be used to convince philistines that videogames are an art form.

It takes a couple of hours to start driving well, especially as you're forced to drive crapboxes at the beginning, but that means that once you unlock the real rally cars you'll truly appreciate it and know how to use them properly. It's game blue-balling done right, in that it teases you until you desperately want access to a proper car and then oooh it feels so damn good.

I guess it's a simcade, but it differs from other simcades in that the elements that are usually arcadey are simulation-like here, so it won't have you setting up your vehicles but you better know a bit about how cars behave. You just go straight into it. My only non-technical critique is that a view from the front of your car would be nice. Regardless, it is a beautiful game, and the minimalist menus bring that beauty to the forefront. You get into this sort of meditative state once you get good, and it feels incredible. Turn off the crowds not only for a performance boost but, imo, better atmosphere.

Now for the bad part, and probably the most important: The Linux version seems to perform a lot better than Windows. On Windows the game has very little optimisation. Running a dual boot system with Manjaro, in one OS I can max the game out at 1440p 120fps, while on the Windows it struggles on medium (which are Deck settings at a higher resolution) to maintain a consistent framerate. In some ways it's amusing to me that *Linux* is the preferred OS for this game!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000900887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1711717211}
review:
While this is far from a true rally sim like the Dirt Rally Series and WRC; it is an enjoyable, minimalist but colorful, rally-arcade game. It's easy to pick up and do a short run with its challenging control model. You have no co-driver calls but you're always able to see a short ways ahead of the track (and through obscuring objects) to navigate, though I would still prefer co-driver calls personally (though they would not be able to integrate their fitting soundtrack during rallies if they had pace notes to listen for) . 
     This game has been out a while and has been getting consistent updates from the developer, who loves their game with all the post-release updates. Runs great on the Steam Deck and yet will use a large amount of graphics power (wattage) on a PC with maxed graphics settings at a high refresh rate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990828698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1698500628}
review:
Ламповая инди-ралли. Противники не отображаются, медитативно ездишь по трекам, сгенерированным из разных участков регионов (Норвегия, Япония, Афрки и тд). 

Из минусов: 
- камера специфическая, от 3 лица удалена и на некоторых поворотах мешаются предметы, поадающие в камеру

- периодически возвращает на трассу автоматически со штрафом в 5 секунд в местах, где даже не отьезжал далеко от трассы

- опять же из за камеры кочки плохо видны и случайно улетаешь в кусты на ровном месте

- играл на среднем уровне сложности, время проохождения трека ИИ соперниками кажется случайным. Иногда - много косячишь и первое с запасом, иногда - наоборот и требуется идеально проехать

- ночные трассы и дождь-  какое-то извращение по мне, очень портят динамику и видимость

- на стим деке на трассах с освещением (утро/вечер) ест слишком много ресурсов для такого уровня графики

author: {'steamid': '76561198351913864', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2835, 'last_played': 1704542185}
review:
Un super jeu de rally!

Si vous aimez les drifts et détestez la pluie, ce jeu est fait pour vous. La maniabilité est surprenante au début (on a l'impression de piloter une savonnette) mais après quelques heures de jeu elle permet des trajectoires sympas. Le jeu a pour particularité une vue de dessus mais le réglage de caméra le plus en arrière possible permet de limiter cet effet. Cette caméra permet de bien voir sa trajectoire, par contre les changements de pente de la route sont vachement durs à voir.

Les graphismes sont ok mais avec une direction artistique magnifique, il est facile de faire de belles photos avec le mode photo. La musique est ok mais un peu répétitive lorsqu'on joue longtemps, le son des voitures peut aussi être un peu lourd après plusieurs heures.

La difficulté est bien gérée, on progresse dans le jeu en débloquant des voitures de groupes plus récents et donc plus puissantes, des voitures du groupe 2 clairement sous motorisées aux voitures du groupe a qui sont bien trop rapides pour les spéciales sinueuses et qui demandent une conduite attentive.

Beaucoup de voitures sont disponibles par groupe (un peu moins dans le groupe a) et elles ont toutes un comportement différent.

Les devs sont très impliqués dans le jeu avec des mises à jour régulières qui apportent du nouveau contenu (régions et voitures)

Seul petit point faible, l'absence de pace notes et de minimap couplée à la caméra de dessus rend certains virages difficiles à anticiper. Ce n'est pas vraiment un problème en mode contre-la-montre parce qu'on peut juste recommencer (les spéciales durent 4 ou 5 minutes max) et on finit par les connaître par coeur mais, dans le mode "histoire" où les spéciales sont aléatoires, ça peut être pénible.

Bref un super jeu de rally dans lequel on s'investit grâce à un sentiment de progression au fur et à mesure qu'on maîtrise de mieux en mieux les voitures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10153, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 2409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1702263589}
review:
[h1]
尘埃拉力玩不动了，就玩这个。
[/h1]

美术风格清新的拉力游戏，车多边形数量不多却很有神韵，风景更是一绝。操控部分难度并不小，刚上手时一个弯都过不好。但在控制速度后慢慢找到了手感，再逐步提速逼近极限。10小时，玩了3个阶段的生涯模式，解锁了两个自由探索地图，初步上手。一次次调整走线、提高过弯速度、优化刹车时机，和自己较量，颇有些禅意。

author: {'steamid': '76561197983280761', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1703383159}
review: Incredibly fun, beautiful graphics and just the right amount of difficulty. I really like this game! It plays equally great on 720p on a Steam Deck as it does at 2k+ resolutions on my gaming PC. It feels super rewarding when you throw the car into a corner and do a smooth drift. I will keep playing and hope more content slowly fills it out. Highly recommend if you own a Steam Deck, but be ready to change up your controller settings and sensitivity.

Nice and relaxing/chill game to play, especially with controller. Game looks good and is easy to learn. There is not much more to it than driving rally stages to the beautiful backdrop of which ever country you are in. The progression in too higher class of car makes it more challenging, as the result of an increase in power from class to class. 

The main thing when buying expect not too much of a story or too realistic/hard of a game it is very relaxed by nature. 
Recommend to play with controller.

review: Игра разочаровала. Сложность в игре достигается за счёт максимально неудобного управления. Знаете, бывают такие игры, в которых даже в пределах полосы сложно держаться на минимальной скорости. Вот эта такая. О каком ралли может идти речь в таком случае? Визуальная составляющая приятная, да. Вида из кабины автомобиля нет. Камеры неудобные. Главное меню убогое. Карьера примитивная. Короче говоря, такое себе. Не рекомендую к покупке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034812998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1704498146}
review:
[h1]Pure driving essence. A perfect vision perfectly executed.[/h1]

There is no fluff at all in this game; it's just you, any one of dozens of legendary cars, and stunning winding roads. The sound design is incredible, the background music is perfectly measured, the art style is simple and beautiful. 

Played with a controller, a manual transmission, and no assists, it enters a league of its own. You can [i]feel[/i] the absolute limit of grip around every corner, with every gear change and through every kick of the clutch. Every car and every stage has to be iteratively mastered. It's hard, but when you finally chain it all together... 

A masterpiece.

review:
A low poly semi arcade rally game where you play through the "history" of rally era across some fictional stages on different countries.

Game has pretty fun handling once you get used to it, in some ways it's actually a better rally game than the recent rally expansion pack for Forza horizon 5 game, in this game rally actually feels more like rally and similar to games like dirt rally series than FH5 with rally skin from that other game.

The game performance is quite disappointing considering that this is a low poly game, but it supports 21:9 display aspect ratio well.

author: {'steamid': '76561199065003962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1952, 'last_played': 1704285407}
review:
Would recommend, provided you have an idea what you're in for.

I would advise you to ignore any review that claims the controls of this game are "realistic." They aren't. They are more "advanced" than basic arcade or kart racer games, I'd say. They aren't realistic. The same physics that allow you to get that big, sweet air also make your vehicle go airborne after backing into a 45-degree embankment at, like, 13mph. I don't care what kind of weight reduction measures your team may have employed in your head canon---cars don't do that. In line with the visuals, the controls feel kind of like a cartoon or caricature version of driving.

Despite the weird behavior of the cars, it is possible to make them do what you want. The models each have a different feel to them, based at least in part on the engine aspiration and drive-train. But the controls are not exactly "intuitive." Also, you might as well get in the habit of flying off course. The 5sec penalty is still less of a loss than you'll incur by actually trying to get your car to come to a stop so you can go into reverse and reposition yourself.

I imagine for many people the graphics are the big draw. Everything looks great in photos, but it can be hard to look at when actually driving. (Chalk it up to rally racing; learn the courses.) I did have a few display problems (stuttering/freezing) on my most recent install that didn't occur before. Can't say why. 

Altogether, it's a mostly fun game with a good vibe. Most frustrations I experienced involved trying to hit target times, and not just progressing through the base game. 

If they release more content or a sequel, I'd probably check it out.

ADDED: So, I've obviously continued playing the game. But I'm adding another caveat: The leaderboards are unreliable. Even if you aren't committed to competing with top players, this means you don't always have an idea of how your performance stacks up against your previous times unless you are willing to keep track records yourself.

review: Spiel bewerte ich als definitiv gut. Fahren macht richtig Spaß. Idee ist gut, wie man Jahr für Jahr zu schnelleren Autos kommt macht Sinn und gibt eine verständliche Progression. Besonders gut: Die Musik. Gute Laune vorprogrammiert. Und sie zieht sich nicht nur über eine Etappe, sondern auch ins Menü weiter. Gibt ein rundes Gefühl und lässt die kurzen Ladezeiten noch angenehmer vergehen, dass die gute Laune dauerhaft vorhanden ist. Das Wohlgefühl wird nicht unterbrochen. Eine wirkliche Oase des Glücks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051793059', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1690113778}
review:
I really tried to like this game, but it fails to deliver some basic features of a good racing game. One of these basic features is driving physics. All cars are so wobbly and it is not possible to steer them instinctively. Also, I know that tracks are auto-generated, but without co-pilot directions, the feeling of this game is closer to Micro Machines than a rally game.

The game has a cute art style, various legendary cars and a free roam mode. Nevertheless, I would go back to CMR04 instead of replaying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000453452', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14457, 'last_played': 1704959060}
review:
Played this game while building my IRL rally car.
Can't afford to spend more money on expensive racing-sim rigs so this game fits the bill perfectly.
Realizing that I don't have to pay for gas, maintenance or stage fee in the game, and the car comes with pitch perfect tune with 100% reliability.
Profit!!
[strike]Motorsports are like girls; the best ones are found electronically and the real ones are a moneypit.[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198156089925', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1462, 'last_played': 1645923417}
review: While sharing the same sport as games such as DiRT Rally, this game distinguishes itself in its own unique way through the art style and game play. The vibe of this game feels much more relaxed and enjoyable than the white-knuckled racing of the more realistic racing simulators and as a result this game fills a unique role of being fun while scratching that racing itch. This game has also gotten many updates with more content for free which shows how much the devs care.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418889117', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1682925651}
review:
Pudo ser el juego de Rally perfecto, es de por si hermoso en su diseño artistico y muy relajante, el juego intenta ir al hueso, el objetivo es claro: desentrañar el espiritu de correr rallys.

 Lo consigue desde su concepcion, puesta en escena y desarrollo, pero no desde lo tecnico, este port lamentablemente posee micro stuttering, empañando la experiencia aun en equipos de altas prestaciones, una lastima, por que contrasta con el esquema de relax que propone.

Otra cosa que me parecio chapuzera, es que los Clase B NO SON los mas potentes del catalogo, esto es una licencia que se toma el juego por que necesita estructurar su modo historia temporal con cierta logica, pero los que conocemos de Rally nos causara molestia (o gracia) ver que un Subaru Impreza  (280 a 300 Hp) figura mas potente que un Lancia Delta S4 ( bestia de casi 500 HP), simplemente ridiculo y no se justifica.

Pudo ser y no fue, lo tecnico lastro todo lo genial de este titulo, aun asi recomiendo una probadita en descuento.

Mi nota: 7

author: {'steamid': '76561198002155787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8906, 'last_played': 1706568529}
review:
Ok, après 150h de jeu je pense que je peux donner un avis qui aura peut-être un peu de pertinence.

J'ai acheté ce jeu en pack avec le précédent des mêmes développeurs, un truc de drift sur le même moteur, qui m'a pas mal saoulé, j'ai aps trop aimé, mais c'est ptet aussi parce que le drift c'est pas trop mon truc, moi je kiffe plutôt le rally.

Je le ressens comme un excellent compromis, un jeu d'arcade ultra-accessible avec un minimum de réglages pour arriver direct dans l'action, des graphismes tout mignons <3 et un gameplay qui arrive à être plaisant, mais avec suffisamment de subtilité pour motiver à try-hard, sans pour autant être punitif. On est loin d'une simulation genre RBR ou Dirt, mais les différences entre les différentes caisses sont vraiment bien retranscrites, la physique est correcte et suffisamment bien tunée pour que ça soit agréable à jouer tout en récompensant la maîtrise de la conduite (surtout depuis les derniers patchs qui ont rendu les sauts beaucoup moins aléatoires).

Dans les défauts parce qu'il y en a : on fait relativement vite le tour de tous les circuits et toues les caisses (surtout en 150h ...). Il n'y a pas de réglage précis du force feedback, qui d'ailleurs est ... chelou, même s'il fait le taf. La gestion des dégâts est anecdotique et il n'y a aucun réglage des voitures (moi je le vois plutôt comme un avantage vu l'approche arcade), la gestion de la pluie est simpliste, et la physique en général a des défauts bizarres, genre quand la voiture se met à décoller et partir en tonneau, on a l'impression que d'un coup la gravité est la même que sur la lune, très étrange. Mais tant qu'on ne fait pas de sortie de route, la physique est suffisamment convaincante, je trouve. Quant à la musique elle est ... adaptée on va dire, et les bruitages sont satisfaisants, les bruits de moteur font bien le taf. Il y a un onglet "mods" mais c'est uniquement pour changer les livrées, donc aucun intérêt pour moi :( Les épreuves en ligne sont vraiment peu nombreuses, aussi, juste un time attack quotidien et un championnat de 4 courses par semaine, c'est pas beaucoup.

Bref, pour un petit jeu il est très réussi et rempli très bien son office.

Typiquement le genre de jeu que je donnerais beaucoup pour avoir le code source, ou une version modable, car je pense que ça serait une très bonne plate-forme, à la foi techniquement saine et (a priori mais ptet c'est une fausse impression) relativement accessible. Il me fait beaucoup penser à Generally, mais en infiniment mieux fini.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970188930', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1706234002}
review:
first of all, all rally games are essentially platformers, so jot that down.

i think that's a great way to describe this game, because it's not quite a sim due simply to not having the level of detail. but it's a great game, where you take a car through tracks that provide a vibe of real world rally locations. the car physics are detailed enough to have unique driving characteristics for every car, without having to give a shit about tuning. very controller friendly. the synthwave and the pastel color grading creates a soothing experience, which is how i imagine colin mcrae looking at the world when he sat in a car. 

very recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198199700838', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3505, 'last_played': 1709093545}
review:
Art of Rally is one of those games that's close to perfect. there is very little about it that is bad or even that could have been done better. the graphics are beautiful in their simplicity, the gameplay is simple and engaging even for me who had never played a racing game before. now i have dozens of top 1% time attack times. and the music, omg the music. this is actually my favourite video game soundtrack. i've listened to it like at least double my hours. i bought it on vinyl it was so good. i discovered this game from its music, and i'm so glad i tried it too, because it is nearly perfect
i have like, 2 nitpicks. some songs are not mixed at the same volume as others. so you'll randomly get a song that's louder than others. and that some of the graphics are a little clippy.
i've had more issues but they were swiftly resolved by the developers in the steam community discussions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019059522', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1778, 'last_played': 1677942949}
review:
[h1]Schnell, klein und fein! | [b]9/10[/b][/h1]

Ich bin kein passionierter Motorsportfan oder Racing-Sim-Liebhaber, DiRT ist mir zu komplex. Deshalb war ich auf der Suche nach einem Spiel, das eine gelungene Mischung aus Arcade und Simulation bietet – und genau das habe ich hier gefunden.

Die Low-Poly-Optik von art of rally ist einfach umwerfend. Die liebevoll gestalteten Strecken und die detailreichen Umgebungen werden nie langweilig und machen Laune. Die Story mit ihrem Humor und geschichtlichen Fakten ist sehr unterhaltsam. Und das Beste? art of rally läuft absolut flüssig und ohne jegliche Performance-Probleme, selbst auf dem Steam Deck.

Die Schwierigkeit des Spiels ist genau richtig. Es ist herausfordernd genug, um mich immer wieder aufs Neue zu fordern, aber niemals frustrierend. Das gilt auch für die kurzen Rennen und Turniere. Es gibt kein endloses Hin- und Herfahren, sondern schnelle, actionreiche Runden, die auch dann perfekt sind, wenn man nur wenig Zeit hat.

Das einzige Manko ist vielleicht, dass es im Spiel wenig Erklärungen gibt. Als Einsteiger musste ich mich zu Beginn etwas durchprobieren, um alle Feinheiten des Spiels zu verstehen.

[u]Fazit[/u]: art of rally ist eine tolle Rallye-Simulation, die mit beeindruckender Optik, angemessener Schwierigkeit, kurzen Runden und einer perfekten Mischung aus Arcade und Simulation begeistert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306938469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1691343627}

author: {'steamid': '76561198262712408', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1690624361}
review:
Art of Rally is an absolute gem of a game that has revved up my love for racing in ways I never thought possible. What truly sets this game apart is its mesmerizing music that transforms each race into a symphony of speed and sound.

From the moment you hit the accelerator, you're greeted by a soundtrack that feels tailor-made for every twist and turn. The music seamlessly weaves into the gameplay, creating an immersive experience that's both thrilling and euphoric. 

As a racing enthusiast, I've played my fair share of games, but Art of Rally takes the cake with its unique blend of visual artistry and audio magic. The tracks pulse with life, and the music acts as the heartbeat that keeps you in tune with the road. It's a symphony of engines and melodies that work together in perfect harmony.

Whether you're a seasoned racer or a newbie to the genre, Art of Rally is a must-play for anyone who craves an adrenaline rush accompanied by a killer soundtrack. It's a driving experience that goes beyond the finish line, creating a lasting memory of racing to the rhythm. So grab the virtual steering wheel, turn up the volume, and get ready to embark on a musical rally adventure like no other!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146974823', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 25672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2723, 'playtime_at_review': 4281, 'last_played': 1712176907}
review:
Art of Rally U.S.A., toiset tykkää, toiset ei.

No, oikeastihan Funselektor on Kanadasta. Kyseessä on joka tapauksessa vähän ihmeellinen sekoitus, jonka kuvakulma tuo mieleen 90-luvun Ignition-rälläyksen, joka näyttää siltä kuin ohjaisit Micro Machines -autoa paperissa diodraamassa, jossa rallin historian tunnetuimmat autot (ja muutama vähemmän tunnettu) ovat mukana sarjakuvamaisina karikatyyreina, jonka ääniraita on eteerista konepoppia säestettynä erilaisten moottorien ominaisäänillä (mukana tietysti hukkaportin suhahdukset ja saksalaisen electro-industrial-bändin komppiryhmältä kuulostavat antilagit), jonka ajomalli on sekin omituinen sekoitus simulaation ja mariokartin välillä.

Juuri tämä elementtien sekoittuminen on aiheuttanut negatiivisiakin arvioita, itse olen jonkun matkaa viihtynyt, tosin nostan pöydälle heti ensimmäisen kissan: ohjain.

Yksi vaihtoehto on pelata näppiksella kuten tätä olisi 90:n arcaderälläyksenä lähestynytkin. Se onnistuu, mutta hivenen tuntuu siltä, että sivuluisussa ajaminen voisi olla helpompaakin analogisella kaasulla. Toisaalta inhoan nykyaikaista padia kuin ruttoa, ohjain käyttää ties kuinka monta vuosikausien kirjoittamisen (ja näppispelaamisen) harjaannuttamaa sormeani lähinnä pysyäkseen kädessä ja aivan liikaa asioita pitäisi tehdä peukaloilla – ja minähän pelaan kuitenkin pöydän ääressä. Toisaalta kuulemma myöskään oikea simuratti ei ole hyvä tähän tarkoitukseen (itseltäni nyt ei tätä nykyä sellaista löydy niin en ole testannut). Muita kaupallisia vaihtoehtoja on nykyään vähänlaisesti, varsinaiset tikutkin ovat joko digitaalisia arcademätkimiä tai full hd lentotikkuja, millä tätä muka pitäisi ohjata, rautakauden aikaisella Gravis Analogillako? Puolivakavissaan mietin saisikohan jostain jonkun keypadin analogisilla kytkimillä ja sitä voisi väittää koneelle joystickiksi? 

Uratila on rallissa tietysti vain kasa kilpailuja, jotka pitää ajaa nopeammin kuin jonkun algoritmin arpomat ajat muille kuljettajille, lajissa kun on lähinnä olemattomasti vuorovaikutusta (edes Carloksen auto ei syty palamaan). Tämä on kuitenkin välttämätöntä kaikkien avaamiseksi. Rallin aikana auto saattaa hajota, tai ainakin periaatteessa saattaa hajota, mutta oletusvahinkoasetuksilla tuntuu ainoa vaadittu huoltotoimi olla auton peseminen. Erikoiskokeita voi myös uusia, mitä mahdollisuutta ei tietenkään viitsi oikeasti käyttää, koska silloin ei saa kaikki bonuspalkintoja ja muuten huijarien touhua, yksi rallin perusajatuksistahan on ajamisen varmuus pitemmän päälle. (ulosajon jälkeen saa tosin aivan ehjä auton takaisin viiden sekunnin aikasakolla ryyditettynä).

Hauskempaa on kuitenkin ajella time attackia ja verrata, miten korkealla on pelaajien maailmanlistalla (hämmentävintä kyllä olen joillain pätkillä päässyt viiden prosentin parhaimmistoon, ehkä näitä ovat kokeilleet niin monet sunnuntaiautoilijat kerran). Valitettavasti varsinaista GPLRankin kaltaista selkeää maailmanlistaa ei ole, joka jotenkin laskisi kokonaisuutena miten hyvä olet verrattuna muihin pelaajiin. Nöyryystä voi tietynkin hakea osallistumalla aktiivisempien pelaajien kansoittamiseen, satunnaisella autolla ajettavana merkkiluokkana suoritettaviin päivän erikoiskokeeseen tai viikon ralliin.  

Muutakin huomautettavaa, kartturia ei ole, koska tästä kuvakulmasta kai pitäisi nähdä mihin on menossa, mutta joskus ovat puut, joskus talot tiellä, yöajosta ja sumusta puhumattakaan, ja tulee mieleen, että eikös tuolla autossa niinku.... pitäisi olla joku tyyppi kertomassa mitä seuraavaksi tulee silmille. Samaten on hyvin vaihtelevaa, missä kohdin voi oikoa (ojiahan ei oikeastaan tunneta tässä rallimaailmassa) ja mikä lasketaan ulosajoksi, nämäkin kai pitäisi osata ulkoa.

Pelissä voi tietysti ajaa myös Suomessa, pätkillä, jotka näyttävät lopulta suomalaiselta rallipätkältä perin vähän, ja nimistä päätellen sijaitsevat lähinnä Porin läheisyydessä. No, vähän sellaisia karikatyyreja nuo muutkin sijainnit lienevät, ei Saksassakaan ole keskiaikaisia linnoja kai ihan kaikki paikat väärällään?

author: {'steamid': '76561198076377654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1691512467}
review: A better rally game than Dirt Rally or any other rally game that has come out in 8 or 9 years.  Sound track is awesome.  Physics are great.  Cars feel good.  As with any rally game, it takes a few races to get a hang of how the cars handle.  Don't let the aesthetics fool you, this is not much of an arcade racer.  It takes some finesse to get the cars around the track.  Highly recommend playing with some sort of controller.  Only cons I can think of are: I've experienced some framerate drops from time to time and no force feedback on a racing wheel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259183894', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1832, 'last_played': 1701490071}
review:
[b]Sadly as much as I love Group B and really wanted to enjoy this game it is impossible for me to recommend in good faith. Even though this game markets itself as some sort of homage to the golden age of rally many elements of the game design seem to contradict this and this review will list my main gripes. However I will start out with a few positives as I don't want anyone to think I have something against this game or believe it's all bad :P.[/b] 

[b]TLDR:[/b] A quite decent game with a great concept is undercut by invisible walls, poor attention to detail and a somewhat strange handling model leaving it somewhere in between a relaxing "zen like" tribute to the greatest form of motorsport and a rage inducing nightmare with frustrating map design, invisible walls and a lack of the finer details that would have made this game the love letter to Group B and rally fans it claims to be.

[h1]What I liked[/h1] 

[h2]The Variety of Cars Included[/h2] 
This game features a wide variety of rally cars from all different eras from the 1960s through to the 1990s as well as a parallel universe class known as "Group S" which is the developers interpretation of where rally development would have gone if Group B was not discontinued. Really this is one of the games main strong suits as it most certainly has a wider variety of cars than you would first expect (including my favourite the Ferrari 288 GTO EVO which never actually got to race as it was developed right as Group B ended). However a few let downs were the engine note of each car being far, far too similar and a few famous liveries being left out of the options, although these can mostly be overlooked.

[h2]The Art Style[/h2]
Another main selling point of this game is its somewhat unique low poly / cartoony artstyle this in my opinion works quite well with the semi arcadelike feeling that this game was going for with its more striped back approach. Overall I like it quite a bit (especially how the different time of day impacts the look of each stage) however some of the stages / maps have textures clipping into each other and other details which undercut what is otherwise a really appealing clean artstyle. The worst part is the new Indonesia maps don't have this problem which tells me that it is absolutely fixable and it is just a product of the devs not putting the effort in to get the game polished on release almost making the game feel a bit rushed when it should be leaning more in the labour of love direction, considering how this game is supposed to be a tribute to Group B and all. 

[h2]The inclusion of different game modes[/h2] 
Another positive of this game is the inclusion of different modes which can suit different play styles / moods and can add variety to the gameplay they are as follows:

[b]Career[/b]
In this gamemode you play linearly through the history of rally starting in the 60s and working your way through chronologically until you reach Group A rally (Group S is slotted in between Group B and Group A and it is required that you play through Group S before reaching Group A). The career mode is broken up into the years each class of rally took place in (eg. Group B in the 80s and Group A in the 90s) you play through each year completing multiple rallies competing not only in each stage but each rally and also for the overall championship for the year. Throughout the career mode you will unlock cars and (if you have at least one restart remaining at the end of the year) bonus liveries which add a small sense of progression on top of the fact that you are progressing forwards in the history of rally after completing each year. this is my favourite game mode purely because it adds a sense of competition through the AI and it is such a satisfying feeling progressing into a new era of rally as the cars feel completely distinct across classes.

[b]Time Trial[/b]
This game mode has you compete against the clock in the car/stage/conditions of your choice nothing more nothing less. You can try to work your way up the leader board or just improve upon your own times using either the world record ghost or the ghost of your fastest time.

[b]Freeroam[/b]
Freeroam allows you to freely travel across a map (eg. Finland, Japan, Sardinia etc.) collecting the letters R, A, L, L, Y, to progress to the next map as well as collecting points of interest (which are spots where you can get a scenic view of your car against a backdrop of the map) and cassettes which unlock different songs for the soundtrack. All of these elements are hidden across the map encouraging you to drive around and explore, this gamemode is pretty good to unwind to as there is no real pressure to preform and you can just drive your favourite car as you wish through each map.

[h1]What I didn't Like[/h1]

[h2]Invisible Walls[/h2]
For example there are a lot of invisible walls right next to the road on all stages, this means that for some tight corners for example cutting the corner close to the road is absolutely fine but for other corners you'll clip into an invisible wall which will send you tumbling through the sky ruining your stage and breaking any immersion / flow state you may have been in. This isn't only an issue when it comes to corner cutting however sometimes if you find yourself drifting slightly off of the marked road / track you will come head first into an invisible wall which will not only take away all of your momentum but if playing with damage turned on will ruin your car. I must stress that these invisible walls are [b][u]RIGHT NEXT TO[/u][/b] the road in a lot of areas and are in no way consistent making some stages feel like a game of random chance instead of a test of skill. What I will say however is this seems like it may not be as bad in the new stages added in the Indonesia update or at least it doesn't feel that way.

[h2]Handling[/h2]
As much as this is personal preference for me the handling in this game exists in a sort of 'no mans land' between being completely arcade like and being semi realistic almost as if the devs weren't sure in which direction they wanted to go and instead went straight down the middle. It definitely could be worse though and it is something you just get used to after a little bit of playtime, however I still sometimes find myself surprised when a car behaves unexpectedly relative to the road surface (tarmac, snow, gravel etc.) which can sometimes feel a little counter intuitive the main one that sticks out is the lack of grip on tarmac for example.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1] 
As much as I want to love this game it is the smaller details and the frustrating at times gameplay that let it down for me, for any die-hard Group B / Rally fans I would still recommend picking up this game on sale as there are definitely a few details (especially the cars) that I'm sure you'd enjoy to see in a game like this. If you are just looking at this game for an arcade like rally experience I am sure there are better options out there that are worth looking at as it would be a bit harder to overlook the more frustrating elements of this game.

[b]Much love to anyone who read this review hope this helps you make the right choice for you! Have a great day! :)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198220618991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3043, 'last_played': 1692416368}
review:
ストアページの画像や動画を見ての通り、このゲームは超リアルな映像を売りにしたものではありません。

ですが、その挙動は見た目の印象よりも骨太です。シミュレーター的なものではありませんが、車のパワーや駆動方式の違いから来る個性の表現がとても「それらしく」造られています。

とにかくこの個性の表現とカジュアルさのバランス、という所で秀逸な挙動なので、カメラアングルこそ特殊ですが入門向けとして推したいレベルにあります。

このゲームで雰囲気を掴めば、さらに"リアル"なゲームにも踏み込んでいけるでしょう。

収録されているマシンも仮名でこそありますが、皆様ご存知という一台から、非常にコアな一台まで幅広く揃っています。

取っつきやすく奥深く、遅い車からステップアップしていけるので、初心者からマニアまでオススメです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198208253273', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1699849140}
review: A game created from a passion for rallying, don't let the stylized look trick you into thinking this is just another arcade racer. Each vehicle has its own feel, and requires finesse to drive at the limit. The career takes you through the years of rally history, with every different class of old rally cars: Groups 2, 3, 4, B, S, and A. The physics are good, with each surface type having its own grip limits. The driving feels good, and is a lot of fun to just select a random stage with a random vehicle to just drive. I fully recommend this game to anyone that loves racing, and loves rallying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005425431', 'num_games_owned': 1224, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1688986641}
review:
I love Rally and own the complete Dirt series, many WRC titles, and a bunch of other rally games. I also love top-down racing, like Circuit Superstars. I wanted to like this, it seemed like the perfect in-between game for me, but it's just bad.

I also don't get why people say this is [i]hard[/i] -- let's face it, both the controls and the physics are very, very, bad. That's the problem. Yes, they make it hard to control the car, even in trivial corners. The tracks are very straight-forward, not suitable for rally because they lack interesting corners. But with these controls, they get indeed hard to navigate. Jesus. I requested a refund. 

On a side note, it also runs very badly. After a while of free-roaming on the Indonesia map, it got slower and slower. This is the only game I ever saw stutter on my computer, a powerful desktop machine with 128GB RAM and a recent Nvidia GPU.  How did they even manage that?! oO

author: {'steamid': '76561197992865415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1711809864}
review:
This is a great little game. It has just enough difficulty to seem impossible at first, but with a bit of patience and a controller one can master the art of rally.

I'm far from good, but I have gotten far more fun out of the game than any of the racing games since my teens.

Once I finished with the carreer I had a few moments where I just couldn't fathom how I did some of the really fast and technical parts without any mistakes at top speed. Just did it without thinking. Had I thought I would have failed. It made me all giddy with tension. This is very rare in a game.

A few hints:
- Staying on the road is usually more important than speed. Since road helps you to change both speed and direction of the car faster. Learn the game by staying on the road.

- Play through the carreer mode even if frustrating. No need to re-do as the amount of driving will teach you a lot once you conclude with 1995. You can always return and re-do whole seasons once you get grasp of drifts and how breaking will affect the steering and all the tiny micro-skills that exist out there. Trust your brain to learn a lot of it. Experiment.

Read the lore; it's fun.

- Play with the accellerator by pushing it repeatedly when taking turns. It will help your brain find the balance spot of control.

- Try to find cars which have better sideways-grip. Those stabilise better.

- Plan ahead. You can't handle some turns by improvising on the go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056657886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1688817907}
review:
I was hesitant to buy this game for 2 reasons, the top down view and the drifting. After pulling the trigger during a Steam sale I'm sorry I didn't buy this one sooner. The top down view is really more of a far chase cam, which I can absolutely live with. If Circuit Superstars had this camera view I would have hundreds of hours in that game by now.

As others have said, the game is easy to pick up but hard to master, meaning it's not going to be easy to post good times on the leaderboard and it's very challenging just to keep the car on the pavement, but it's not so frustratingly difficult that it's not enjoyable.

I haven't really done much drifting yet (not on purpose anyway) just working on controlling the car and learning the routes. So my initial concern about drifting hasn't really been a factor. I'll learn it as I go and continue to hopefully get faster.

Free roam is a nice option to have and it's fun to find the collectibles and explore the maps. 

The game is easily worth the $25 full price, but it was nice to pick it up on sale. I like it so much I will be buying it on Xbox as well.

Edit: After playing deeper into the game, I still think it's worth buying, but there are times when it seems too difficult. I just finished a stage at Norway in 4th place on normal mode, but I was top 10% on the leaderboard. Not saying my time was great, but top 10% should win most, if not all stages on normal mode. Also, the daily and weekly challenges are pointless once you get the achievements. They are one and done and you can't even practice for them. Great game overall, but it's too hard for most players, IMHO.

review:
グラフィックが素晴らしいです、センスの良さを感じます。走行中に見えるシーンにハットして操作をミスすることもしばしば、
ほんとに美しい景色が流れていきます（静止画だとわかりません）。それと製作者さんにお願いがあります、動物たちを動かしていただけないですか？、完璧なシーンになること間違いなしです！。ゲームのほうは他の方のレビューのとうりかと思いますが、グリップ走行でも十分楽しく遊べるし、そこからすこしずつドリフトを練習していくこともできます。初心者ドライバーでも大丈夫です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198285995361', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1688830052}
review:
Thumbs down because of the price - Way too high.

Visually the environment is very nice, indie-wise.
Cars sound pretty much all the same.
Music is cool, but I couldn't care less.
I feel the vehicles handle sluggish. The tendecy to oversteer is extreme, even at 60kmh.
Devs strategically placed objects where you most likely gonna crash.
[b]I crashed on a ZEBRA![/b]

TLDR: 
You gonna hate it. 
Then you gonna hate it some more. 
Then you gonna get used to the hate.
Eventually you gonna love hating it.
What world we end up living into..

review: Excelent game for playing casual rally. Very good graphic design with nostalgia about Rally golden era.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999164173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1710290006}
review: Hands down one of the best top down racing games ever. It's a rally so you're racing against the clock through multiple stages. There's many car groups and car models that resemble real cars that were rally gems and the gameplay is a mix of a arcade and simulation that feels so satisfying to drive. There's also a freeroam mode with many cool areas and there's online leaderboards, daily and weekly challenges. Completely recommend this game! I just wished the devs kept the track mods project alive :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197970832308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1708772972}
review:
I wasn't sure I'd like this given it's a more arcade-style rally game, when I thought I was a fan of realistic simulation rally (RBR and DIrt Rally 2.0), but I love it. Art of Rally still maintains the tension & 'feel' of rallying, without needing to be such a simulator.

The lack of pacenotes and the view style actually makes for a more enjoyable and less annoying game; the poor quality of Dirt Rally 2 pacenotes ended up making me give up on it. There are still stages which would benefit from some hazard warning pacenotes, but it's not such a problem. The fact that it's more arcadey also makes it more enjoyable to play, rather than just being stressful/intense!
It is visually beautiful, the ultra low polygon graphics end up looking spectacular, partly because of the colour choices and lighting effects.

Update: after more playing with the other cars I find most are extremely skittish and are hard to control to even keep in a straight line; I'm using a PS4 controller, with a wheel I'm sure would be better, just be aware of it. I've ended up reducing the sensitivity of the steering axis via controller configuration app. Still playable, and I may go back to the slower cars which didn't seem as bad.
