author: {'steamid': '76561198445269788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 188, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1712274815}
review: Accessible and easy to grasp but difficult to truly master, as any driving or racing game should be. Cars are all fun to drive and mostly feel unique to each other, and the different rally/road conditions make for a different set of challenges you'll consistently face. The fact it is still being updated with new rallies is rad, it's a strong game that is worth supporting and getting more of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382529727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 678, 'playtime_at_review': 10901, 'last_played': 1712489530}
review:
ラリー好きによるラリー好きのためのゲーム、そんな作品です。
歴代の素晴らしい名車たちを操り、世界の美しい景色のなかを駆け抜けましょう。

他のレビューでも多数言われていますが、可愛らしい見た目からは想像し難い、シビアな操作が必要になります。
でも心配は要りません。慎重なブレーキングが出来れば、とりあえず完走することはできます。
キャリアモードを走り切る頃には、木々に突進していたあなたも立派なラリーマスターになっていることでしょう。

一通り腕前を磨いたところで、タイムアタックモードで世界中の猛者たちと争うこともできます。
各ステージごとに任意のプレイヤーのゴーストを表示することが可能で、自分より速いプレイヤーの動きを参考にしてさらなるレベルアップを目指すことができます。
トップ10のタイムと使用マシンを見ると分かりますが、1車種に偏ることがほとんどなく、自分の好きなマシンで上位に食い込める可能性がある素晴らしいゲームバランスです。
リーダーボードに自分の名前を刻み込んで、世界中にアピールしましょう。

それでは、ラリーブッダのご加護があらんことを……

author: {'steamid': '76561198045281656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1697741741}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072545540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2217, 'last_played': 1699297042}
review: Un juego de rallys low-poly que entra por la vista pero también por el resto de sentidos. El control es sencillo pero realista. Con una variedad de coches que desbloquear para después deleitarte con lo diferentes que se sienten a sus mandos. Además, solo exige jugar los torneos para ir avanzando, sin que sea necesario quedar en una posición determinada. Así que relajadamente y sin presión, podemos ir completando el juego. Cuando acabes aún tendrás un desafío diario online y otro semanal. Mención especial a las descripciones de los coches, ¡hilarantes!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978358674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 2584, 'last_played': 1711294468}
review:
Very nice racing game that you can play with keyboard. The artstyle is simple but it is very pleasing to look at, goes very well with a banger techno-retro soundtrack. It's all about older rally racing, which is a very interesting period. You will be mostly drifting around the dirt and loving it. Even after beating all the championships, I'm still returning to this game almost daily for a couple of minutes to play the challenges. It has a great balance between relaxing and challenging.

Even if it works with keyboard, it will be much better if you use a gamepad.

Cons: the only multiplayer option are daily and weekly challenges. You can't set up lobbies and do championships ingame with a restricted group of friends. In the challenges you can't easily check how you did in the end. Still, you could organize something outside the game and then compare times, I think they do that in the game's discord server.
The damage modelling is way too easy, even in the hardest setting. I tried and literally couldn't get terminal damage. Which is a shame, since it could be a factor in the races - be more aggressive but risk more damage.
There is no map in the HUD, nor a navigator pointing out the next turns. But with the top view it isn't much of a problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210514576', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1667640362}
review:
Art of Rally has the opposite approach to rally driving in comparison to for example Dirt Rally. Its minimalistic approach gives it a more arcade feel than its competitors. The different maps and cars are very distinguishable from each other and you have to approach each setting differently, which is a very positive surprise. 

The handling of a cars is too simplefied in my opinion. Tapping the brakes while cornering is often enough to carry the car with a drift even through long stretched corners. Using other drifting and cornering methods aren't really needed. To embrace the arcade style approach of the game but also encourage different techniques, it would be good to first of all have an introduction to all driving methods and secondly offer a score gamemode in which you earn points by taking corners with different approaches on a simple lap to force the player to use and try out different techniques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376315304', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1704164626}
review:
Está muy bueno, ideal para los nostálgicos de los 80's, cuando los coches de rally eran latas con motores de 300 caballos.
El juego en sí es bonito visualmente, tiene buen audio, y los nombres de los coches son bastante graciosos al hacer referencia a sus contrapartes del mundo real.
En cuanto a gameplay, está bueno, las físicas se sienten bien, más allá de su apartado artístico, sí se siente que los coches tienen peso y no son de juguete, por lo que habrá que ir con cuidado al momento de los derrapes y curvas complicadas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024921983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1692971819}
review:
The controls/physics are downright unforgiving: The cars skid when starting from a standstill, drift in most curves, are prone to oscillate back and forth if you turn a bit too far, and don't get me started on how engaging the handbrake simply sends you down the cliff sideways; but therein lies the challenge and the "art of rally". Once you finally get the hang of it, it's very satisfying to drift past the cheering crowd in a perfectly balanced line.
P. S. The cars have secret messages written under them. Be sure to check them out while you roll out of control after hitting yet another rock on the side of the road. #tofu

author: {'steamid': '76561198996032843', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 2328, 'last_played': 1712394572}
review:
見た目はローポリなのだが、実のところは[u]グラフィックを(盆栽のように)剪定した[/u]レースゲーム。
運転の挙動、打てば響く感じが気持ち良い。
乱雑な操縦をすれば痛いしっぺ返しを食らうのもまた良い。

ついでに。キャリアをクリアするだけなら車を壊さずに完走し続けるだけでOK=順位不問という点で、[b]初めてレースゲームを遊ぶ人にも勧められる[/b]と私は思います。うっかり壊しても数回 (ステージ数による) リスタートできますから。
[spoiler]クリア後の、自分に合う車探しに沢山の時間とステージを使っちゃいますけれどね！[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199390684814', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1703615160}
review:
Arcade-style rally games have been practically non-existent outside of the DiRT series.

And out of the blue in 2020, an absolute artistic wonder called "art of rally" shows up out of nowhere. But that's not all, turns out it's an absolute pleasure to play as well, the handling model is relatively forgiving and accessible for those of all ages and skill levels. Hell, even my mum would have a blast playing this game.

100% recommend picking this game up, it's an absolute steal at only £20, wow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071350538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 2858, 'last_played': 1711928154}

review: I want to listen to spotify while I play this, but it feels like a HUGE disservice to not groove to this games soundtrack. So I do not. (also Samir... you're breaking the car) 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198098786840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 48, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1711321318}
review:
As the name suggests, this game is a piece of art. 
The soundtrack is really good and complements the art style of the game and vibe completely.
The handling/gameplay is surprisingly realistic, coming closer to a sim-cade like Forza Horizon than arcade games, I haven't played such a fun and engaging racing game on a controller in a while. 
It took me around 20 hours to complete the history mode, which was super fun. 
The way the game tells you the story of rally throghout the years is very interesting, and it highlights the beauty of rally. Also, the description of most of the cars are super interesting and have some hilarious descriptions to them, I had a great time just reading them lol. 
In a era where racing games, especially arcade ones are so lacking, this game is the glimpse of hope on this genre, 10/10, can recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961474988', 'num_games_owned': 2924, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1702887039}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002511225', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1710283040}
review:
Just keep it CLEAN and SIMPLE!
So kann man "Art of Rally" beschreiben.
Grafisch hält sich das Spiel wie beschrieben und hat so auch seinen ganz eigenen Charme.
Spielerisch ist es aber dennoch ein nicht zu unterschätzender Rally Titel welche sich sehr schön mittels Gamepad steuern lässt. Schäden machen sich in der Beschleunigung, Tempo und Handling bemerkbar, jedoch ACHTUNG, wenn der Wagen Feuer gefangen hat, dann kann jede Kollision das AUS bedeuten. Aber es gibt nach jeder 2. Stage die Möglichkeit das Fahrzeug mittels Punktesystem zu reparieren.

Was die Fahrzeugauswahl betrifft, fällt diese in mehreren Rally Klassen relativ groß aus und man merkt trotz Low-Poly Modelle, welche Vorbilder sie haben und die Beschreibungen auf jeden Wagen sind auch sehr interessant zu lesen.

Alles in Allem ein gutes Arcade Rally Spiel, welches ich sehr empfehlen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227746040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1708898096}
review:
[h1]art of rally review[/h1]

Art of rally plays in an alternate universe where the legendary "Group B" never ended the greed for more horsepower and lighter cars in the rally sport. Due to multiple accidents in the Group B series including multiple deaths (of spectators and drivers) the series had to get canceled. Cars going 0-60 mp/h in less than 3 seconds on gravel that could keep up with F1 cars of the era might've been a bit too much to pilot on narrow technical roads, even for the best drivers. However, in this game the series continued and the planned "Group S" is a reality, with actual prototype cars that were in development before the series got canceled.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Despite it's innocent look and low-poly art style, this game is still to be taken seriously. The physics are incredibly well optimized for controller gameplay and dare I say - realistic. All the real life rally techniques can be applied in this game: clutch kicking, scandinavian flicks, weight transfers, anything you can think of, can be done in this game and the best thing about it, it gains you time. Heck, the developers visited rally schools and it shows in the physics. It's obviously not a simulation, but this is as good as it gets for a game that isn't meant to be driven with a wheel and pedals.

[h1]Vehicles[/h1]

Due to the game playing in an alternate universe, you won't find any licensed cars. However, this is actually a brilliant way to bypass licensing fees. All the cars seen in the game are basically real life cars as they exist, but with a slight change in the name, as you would imagine, since it is an alternate universe after all. Regardless of that, the vehicle descriptions are hilarious and filled with references. Any enthusiast that knows the cars and the history of rallying is going to love it, especially since all the iconic cars are featured. On top of it, every car has very distinctive handling, mimicking their real life counterparts.

[h1]Car customization[/h1]

Unfortunately this is where the game falls a bit short. You can't change the car setups, solely the paint. You can unlock new paints by finishing stages and most of them are also references to the real world counterparts, but that's about it. Not a big deal for me since I don't fiddle all that much with setups, but still worth mentioning.

[h1]Music[/h1]

Why would I talk about the music in a racing game, when all you want to hear is the car sounds? Simple answer: the music is absolutely brilliant. Synthwave isn't necessarily a genre I was familiar with, but after completing the game I fell in love with it. It just adds so much value to the whole experience. Driving a stage with synthwave blasting, hitting the apex of every corner, the vibrant colors - it just sends you into a trance-like state and I loved every bit about it.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

All in all, this game is an actual masterpiece filled with humorous references, amazing music and of course - brilliant gameplay. The more you love cars, the history of them and the stories motorsport produced, the more you are going to love this game. This is more than just a game, it's a work of art - The art of rally - an homage to the sport as a whole. A must play for every rally enthusiast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992951393', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5828, 'last_played': 1702003136}
review:
TL;DR: Great, simple arcade-style game.

I honestly find myself coming back to this game incredibly often. While the physics and driving are absurdly floaty and a far stretch from realism, the whole game oozes of something I am hard pressed to find in most video games today: passion. And where you see passion, you can also admire the fact that no corners were cut in these aspects. Funselektor clearly has a true appreciation for the sport of rally and it shows, from the car designs, incredibly iconic and instantly recognizable, yet simplistic enough where they look almost cute, to the description text accompanying each and every one, lauding their accomplishments in the world of rally or simply adding a touch of humor to the cars. The soundtrack is also loaded with bangers that make you feel like a badass even as you crash into every tree on the stage from start to finish.

Gameplay-wise, the game is dead-simple. The WASD controls definitely make steering harder and far less precise than, say, a racing wheel, but if you own a racing wheel and are looking for a game to use it on, this definitely isn't it. Initially, the cars feel far too slidey, as if you're constantly on ice, but you do come to get used to it, and once you get the hang of it, you'll be able to rotate the car seamlessly and hit the most satisfying Scandi flicks around hairpins.

For lovers of rally, this game is an extremely entertaining arcade-style game with a splendid art direction, but if you're looking for a realistic or immersive experience, try Richard Burns Rally instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156101177', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2300, 'last_played': 1693629948}
review:
TL;DR: Gorgeous rally-game that feels like doing a blazing sunday-drive (in the best way) where death can be found outside every corner

Great rally-game for anyone wanting a breather from or a generally less intense game than the AAA driving sims around. The minimalist art-style combined with the vibrant use of colours makes for one of the more beautiful racing-games out there. The physics feel great, and tricks like shifting weight, Scandi flicks and clutch kicking all come into play in order to wrap these iconic cars around the corners. (I'm by no means a rally-veteran, but from what I can tell, this is good enough to be more than simply an arcade-racer)

I'd recommend this to just about anyone interested in racing-games and who's willing to learn and get humbled by turn after turn. 

My only real gripes with the game are the lack of pacenotes and closer camera-options, but their absence are justified by the more laid-back approach to the racing, and the times where you don't see a turn or crest early enough to plan for it, are few and far between.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290124697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2987, 'last_played': 1694745374}

author: {'steamid': '76561198336441212', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 3440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1687107413}
review:
An essential game for anyone into racing games. It boggles my mind that a game of such quality and depth came out of just one guy (helped by a small team, afaik). And this is not a case of "Oh, it's pretty good for a game made by one guy! It deserves to be played!". No, this game stands head and shoulders above most of the arcade racing games out today, especially the AAA ones.

Getting into some specifics. This is the first rally game I played, and I haven't played any sim racing games yet. The art is gorgeous, the music is top notch and fits the game perfectly. The handling of the vehicles as well as the camera angle is just right - it is difficult to pull off your first drift and do a clean turn, but you're gonna love it when you get it. The driving is not exactly realistic, but definitely much, much more challenging than your average arcade racer. 

For anyone else coming from other arcade racers into this, I recommend learning to drive with manual transmission - it helps with the drifts a lot. It will take a few hours (you are dropped in a free roam map when you first start-up the game), but the sense of progression from not being able to keep the car on the road to anticipating and pulling off drifts to navigate turns is immensely gratifying. Speaking of progression, the game has a fantastic career mode - with races in different eras in the history of rally. I really appreciate the small blurbs and quips about the history of the cars and events. It  makes the game more complete. Made me appreciate and want to go learn more about rally. The career can also be played through multiple times - since each time the tracks for a season are randomized.

In conclusion, if you have even a passing interest in rally racing, and you love racing games, this game is an absolute must play. Chef's kiss. Bellissimo 🤌

author: {'steamid': '76561199488419569', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1682948189}
review:
Put your Helmets on! Fasten your seatbelts! Tighten your racing gloves! ... 3, 2, 1, and off we go!

Right upon starting the game for the first time you're thrown into free roam of one of it's 7 countries the game takes part in. In order to unlock the next country for free roam you'll have to find all the necessary collectibles. The great thing about this is that you'll not only get a feel for the game and a certain map before actually racing on it but collectibles are picked up in this game mode so you won't have to restart a bunch of career races because you missed a cassette tape.

The game doesn't seem to have official licensing for the cars but it found a fantastic workaround in giving each car a nick name like the esky for the Ford Escort. Also they look like a perfect miniature drawing of its original and come in a variety of liveries that have to be unlocked by progressing through the career mode.

The career mode takes you through the years 1967 all the way to 1996 in rallying featuring all the important classes of it's decades from Group 2 to the unforgettable Group B and it's successors. You're racing against the clock on various stages randomly chosen by the game. The cars all handle and sound slightly different and therefore give you a real feel of depth. Different weather conditions and surface varieties will make your live misserable at times but it also adds to the games ralism that you wouldn't expect from it's initial presentation.

A birds eye view accompanied by the cute graphics style suggest the game is aimed at young audiences and while they definately should give this a go the game can be very challenging especially if you up the difficulty settings. Handling can feel a tad unrealistic but also has some sliders in the options menu to adjust for example counter steering.

The soundtrack is fantastic. If you fancy synthesizer music this will be right up your ally. Also car sounds are superb featuring sqeeky breaks, popping exhausts and rattleing gearboxes. Additional game modes like time attack and Online MP round things up.

This then is a great Indi Racing Title with a lot of depth and love for the History of Rally Sport. I recommend taking the game for a spin and enjoy its soothing soundtrack.

review:
It's a great skateboarding game. It's about the flow, the drifting, setting your steering angle and pinning the throttle into a turn even though you're not sure the tires can handle it and maybe you'll do a barrel roll into a tree but maybe you'll hit the perfect line and fly out of that corner ready (or not) to repeat the whole process over because there is no codriver; it's just you and the road.

Also it's pretty and sounds good and you can just tell how much the developers love rally. I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118033005', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7248, 'last_played': 1704347245}
review:
ラリーってかっこいいね・・！
ラリーファンの多くはラリードライバーではありません。私たちは当時のテレビ映像や雑誌からのみこの時代のラリー文化に触れています。業界を取り巻いていた熱気とか、次々登場する新技術への驚き、サーキットとは違って国ごとに特色のある景色。そういうファン目線でワクワクする要素がうまく表現されています。誰よりも作者さんが大好きなんだろうなってひしひしと感じられます。

ビジュアルこそデフォルメされていますが車の挙動はかなりリアル寄りで、駆動方式やエンジンによる違いがはっきり感じられます。プアなサスペンションの車両は着地が安定しなかったり、ロータリーエンジンは音が煩くて吹け上がりが早かったり。タイムを競うだけでなく車の手触りのようなものを楽しんだり、知らなかった車に興味をもって元ネタを調べたり。そういう楽しさがあり他のレースゲームを投げ出した私でも飽きずに遊べています。
(最初は道の上を走ることも難しかったのが今では安定して上位5%～20%くらいのタイムが出せるようになり、エンディングを見たあともコツコツあそんでいます！)

■多くのラリーゲームで定番になっている以下の要素は潔く省略されており、おかげで私は運転と景色に集中できました。
言われてみればこういうのって走り出すのがひたすら億劫になる要素でしかなかったな・・と。[b]リアルとたのしいは違うんだ。[/b]
・コックピット視点([b]見下ろし視点のみ[/b]-視野角は調整可)。
・コパイロットによる音声ナビゲーション。
・車高やギア比などのセッティング。タイヤの選択。
・クレジットの概念。車両の購入/売却/修理といった経営要素。
・即大破(ダメージ要素はあるが軽微で無効にもできる)。
・タイヤ温度や消耗。
・本番前のシェイクダウンラン。
・車両の実名収録(その代わり、[b]実車を示唆するユーモアに富んだ解説[/b]が書かれていてたのしい！)。

■ほかに特筆すべき点は
・統一感がありつつもステージ各国の要素を取り入れたBGMが良い。ウクライナのスタジオで収録されたそうです。
・コースが豊富です。7ヶ国×5コース×2(逆走)×晴天の雨天のバリエーションがあり、6+αの車両クラスごとにタイムが別集計されるので全パターンの記録を残すだけでもけっこう時間がかかる量です。
・走行毎のセッティングが要素がない反面、視野角、キーバインド、カウンターステア、ABSやトラクションコントロールなどのアシスト強度は細かく設定でき、[b]一度きちんと設定すれば操作のしにくさがストレスになることがありません[/b]。ほんと車の特性や路面にだけ集中できます。

■[b]最後に私のおすすめの設定を載せます。[/b]
うまく操作できないよーって人は真似してみてね。ゲームパッドでやってます。

□グラフィック→高度な設定
・ブルーム、ぼかし、フィルムグレイン、モーションブラーを全部オフに

□オーディオ
・マスターボリューム：55%
・車両容積：65%
・ミュージック：50%
・アンビエントボリューム：100%

□カメラの設定
・カメラビュー：1
・視野の広さ：48
・カメラの回転：60%
・カメラの手ぶれ：0%

ゲームプレイとコントロールに関しては全部デフォルトです！
でも視野が変わるだけでめちゃくちゃ運転しやすくなり、カメラの追従度を上げると低速コーナーで先が見えるようになります。
長時間遊ぶと大きい音で疲れちゃうので音量設定もわりと重要ですね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198008448321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1424, 'last_played': 1683495120}
review: Świetna ściganka, gram również na steamdecku i immersja na drążkach z która mam problem w większośći gier- rednek wychowany na klawiaturze i myszce- jest b.dobra. Pozycja z tych, którą chce się ukończyć w 100% czyli stara dawna retro szkoła gier z lat 90'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289388901', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1710011491}
review:
Pretty much everything about this game is great. The soundtrack, the visuals, the cars, the driving, it's all very well done, and each update keeps making it better and better. An awesome rally game, well worth the price and a ton of fun!

P.S: It is also very fun on the Switch too, but I recommend the PC version over the Switch version. Not that the Switch version is bad by any means, it just has a downgrade in graphics quality (although not much) and it seems to run at a lower framerate than the PC version. This is just here for anyone thinking of buying the Switch version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010224296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1698855404}
review:
It took me a while to fall in love with this game.

My first impression when getting the game was - pfft - the graphics are so simple, and it's practically impossible to control. This must be some tiny indie game with cartoonish graphics about racing.

But then I played a bit more. And tried playing with a game controller instead of keyboard, and realised it is all on purpose - The game does provide a nice journey as you progress from the inconvenient initial cars unlocking better and better models. All while exploring so many different maps with different weather, road surfaces and decorations. It's absolutely not as simple as it seemed at first sight.

And the simplistic graphics are so mellow and enjoyable - making it easy to use this game for relaxing. Love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116820523', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1682091551}
review:
写这个评测的时候已经打穿生涯GroupB，稍微谈谈感想

Art of rally和absolute drift两个游戏我都是玩过indie(or demo)版本，这是很久后才想起买了一个同捆来玩
两款游戏都有着不错的点子，不错的呈现，还有够硬的内核和手感，其实我是愿意推荐的。

 但是这游戏
·既然都是一个lowpoly，加上我手头也是个12900k+4090的配置，这无时不在的卡顿掉帧只能说我还是很有资格说你一句优化烂了吧。（stuttering crash）（+5s penalty）
·很显而易见的场景没有lod优化（你都lowpoly了还怎么lod），其次即便大部分物体都是无法破坏的刚体，也采用了全局动态光照，你不卡谁卡？（+5s penalty）
·从表现和物理来说，大部分人会以为这是个尘埃0.2。其实很遗憾，物理比尘埃更简化，坏的机翻中文（你有商店页面一半用心我都不至于说你），难受的转向比控制和含糊不清的设置选项；加上糟糕的地图设计：不允许你cut，判定范围很窄，草地抓地损失极大，抓地力极限非常极端，以至于雪地泥地都比公路抓地更自然；一点点刚体擦碰都会使你车辆原地spin；车轮离地前后的物理表现和GT系列一样差劲，着陆没有多少惯性而是抓地力突然介入非常容易失控；罚时重置车辆起步其实你损失的时间会更多，而往往这种情况我可以自己回到赛道，惩罚非常重；萨丁岛这种图的水泥路甚至有平地碰撞能翘飞车的地方（+5s penalty）
——以至于整体的体感就是一个赛道限制非常大的GT味的拉力，最快的方式还只能抓跑。（+5s penalty）

很难想象，这么一款看起来不错的小品游戏，最后从硬件优化、体验两个方面的糟糕表现我反而会更推荐他人直接去玩Rally2.0


对了，别指望有模拟器支持，只有键\手把，手柄振动做得极其糟糕。（+5s penalty）

author: {'steamid': '76561198271923862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1681570333}
review:
Der Hype in den Bewertungen hat mich nach dem Kauf (Sale) irgendwie genervt und ich fühlte mich zuerst etwas veräppelt.
Letztlich habe ich das Spiel aber durchgespielt und ja, es macht halt Bock.
Es ist irgendwie ein Geschicklichkeitsspiel mit Mini-Rallye-Autos in Spiellandschaften. Die Fahrphysik ist dabei aber "realitätsnah". Darunter verstehe ich Reaktion auf Gas, Über-/Untersteuern, Ausbrechen, Auswirkung von Fahrbahnneigung, verschiedenen Untergründen, Pfützen, ist Alles da. 
Die Rennen sind unterschiedlich lang, aber irgendwie genau richtig getimed. Streckendesign ist auch gut. Nur ganz selten mal eine leicht unfaire Stelle. Wenn man eine Etappe richtig versemmelt hat, kann man sie neu starten (begrenzt). 
Karrieremodus ist motivierend ... also es macht einfach Spaß und es ist ideal für ein eine schnelle Etappe zwischendurch, oder 2, oder 3 ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198044169133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1681446676}
review:
Really conflicted about leaving a negative review. After playing through the career mode i'm left with a sense of what could of been, 
Pros:
The game is incredibly unique and offers something that is quite unique between sim and arcade but it doesn't hit either of them at any great quality or level. The selection of cars and content are impressive but are ruined completely by the shoddy physics and map design. 

Cons:
The game is incredibly poorly optimised, after 30 mins of play the GPU's on all 3 devices i play this game on go to 100% load... the devs have indicated that this is a issue.. especially when the game isn't graphically demanding and my selection of hard at my disposal is higher end.
The physics and poor map design is a real issue, it feels like obstacles such as straw bales and crash barriers have magnets attached to them. As soon as you brush one of them the car spins and your facing the wrong way no matter how lightly you make contact.
The Career mode which I've completed is boring and long winded. Whoever designed the Indonesia stage needs to be fired.
The Tracks are not big enough for 90s early 2000s era rally cars, you can only use 1/8 throttle before the car is flying off the track in flames. Really poor  design with that era of cars, many have complained. 
On the whole its really hard to fully like this game, especially with devs who can't or wont fix the simple issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992369968', 'num_games_owned': 4009, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1680944811}
review:
Art of Rally is a racing game developed by Funselektor Labs that celebrates the golden age of rally racing. The game is set in a low-poly world that is both visually appealing and immersive. Players have the chance to race across a wide range of stages and terrains, from the rugged mountains of Japan to the lush forests of Finland.

One of the standout features of Art of Rally is its attention to detail. The developers have meticulously recreated classic rally cars, complete with accurate physics and handling. This level of authenticity makes the game feel like a true tribute to the sport of rally racing.

The gameplay itself is both challenging and rewarding. Players must master the unique handling of each car and navigate each stage with precision. The game offers a range of difficulty levels, so both casual and hardcore players can find a level of challenge that suits them.

The graphics and sound design of Art of Rally are also noteworthy. The low-poly art style is both beautiful and functional, allowing for smooth and consistent performance even on lower-end hardware. The sound design is equally impressive, with engines that roar and gear shifts that snap with satisfying precision.

One potential drawback of the game is its lack of variety in game modes. While the core rally racing experience is excellent, there are only a handful of modes to choose from. This may limit the game's replayability for some players.

Overall, Art of Rally is a fantastic tribute to the golden age of rally racing. The attention to detail, challenging gameplay, and beautiful visuals make it a must-play for any fan of the genre. While it may be lacking in variety of game modes, the core racing experience is so well-crafted that it is unlikely to disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198464767837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1687019243}
review: искренне желаю, чтобы разработчики на базе этой игры продолжили развитие такого формата. отличные гонки с приятнейшей физикой — прошу, сделайте больше разных форматов

author: {'steamid': '76561198119148063', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1700066162}
review:
First: the game itself. I've played a lot of trackmania and have really liked the way the cars handle. Art of Rally does not have extremely tight controls like trackmania, but they have a lot of options for how your car should handle. After about an hours worth of finagling, I was able to get a relatively simple control on the car. 

Honestly, the settings are only 1/4th of the equation. The meat is simply mastering the unique physics of the game, then you should be able to maneuver sufficiently with any car. The trick that I found is that slight turns are very responsive, but the 90 or 180s should have a good brake or lead up angle to make it without issues. It takes a ton of practice, but in doing so, I quickly entered the top 1% of a lot of the time attacks. 

The terrain is pretty cool. There isn't a large amount of variety in the design around the roads, but its on theme so it works. I don't get tired of playing the maps, however, it does make it harder to distinguish which map you're playing and, following that, any checkpoints to distinguish turns. 

Overall, the game is exactly what I expected. But the best part of this game is its support. 

I've been playing this game on an M1 mac. It runs great. I did notice early on though that my steam save was overwritten and wiped out half an hours worth of playtime. I thought it was a fluke so I kept playing. On my 24th hour of playtime, the error appeared again where my save was wiped and stored to the cloud. I sent a message to support and they worked extremely quickly to recover my save files. They weren't able to replicate my issue, but I think running games through the pinned app on the dock may be running a fresh save instead of running it directly through steam's library. 

For how quickly their team cares enough to have quality support, and for the great quality of gameplay, I would recommend buying this game and supporting this developer studio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009321752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 80017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 207, 'playtime_at_review': 76762, 'last_played': 1711559792}
review:
art of rally is a game where the base driving physics are solid enough to carry the game on it's own despite its quirks. The way the game handles can be extremely satisfying, especially if you're a time attack nut like myself.

It doesn't have everything, and there's still problems. Here's the shortlist.

1. S class has one dominant car (Rotary S7), and the rest are just on the whole frustrating to drive with very little reward for mastering a lower tier car.

2. Gear management and rev management using the clutch is counterproductive, and will deter some players from getting serious about top level driving.

3. Some cars just hate jumps to a point where it feels less like the chaos of rally conditions, but moreso that the suspension geometry is actually just a problem on cars that should otherwise be capable.

4. In their effort to create a minimalist driving experience, some staples of the rally genre are missing, i.e split times for sectors. It really sticks out, but its arguable that the clean look of the game is to it's merit.

If you can appreciate a solid, unique driving engine, and can handle some jank, art of rally is a must play. If you're looking for a fully rounded out experience, perhaps look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084785793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1707895073}
review:
As a fan of rally this game is such a masterpiece. It may not be a sim like Richard Burns Rally, or have astounding graphics like WRC or Dirt Rally titles, but it is truly a work of art. It really conveys that magic feeling of driving a rally car, the excitement of going 120+ km/h through a winding gravel road, the roar of the engines, the whistle of the turbo spooling up, the bang of the anti-lag systems and topped of with the great synthwave soundtrack that really suits those golden years of rally.
If you have even a slight interest in rally this game is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212544483', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1694014466}
review:
I am by no means a car expert I think they look cool and that's it so most realistic racing games bore me with all the details and excessive customization to the point I do not want to play it.

Not this game.

Art of Rally is extremely simple in the best ways, the controls are good, HUD only shows you what you need, and you spend very little time between races. That is probably the best part of this game is that it just lets you DRIVE, no obnoxious tutorials or forced storyline it is just a racing game. Highly recommend this to anyone who likes racing games or has even a little interest in them, it is that good. 

The art and music are top notch, this game just has so much style that AAA racing games have been lacking as of late and makes the experience much more memorable. The camera angle contributes not only to the style but gameplay unlike most rally games there is no pace notes and the camera gives you the ability to plan for upcoming turns. You still get the excitement of having to quickly brake on hairpins but there is no giant turn signs or someone yelling in your ear to distract you from the fantastic visuals. 

Things that can use some work: 
Performance is a little tricky with this game, I have a brand new gaming laptop with an RTX 3060 and can run most games smooth as butter but this game does have some strange issues. Nothing game breaking and I actually got a response from the devs and the community on some things over on their subreddit. Maybe some updates to the optimization are needed but this is really my only major complaint and for a small indie game is totally fine.

Tutorials which I know I said I am glad this game has none but I think a basic optional one would be helpful though not necessary. I played this game on gamepass a year ago and struggled to even get past group 4 but quickly have gotten far in under 15 hours. Some kind of explanation of some systems would be helpful BUT not needed, I learned the hard way and loved it. 

Conclusion:
This game is VERY good and just a solid racing game that I have fallen in love with and introduced me to the amazing sport that is rally and have since been heavily interested in it. This game is very clearly a passion project and does not feel hastily made in any way, there is a ton of creativity on display here that is not present in many racers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970412411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1613154549}
review: [h1] Over All [/h1]Art of Rally is a truly unique and charming driving game that has captured the hearts and minds of many gamers who have taken the time to delve into its world. From the moment you first lay eyes on its captivating art style, it becomes evident that this game is something special. The stylized, low-poly visuals not only create a distinctive look but also manage to evoke a sense of nostalgia for the golden age of rally racing.[h1] Controls[/h1]The game's controls, while initially challenging to master, are a testament to the dedication and passion of the developers in crafting an authentic rally experience. Once you become accustomed to the nuances of the handling, you'll find that the physics and mechanics of the game provide a satisfying and rewarding driving simulation. The attention to detail in Art of Rally is truly commendable, and the learning curve of the controls only serves to make the game more engaging and immersive.[h1] Racing Tracks[/h1]The tracks in Art of Rally are beautifully designed and feature a wide variety of terrains and environments. From the sweeping vistas of lush forests to the treacherous mountain passes, each location offers its own unique set of challenges and obstacles that will test your driving skills to the limit. The sense of speed and exhilaration as you navigate the winding roads and tight corners is

author: {'steamid': '76561199071037912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1708087399}
review: A great little game with tons of classic rally cars and locations. It's fun to play but the learning curve very high and it takes a bit of getting used to the top down angle. The difficulty can often be a source of frustration at times when things don't go quite right (especially if you are used to more mainstream racing simulators).The game has definitely has had a lots of passion and time put into it which it shows in the gameplay and scenery. The physics are solid overall but I have had some minor problems with cars clipping guardrails and being completely unable to move ruining runs. Another Issue I find with the guardrails is that they often blend in too well with the rest of the scenery in the top down view (this issue is most problematic in the Japan stages), making them harder to spot whilst you're focusing on the road ahead and keeping your car under control.Overall Art of Rally is a solidly built title which is definitely worth a play if you're up for the challenge of mastering the legendary cars of rallying. Once you get to grips with it you'll be flying down stretches of road full on Group B style!

author: {'steamid': '76561199012087594', 'num_games_owned': 1258, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1670151130}
review:
Are you ready to hit the dirt roads and drift around hairpin turns in Art of Rally?

This game is a total blast! From the graphics to the soundtrack, everything about it just screams fun. The controls are easy to pick up, but mastering them is another story. It takes some practice to perfect your drifts, but it's oh so satisfying when you finally nail that perfect turn.

Overall, if you're a fan of racing games, especially rally racing, you need to give Art of Rally a try. It's the perfect mix of challenging gameplay and lighthearted fun. Plus, who doesn't love a good drift?

review:

review: It's so awesome. I really like the gameplay and I am addicted and play nearly every day. The physics and simulation is easy to learn but hard to master and that's what I love in a game. I also enjoy that it's starts out in the early years of really and takes you on a journey through rally history.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998933224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 180, 'playtime_at_review': 2850, 'last_played': 1711940107}
review:
If you're looking for a game to scratch that RC car esque itch you got, then this is the game for you. I highly recommend you look up some setting configurations if you're finding the handling a little... odd. It's not bad by default, but just doesn't feel right. I had to play around with my controls to find a setup I like (highly recommend Camera Rotate 80%+ so that you always stay behind the car).

So far two updates with a handful of tracks each. Both fun, though I think Kenya was better than Indonesia. We'll see what the future holds, but whether it's another game or more content, it's gonna be great.

Buy Absolute Drift if you're looking specifically for a drift game. Using the RWD cars to drift in this game is great, but you're not gonna get as good of times.

The only multiplayer is a Daily stage that you get one shot at and a weekly Rally of several stages that you also only get one shot at. It's fun, but I wish there was more.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198056992480', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1682341419}
review:
Если коротко и сразу: рекомендую всем фанатам автоспорта и синтвейв музыки. Остальным стоит попробовать, но обратите внимание на минусы.
Теперь подробнее:
art of rally - гениально простой концепт о раллийных заездах разных временных эпох, реализованный на юнити движке в стильной лоу-поли графике, с хорошим синтвейв саундтреком. Минимализм во всем: графика, музыка, управление, интерфейс и шрифты, трассы. Для меня игра стала этаким антистрессом, способным отвлечь тебя от проблем, предлагая при этом простой и понятный челендж.
Плюсы:
+ Самое главное достоинство - ощущение скорости. Бывают гоночные игры, которые вроде по отдельным частям исполнены великолепно, а как конечный продукт не дают фана. Чаще всего это именно из-за отсутствия ощущения скорости. В этой игре чувствуешь накал борьбы со временем, когда пролетаешь мимо елок и прыгаешь по трамплинам в Финляндии, идеально проходишь шпильки на серпантинах Японии, обруливаешь заграждения в Германии или контролируешь занос на грунтах Кении или снегольду Норвегии.
Скорее всего это ощущение усиливается камерой, которых тут несколько на выбор: от привычной из-за багажника до полностью изометричной. Второй вариант помогает видеть трассу и заранее подбирать скорость и траекторию, что и держит тебя в фокусе всю игру. 
+ Управление, которое стремится к формуле "Easy to learn, hard to master". Буквально через час, местная физика становится полностью понятна и предсказуема, но от этого не менее сложно с ней справиться. Разные автомобили рулятся по-разному, разное покрытие дает разный зацеп, где-то выгоднее полностью оттормаживаться, где-то использовать ручной тормоз, где-то использовать контрруление или контрсмещение. Как всегда есть одно "но", о котором в минусах.
+ Внимание к мелочам. Есть моменты, где такая инди игра удивляет проработкой. Из того, что отметил: уникальность трасс и схожесть их концепций с реальными, звуки мотора, временные и погодные условия, эффекты трассы и автомобиля (например лужи в Кении более грязные, как и машина после проезда по ним), наличие толпы зрителей, расходящихся в последний момент, наличие прототипа Лада Самара, которая даже не успела выйти на старт.

Казалось бы, идеальная игра, но минусы все же достаточно фатальны, чтобы я, как фанат автоспорта и игр по нему, был несколько разочарован.
Минусы:
- Производительность. Это удивительно, но игра умудряется ловить статтеры даже на r5 5600x и gtx3070. Также иногда пропадают текстуры или сильно падает фпс до перезагрузки. Казалось бы идельная игра для стим дека, но юнити говорит о себе. Изменением настроек можно улучшить ситуацию, но не решить до конца. Помимо этого, иногда сильно бросаются рубленные текстуры и отсутствие гладких переходов даже среди текстур одного типа (снежное или травяное покрытие). Это особенно заметно в рассветное и закатное время суток по теням, которые отбрасывают объекты, которые даже не должны этого делать.
- Однообразие трасс внутри одной локации. Игра предлагает проехать только в режиме карьеры около 150 этапов в 7 странах, но в каждой локации всего 7-9 трасс + реверс. Нередко бывает, что следом за одним треком идет он же в реверсе. Помимо этого трассы не самобытны, а используют отрывки именно локации. Это сильно наскучивает, хотя и соответствует правилу "Easy to learn, hard to master", в котором ты совершенствуешься и улучшаешь свое время. Ничего не мешает нагенерировать больше трас, а уж идеальным решением было бы дать инструментарий для создания кастомных трасс или отдать это дело нейросеткам.
- Концепция придерживания трека. Стоит отъехать или вылететь с дороги на несколько метров, игра тебя вернет и накинет штраф в 5 секунд. Поначалу все кажется логично, но потом возникают ситуации, в который ты можешь резать углы и переживать, откинет ли тебя игра или нет. На некоторых трасах, где много поворотов угловатых поворотов, это особенно заметно, даже по их лидербордам видно, что люди просто научились резать углы так, чтобы игра не наказывала за это. Еще более обидно, когда ты вылетел с поворота, но уже отловил авто, почти вернулся на трек, но игра сбрасывает тебя на трассу со штрафом.
- Баланс. Когда ты запускаешь заезд в карьере, то не знаешь какие страны тебе предстоит посетить. Казалось бы логичнее взять под асфальт Германии заднеприводную Лянчу, а под жаркую Кению надежную Тойоту. Автомобили вроде как уникальны, но есть максимально стабильные, оттого и имбовые в каждом классе. Их даже искать не нужно, по результатам ботов видно, что совсем донное, а что стоит попробовать.
- Автомобили, а точнее их название и исторические справки. На мой взгляд узнаются только культовые автомобили: bmw разных моделей, монстры группы Б: Audi quatro, Lancia delta, Peugeot 205  и группа А полностью. Остальные угадываешь только по стране, так как у многих авто описание в стиле "лютые японцы изобрели вундервафлю работающую на рамене и пошли покорять чемпионат", но есть и забавные истории про пасхальные транспортные средства типа трицикла или фургона.
- Мультиплеер составляющая. У тебя есть только еженедельный заезд в виде ралли из нескольких этапов и ежедневный только из одного этапа. Никаких ивентов, соревнований. Даже лидерборды не прокручиваются.
Не минусы, а так, придирки:
- В игре нет подвески. Вообще. Нет кренов, нет отработки неровностей, как и самих неровностей по трассе. Сложно обвинять инди игру в этом, но это подбешивает при приземлении после прыжков и при езде за пределами дороги. 
- Достижение на 1000 заездов звучит изнуряюще на 50+ часов.
Резюмируя, рекомендую взять по скидке, откатать часик, а дальше рефанднуть или провести пару вечеров, если получится поймать вайб, описанный в начале.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996428705', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1701514525}
review:
TLDR;
Recommended for: Players who has a controller, love rally and has a thing for grinding the same track over and over to get that 1 sec. off your track record.
Not recommended for: Players with no controllers, want a casual pick-up & go game-play.

I first thought this would be a relaxing casual top-down racer with beautiful minimal designed graphics.. boy was I wrong. This is a very sim-cadey race game where it requests full concentration while you race. I say sim-cadey because the game sort of simulates a realistic driving mechanics and physics but it's nothing like the real world and has it's own rules of physics that you need to get used to. 

First the control seemed very awkward and finicky but after getting used on how the vehicles react it just became finicky. I think it would have been more beginner friendly if they had a better tutorial and more guidelines on how and what matters to the physics of driving a car. This definitely isn't for everyone but if you find joy in figuring out things on yourself and get a dopamine boost when you shave that half of a second off after trying a track for tens of times in a row - this game is just right for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101208474', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1710662599}
review:
[h1]《拉力的艺术》：艺术不仅仅来源于丝滑[/h1]

很难想象，在众多赛车游戏逐渐步入次时代，在追求真实的路途上一骑绝尘，还会有这样一款卡通lowpoly画风的拉力赛游戏。
 色彩明艳的大色块风景，颇具地域特色的地图元素，《拉力艺术》有着一种别具一格却也让人赏心悦目的视觉氛围。完善的截图功能，以及视角切换设定，可以让玩家在游戏中随心一按就能扣着颇具艺术感的图片。
 
虽然游戏名字叫《拉力的艺术》，但和市面上其他拉力赛车游戏相比，个人感觉玩法差异还是很明显的。
 
首先游戏不支持第一人称视角，当然也没有路图和领航员，过弯时经常会因为上下坡冲出赛道，所以需要经常减速。
另外赛道看上去很宽阔，但赛车抓地力多多少少觉得有点飘，冲出赛道一定距离会强行复位，并扣除一定的比赛时间。赛车只有后驱，经常会出现扭头入弯车头又甩回来掉头的情况。
如果拿着玩其他拉力赛游戏的经验来开，会比较难受。
游戏的整体操作手感，用丝滑来形容很贴切，虽然有点太滑了~
 
操作上的简化，比如自动上档等一些功能，会让操控难度下降不少，花上一些时间适应后，也能玩的很愉快。
 特别是对于一些新手玩家来说，自由探索模式是一个很棒的练车点，不需要和时间竞速，不会强制复原，享受自由自在的驾驶乐趣，看看风景，收集物品，轻松惬意~

[h1][code] 欢迎关注：[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42228259] 游话好说 [/url]
 我们是一群游戏爱好者，希望能用评测来帮助大家认识更多好游戏，期待您的同行！ [/code] [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198391667076', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1693481045}
review:
独特的游戏画风。
在所有厂商都在内卷画质的时候却诞生了这样一款卡通画风类型的拉力赛游戏，刚看到这个游戏画风就被抓住了眼球，自己也是半个拉力赛车迷，想都没想就下单了，内容也是一样精彩，手感不错，就是有点偏滑，平时习惯方向盘了，可能一下用手柄回方向回的有点多，感觉抓地力不是很够，但也是很容易上手。
游戏里的路很宽，但拉极速肯定也是转不过去的，个人感觉这就是一个考验走线的游戏，每个弯道要找到最晚的刹车点，最早的给油点，因为轮子有点滑所以感觉有点像在开漂移车，可惜没有调校，感觉这是唯一的遗憾了。
最吸引我的是很多历史拉力赛车，a组b组，甚至还有配文大致介绍。最最最最好玩的就是每个地图里的观众了，他不像我所接触的其他拉力游戏固定不动，而是会到处乱窜的2333。之前在视频网站上看到过b组时期的观众有多么疯狂，在这个游戏里也算是切实体会到了。

总而言之！！这是一款很值得一试的游戏，独特的画风但又形象的带给玩家拉力赛的乐趣和艺术。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067482644', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1673453749}
review:
F1 is not a more interesting sport than rally. It relies on the politics and personalities of the drivers moreso than everything unique about driving. It takes an extremely amount of skill to be even close to that level, but you are still watching a no-contact, all-traction, precision engineering sport where every car is the same and the cup is determined by the drivers.

Fuck that. In Rally, the car is the one with character. From the rich history to modern day, the sport is about flinging yourself on roads not designed for the sport, in heavily modified cars that are sold to the public, over multiple surfaces, random weather, and constant loss of control at speeds that reach over 100 mph. Instead of witnessing the bleeding edge of technology, you are witnessing two guys in a car on the bleeding edge of wrapping themselves around the next birch tree, midair and sideways. It's tenfold more brutal, tenfold more focused on the actual culture of civilian accessible cars, and tenfold more interesting.

art of rally is a celebration of rally. If you care about the sport (or would like to), this game is good. If you don't, it's a surprisingly difficult time trial racing game. Still good, but knowing the stories behind these years and these cars is the real core of the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115607224', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1666365839}
review:
Приставка ART не просто так есть в названии. 
Как сделать удачную, на моя взгляд игру про ралли:
* Много машин из разных эпох, классов, к ним накидываем щепотку раскрасок
* Много разных спец-участков, каждый со своей физикой и окружением
* Вариации погоды, добавляются особенности вождения и красота картинки
* Таблица лидеров, а это добавляет азарта поехать вот здесь еще быстрее, а здесь чуть срезать
* Исторические заметки о ралли
* Физика управления самих машин, раллийные техники прохождения

Получается, что приставка ART,- обозначение "мультяшности" сурового ралли и искусства вождения

author: {'steamid': '76561197977007999', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1700529887}
review:
Art of Rally is an indie racing game that follows the history of rallying from its early days through its peak with the banned Group B cars and then the aftermath in the 1990s. The game is unlicensed, but all the cars are close recreations of legendary (and forgotten) real-life rally cars, even recreating the liveries in which they had their greatest success. The way they get around the licensing is with the simplified art style and by giving them all fake names.

I was really into watching rallying when I was young, and have played many rally games over the years, so this stylish indie effort has been on my wishlist since it came out. 
 
---{ Graphics and Art Direction }---
☐I want to live in this world
☑Beautiful
☐Functional
☐Bad

I adore the art style, and I think it will age much better than a lot of "realistic" rally games. Despite the style, there is some modern rendering going on here, with beautiful volumetric light and real-time shadows. The thing keeping this from the top rung is that it has some surprising performance issues, with stutters and fps drops. I wasn't able to find a low-impact way to mitigate stutters, so had to turn down graphics, and below the highest settings there are some issues: ugly jagged shadows and lots of distracting LOD pop-in.
 
---{ Gameplay }---
☐Hall of fame
☑Keeps me coming back for more
☐Fun enough for a few hours
☐Watch paint dry instead
 
The most important thing in a rally game is how the cars handle. From the art style you might think this is an arcade game, but in fact the driving model is surprisingly deep and more akin to a simulation rally game. Cars all handle realistically based on the characteristics of their real life counterparts. Hit a jump at the wrong angle and you feel like there's some real suspension modelling going on here.

The main difference between this and a normal rally game is the camera. A normal rally game you're either sat in the cockpit or with a close trailing camera. Because you're travelling at very high speed, and most corners are unsighted, rallying (in real life and in games) relies on a co-driver who is calling out corners a few beats ahead of your arrival at them. In this case, the game pulls back to a very high drone camera angle, giving you full advanced sight of the corners to come. This allows the game to forego the co-driver, which does allow it to be played muted unlike normal rally games.
The downside to the camera angle is that you're further removed from the action, and so you lose out on the visceral feeling of nailing a few difficult corners back to back, which is the usual dopamine rush from rally games.

One small note is the default settings amplify counter-steer inputs, which because of the way most cars behave makes your life more difficult for no reason, so I suggest changing that setting immediately.
 
---{ Story / Writing / Lore }---
☐Deserves a Pulitzer
☐Wouldn’t be out of place on a bookshelf
☐Nothing special
☐Written by teenagers
☑No Story
 
No story, but the game is clearly a labour of love, and makes an effort to front the lore of rallying. Part of this is in the little descriptions of each vehicle and their place in the history of the sport, part of it is in the vehicle selection itself.
This article explains a bit how the game engages with rallying history: https://traxion.gg/six-forgotten-rally-cars-art-of-rally-shines-a-light-on/

---{ Music and Audio }---
☐Earned a permanent spot in my playlist
☐Enjoyable
☑I didn’t notice it
☐Mute immediately

Music is simple techno / synth. Works well enough but nothing special. There are subtle sound effects for locking brakes and spooling turbos, and cars do sound like their real-life counterparts, but nothing worth writing home about on the audio front.
 
 ---{ Difficulty }---
☐Walking simulator
☐You can technically die, but you probably won’t
☐Easy to learn / Hard to master
☑Hard to learn / Hard to master
☐Dark Souls

Rallying is the most difficult motorsport, and rally sim games have a reputation of being the Dark Souls of racing games. This game shares the difficulty of navigating a realistic handling vehicle down narrow forest roads at much too high speed. There is difficulty settings for your opponents, but as rallying is a time trial, the only thing it affects is where you place on a leaderboard. As with all rallying games, the real challenge isn't your competition but personal: keeping your vehicle on the road and nailing each stage. This game seems to recognize that, and in what I think is a stroke of genius, there doesn't seem to be any progression (other than a single achievement) tied to beating your opposition - the only goal is to finish, and as you move up through the categories it becomes harder and harder to get the cars through the stages. Rewards are tied only to using as few 'restarts' as possible.

However, it's a little easier than something like Dirt Rally for a few reasons: the camera angle and lack of co-driver means you don't have to split your attention between your eyes and ears; one of the things lost in the simplification is immediate roadside hazards like ditches, so it's much more forgiving of going slightly off-track; and the default damage model is way too forgiving (I suggest bumping the damage model up to the highest setting for something approaching the normal setting in other rally games.
  
---{ System Requirements }---
☐Could run on a Samsung smart fridge
☑Modern console or decent PC
☐Ask NASA if they have a spare computer

As I mentioned, there are some surprising performance issues. 
  
---{ Length }---
☐<10 hours
☑10-25 hours
☐25-100 hours
☐Hundreds of hours, if you want

Probably 20 hours to 100%, which I will likely do.
 
---{ Value }---
☐Buy it twice
☑Worth full price
☐If it's on sale
☐Not recommended

Overall an 8.5/10 for me. Good value at its normal price of C$29.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024845355', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1675612684}
review:
Hinter einem bunten Rallye-Spiel mit knuffiger Bauklötzchenoptik versteckt sich eine knifflige Simulation mit beeindruckender Physik. Nebenbei gibt es Geschichtsschreibung der siebziger bis neunziger Jahre und (unter falschen Namen) viele ikonische und auch unbekanntere Fahrzeuge der Zeitgeschichte zu fahren.
Das Spiel bietet wenig Möglichkeiten, abzustimmen und einzustellen, aber so wichtig ist das gar nicht. Die Fahrerei ist herausfordernd, Ambition kommt von ganz alleine. 
Im "free roam"-Modus - und sogar im Wettkampf - lassen sich wunderschöne Bilder von Panorama und/oder Autos machen. Nicht umsonst gibt es eine ingame geschossene Hintergrundbildsammlung als DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561199199011420', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1701941697}
review:
画风很可爱，还能调手动挡。没有第一视角也没有路书基本上不能称之为硬核拉力赛游戏，但是可以说是一个面向硬核玩家的小品游戏，一方面神力科莎或者尘埃玩累了可以玩这个换换脑筋，另一方面觉得极品飞车或者地平线手感太魔幻也可以试试这个。至于轮胎物理真实不真实就不考虑了吧，毕竟就这么个游戏也没法指望啥。
缺点就是优化不好，按道理来讲这种低多边形不应该吃配置，但是我4个g的显存画质就那样帧率也是不稳，第一张芬兰图因为树木多杂草多比第二张小岛图帧率低不少，所以想玩的好还得硬件够给力才行。再一个键鼠玩的话不是不行，但是方向反打这个手感确实不敢恭维，经常出现他自动回正太慢，但是你再按一下方向键他又给你反向冲出跑道的情况，不过适应适应还是能玩。
也没啥了，就一小工作室做这么个游戏已经很优秀了，里面小车也不少，不想玩赛车的时候自由漫游也是挺有意思的。音乐很带感，而且整个游戏也充满了那种精致，温暖的感觉。比方说虽然我对日本文化无感，但是选车菜单车旁那棵樱花树我觉得确实是神来之笔。这种走心的小细节还很多。当时就是看宣传片打算下载一个手游盗版，结果我都用上steam了也不见他往手机上移植就自己掏钱买了，现在看来打折买绝对绝对不吃亏。
（再吐槽中文翻译，真的，稍微懂点英文就用英文吧，中文翻译有时候驴头不对马嘴）

author: {'steamid': '76561198873254249', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1708873176}
review:
En mi opinión este juegazo compite con otros de rally como lo puede ser dirt rally 2.0. Obviamente que los juegos tienen características super distantes, tanto gráficas como físicas, etc.

Pero Art Of Rally hace algo que ningún otro juego pudo hacer. Mezclar unas físicas divertidas a la vez que competitivas, con unos gráficos simplistas y hermosos a su vez combinado con una melancólia implícita en toda la experiencia del juego por el rally de los 80s. 

Es un juegazo para toda la gente, tanto los que aman los motores como los que no. sin dudas la desarrolladora se merece el respeto de toda la comunidad motriz de los juegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049035729', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1705757316}
review:
A masterpiece. Been playing on Steam Deck between my duties as an adult and a father and it's so easy to pick up, play a few stages and then put back down.

The graphics are gorgeous and the deceptively simple gameplay is hiding some seriously realistic physics.

I'm bad at the game, which is how you know it's realistic.

Must buy for any driving fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198959371325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 1992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1971, 'last_played': 1674642538}
review:
[h1]복고풍의 랠리게임[/h1]

마음대로 움직이지 않는 컨트롤 미숙한 이유로
레이싱 게임에 대한 두려움이 있었지만
게임을 구매한 이유는 단 하나, [b]힐링되는 배경들[/b]입니다.

물리엔진에 대한 자세한 지식은 없지만
평가들을 보면 나름 준수한 편인 것 같습니다.
또 이 게임을 출시하게 된 배경이 된 같은 회사의 전작 
'Absolute Drift' 게임보단 접근성(난이도)은 쉬운 편입니다.

[b]bgm[/b] - 전작 'Absolute Drift'보단 템포가 빠르지 않고 
편안하게 듣기 좋은 것 같습니다.

[b]트랙[/b] - 총 7개 나라가 등장하고 나라별로 3~5개의 
트랙이 존재합니다.(트랙별로 리버스가 존재)

[b]업적[/b] - 특별히 어렵다고 느낀 업적은 없습니다.
대부분은 수집과 카운팅 업적들입니다.

[ENG]

[h1]Retro style rally game[/h1]

Because of inexperienced control that does not move freely
Although I had a fear of racing games
There is only one reason I bought the game, [b]the healing background.[/b]

I don't have detailed knowledge about the physics engine.
Looking at the reviews, it seems to be fairly decent.
Also, the previous work of the same company that led to the release of this game
Accessibility (difficulty) is easier than 'Absolute Drift' games.

[b]bgm[/b] - The tempo is not as fast as the previous work 'Absolute Drift'
It sounds like a comfortable listen.

[b]Track[/b] - A total of 7 countries appear, and each country has 3-5
Tracks exist. (Reverse exists for each track)

[b]Achievements[/b] - There are no achievements that I felt were particularly difficult.
Most of them are collection and counting achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198950099632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1704331233}
review:
Excelente jugabilidad de este juego, lo hace muy divertido. la cámara y los paisajes le suman un montón.
Para un juego de carreras, rally en este caso, la jugabilidad es de vital importancia. 
Una pena que no se pueda ajustar los neumáticos según el terreno o que tenga las indicaciones del copiloto.
La música que viene por defecto creo que le resta a la experiencia de manejo, en mi caso dejo muy baja la música y subo los efectos del auto o directamente anulo el audio y juego con un audio externo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288228187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1712269016}
review:
Just before i start the review i'd like to say I'm not that well versed in this genre, but i still really like the driving games I have played.

It's a great driving game, with somewhat strange driving physics. 
Where you have to be more aware of your speed and ability to turn in certain situations than games like Mario Kart 8, (which i've always felt as having a bit too uninteresting driving, especially compared to games like Sonic Robo Blast 2 Kart, and this game, so if you feel the same way about Mario Kart that i do, maybe check those games out?)  and Sonic Robo Blast 2 Kart.

I haven't tried online yet, but i can give my opinion on the rest of the gamemodes. The racing mode in this game is more like a time trial, which may not sound as cool as playing head to head, but it still feels great to play.

On that point, i'd recommend playing the free driving mode, to get the hang of the driving controls, since you can rocket off the track and still be fine, unless you get stuck upside down or fall into a lake. And it feels so cool  to successfully do a difficult turn with this game's physics, especially when going really fast. And the open worlds it has, all feel different from one another, while also being fun, and pretty.

I've spent a fair bit of my time offroading in this game, trying to get as far away from the road before i get stuck, and get teleported back to the road. Dodging trees, going over hills, it sucks that this game doesn't have an offroading mode, to my knowledge. But either way, it's still fun to do.

So, i'd really recommend this game, though personnaly, with how common steam sales are, and this game being a bit steep at 25 dollars, i'd wait until it gets to around 15 dollars.

In summary, it's a really fun racing game with strange but fun driving physics, try the free driving mode first, and i really hope the devs add an offroading mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041106108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1712438303}
review: Great game with some narrative humour and great mechanics; the handbrake drifting is immaculate and satisfying to control and the crowd that parts like a wave around the car takes me back to those old images of Group B rallying with all of the people gathered on the track in front of the car, then jumping out of the way at the last minute! There are however some little niggles; like it crashes on closing down and it requires some optimisation to run smoothly, even on a top end 3080 it does chug a little with some screen tearing on occasion. But once those niggles are addressed it beats a large portion of the average driving games by simply being unique with a considerable amount of care and effort having gone into it. More so, in some instances, than some triple A titles of late.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080427359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1691558909}
review:
Dart RallyシリーズやWRCシリーズを遊んだことがある人には絶対オススメ。
ただし助手席ナビが無いので見渡せる視点で自分が先のコースを判断する必要がある。
グランツーリスモシリーズなどを遊んだことがある人にもオススメ。
スーパーマリオカートやNeed for speedシリーズしか遊んだことがない人には難しい、
カジュアルな見た目と裏腹にかなり慎重な運転が必要。この人達にはオススメしない。
クラス内で挙動の異なる車が揃っているので色々試せば好みに合う車が各クラスで見つかる。
キャリアモードを最後までクリアしたがコースと天候がランダムで設定されるようなので
全てのコースを遊ぶためにはタイムアタックで各コースとクラスを選んで遊ぼう。
オンラインランキングでタイム順位が出るので何度も走って上位を目指すのも楽しい。
しかし実績のパーセンテージを見るとキャリアモードを最後まで遊んでいないプレイヤーが多いようだ。

review:

[h2]? / 10[/h2]
☐ 1

☐ 4
☐ 5

☐ 7
☑ 8
☐ 9

[hr][/hr]
[h1]Details ✨[/h1]
[h2]👍[/h2]
[list]
    [*]Stunning graphics
    [*]Amazing soundtrack
    [*]Sound effects
    [*]Humour in texts
    [*]Handling
    [*]Vibes
    [*]Photo mode
    [*]Linux support
[/list]

The soundtrack and the graphics are really what make this game unique. 
The details in the particle effects or small things, like that breaks light up, when they get hot, just adds to the experience.
Also it has support for TAA.

[h2]🤷[/h2]
[list]
    [*]Physics
    [*]Assists
    [*]No checkpoints
    [*]No co-driver
[/list]

When all four wheels touch the ground and you are on track, the handling is great. But jumps are sometimes hard to see and depending on your rally class, way too extreme. Also handling off the track feels sometimes weird, because you just get slowed (except on Ice). And coming from games like Forza Horzion 4/5 and Dirt Rally 2.0 the handbrake just feels strange.
Also it's nice to have assists, but I found them making the gameplay just unpredictable, so I turned them off.


[h2]👎[/h2]
[list]
    [*]Aggressive out-of-bounds detection
    [*]Gets laggy over time
    [*]Graphic bugs
[/list]

Instead of tracks which have a layout to keep players in bounds, art of rally has a relative aggressive out-of-bounds detection system. This means when you think you can cut some corners to shave a few seconds down the game thinks you are out-of-bounds which results in a 5sec penalty and you lose all your momentum, which can be quite frustrating.

DirectX 12 straight up has weird artifacts on my setup and using the other configuration has a few graphic bugs. Like some objects just pop in which is very noticeable. Also driving at night with headlights makes the individual polygons which make up the track visible (so the track looks very blocky and not smooth).

Also the photo mode has a few bugs too. Like when saturation is turned down to 0% there are still elements in the picture (like the background), that are still saturated (so no b&w pictures possible). It would be also nice to set the focus even more precise, as it's currently not possible to have a very shallow depth of field and set the focus on the right spot. Finally, adding a lense flare would be nice.

But one thing is driving me crazy is that the game is getting laggy over time, so you have to restart the game every 45 mins or so.


[hr][/hr]

But after all that I really enjoy driving around and diving deep into the world of art of rally time to time again.


[h1]Tested on ⚙️[/h1]

[code]
    - OS:            Windows 10 [22H2] / Arch Linux [6.1.2-zen]
    - Specs:         RTX 2080 & Ryzen 1800x
    - Drive:         NVMe SSD
    - Game version:  1.4.2a
[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197978592874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1673042234}
review:
If you like time trials, by yourself, then this might be a game for you. If you like arcade-like racing/drifting, this is definitely your game. 

This game was on my wishlist for so long, because it looked so fun and exciting, but I'm requesting a refund.
It's very lackluster. I can see there's been effort in development, but there's hardly any gameplay. 

I should have known better. I didn't like Absolute drift and this is basically that with a new camera angle and some actual race tracks. That's about it though. Playing it made me reminisce how fun Wreckfest is and how I should be playing that instead.
As other reviewers pointed out: the car doesn't seem to be impacted by gravity at all and it's like driving on ice. The trailers make it look so cool, but it's just nonsensical drifting and sliding.
I don't see myself playing each track more than once. It's just too annoying.

I also believe most of the reviews are either fake or just absolute meme lords. because I'm a pretty bad racer and I place very high on the leader boards, without really trying.

nie polecam tej gry z następujących powodów:

author: {'steamid': '76561198368155801', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1673374483}
review: Great graphics, sound, and the amount of detail into this game is very good. You have brake glow as well as the bystanders moving out of your way when you're passing by them. In terms of difficulty, its a decenty hard game to master. Unlike DIRT and other rally games, the cars do require you to learn them in order to drive them fast which i do like as you get more confident per stage to drive the car. The controller support is also amazing here for an indie game. Using a DUALSHOCK 4, i don't even need to configure it before launching the game. Just plug in the controller and play, with rumble and adaptive triggers working perfectly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098717872', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1675317781}
review:
[h1] Very nice and one of a kind game [/h1]

Art of Rally is absolutely awesome in what it does. I played it during the year it was offered on Xbox game pass. I was looking at the promo video and screenshots and thought the graphics/gameplay & physics isn't going to be that great. However the graphics are pretty good, while not like a AAA game, its unique in its own style. But when I played it I found it to be enjoyable. There are many different cars you can unlock that are knockoffs of real life brands of rally cars. There is so much that is unlockable as you race through the many different rally tracks based on real life areas. The default camera can be not the best, but there is a workaround to download a mod to pretty much have camera views like you would normally expect in a racing game. If you enjoy racing and driving and just want something different to try, I would pick Art of Rally up. Don't let the graphics and pictures steer you away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041722474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 14007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3777, 'last_played': 1701024292}
review:
Looks great, sounds great and the gameplay is great and gets better the more you play and get to know the cars - really good.

Sadly, the leaderboard-hunt is the only thing left after you've unlocked all the cars and that is more about abusing exploits and finding shortcuts than improving your driving.

I still recommend this cool game and hope for improvements in a sequel, like creating your own, long rally wc and less oppotunities to cheat and exploit

review:
我就一个意见，这游戏的退出功能在哪？如果是主机移植过来的，最好关注一下主机和PC的区别，总不能让PC玩家每次退出游戏都要按ALT+F4吧。我就是因为按ALT+F4，导致电脑死机了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198350750090', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 6892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 64, 'playtime_at_review': 5145, 'last_played': 1711548121}
review:
First of all, I'll be absolutely clear: This game reminds me of my ex-girlfriend. Why so? The sex was mind-blowing, but it was mentally challenging. 

Graphics 
Hot. You can tell this game was designed with passion and love(and a lot of techniques and skills). Funselektor got it right, this is the kind of graphic that rally/ racing gamers don't know that they want, but they do want it when they see it. So like my ex-girlfriend in general.

Music
More like an immersive ambiance. Funselektor got the vibe of "long drive and good music" right.  Think "Moon" by Kid Francescoli, or "Experience" by Ludovico Einaudi. This hits very hard especially in foggy stages like Norway. So like my ex-girlfriend in general.

Gameplay
Tough, mentally challenging(if you're new to Rally/ Racing). Art of Rally spared nothing when it comes to difficulties: you could make career-shattering mistakes just because you drift too hard or not enough, you could smash into obstacles if you drive too hard, and when you don't drive hard enough, you're left behind on ranking. Despite being a game of relaxing music and an immersive ambiance, the competition is cut-throat and to the point. One second lagging means you're behind someone else. But that's also the reality of this genre, it feels like you're working in competitive sport more than playing a video game. I'm still a novice in this genre, but if you're also a novice, i would say believe me that this is a tough game. Maybe not as tough as the Dirt Rally series(this franchise is more professional looking while Art of Rally is more of a slapstick tournament). After the toughness and the challenges, it's also rewarding. The feeling of undergoing a stage, a tournament in this game is unbeatable. So like my ex-girlfriend in general.

Optimization
It runs well on my Gtx 965m, although not in full Ultra. It looks crispy and appealing without any bugs/hiccups/ stutters.

Price
Worth every damn penny, although if you want to get it on sale, that's fine(maybe even better).

By now you would know that everything reminds me of her and this game is worth it. If you think you want it, definitely go for it. The game is exactly what they advertised(actually even better than advertised).
