author: {'steamid': '76561198044986334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1703890369}
review:
This is a very artistic homage to the best eras of rally

Good game play that has easy enough controls (I am using steam deck) to pickup but the game play and physics are harder to master. The graphics are great in an artistic way, the sounds of the cars are great, and the soundtrack is fantastic. Quite addicting to play. There are enough gameplay settings to be able to ease yourself into the racing experience but enough challenge to keep you playing, unlocking cars and climbing the leader boards of your friends and the larger playerbase. The occasional humour written in is also appreciated.

If you have a steam deck (or a controller) I can recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279214530', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1693163239}
review:
art of rally é um jogo BEM diferenciado e bastante de nicho, se você gosta e já acompanhou o rally da década de 80 e 90 esse jogo é um prato cheio com uma vibe pra lá de gostosa pra ti ja que esse é o ponto forte desse jogo.

o jogo é simples, é literalmente o que é mostrado aqui, porém isso não quer dizer que seja mal feito ou deixe a desejar e muito pelo contrário, a física é MUITO boa, os mapas são bem feitos e é gritante a diferença do asfalto pro cascalho, areia, lama e neve. o modo campanha é bem feito, você passa por todas as categorias do rally e entre elas tem uns vídeos muito bem feitos mostrando os carros e as regiões das respectivas épocas e cara que vídeo bem feito, ele passa muito bem a vibe da época correspondente ao vídeo. os controles são muito bons, no inicio você apanha um pouco pra pegar o jeito com eles mas depois você já ta fazendo drifts num penhasco a mais de 70 km/h.

como já disse antes o foco desse game é o vibe e o feeling que ele passa pro jogador, e ele faz isso com uma maestria impecável. a diferença que você sente quando pega um carro com mais de 400 cavalos de tração traseira pisando fundo numa saída de curva é absurda, a sensação de aceleração, os sons do turbo, freios, motor e corte de giro causam entusiasmo no jogador, a sensação de perigo quando você deixa acidentalmente uma das rodas irem pra grama e sentir o carro destracionar é incrível.

sinceramente eu nem escutei a trilha sonora porque só queria escutar toda a sinfonia do motor, suspensão, freios, turbo e escape. a arte desse jogo é bem única e tem seu charme e ela possui seus detalhes INCRIVEIS como as pastilhas de freios aquecidas, as sombras e vegetação são extremamente bem feitas e as fumaças de altíssima qualidade.

o jogo também possuí um modo livre com todos os mapas do jogo e eventos diários e semanais. o jogo é absurdo de incrível, mas a primeira jogada dele tem que ser algo especial e você tem que desfrutar disso o máximo que conseguir, depois que você termina a campanha não tem muito mais o que fazer além de rejogar tudo e tentar bater seus próprios tempos e os tempos do ranking mundial.

você precisa jogar pra saber e sentir, recomendo esperar uma promoção

author: {'steamid': '76561198006987146', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1710213967}
review:
halfway through the career and I'm struggling to recommend this game. Overall, it plays like a basic unity engine indie game.

I had continuous issues with the camera angle, viewing objects/height, no textures, and handling settings.

1) I only found one usable viewing angle - the one that showed the most track ahead. There is no navigator or mini map or heads-up display. So you need to see whats coming ahead, but the game views are mostly blind top down views.
2) All the viewing angles hide different obstacles/objects. Grass height is the same as small objects which makes them tricky to see. A lot of stages in the early game had hidden fence posts, rocks or stumps that couldnt be seen until too late. It also makes it hard to see elevation. Cars are floaty when airborne which makes it twice as difficult when you weren't sure if there was a crest ahead.
3) A lot of the visibility issues are to do with the lack of textures. Grass has the same texture/colour as flat ground. Driving surfaces all look and sound the same with no dust being kicked up (unlike in the screenshots).
4) Always playing around with the control settings and could never find a good setup. All cars brake WAY too well in a straight line even with ABS set to low. Then they're on ice skates when engaging a high speed slide. I could not get used to the counter steering no matter what I set the percentage to. 

It feels like I'm the only entrant in a multi-year career. The game occasionally shows you flags and names of the opponents (meaningless), but what is wrong with stage rankings and a small visual to show opponents cars and livery? There isnt even a podium, just a number of your place. It's all very disengaging and confirms that the game is very much style-focused.

5hrs in, I'm not having fun or impressed with the visuals anymore. It tries to strike a tricky balance between arcade and sim-lite but isnt fun or interesting enough to be either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972129009', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1671117107}
review: I'm playing with a keyboard, so controllers may be different, but this is ridiculously difficult to navigate. Let's imagine you're approaching a long, shallow corner. You're in a rally car, you want to drift around it, right? So you turn in, ease the accelerator and... continue moving in a straight line and slide off the track. Well okay, maybe you were too fast that time, let's try braking a bit. Approach the corner, turn in, tap the brakes and... immediately jerk to a halt. So what are you meant to do here? Well your guess is as good as mine because I still haven't figured it out. The floor has no grip. The brakes are way too strong. Dare to even breathe against a wall and you'd best strap in because your car is about to perform its best teacups impression. If you go over a jump you'll think you're going to spaaaaaace... because a big metal car weighs as much as bag of feathers apparently. I know this an arcade rally game, and realism often takes a back seat with these, but this is so far from believable it's near unplayable. The game wants you to drive around in a semi-realistic manner, but gives you physics that simply don't work together. If there's no grip, I want to brake. If my brakes are too strong, I want to use them as little as possible. Combine the two and you're forced to drive around at a snail's pace to get around corners. Quite how I'm meant to get through this quickly is beyond me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341396757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3329, 'last_played': 1710878977}
review:
TLDR: The best rally sim-cade if all you have is a controller. 8/10
Cons: The camera angle can also make it difficult to see whats ahead sometimes but this is only a problem on a few corners of a few courses.

Wanna play a rally game that is immersive but still easy to play without a wheel? Then art of rally is for you, this game is fun to play with controller unlike other rally games. It may have simple graphics but the handling model is perfect, not the most realistic but very fun and challenging. Compared to funselector's previous game Absolute Drift the handling feels less locked down. Art appears to have a more accurate depiction of slip angel and the loss of grip. I'm a big fan of the D*rt rally games but they can only be played with my wheel and are uncontrolable on controller. Which is the niche Art of Rally fits into for me. This game is amazing for when I want rally but don't have access to my wheel. Also the music is nonstop bangers. And the devs actually update the game with new content years after release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990222797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1671148827}
review:
AG racer with odd visuals. I like this game but I have to add a huge IF to it. This is far closer to a digital input AG racer style game than any arcade or realistic car simulator. Even with an xbox controller I feel more like I am playing with a keyboard.

Highly recommend tweaking control settings a bit too. That said this can be a very fun game if you're willing to treat like an AG racer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027634232', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1673487445}
review: Hands down DIRT 3 is my favorite rally game of all time. It is as realistic as I want. This game is not as realistic, but it has a pure, simplified feel of the dirt and gravel that DIRT 3 has. Plus the simple, almost cartoony graphics are phenomenal because it gives it a kinetic energy that merges sweetly with the lo-fi soundtrack. This is my favorite arcade rally game by far.

Ótimo jogo arcadezinho pra quem curte Rally.

A dirigibilidade é gostosa e com física realista na hora de fazer drift e tangenciar rápido nas curvas, onde qualquer vacilo tu capota ou cai do penhasco. Há inúmeros carros e pinturas para ir desbloqueando conforme joga.

Recomendo inclusive no preço cheio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341625406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1670642967}

review: топ. очень непростое управление, игра так и мотивирует тебя научиться нормально ездить. играл на клавиатуре, понимаю, в такое лучше играть на паде, но даже так получил массу удовольствия.

review: 在拉力赛的黄金时代里比赛。驾驶着卡通的赛车从六十年代的标志性的赛段到B组的挑战性赛段上，穿梭在取材于世界各地的个性化场景。如梦一般的青葱岁月

author: {'steamid': '76561198278192009', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1708972341}
review: I had this game a while but never really played it for more than a few mins. When I got a Steam Deck it was the first game I downloaded, and it became my favorite chill game. I just finished the campaign and got all the free roam collectibles. If you have a Steam Deck you should definitely get this game, it plays so well it’s like the two were made for each other. I really like that the game has no competition, time constraints, or otherwise any sort of pressure on the player. Alls you have to do is complete the races to advance and unlock everything, giving you a truly chill experience. It has really nice physics and the car sounds are really good too. It’s also highly replayable because all of the career rallies are randomized and you can reset your progress in the options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099981431', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1674945988}
review:
A love letter to rallying. Immaculate vibes, great audio, and really unique visuals make for such a nice package. The physics are the icing on the cake, with realistic physics that make for a game that is easy to pick up but really really hard to master. 

Some minor gripes:
- Some of the jumps in the game are really hard to judge based on the camera position which makes for either breaking heavily before hand or simply launching your car into the trees
- Although there are a lot of cars to choose from here, and almost all major cars from each respective era are present, there are some notable exceptions that some other reviewers have pointed out. Not a huge thing but something that I did notice.

Overall, this game is great. Amazing that it was made by a team of basically one person, and the amount of content and replayability, coupled with the fact that it's only $25 (or even cheaper on sale) makes for one hell of a steal. This is a great racing game, although its appearances may look a little cartoon-y, and one that is quickly becoming one of my favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111283171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1694365600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050280289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1669750804}
review:
One of the best games I've played in recent memory. Great handling and an amazing car list, featuring some of my all time favorites that we don't get to see enough of in games like the Alpine A310, the Ferrari 308 and Group S monsters like the Lancia ECV and the Peugeot 405 T16. I do have a few gripes though:
-I didn't like the camera selection, so I had to download a camera mod to get a proper chase cam
-I would have liked to be able to set up cars before a stage, so I can at least run stiffer set-ups on tarmac courses
-No Ferrari 308 GT/M and Opel Manta 400 is disappointing. A minor gripe, but the Manta is one of the most iconic Group B cars ever and the 308 GTM is the actual Group B rally car from Ferrari, NOT the 288 GTO (though i still like that the 288 EVO made it to the game).

That said, well worth the money. A truly challenging game that's a love-letter to rallying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060676150', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1704274800}
review:
ラリーレースをカジュアルに楽しめるゲームです。
「ラリーは知ってる！でもペースノートわからん。チューニングもわからん。車体ダメージ？？？えぇ？？」みたいになっちゃう人でも簡単にラリーをお楽しみいただけます。
なんだか重力がガバガバなので、そのグラフィックやカメラアングルも相まってまるでミニカーを操作しているような感覚に陥りますがこれはこれで面白いのでヨシと言った感じです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198171677731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1680827028}
review:
Art of Rally is the most charming race game I've ever played.

Visual style may be simplistic, but it's executed well with attention to detail that fans of old school Rallying will appreciate.

Soundtrack is fantastic. If you like synth, then you're in for a treat. "Race" and "Go Crazy" would be my favourite songs.

The game play has semi-realistic elements to it. Rallying probably isn't the most forgiving category of racing, but it's not too bad to learn and there's always assists if you're struggling.

I completed the main campaign almost  two years ago now, but I've always kept the game installed to come back to from time to time, especially for the new content releases. Kenya and Indonesia have been great additions, and I'm looking forward to what comes next.

review: Need's serious work on the handling of the car's. More like an ice skating simulator than anything else. Losing a mild corner at 40mph? No, just no. Very pretty game, but until they fix the handling i would not recommend this game at any price. (If you really need to get this game, get it in the sale like i did)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074158424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2938, 'last_played': 1701135782}
review:
For the so inclined this is a satisfying little racing "simulation". The style is just great and you can work on improving your skills. It is very hard though, believe me I've played many racing games over more than 3 decades. 
Don't make the mistake to play with automatic transmission as the game is just much harder and far less fun that way. MT all the way, believe me (I learned that fact way too long into my playing the game).

review:
Little game with realistic physics (even if it's an arcade game) that lets you drive various classic rally cars in a beatiful environment.
Camera is a bit weird at times because you have to focus on the incoming road while checking what your car is doing (weight and suspension) but you get used to it.

review: Fantastic game for picking up here & there on the steamdeck. Driving feels great. Drifts feel heavy. Cars handle as you would expect & you can't just blast into every corner expecting it to work out. Tracks are a perfect length for dropping in & out. It's a recommendation from me from anyone that enjoys chilling out with driving games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323572553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 7332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1712409246}
review:
I suck, is fun.

As for what this game offers, a real sense of thrill while driving.
Even if 200 Km/h doesn't sound too fast, speed feels so fast in this game and it is so much fun when you are pushing yourself to get the perfect lap and go as fast as you can!

The style of the game and soundtrack is also something to be appreciated for it is really nice!
For the game is both relaxing and thrilling.
If you are a bit of a car person, the cars are quite nice as well.

Toyota Celica GT-4 ST 185 for the win!

I'll keep this installed on the Deck for the foreseeable future. Recommended.

review:
You can feel developer's love.
Great graphics.

Pick up Rotary B7 and be happy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022680190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1674072966}

author: {'steamid': '76561198319585895', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 2895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1704041617}
review:
tl;dr: Although arcade-y looking, art of rally is a rather hard-core rally racing game that is at the same time challenging (due to its semi-realistic physics) and relaxing (for the excellent synthwave soundtracks and gorgeous low-poly scenery). I fully recommend it to casual gamers and racing game players alike.

Contents of art of rally:
Currently, the game has 8 locations: Finland, Italy, Norway, Germany, Japan, Kenya, Indonesia, and Australia, the last being part of a paid DLC. Each location offers 6 stages and a freeroam map.

The stages are the staple of the game. The length varies, but a stage typically takes 3–5 minutes to finish. Each of the current 48 stages (from all 8 locations) can be raced:
+ in two directions: default and reversed;
+ under 6 weathers: morning, afternoon, sunset, night, fog, and rain (or snow in Norway), although only rain/snow change the physics of handling, while night and fog only diminish visibility of the stages, and the other three are purely cosmetic;
+ with over 50 cars, each with different handling physics, all based on iconic cars in the history of rally, ranging from group 2 to group A;
Therefore, the game has a great deal of replayability.

The game has 5 play modes:
+ Career mode. This is the mode to play through in order to see the credits roll. You will experience the golden era of rally, from 1967 to 1996, through group 2, 3, 4, B, S, and A, for a total of 200+ stages. The rallies and the stages are semi-randomly chosen from the pool of 42 stages, in order that the difficulty curve is gentle and that you naturally get acquainted with all locations and all weathers. Playing through the career mode will unlock all the playable cars in the game and their bonus livery.

There are 5 levels of AI difficulty, the easiest one beatable by even newcomers to racing games, while rivalling the normal one already requires plenty of practice. You can also select from several damage levels, from none to severe, and you will be able to partially repair your car after every other stage. Note that there is no penalty for losing, nor reward for winning. The AIs do not even show when you drive; only their time is displayed at the end of a stage. In other words, the competition with AIs and the damage system are there to provide extra challenge for those who seek it. This makes the game significantly more Zen and relaxing than most racing games, and suitable for casual players.

+ Time attack. Choose a stage, a weather, a group, and potentially a ghost car from, for example, your personal best or world record. Then there you go! Try and see if you can improve your record!

+ Daily and weekly rallies. Compete for the leaderboard!

+ Custom rally. Pick up to 12 stages from one location to form a rally, customise their order and weather, then compete with AIs in the group you want.

+ Free roam. There is one freeroam map for each location. In a freeroam map, you can, as you can expect, roam freely and find collectibles. By finding collectibles in one map, you unlock the next free roaming map, a bonus soundtrack, and an achievement.

A few caveats:
* The game does not have a first-person camera, but a low-down third-person one. You can slightly adjust the altitude of the camera, the FOV, and its rotation speed.
* It would be ideal to play it with a controller rather than the keyboard, due to the need of pressure-sensitive buttons for braking, accelerating, and steering.
* The handling may not appeal to everyone at the beginning. Some consider the cars uncontrollably slippery, while some others think the physics is wonderfully realistic. Lacking expertise on this matter, I shall not deliver a final verdict on it. Rest assured that the game has tons of controlling settings for tweaking the handling to your likings. Just spend some time getting accustomed to the driving physics, and you will not be disappointed by this gem.

review: This game goes on my highly recommend list. The visuals and art style are excellent, each location has its own real character that distinguishes it from the other. But the cars are where it really shines. The sounds are fantastic, and really help get you in that rally mindset. The dynamics really do differ from car to car as well. I've put a number of hours in so far, and keep coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871588099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1669075272}
review: I played the whole thing with default settings with arrow keys and had a blast. Found out later you can adjust the camera and controller can be more fun. There are many ways to give yourself advantages like traction control and stuff to make it more arcade-like. 9/10 would recommend. Also, look up how to do the 1000 stage achievement quicker. There isn't enough content to play more than 30 hours while that achievement might take an additional 30 hours of tedious grinding on top of the 25-30 hours of base game content. Remember, if you feel you're still in control, you're just not going fast enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284018331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1702390084}
review:
Basicamente es un juego de rally, y por supuesto que no es un juego relajante sino de tener paciencia(mucha paciencia), si esta muy aficionado a los rally, esta deberia entrar en tu lista. 

Lo malo:
-El juego te presenta carreras en solitario y no en competición en grupo.
-Todas la carreras se trata de batir records de otros.
-No hay muchas skins de coches, la mayoria son colores solidos
-No puedes personalizar el coche, si eres fan de NFS
-Sobretodo: paciencia, mucha paciencia porque hay circuitos de muchas curvas y la fisica es un desmadre.
-La banda sonora no es mala pero sobra basicamente, mejor ponte la tuya. 

Lo bueno:
-El ambiente minimalista.

Basicamente lo compre por capricho.

review:
[h1]Spaßiger Arcade Rally Spaß, der Spaß macht[/h1]
[list]
[*]viele verschiedene Fahrzeuge, die sich auch unterschiedlich anfühlen was das Fahrverhalten betrifft
[*]die "Biome" und Wetter- sowie Lichtverhältnisse sorgen immer wieder für neue Herausforderungen
[*]man kann sich die Karriere so schwer oder leicht einstellen wie man möchte
[*]der Grafikstyl ist funktional und bietet trotz low-poly genug Details in der Umgebung
[/list]
[hr][/hr]
Klare [i]Kaufempfehlung[/i] für alle, die auch schon [b]Absolute Drift[/b] mochten und/oder ein weiteres gut designtes und poliertes Arcade Racing Spiel mit leichtem Simulations Faktor brauchen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116915997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1670454416}
review:
An excellent game for anyone who likes driving games, but doesn't necessarily want a singular focus on competition. While this game does track times and who "wins", there is no interaction between drivers, and last place can get the same rewards as first place; turning the focus to personal improvement and fun, rather than being the best among other drivers. On top of that, the driving system is not only enjoyable, but feels very fair. When something goes wrong, I don't blame some feature of the game, I just tell myself I'll do better next time. 

Besides great gameplay, Art Of Rally is also a very visually pleasing game. The scenery and lighting are excellent; though some people may prefer realism over the low-poly aesthetic that I enjoy in this game.

On top of everything else, this game is backed up by an incredible soundtrack that I often find myself listening to on my own time as well. I highly recommend downloading it.

I do have a few nitpicks, though they come up so infrequently they're hardly worth mentioning. Some barriers feel as if they shouldn't stop your car as well as they do; such as the plastic mesh fencing, which I don't believe should bring a rally car at 100MPH to a full stop. Some map geometry also feels more punishing than is necessary. For instance, some bumps off the side of the road will send you flying in a headfirst roll; or the stones that line the road in some sections of the Germany map, which seem to bring your car to a violent stop if you even slightly graze them with the side of your car, and leave you in a difficult position to recover from.
But then again, if I could just manage to stay on the road, none of these would be a problem, so it all comes down to user error again.

Overall, I think this is an excellent game. I came here from the recent Forza games, and I've found this to be a much more enjoyable experience free from unfair AI drivers, complex car tuning, and a reward system that can leave people disappointed and upset.
Pretty much, if you just want to relax, drive, and enjoy getting a little better each day, this is a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363403703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1710185992}
review:
i think it’s only right to write this review in all lowercase, so here goes!

art of rally is a top-down view of what the sport, rally, looks like. although this game portrays itself as “arcadey,” due to its minimalistic (and beautiful) art style, the hands-on gameplay has a hint of realism. this game was hard for me to learn and still is. the racing games i’ve played in the past taught me to floor the accelerator and to rarely use the brake--this is not the case in art of rally.

art of rally’s main mode, career, will guide you through the upbringing of rally racing. along your journey with each group, you will read about the history and progression of the sport and unlock new cars and liveries. thankfully, you don’t need to complete the career mode to unlock the next group of cars, but there are just a few that need to be unlocked that way. playing the next group of cars feels rewarding and exciting. in addition, there is a short video of the next group of cars after you finish the current group’s season. this addition hypes up the upcoming races and is a great way to introduce them! the problem for me is that the career mode is long and "grindy." it’s probably just a me problem, but i found myself later on not enjoying the seemingly repetitive races: rushing through the stages just to move on to the next one and then the next one–i wasn’t present with them later on and eventually it became a chore to work through.

there are also different game modes to mess around in: time attack, which is a great way to beat your personal best time on a certain track; custom rally, which you can play instead of the career mode if you want to drive the other group of cars and certain tracks; online events, which feature a daily and weekly event; freeroam, where you can hunt collectibles and just race around where ever you want. overall, this game has a lot to offer if you’re looking for that rally racing itch.

there are a total of 50 cars and each car feels and sounds different. furthermore, there are different types of grounds and tracks to race on. changing from your current favorite car to a different one can be weird sometimes and it can take a bit of adjusting--there is always something new to learn in this game.

while i’m not a huge fan of edm in general, i enjoyed the music choice for this game. if you’re ever not feeling a certain song, you can easily skip it; even while you’re going 90 mph into a hay bale–the accessibility is simply unmatched here! in addition, the music--naturally being upbeat--is a great reminder to speed up.

for a racing game, the keyboard controls are not too bad. initially when i purchased this game, i had a hard time choosing to use my ps4 controller or my keyboard. at first, i started to use my controller, but after experimenting with my keyboard, i found it much easier to use. of course, it’s all personal preference, but take the time to experiment and find what you like best!

i will say that some of the hitboxes of some objects are a little odd. bridge rails, for example, confuse me; i seem to hit them even though i’m far enough away from them, but this could be the case of me being frustrated and blaming the game instead of myself.

art of rally showcases [i] the [/i] art of rally; each turn and curve is a great opportunity to really show that off. i like this game, and i think it’s worth it for at regular price--even better if you get it on sale. i had never played a rally racing game before, so this was a first, and it was a great introduction to what this sport is about!

review: A nice and artistic homage of older style rally, taking the player through the early 60s all the way to group B. More relaxed than a typical sim, but still engaging with it's top-down perspective, weighty physics, and satisfying tracks reminiscent of the real life historical stages. A must for any old time rally fans, or just wanting a very pleasing and beautiful rally racer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090057597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 10668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1703233634}
review:
캐쥬얼 레이싱 겜이라 하기엔 물리엔진이 캐쥬얼하지는 않고
심레이싱 겜이라 하기에는 흠..
말을 아끼는 게 나을 거 같으니 직접 보고 판단하는 게 빠를 듯 함
일단은 시점과 카메라 거리 때문에 초행길에 억까 당하는 요소가 있음
대표적인 예로 사르데냐 겐나마리의 도심지쪽 길
건물이 길을 가려가지고 시이벌 차 머리는 이미 들어가 있는데 정작 길이 (중략)

개인적으로는 독일 맵 개 ㅈ같음
연석은 왜 이따구로 정성스럽게 하나하나 개 꼴받게 박아놨는지 정말 그지같음
이거 잘 못 해서 살짝만 박아도 차가 돌아가고 파손 옵션 켰으면 어디 맛탱이 가는거 순식간이라 진짜 개 ㅆ(중략)

여튼
나는 재미있게 했지만 레이싱 겜돌이들에게도 추천할 만하냐에 대해서는 아직도 잘은 모르겠음
뭐, 할 사람들만 남은 게 레이싱 겜 시장이니 일단 추천 박고 가야겠음

author: {'steamid': '76561198048282809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1687773304}
review:
art of rally is soulful, passionate and was made with love. I absolutely adore this game, but would caution you to try it before you commit to keep it. Its retro steering controls are imprecise and finnicky, and with simcade physics this game has a fierce learning curve. And it's unforgiving, you may find it more frustrating than fun. 

You need to approach this seeking a challenge, and with a willingness to learn and occasionally to suffer. But if you do, there's so much to love about art of rally.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994960305', 'num_games_owned': 2211, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1667355902}

author: {'steamid': '76561198364484350', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1666667218}
review:
Me hubiera encantado escribir algo positivo sobre este juego, ya que hace mil años que tenia ganas de probarlo. Sin embargo, desde el minuto 1 ya todo se fue al choto. Acá van las 2 cosas que arruinaron mi experiencia:

1- Horrendamente optimizado, ni siquiera se ve tan bien y se juega para el re culo, los framerates son una basura.

2-Las físicas parecen traídas del Absolute Drift, sin embargo los autos se controlan todos masomenos igual con distintos niveles de subviraje. En el AD, esto estaba bien ya que las físicas eran básicamente solo hacer drift, se sentían bien y siempre se notaba el peso de cada vehículo, aparte de que según la longitud de ejes se manejaba relativamente diferente.
Sin embargo, acá las físicas hacen que los autos se sientan pesados o simplemente engorrosos de hacer girar. El vehículo no se decide si sobrevirar o subvirar y la transición entre ambos también se siente engorrosa, hasta con el Alpine A110 y el Mini pasaba esto, vehículos que no son para nada pesados y mucho menos se manejan mal. Por otro lado, ni siquiera sin ABS se bloquean los frenos y los autos frenan de una manera exagerada. El factor de contravolanteo también es molesto, etc..

author: {'steamid': '76561198082256751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4278, 'last_played': 1666112450}
review:
A minimalisztikus megjelenése kicsit megtévesztő lehet, ennek ellenére egy tartalmas autóversenyzős játék. 

Sikerült eltalálnia a tökéletes simcade autó fizikát a játéknak, könnyen vezethető akár billentyűzetről is, de mégis ügyességet igényel, érezni a súlypont változásokat, a tapadást és hasonlókat. A hangok helyenként kicsit gyengék, de a zene jó, illik a játék stílusához. Az autó felhozatal is kiváló, a legismertebb rally autók többsége szerepel a játékban, néhány vicces ráadással is (tuktuk, faszállító teherautó). Lehet különböző festések közül válogatni, vagy újakat letölteni is, ami szintén egy plusz. A különböző országok különböző pályái is változatosak és hangulatosak.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970526038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1665247346}
review:
This is a "thumbs down but could be thumbs up".

Disclaimer: I played a lot of driving games. Colin McRae Rally 2 was one of the few games where I could "get in the zone" and drive the wheels off a car without thinking. I miss that experience.

Thumbs up:
The design, the graphics, the soundtrack all all top-notch. The cars and the sponsors are all spoofs of real cars and brands, very cheeky. It's fun to recognize them. I love the soundtrack too. The tracks are big and varied. You can play in arcade mode, or in manual mode with all assists off. You can play career-mode to unlock everything, or you can also just wander around.

Thumbs down:
Where to start? First, this game is missing some classic rally game features. Most glaringly, there's no co-pilot! This means hood and in-car cameras are also missing: these views reduce visibility, and with no co-pilot you'd crash constantly. The only camera option is high-up following, but no matter the FOV the sense of speed is really lacking. Also because there's no co-pilot, the night races are really hard (am I approaching a tight turn after this dip? I'm about to find out!), but the AI doesn't suffer as much.

Also missing: there's no checkpoint timing! You have no idea how fast or how slow you are compared to other drivers, you only see your time at the end of each stage.

The races in career mode are also completely random. So if you try to improve your score... you're spinning the roulette wheel!

What about driving physics? They're bad. You're either at 100% grip, or you're struggling to go back to your racing line, and the transition between the two is very mushy and unpredictable. This might be due to using controller, but then again maybe not. Also the brakes are RIDICULOUSLY powerful, and yet even with ABS off I've never once locked my wheels? :shrug:

The damage system on "normal" mode is useless. I've never needed anything more than a wash, even after multiple crashes :shrug:

There's not much difference between cars in each class. They all have pretty much the same power and the same cornering ability, only slightly different oversteer, and maybe steering sensitivity?

The collision physics are also terrible. If you scrape a barrier, instead of bouncing off your car will TURN INTO THE BARRIER and you will face-plant. Wat? And let's not talk about Germany and its tombstone-lined roads.

So I'm pretty disappointed. I would love to love this game, but there's just too many problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035318025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1668804948}

review: 아기자기한 동화 같은 그림체에 아케이드성 레이싱인줄 알고 구매하였는데, 깊이가 있어서 처음엔 당황 했습니다.  2시간 정도 하다 보니, 대충 감이 오는게  호쾌하진 않지만 나름 재미 있네요.  포르자4 세일할때 함께 구매했는데, 무언가 끌리듯이 포르자보다 이겜을 먼저 하게 됩니다.  스테이지별로 나눠 있어서 짧게 하기 좋아서 그런듯 합니다.  패드로 플레이 했고, 원래는 스팀덱에서 가볍게 하려고 구매한건데 배터리 엄청 먹습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210392976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1669061962}
review: good game

author: {'steamid': '76561197983577751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1705631535}
review: This game looks awesome, the music is great, and the trailers are cool.  The physics are basically like your car is on ice skates.  People blame the top down angle and say there is a learning curve, but I think its BS.  Drive a car around a slight bend to watch your car fly off the track, if not tumbling down a mountain or into a lake.  Most of the time I put into this game is just trying to stay on the road in free roam.  I really don't recommend buying this game, but the free content updates have provided me with some awesome wallpapers over the years.  I have played a load of sim and arcade racers over the years, and have never ever had this much trouble with a racing game.  I honestly think its broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081864372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1664815293}
review:
Fun but terribly made, was hoping that it was in early access but apparently it's "finished".

It looks like a ps1 game with fancy shaders yet it runs worse than modern-ish AAA games like Titanfall 2.

Also even on max settings there's tonnes of pop-in, foliage and shadows are constantly changing in the background. The game looks great otherwise but that kinda ruins it.

Also it takes 6 gigabytes, which for such a low-fidelity game makes no sense at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561199156719539', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1703893803}
review: Great rally racing game with a simplistic but beautiful art style. After completing the story there is still a bunch of things to do but my favorite is to do time attack and try to get top 10 in each track.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009091418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1666127042}
review:
Easy to play and hard to master. As a Rally Fan the career mode is awesome to work up through. Group S and A are extremely challenging cars to drive. Luckily at that point you should have played at least 100 stages and should be able to identify repeated parts of the tracks so you know how to attack those blind corners. Group 4 is the highlight of the career mode. Turbocharged RWD cars ripping through the gravel is an amazing feeling. 

Pros: 
- Great selection of cars, unlicensed of course but use IGCD to find the real-world counterparts.
- Great variety of tracks, locales, weather conditions.

Cons
- Sound. Cars don't sound very good but at least there is a difference between cylinders and aspiration.
- Cutting corners will sometimes reset your car when you cross an invisible wall 

Wants
- Independent suspension 
- More rugged stages with multiple surface changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985387346', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2592, 'last_played': 1680065064}
review:
This game has a great visual style and a dope retrowave soundtrack. It's easy to pick up and hard to master. For rally fans, this is a must buy. It piqued my interest in rally and had me googling the real verisions of the cars in this game. I went straight from this into Dirt Rally 2.0.

A few things to note: the default controls for this game suck, and the game does lag at certain moments. For me, playing in DX12 mode seems to fix the random stutters. For w/e reason, this is also one of the worst performing titles on Xbox Game Pass, so download it first if you want to play it before buying this.

review: El juego es genial estoy haciendo esta reseña rápida para simplemente pedir que por favor incluyan el rally sudamericano. Quiero hacerme mierda en las curvas de Los Gigantes en las sierras de Córdoba.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206571429', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1695758932}
review:
The name says it all, "art of rally".

It has simple graphics, but beautiful lighting and atmosphere makes the game unique and somewhat better then other racing games on the market. Wish It had 1st person view though.

The game catches the good old rally vibe surprisingly well.
Mad classic rally cars, check.
Damn nice stages, check.
Crowds on the stage, check.
F**king jumps, check.
It even has nice Soundtracks.

Overall, if you're a rally fan (especially Group B) recommend. There's no other game like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994061969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1671291250}
review: Not a huge racing game enjoyer. Bought this game to play with my son. The handling feels like driving on a teflon surface through treacle with a 1 second control lag. Your car will understeer any corner, then fishtail under acceleration. Restarts required every 30 seconds or so. No real sense of speed due to top-down view. Feels cartoonish (like micro machines) but without the intuitive responsive handling. Really didn't find it enjoyable. The aesthetics are nice though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159524543', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1668489568}
review: This is a great 'arcade-sim' racer.  All of the cars in game are faithful to their real life counterparts.  The graphics are a refreshing take on this type of racer.  The in game music is great and doesn't get annoying as the miles begin to add up.  This is a great game to have if you want to really get into it or if you just want to click of some laps.  Highly Recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198372660209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1445, 'last_played': 1705455905}
review: Beautiful game with great physics and brilliant soundtrack.  Make sure you turn off a lot of the driving aids like steering correction and auto gears, it really unlocks the game - the handling actually seems a lot better after that and you can actually drift smoothly around all the corners.  The presentation is fantastic throughout, there's a daft sense of humour in all of the descriptions too, and then there's a constantly growing 50+ tracks of varied synthwave ranging from stuff a bit like John Carpenter & Kraftwerk to some more more modern 'retro' stuff.  Wicked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065398223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1710019464}
review:
If you want a quick review before I go in detail: 

- Price is fair
- Handling feels very satisfying, semi-realistic
- Great music, suitable selection of cars and tracks
- No story, multiplayer activities (daily and weekly too)
- Devs are cool and release updates and DLCs for free (Consider buying OST)
- Good graphics, but surprisingly intensive on GPU

And now, for actual review I suppose:

Going as fast as possible, passing by spectators that don't care about their safety at all, Eurobeat blasting in the radio - that's art of rally, at least according to the devs, but honestly, I dig their vision. Yeah, the game has its own Eurobeat (it slaps btw) and generally good selection of music to let you feel the flow better.

Cars, colorful and diverse - they resemble real world ones, not only by looks, but also by the anecdotal behavior (Cause I haven't driven 'em irl, besides RBR and DiRT Rally games, what you hear about the cars IS reflected somewhat in AoR) which makes every one of them feel like a unique driving experience, lengthening your fun time in game.
There's also fair share of just random vehicles to use, like a lorry that has very noticable weight to it, or VW Pickle bus with way too much power for it's own sake.

For tracks - paired with the incredibly cute and atmospheric graphics of the game, they are vastly diverse and provide the expected feeling you'd see in other rally games or in your TV. Among like *maybe* 10 countries in the game, you have different stages with their reversed patterns too, longer or shorter ones. These are also affected by weather, you can encounter rain which makes things very slidey, or night where if you have a frontal crash... things do get a lil' teeny weeny bit harder (yeah, broken lights make seeing harder, who would've thought)

The driving - Delightful on a gamepad, satisfyingly difficult but not resistant to be bridled. From my own experience, it required a bit of tweaking in the settings like adjusting camera FoV or the countersteer speed to get it to my liking, but after that I haven't had many issues controlling the car in a way I want. I feel like fair warning would be that the faster the cars and speeds get, the less confidence you usually have.
Cars behave in a semi realistic way which for people that just want an escape and relax while playing a car related game - it is perfect. BUT! BUT BUT BUT - I've seen people have fun and learn thing or two about car control while playing THIS very game too.

For everything else - Game looks really good, it has its own artstyle, but is suprisingly resource heavy, at least for the GPU. DX12 version seems to be unstable for me and shows graphical bugs after a while, DX11 is fine. Sadly you can't just save replays, you can always record them though. There is some multiplayer to play, competing against other people in daily and weekly challenges, or just trying to break world records in specific settings. I played without any assists and in maximum damage possible, although it's very inconsistent as you can be fine after striking a tree with a roof of your car or have terminal damage after trading paint with a guardrail. 

*Damage system is really frustrating at times*

Game gud, worth price, dribing fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051502086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1701553632}
review: Physics try to be realistic, but the controls don't match up to it so it becomes kind of meh. You constantly end up in slides that you can't catch with a controller or keyboard, so it's either turn on assists or have a bad time. The camera angles really don't help either.

review: Marvelous, just marvelous. Attention to details, funny car names, geeky car hommages etc. And I dont see keyboard controls and physics this good since GTA V. Puts a lot of recent games in the pocket.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122870273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1711139775}
review: Pretty neat challenging indie game with surprisingly good physics. Feels like a love letter to the history of the WRC, the campaign takes you through the eras of rally and the engineering over the years is fascinating. I recommend it for racing fans and casual racing fans alike. For sim racing fans like myself this isn't nearly as sweaty as Dirt Rally 2.0 on a wheel but I can kick back with a podcast and play this with an Xbox controller. For casual types that play a couple hours of need for speed every time that game comes out, this game is more challenging and maybe it can serve as a soft introduction to the sim racing world (where you have to fight the car instead of it driving for you).

author: {'steamid': '76561198452115850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4054, 'last_played': 1692136109}
review: This game is awesome. Easy to pickup, hard to master rally game with a focus on retro cars. There are 7 locations that all look stunning and offer different challenges with the various track layouts. The soundtrack is fantastic, and makes the game super chill, whilst still being engaging. This is a great game to keep coming back to for a couple hours at a time. If you like rally games, pick this up :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198177558007', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1690236024}
review:
One word: Chill
This game is incredibly relaxing for a game that depends on the time you get on the stages, but the atmosphere plus gameplay just makes it so.

I really enjoy the progression, going through the years paying tribute to older models while it allows you to get better by using slower rwd cars instead of going directly into class b and beyond.

review: This is a pretty incredible game. Goes into different eras of rally, without explicitly stating what cars they're representing. Allows you to really feel out of control, while having a reasonable learning curve to gain control. Would definitely recommend. Just wish more of my friends played, so we could compare times. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197962214787', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2688, 'last_played': 1709900589}
review:
This is a game that understands that in rally, the only thing that matters is the next corner.

It strips everything else away. Minimal career mode, minimal aesthetic, minimal customisation and tweaking. Just you and the next corner.

My only suggestion for improvement is that the road surface is always at a constant bank and width. Some narrowing and banking of corners would be very welcome - the most satisfying moment in rally is always when you juuust dip your front tyre into the inside bank of a corner and use that to swing your car round. That is sadly missing in this game.

The aesthetic and soundtrack is on point. This is flow-state-on-demand, and having access to that has honestly been a form of therapy for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012469706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1669058672}
review:
Es macht einfach nur Laune, nicht nur die Strecken abzufahren, sondern auch die verschiedenen Wagen auszuprobieren.
Denn nicht jeder Wagen ist gleich, alle haben so ihre "Macken", - die einen kommen besser in und um die Kurve, andere sind im Anzug einfach schneller und auch das Fahrverhalten ist eben anders.
Ich kann das nicht so recht beschreiben, denn ich habe keinen Autoführerschein und bin nur als Beifahrer unterwegs.
Es macht einfach Spaß und das ist für mich die absolute Hauptsache bei diesem Game.
Daher ein klares JA zu diesem Spiel!!

Noch was am Rande... wundert Euch nicht, das ihr keine Original Automarken zu lesen bekommt.
Wahrscheinlich geht es hier um reine Lizensfragen, und sowas ist nicht billig - und warum dafür zahlen, wenn ein Kenner die einzelnen Wagen sieht, weiß auch so worum es sich hier und da handelt.
Sogar ich habe einige gekannt.
Ihr werdet es ja sehen.
Es soll zwar einen Multiplayer geben, habe ihn aber noch nicht ausprobiert, da muss und sollte ich noch was üben. Und die 23 Std. sagen ja schon alles - immer noch passieren mir dumme Fehler beim Bremsen oder so und mein Wagen landet meist nicht da wo er hin sollte.... hihihi....

author: {'steamid': '76561197970876788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5551, 'last_played': 1705633563}
review:
Probably my favorite driving game that I play with controller (I tend to use my wheel/pedals on sims). I'll just list what I love about it:
PROS
-Graphics are phenomenally good, I mean aesthetically for me they are simply gorgeous and have a unique look. Quite scalable too, can make it run barely good enough on my surface laptop.
-Much more sophisticated handling than first appears. You can use some real rally techniques, Scandinavian flick, left foot braking (weighting the front wheels), over/under steer, weight transition, throttle control in powering out of corners, it's all there. No tuning, but there are different cars and characteristics to get used to.
-Handling through different weather conditions/surfaces is done quite well.
-A real homage to a golden era of rallying, namely the 80s-90s, where the Group B shone and real prototypes were getting limelight for brave tuning and engineering out of the box. ALL car models look great.
-Fantastic soundtrack that plays seamlessly and unobtrusively the whole time, I love it, you will too if you appreciate decent synthwave. Couple of extra nice songs to unlock via the free roam mode.
-Steep but fair difficulty curve, the master difficulty can be conquered too if you are patient enough. You would have to be at the top of your game though, but even the AI still makes mistakes here and there.
-All locations are so unique and capture what made each of them special
-plenty of content when it comes to cars and locations to unlock and master, the game is intensely satisfying when you really 'become one' with it, and start to be more precise with placing the car where and how you want it.
It's unbelievable value for what it is, give it a try if you like driving sims or rally racing, you won't regret it. Not too mention, no scummy practices when it comes to DLC or microtransactions, just a damn solid game (the Kenya update was extremely nice welcome, and I hear there's even more coming with a location in Indonesia where I live. Can't wait!!!!)

CONS
Not a lot to say here, just:
-if the game says it can't Sync upon launch, just close it and open again, DON'T play or you will lose all your progress. Yes I had a 100% game lost due to this, heartbreaking stuff, but to be honest I didn't mind the excuse to go through it all again, this time master 1st trophy on all career mode
-I can understand why they reset your car and give +5sec penalty for cutting corners, but sometimes it happens just from going a few meters outside of the track. Not sure why, just wished it was a bit more lenient on that, if I went that far off it's already costing me time, not benefiting, but maybe it's for preventing being able to roam too far from the track I'm not sure, mildly irritating is all.
-Be careful with the graphics options, there are very few things which will kill your framerate out of the blue if your rig is not up to it. On the whole, it is extremely well optimized though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014989414', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1703548295}
review:
[b][url=http://www.lamazmorraabandon.com/modules.php?name=Forums&file=viewtopic&t=2623]Análisis del juego en "La Mazmorra Abandon"[/url][/b]

Probablemente se trate de una de las sorpresas más agradables que me he llevado a lo largo de la última década en lo que respecta a juegos actuales. Y no me estoy refiriendo a una superproducción o un lanzamiento de los denominados "Triple A" con un exorbitante presupuesto detrás cuyas millonarias cifras marearían a cualquiera. Todo lo contrario, ya que nos encontramos ante un título de aspecto minimalista cuya puesta en escena se desmarca por completo de lo que cualquier usuario haya visto en el género de conducción y, más concretamente, el de carreras de rallies.

"Art of Rally" hace honor a su nombre, alejándose del barro y la suciedad característicos de los juegos de este tipo que pretenden reflejar la realidad de las grandes competiciones. Como si de una acuarela se tratara, Funselektor Labs ha sido capaz de dotar de color y vida a unos escenarios por lo común oscuros y mortecinos. Pero ello no es óbice para que las diferentes condiciones climatológicas estén debidamente representadas con la delicadeza que exhibe este título en todos y cada uno de sus aspectos.

Así como los entornos dibujan su relieve de manera estilizada, el diseño de los coches también merece una mención especial. No en vano, "Art of Rally" pretende trasladar al jugador a épocas pretéritas para ponerse a los mandos de vehículos clásicos e icónicos con los que poder disputar etapas en algunos de los trazados más representativos. Desde Finlandia a Japón, pasando por Italia o Alemania, el usuario dispondrá de un amplio y asombroso abanico de automóviles correspondientes a algunas de las categorías más conocidas como los Grupos 2, 3, 4, B, S y A. Por si fuera poco, todos ellos son completamente personalizables para conseguir adaptarse a los gustos de cada jugador, al mismo tiempo que se ponen a su disposición distintos estilos de conducción con los que exprimir la habilidad al volante.

La ambientación no se circunscribe en exclusiva a su apartado visual, contando el juego con una banda sonora que hará las delicias de los más nostálgicos gracias al uso de sintetizadores que evoca otros títulos clásicos de conducción. Además, el sonido de los motores y los vítores del público constituyen el acompañamiento perfecto para generar una sensación lo más cercana posible a lo que sería una carrera real.

Por lo que se refiere al manejo, "Art of Rally" permite al jugador escoger entre caja de cambios automática y manual, según quiera experimentar la dureza de la alta competición en sus carnes o, por el contrario, disfrutar de una manera más relajada. Lo mismo que los daños que pueda sufrir el vehículo y el impacto en su rendimiento. Una vez en carrera, el sistema de control no puede ser más básico y sencillo, utilizando tan sólo las teclas direccionales para dirigir el coche y la barra espaciadora como freno de mano.

Otra de las características a tener en cuenta en "Art of Rally" es su variedad de modos de juego, tanto en solitario como en línea. De esta forma, a las modalidades de carrera y contrarreloj se unen eventos personalizados y desafíos semanales que posibilitarán al usuario competir contra otros jugadores por la gloria automovilística.

Por último, cabe destacar que el juego incluye una breve historia de los campeonatos de rallies desde sus orígenes con referencias a marcas legendarias como Peugeot y Audi, entre otras. Por desgracia, no cuenta con los derechos y licencias pertinentes, viéndose aquellas ligeramente modificadas.

En definitiva, "Art of Rally" es un título que combina el sabor añejo propio de la era de los 16 bits con un estilo muy personal y vistoso que logrará cautivar los paladares más exquisitos. Así que todo aquel que esté dispuesto a desempolvar su casco y enfundarse su mono de carreras ha de dar una oportunidad a este juego que le va a proporcionar una experiencia única. ¿Estás preparado para conquistar el éxito a golpe de acelerador?

author: {'steamid': '76561198050256748', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1691071714}
review:
New review: Positive

As already stated in the original review, the game is super fun.

One year later, a user commented on this thread suggesting to initiate the game in DX12 and switch the vegetation renderer to "instanced." After doing this and using the same PC, I had no more technical issues, and I was able to complete the full game.

In this way, I am updating my review to a positive one, keeping my word as I said in my original post.

Original review: Negative
The game is super fun and recommended.

However, there is an issue that I found extremely annoying with it. The more you play, the lowest the frame rate is. I don't have any clue why but at start, the game is fluid and at constant 144 fps. This maintains during the first rally of 4-5 stages (around 15-20 mins playing). In the second rally, the game starts to perform worst at each stage. Around 30 min of playing, the game is practically unplayable with frame drops to 20 fps.

If this issue is fixed, please buy it because the game is awesome. If not, think of it before.

Happy to turn this review into a positive one if this is fixed!

PS: the game is running on a i5 12400 and RTX 3070 ti...

author: {'steamid': '76561198074833776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1666217683}
review:
Art of Rally is surprising deep, with rallies spanning different eras (e.g., 70s, 80s, etc.), a large variety of environments that change with the seasons and weather, and very accurate diving dynamics that apply to the many recognizable vehicles from the different categories and eras.

I really did not expect to enjoy Art of Rally so much. The art style is as beautiful as the driving too. Crowds scatter as the cars approach sections of track with bystanders and the open world collectibles are a great way to get familiar with the race locations. Art of Rally is a great racing game and highly-recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037037927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3875, 'last_played': 1690572885}
review:
[u] Points forts :[/u] 

- Graphismes Low Poly qui rendent vraiment bien avec de bons effets de lumière.
- Nombreuses voitures des Groupes 2, B, A et S dont les R5 Turbo, 205 T16, alpine 310 V6. si vous êtes un amateur de rallye, vous serez comblé.
- Les différentes spéciales sont variées et dans différents pays avec des effets météos aléatoires (pluie, brouillard, nuit, etc.).
- Les sensations de conduites sont bonnes et agréables. Il est possible de régler la puissance de l'ABS et des aides à la conduite (attention cependant le niveau de paramétrage n'est pas aussi complet qu'un Dirt rallye ou autre jeu de simulation).


[u] Points faibles :[/u] 

- Peut devenir lassant au bout d'un certain temp, mais on y revient toujours pour les magnifiques sensations que nous procure le jeu.
- Jouable en vue troisième personne (derrière le véhicule) seulement. Il est impossible (sauf mod) de jouer en vue cockpit ou à l'intérieur du véhicule. 
- Le jeu est très orienté rallye (on va me dire c'est marqué dans le titre) mais il aurait été sympa de proposer d'autre modes de jeu avec des courses à 4, 8 ou des circuits.


[u] Bilan :[/u] 
Si vous aimez le rallye des années 80/90 foncez ! Vous ne serez pas déçu.
Les graphismes et les sensations de conduites sont vraiment super agréables et je retourne souvent sur ce jeu même après l'avoir fini.
Il est rapide de se lancer dans une spéciale ou de partir en exploration libre sur les différentes cartes proposées. 

[u] Note :[/u] 
 Un très bon 18/20. !

author: {'steamid': '76561197977750050', 'num_games_owned': 1891, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1699635112}
review:
Es ist gut aber ich denke ich werde das nie wieder Spielen... Das Fahren ist grundsätzlich super gemacht, aber alle Strasen sind irgendwie gleich bzw. gerade. Oder sagen wir na ja es sind halt Strasen :-) Keine Schlaglöcher etc... Einfach nur perfekte Strasen -_- Für ein Spiel das Rally im Namen hat ist das irgendwie komisch?

Auf der anderen Seite sind diese Perfekten Strasen irgendwie in de Landschaft gepinselt. Wenn man ein bisschen abkommt und es da gerade mal nach oben geht überschlägt man sich garantiert 10 mal da man an irgendeiner kante von einem Polygon aneckt...

Und wenn man gerade mal nirgendwo aneckt und man von der Strecke abkommt wird man sofort zurückgesetzt. Keine Ahnung aber ich dache man muss bei einer Rally eigentlich durch Checkpoints fahren? Sowas gibt es hier nicht...

Ist für mich eher ein Drift Spiel als irgendwas mit Rally... Trotzdem nicht schlecht...

author: {'steamid': '76561198096725347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5855, 'last_played': 1649505571}
review:
I bought the game one or two months after release and It was great and It still Is. 

But updates came out really slowly, and they still are. 3 updates in almost 2 years (Only 2, If you don't count liveries/paint options as an update (And only one was a new location, mind I add) I know that the dev team is small like really small. Only one person If I remember correctly, but the content can be played through pretty fast compared to how often content updates come out. 

The career mode Is lovely and fun when new and Is challenging as novise/experienced. 
New locations/settings makes you feel like a pro driver just waiting for what's to come.
And the way that the groups are unlocked Is good, having to know what came before almost makes you ready for what Is to come.

But the thing that made me tired of the game was the leaderboard of the online section. I wasn't bad, I even held multible WR's (although on the same stage between multible groups of cars) It's was still amazing. But now as I've played more hardcore rally/racing sims. The way that you can just cut the track, makes me mad. Well more sad then mad. Because getting a fast time Is about being faster/better and more brave then the opposition. But not here. I've fought with multible people for WR's, but the faster we got the more we had to cut, and at the end I didn't see It as rally'ing but more as "Who can cut more without being caught by the stage borders" It's a bit sad IMO. 
The online part doesn't take away the fun and satisfactory of the game doe. It's still good and Is still a great game and bridge between arcade and sim for the people who want's more realisme but aren't sure If the are ready for It.

 8/10 A great and fun game for at least 50+ hours (Completing the career mode, even later on harder difficulties. Doing online time attacks, aswell as doing daily's/weeky's in online for more knowledge/experience In the different groups of cars)

author: {'steamid': '76561198280810537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3989, 'last_played': 1709632274}
review:
Absolutely one of the best rally games ever. The graphics are beautiful, the cars are amazing and different. And once you get a hang of how to drive in this game, it becomes even more fun. 

I can recommend to start out with the first group; group 2, and then find out which car comes most naturally to you. Then learn that car. Learn how to control it, and then it is just to do the same process with the other groups. I can HIGHLY advice you to buy this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198160258616', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1679533764}
review: This is truly a rhythm game in which when found is downright therapeutic. Throw it in manual, swipe the handbrake, switch to the low gears, prepare to break traction again with the clutch, and let the revs bumble and the car swing around the corners while negotiating chaining corners that tighten and loosen. Art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978540860', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2404, 'last_played': 1708024058}

author: {'steamid': '76561198358467374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 27, 'playtime_at_review': 2235, 'last_played': 1711657272}
review:
Unconventionally starting this reviewing by stating that the soundtrack is an absolute masterpiece by Tatreal. 56 songs, or more than 3 hours of absolute bangers.

Now to the game itself: Driving at first feels random and unfair at times, but the moment you drift your first good curve and you get the idea of counter-steering, then this is probably one of the most fun games to play. It takes a fair amount of practice and frustration tolerance, but after the first 2 classes, it becomes so much more fun.

The game looks superb, though it must be said that you should have a decent rig, since the optimization of this game is not really great. The driving feels more natural than absolute drift and the countries all feel unique with their own style (fuck germany though).

I can absolutely recommend this game, but it must be played with controller in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031033148', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1706996573}
review:
This game actively punishes you for taking jumps, there is no co-driver and no driver cues, it promotes replaying courses over and over to get decent times. This goes against the spirit of rally entirely.  

The gravel physics are also flaming garbage, the cars drive like it's ice and there is absolutely no nuance to control at all, weight transfer is incredibly unrealistic and all of the cars feel very floaty. 

I'm pretty sure the gravity is really low, it explains how you can spend over 5 seconds in the air on a blind jump that exceeds twice any jump you'd find in Finland in real life. These blind jumps are suicidal to get any airtime on because many go from being long fast straights to the jump, and then mid-jump it becomes a sharp corner. 

Imagine going from a long 6  right, 250, to big jump square right triple caution. Nowhere on earth is that realistic, and it's even worse not having any cues that warn of them especially at night since the view is more top-down than forwards-facing that could give you the opportunity to look ahead, but no you have to spend time staring at how awful your car drives since the camera is not completely locked and sways around with drag and your momentum instead of the car chassis itself. 

It's a recipe for an unplayable game that is the antithesis of rally, it has no redeeming characteristics that would make me ever recommend this game in the face of these issues. Do not play.

author: {'steamid': '76561199009160964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1705859571}
review:
Art of Rally for me is pretty much the rally videogame which I would recommend for those who don't have high end PCs and wish to have a inmmersing Rally game experience. Art of rally mixes both low poly 3D with semirealistic rally car handling and third person cameras with both the posibility of freeroam or messing around in weird bonus cars. 
 
Physics wise it might need a rework, maybe we could tweak settings like brake distribution but for now... This game is like a incomplete painting. Here hoping for what the future has in store for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081200778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1696369631}
review:
A must have for rally and arcade racing fans.

This game is beautiful and fun, with a good amount of challenge mixed in. The music and sound affects combined with the art style work together perfectly. 

I do recommend this game but there are a few things keeping it from being perfect:
 - Mid corner adjustments while sliding are broken. Using the handbrake mid-corner actually causes understeer (What?) and lift-off oversteer doesn't work. This is mostly an issue for medium hair-pin corners.
- The metal guard rails, such as the ones found in Japan stages, are far too grippy. It is quite frustrating that the car will come to a standstill or even spin around after a minor brush against the railing.
-Car selection should be after the location is revealed in career mode. I want to drive certain cars on certain stages.
- For online events:
          - Let us select the car paint for the daily and weekly events.
          - On the leaderboards it should show the total number of competitors instead of just a percentage.
          - On the leaderboards it should show the event details at the top (car, location, etc

author: {'steamid': '76561199038426683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1672972246}
review: Fun graphics, cool classic cars - even if they have to rename them to avoid copyright issues, interesting facts and history. Great on Deck & Mac. Perfect for casual gamers with an interest in rally racing and antique autos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281134102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5423, 'last_played': 1710769979}
review:
Großartiges Rally Spiel!
Sehr nachvollziehbares Physikmodell und Fahrverhalten der Autos. Verschiedene Untergründe und Regen machen sich deutlich bemerkbar, ebenso Antriebsart, Gewicht und Radstand der Fahrzeuge.
Die Singleplayer Karriere ist motivierend und führt sehr schön durch die Historie.
Updates inkl. neuer Strecken und Fahrzeuge gibt es ebenfalls und der Onlinemodus hält täglich/wöchentlich neue Herausforderungen bereit :)

Alles in allem ein super Spiel, welches viel simpler aussieht als es wirklich ist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198192785509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 44556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 770, 'playtime_at_review': 5633, 'last_played': 1712443764}
review:
This game is an evident proof that racing games and art can come together. A simple approach with much more deep meaningful message. "To do something dangerous with style is art..."

Compelling campaign throughout the history of Rally. Simple yet stunning visuals along with a great handling model. Each car will behave with their aspects. Some more demanding than others while progressing and learning about their history and find cars you never heard of or never expected to see in this game. Pretty challenging to get used to at first but very rewarding once you get hang of it and learn to be faster making the experience much more gratifying and that's the special aspect of rallying and it nail it right on. Good amount variety of stages, cars and locations. not the mention the excellent soundtrack.

art of rally Became one of my all favorite games ever and it has a special place in my heart for racing games in these days. A new classic that everyone need to check out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198173874379', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1706454770}

author: {'steamid': '76561199004581751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1700938267}
review:
Je m'attendais à un jeu différent des grosses licences, simple à jouer à la manette. Mais il recopie les même défauts. Il n'y a aucun fun, mou, aucune logique ou respect des proportions dans les notions de vitesse, dérive, et autres coups de raquettes.Le frein à main agit sur les 4 roues, très gênant. Aucune lecture des défauts de la route n'est possible, Je m'ennuie avec du groupe B, j'ai l'impression d'avoir un 38 tonnes entre les mains. Les abords très adhésifs bien sûr ! avec ça on se régale. Si tu ne veut pas qu'on coupe, mets des obstacles. Le vertical est à vomir, enlevez-le. Aucun réel mode multi en ligne, dommage. Pour finir le menu quitter plante le jeu, super! aucuns temps sauvegardés.
Ne fournit pas les même sensations ni prestations qu'un CMR2 sur ps1 sorti en 2000. A comparer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028033358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1682193356}
review:
Una delicia de juego si te gustan los rallies y su historia. Por y para apasionados. 

No tiene opciones mecánicas ni configuraciones. Se centra pura y exclusivamente en la conducción, lo cual es para mí un punto a favor el no tener que complicarse mucho la vida entre etapa y etapa. Sit & Drive :)

Al principio cuesta algo hacerse con el manejo de los coches pero con un poco de práctica (sobre todo si tienes ya experiencia con algún juego similar) pasarás las curvas a todo lo que da tu máquina y querrás más y más tramos! 

Grandísimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198390696703', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1697642860}
review:
1.Камера. Может у меня 2 iq, но не модов, не настроек я не нашел, чтобы исправить очень убогий вид сверху. 
2.Физика. При малейшем столкновении машин с объектами происходит разворот, полная остановка.
3.Оптимизация. По системным требованиям мой комп проходит идеально, но даже так во время езды постоянные микро фризы. Пришлось снизить до минимальных-низких, чтобы глаза не умирали.
