author: {'steamid': '76561198074388172', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1653243207}
review:
Took me about 35hrs to 100%. 

This game is incredibly well done. From the sounds of the cars, environment, car physics, and music, all of those create a near-perfect mixture for an exhilarating rally game of those eras. 
Art of rally can be a casual racing game and one you can master. There is a relatively high skill ceiling that allows a player to really sink their teeth in to master a car.

Also, the soundtrack is amazing and that's a recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010425033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1658090081}
review:
Art of Rally is pure, gorgeous, authentic rally racing zen. Don't let its simple visuals fool you. There is beauty around every corner and an exhilarating sense of accomplishment for nailing them just right. You can tell this game comes from a place of passion for the sport, and this shows in the choice of detail on the courses, the cars, the sound design, and the physics. It captures the essence of rally in only the most important details. 

If you pick up this game, don't let the controls and perspective scare you off. If you're like me, you'll find yourself struggling to find a footing, but if you give it a few races, and as you unlock the newer, better handling cars, you'll find yourself at home, one with the car and whatever sits under the rubber of your wheels.

If you like racing, rally, or history of the sport, don't miss out on this one. Even if you're new to it, give it a try. You might find yourself surprised.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991297606', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1656242540}
review:
После 6 часов игры я её удалил и поставил Dirt Rally 2.0.
Поначалу забавно и интересно. Стилистика интересная, музыка вообще великолепная. Физика радует своей непростой аркадностью.
Через два часа ты начинаешь видеть повторяющиеся трассы. Через четыре часа ты добираешься до overpowered машин, которые за дорогу держатся так же, как суицидник за перила моста. К тому же при таком обзоре ездить на скоростях 150-180 - это рулетка. Ты либо угадал\помнишь наизусть поворот, либо ушёл на рестарт. При таком раскладе лучше поиграть уж во что-то поинтереснее.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993693261', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1688391482}

Great vibes. One of my favorite podcast games.

Requires a controller with analogue triggers to feather the gas. Not worth playing otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561199267428430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1660693523}
review:
X-TREME LIFT OFF OVERSTEER: THE VIDEOGAME!!!

Honestly the game's fun, just be aware that it's set on the Moon, or some other fictional planet where the gravity is about 30% of Earth's. You will literally get air and spin wildly out of control if you hit ANY sort of bump beyond 5mph. Apparently cars from the 70s and 80s also had their steering columns attached directly to their throttles for some reason. You get no response at low and high revs so play with the assistance controls til you find your sweet spot. Also good luck if you are right handed or want to use the arrow keys like a normal racing game. Remapping pretty much all of the keys breaks the game. Oh well.

Overall, fun game, not worth the price though... but who the hell buys games at full price on Steam? Rubes, that's who.

author: {'steamid': '76561199139761615', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1657374346}
review:
Итак, сегодня у нас art of rally. И про машинки? Не так просто, название говорит само за себя, здесь мы будем месить грязь, пыль и землю на машинах разных поколений и мощностей, от группы 2 до группы A, даже на грузовиках и трициклах можно покататься. 

Графика- на ультрах она хороша, глазам приятно, нету вырвеглазных текстур. Да думаю хоть на самые низкие настройки поставь, всё равно будет довольно неплохо.

Карьера/Сюжет- здесь правильно будет сказать карьера, мы же пилоты скоростных болидов, верно? Ну так вот, она тут длинная и интересная. По мере прохождения карьера вам будут открываться новые машины и ливреи (раскраски)

Автопарк- всего в игре 59 машин, я сидел и считал, да, я странный. Думаю тут понятно что разнообразия хватает. Из наиболее популярных машин я могу выделить: Audi S1 quattro, Subaru Impreza, Toyota AE86, Datsun 240z , Mitsubishi Lancer, Toyota Celica, BMW E30 и т.п. Если я попутал кол-во машин, можете меня поправить)

Физика авто- самое интересное, многие игроки говорят что у машин очень тугая поворачиваемость, и вообще чувствуется что водишь не машину, а кирпич. Я частично могу согласиться что машина ощущается странновато, но к тачке надо, не побоюсь этого слова *придрочиться*. И тогда вы сможете быстро понять что будет с машиной в той или иной ситуации. Если кто-то будет мне писать что якобы *ой смотрите, поиграл два часа и уже тут всё выписывает*, говорю сразу, в эту игру я играл еще на пиратке, почти тогда, когда она вышла, и наиграл в неё немало. По этому с игрой я знаком давно.

Атмосфера- тут она шедевральная,живописные пейзажи, приятный цвет, гул фанатов, рёв мотора, животные возле трассы, офигенная цветовая гамма. Короче, приехали в Финляндию на чемпионат. 

Оптимизация- норм. А что еще писать? Ну нормальная она тут. Если у тебя тостер или микроволновка, играть сможешь без фризов или просадок.

Геймплей- вполне себе, проходишь карьеру, гоняешь в свободном режиме, собираешь коллекционки, дрифтишь в японских горах.

Заключительный вердикт- хочешь ощутить себя ралли гонщиком?- бери. Хочешь расслабиться после тяжелого дня и почилить?- бери. Хочешь расхреначить субару об дерево?- бери


Овладеете ли вы искусством ралли?

author: {'steamid': '76561198316525348', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1660562173}
review:
why there are not any upper cases in the name? let's keep this style!

if you like rally, BUY THIS GAME! 

[b]art of rally[/b] is focused on the golden era of this sport, because the best time of rally is definitely part of the past. each car has its own physic and sound. sure, cars are not licensed, but true hardcore rally fan will recognize each of them. :-) 

+ unique atmosphere thanks to great idea
+ cars, lot of legendary cars with funny description in the menu
+ easy look but great design
+ manual gearbox
+ beautiful locations around the world
+ diferrent physics for each car
+ nice music style
+ spectators jumping out right in front of your bumper
+ diferrent surfaces

- maybe too harsh system of penalties when you go out of the road

yeah, i love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199063986228', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1699124308}

author: {'steamid': '76561198880265989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1707052173}
review:
[h1]Jalopy, Synthwave & Relax..[/h1]
 Или старенький утюг ускользает по трассе в закат.
И управлять им сложновато. Надеюсь привыкну, потому что игрушка обладает шармом. 
 Не то чтобы она особо красива или хороша. Просто именно это сочетание  визуального стиля и музыки зацепило. Хотя, не уверен что надолго.. с такой физикой.
 Относиться к этой игре как к обычному ралли не стоит. Это скорее ралли альтернативной реальности. Ралли где результат не самое важное. Важен процесс.
PS. Сразу после покупки запустите игру и поиграйте. Вполне возможно, что вам она совершенно не понравится.
PPS. Кажется тут можно скачать [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/320140/eventcomments/2152098843850721165?snr=1_2108_9__2107] демо [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198052373209', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1656595128}
review:
I love everything about this game, the setting, the music, the art style. Everything except the gameplay.
A shoddy physics engine that rolls the dice on whether your car drives normally or flips end over end, and a barebones career mode with none of the otherwise expected racing game features. 

There's no ghost cars, there's no previous attempt timer, there's no track map, there's really nothing besides driving from point A to point B and hoping to god that you qualify at the end of the attempt. The worst part is some of the maps take almost ten minutes to complete, so if you make a mistake and need to start over you're going to have to spend another ten minutes completing the track. On top of this because the timer is so rudimentary you have no way to know if you're making good time until the very end of the attempt.

The game is so interested in it's own aesthetic that it forgets it's supposed to be a video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299902175', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 38665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6298, 'playtime_at_review': 31492, 'last_played': 1712500929}
review:
Was für ein Überraschungstitel. Wer hätte gedacht dass 'Art of Rally' ein Rallyespiel wird welches so einfach aussieht, aber sich fast so schwer spielen lässt wie DIRT Rally? Und tatsächlich muss ich sagen, gefällt es mir sogar viel besser als DIRT Rally. Endlich mal wieder ein Titel der auch mit eigenen Elementen daher kommt. Gerade eben bspw. weil die Motorensounds nicht echt klingen, aber die Entwickler ihre eigenen Versionen draus gemacht haben, steckt wieder in diesen Spiel sehr viel Seele. Etwas was die meisten Spiele heute ja fehlt, da alle ja 1:1 alles real haben wollen.

Ich habe wie man in meinen anderen Rezensionen zu anderen Rallyespielen schon gelesen hat, früher alle Colin McRae Rally Spiee, sowie Rally Championship 2000 von Magnetic Fields und Richard Burns Rally, sowie die DIRT Rally Reihe gespielt. Ich kann sehr gut sagen, ob dieses Spiel was taugt oder nicht.

Das Konzept aus lustiger Comicgrafik, unlizensierter Rallyeautos - aber mit den echten Vorbildern, sowie coolen Fotomodus ist einfach nur sehr gelungen. Gerade eben weil es nicht brutal realistisch sein will, sondern auch den Eindruck einen gibt, ein Spiel zu sein, gefällt es mir sehr gut. Und trotzdem sieht man das man einen Lancia Delta fährt oder Toyota Celica.

Das Gameplay gefällt mir auch sehr gut, eben weil die Autos auch ein realistisches Fahrmodell haben, sich durchaus nachvollziehbar verhalten.

Hier mal alle Pros und Contras:

Pro:
+sämtliche legendäre Rallyeautos verfügbar von 1960er bis 2000er Jahre
+freie Fahrt Modus auf einen großen Straßennetz in meheren Ländern
+komplette Rallyemeisterschaft
+gute und realistische Steuerung - auch mit Tastatur sehr gut spielbar
+schöne Motorensounds
+hübsche und lustige Grafik
+Kameraperspektiven erinnern an Bleifuss Fun bzw. Ignition, lassen sich aber per Camera Mod verändern
+lustige Bonusfahrzeuge
+keine kostenpflichtigen DLCs!
+sehr schöner Kameramodus
+viele zuentdeckende Kurse und Aussichtspunkte

Contra:
-die Musik ist nicht wirklich mein Geschmack (kann aber ausgestellt werden)
-es gibt kein Toyota Corolla und Ford Focus
-keine Motorenhaubenansicht
-es nur die Möglichkeit die Autolackierungen über Racedepartment zu downloaden
-es gibt leider keine Kit-Cars bzw. F2 Autos der 1990er Jahre (Seat Ibiza, Renault Maxi Megané Peugeot 306, Skoda Felica, VW Golf GTI III, Citröen Saxo etc.)

Fazit:
Es ist mit Abstand das beste Rallyespiel der modernen Zeit. Aller Zeiten? Nein, dass sind für mich für alle Ewigkeiten die ersten beiden Colin McRae Rally Spiele von 1998 und 2000. Aber Art of Rallye ist defintiv das beste Rallyespiel der letzten 10 Jahre. Tut mir leid, aber die ganzen DiRT Rallye Spiele öden mich nur noch an.. Der Funfaktor und die originellen eignen Faktoren die dieses Spiel mit sich bringt sind für mich viel ansprechender.

in english:
What a surprise title. Who would have thought that 'Art of Rally' would be a rally game that looks so simple but is almost as difficult to play as DIRT Rally? And actually I have to say I like it even better than DIRT Rally. Finally a title that comes with its own elements. For example, because the engine sounds don't sound real, but the developers made their own versions of them, there is a lot of soul in this game. Something that most games are missing today, since everyone wants everything to be real 1:1.

As you have read in my other reviews of other rally games, I used to play all Colin McRae Rally games, as well as Rally Championship 2000 by Magnetic Fields and Richard Burns Rally, as well as the DIRT Rally series. I can say very well whether this game is good or not.

The concept of funny comic graphics, unlicensed rally cars - but with the real models and cool photo mode is just very successful. Precisely because it doesn't want to be brutally realistic, but also gives the impression of being a game, I like it very much. And yet you can see that you are driving a Lancia Delta or a Toyota Celica.

I also like the gameplay very much, precisely because the cars also have a realistic driving model and behave quite understandably.

Here are all the pros and cons:

Per:
+all legendary rally cars available from 1960s to 2000s
+free driving mode on a large road network in several countries
+complete rally championship
+good and realistic controls - also very playable with keyboard
+ nice engine sounds
+nice and fun graphics
+Camera perspectives are reminiscent of Bleifuss Fun or Ignition, but can be changed via Camera Mod
+fun bonus vehicles
+no paid DLCs!
+very nice camera mode
+Many courses and viewpoints to be discovered

Cons:
-the music is not really my taste (but can be exhibited)
-there is no Toyota Corolla and Ford Focus
-no hood view
-It is only possible to download the car liveries via Racedepartment
-Unfortunately there are no kit cars or F2 cars from the 1990s (Seat Ibiza, Renault Maxi Megané Peugeot 306, Skoda Felica, VW Golf GTI III, Citröen Saxo etc.)

Conclusion:
It is by far the best rally game of modern times. Any times? No, for me these are the first two Colin McRae Rally games from 1998 and 2000 for all eternity. But Art of Rallye is definitely the best rally game of the last 10 years. I'm sorry, but all the DiRT Rallye games just bore me.. The fun factor and the original own factors that this game brings with it are much more appealing to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561199127693895', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1694047754}
review:
art of rally no es precisamente un juego de carreras, aunque se puedan realizar en él. es éste un juego de conducción muy libre, que presenta una atmósfera de pequeñez y a la vez de transparencia inolvidable.
se lo recomiendo a todos aquellos que deseen un juego pacífico, que carezca de algún tipo de tensión, y que sea realmente bonito y simple. en cambio, para un jugador menos casual que desee un verdadero reto, si bien hay modos de juego para ese público, sería mejor opción jugar a otro título.

author: {'steamid': '76561199094368147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1708815676}
review:
Art of rally è un gioco di guida che nasconde molto più di qualche corsa.
Non è presente una vera e propria "storia", ma una modalità che segue gli anni di ogni categoria rally, e finendo ogni categoria sbloccheremo auto o verniciature. Ci si impiega all'incirca tra le 20 e le 15 ore per finirla, tempo che impiegheremo anche per migliorare le nostre abilità.
Finita la "storia", avremo tutte le auto e potremo sbizzarrirci nelle prove a tempo (già giocabili, ma consiglio prima di finire la campagna, in modo da aver preso le misure delle auto), o una cosa molto apprezzata nei vari open world delle mappe, molto grandi ed esplorabili fino al midollo, oltre ad una modalità foto apprezzata per il livello di filtri e personalizzazione della messa a fuoco. Apprezzate e divertenti le descrizioni sulle auto.
Musiche fantastiche, che vanno da eurobeat a anche tranquille colonne sonore da viaggio.
Parco auto buono, con verniciature anche ottenibili e creabili con mod.
Per caratteristiche tecniche, anche a modalità con grafica bassa il gioco è piacevole alla vista, grazie a numerose e personalizzabili impostazioni, ma comunque il gioco raramente tirerà scatti eccessivi.
In conclusione, per amanti di auto, o rally, o giochi di guida in generale, un gioco da avere.

review:
+ kivan näköinen peli
+ idea on hyvä
+ tietoruudut

- ajotuntuma kauhea
- ei konepelti-kuvakulmaa
- mittayksiköt pielessä
- ei ole hauska ollenkaan ajaa

10km stage, aikani 4min, eli keskinopeus pitäisi olla 150km/h jotta tuo aika onnistuisi, todellisuudesa ajan Meaniella 50-90 vauhtia, joten mistä helvetistä peli keksii nuo mittayksiköt?!

Ajotuntuma on perseestä. Jos kuivalla asfaltilla lähestyn 40 vauhtia neulansilmämutkaa, jonka kääntösäde on vähintään 3 auton mittaa, niin miksi en pysy tiellä? Miksi auto luistelee ulos? Voi perse millaisiin asioihin kusee muuten hyvä idea on kaunis grafiikka. 
EN TYKKÄÄ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093875416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1674911869}
review:
Simply blown away by the art of rally. Love the art style, the music and its game mechanics. It's easy to play but difficult to master; you will find yourself constantly sliding and fighting for control of the car.

If you have a passing interest in rally cars of the past or just looking for a fun racing game to play, the art of rally won't disappoint you. Highly recommended.

It's the zen from Absolute Drift combined with the focused adrenaline rush of your favorite time attack game. Runs well on pretty much anything. I have a Steam Deck, a base 14" M1 Macbook Pro, and a 3700x/3080 machine ultrawide, and thje experience is stable and enjoyable on all of them. author: {'steamid': '76561198003770847', 'num_games_owned': 10222, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1706046842}
review:
[i][url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/noPROblemscommunity]no.PROblems* [/url] presenta...[/i]

[h1]ART OF DRIFTING ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐[/h1] 
✅ Aspecto tecnico redondo
✅ Escenarios variados y con personalidad
✅ Ese "feeling" a la hora de conducir
❌ ¿Por 20 euros? Ninguno, la verdad.

Cuando un grupo de desarrollo tan pequeñito, tiene tan claro como hacer las cosas, y las lleva a cabo de manera tan sublime, es dificil hacer cualquier tipo de analisis sin ensalzar la maravilla de videojuego que tenemos enfrente.
Como amante del genero de la conduccion, he dado bandazos por todos los generos y estilos, probando simuladores, arcades puros y duros, pero he de confesarlo siempre acabe por la calle de en medio: los mal-avenidos sim-cade.

Este ART OF RALLY se encuentra englobado en este genero, siendo por momentos mas exigente que la saga DIRT, y por otros mas loco que FORZA HORIZON, sin tener que ver con ninguno de los dos, dandole personalidad a todo lo que hace, ha sabido recoger en un paquete, que en principio parece pequeño, lo mejor de todo lo aprendido por grandes sagas en los recientes años.

En el apartado tecnico, todo rinde a un nivel perfecto, redondeado hasta el extremo, acompañado por una banda sonora variada y que casa a las mil maravillas con el espiritu del juego. Las localizaciones, el colorido, hasta las fisicas de los choques o como el publico se aparta al pasar, todo tiene un como objetivo trasladarte y contarte la historia de los rallies. Creo que no existe un juego que haya contado la historia de las carreras, como lo hace este.

Pero vayamos al centro del espectaculo; el control, el conducir, el deslizarte por las sinuosas carreteras de todas las localizaciones que tiene el juego (cada cierto tiempo añaden nuevos escenarios). Estas carreteras forman parte de un escenario mayor, que incluso puedes perderte por el si quieres visitarlo, como si de ABSOLUTE DRIFT se tratara, colocandote misiones y objetos que debes descubrir. La diferencia entre las clases y vehiculos son evidentes a la hora de enfrentar las variadas curvas y pendientes de los que disponen estos escenarios, exigente como poco, te hara pagar caro los errores, pero la recompensa de los juegos de este tipo, ademas de la propio satisfaccion, es lo preciosista que es en el deslizamiento del coche. 
Todo esta hecho para dar espectaculo, pero ademas tiene la funcionalidad para que nada sea en vano. Un ejemplo son las marcas de los neumaticos al derrapar, calculadas al milimetro para que sepas cuando cambiar marcha o tienes algo de subviraje.

Aun no he entrado en el modo online, queda mucho por mejorar, pero tiene retos diarios y competiciones offline de mejora de tiempos a los rivales, por lo que el contenido, junto con su modo historia y desbloqueables, se antoja mas que suficiente.

Si eres un amante de los juegos de carrera y estas dispuesto a enfrentarte al reto, zambullete en la historia mejor contada de los rallies jamas programada.
[b]
💻 Funciona en aparatos con bateria

🎮 Pensado para partir mandos

🔵 Steam Deck Compatible
[/b]

Síguenos [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/2535301/]aquí[/url] y ayúdanos con nuestro mentor 🤟

author: {'steamid': '76561198088976205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1666436438}
review:
Theres something about this game that keeps my mind occupied, the games fun, the stages are difficult to master but great fun to learn. I hope the developer knows that theyve created a game that genuinely feels like a love letter. I've never been much into rally but this changed my mind (although the cars also did that a bit). Its definitely worth picking up if you like racing & especially if you love drifting or rally games. And the low poly art style seriously makes it a thing of beauty. 

My only hope is that this game gets good modding support & tools, because if we could add our own rally cars, or build our own racing locations? I think this game would literally make me never stop playing it and permanently replace a few of my other racing games. I've been dying for a racing game with its own track tools, and I seriously hope its this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025798175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1107, 'last_played': 1701993029}
review:
I really want to love this game, even bought the recent DLC, but some questionable design choices ruin it for me.

My biggest gripe is that the floaty handling that fails to become intuitive for me, it's like if the cars are filled with helium or something. Also the top down view is a bad choice for a rally game where precisely approaching jumps is key to avoid flying off track or spinning out after landing. That's just hard to do if the world looks kinda flat from above, or when you can not see where the road goes after the next crest. Of course this would be less of a concern if you had a co-driver telling you what's ahead, but there is none. Now a rewind feature could ease your frustration, but instead you get an aggressive automatic reset that triggers when you leave the track by like 5m, killing the flow and slapping you with a five second time penalty. You can not deactivate this, probably because it prevents you from cutting corners too much, but this could also be achieved with obstacles, like it actually is sometimes. But then again, obstacles and guardrails also kinda suck in this game, as they bounce your car off like bumpers in a pinball machine when you dare to brush against them.

All of this causes many annoying moments that severely dull my experience and make art of rally feel more like a gamble instead of a skill test.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985152127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1654046647}
review:
Almost perfect, except the career mode being a boring repetitive slog. Not enough variety for such an onslaught by the end of 3x5 or whatever that take what feels like half an hour of focus, especially when certain maps have a couple glaring visibility oversights (in Germany and Africa, 2 stages have truly blind corners with either a tree or a building in the way with no time to react because of it). You'll see each possible stage before even getting to group b, with conditions getting shittier and more unfun as you advance.

With the last group, modern traction control and abs do not appear to be modeled at all so you've got 800+hp cars hurling themselves off the stage with only a quarter throttle. Completely detached from the reality of modern rallying. Not to mention a damage system that seems entirely arbitrary when you get the chance to repair (why the hell is 'cleaning' one of the blocks?) where the *engine* took damage in a slight front end tap... in a mid-engine car.

Get it on sale, absolute barebones rallying, no rallycross, no co-pilot giving calls, no alternate modes that matter, what's there is not enough to carry it through the entire career mode. If anything, I suggest you just stop after finishing group b, the last two are purely for frustration and sweaty completionists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065893327', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1711245901}
review:
A wonderful stylized rally game, definitely recommended.

Don't go into this expecting a simulation, as it is not one. It is stylized from the art all the way to the controls and drifting physics and it does it so well. It takes some getting used to if you are coming from say Dirt rally series or something, but this game offers up lovely music, great art, wonderful driving feel, and something to relax and get good at. 

It is consistent as one would expect, has good controls for controller users with forgiving steering, but to address a falsehood... there is no delay in the steering, if you do have delay, fix your settings like vsync, triple buffering, and low latency.

Overall, one of the better stylized racing games ever made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975897155', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1653937520}
review: Driving physics feel really awkward. The brakes are too strong, it is hard to take corners smoothly and holding slides is difficult because the car just doesn't seem to handle like a rallycar at all. I've played several rallygames like Richard Burns Rally and loads of CMR and Dirt titles. The horrible steering doesn't help either. It feels inconsistent when sliding and is way too direct when you want to make slight adjustments on the straights. The Devs have no plans to add more steering settings options and advised in the discussion forums to refund the game if you don't like it. Which I'm doing now, unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038499939', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1653902707}
review:
[h1]7,4/10[/h1]
[h1]Искусство Ралли[/h1]
Минималистичная игра с хоть и не выдающейся, но хорошей приятной картинкой.
Это что-то типо чисто геймплейного хардкорного платформера, где вам надо прыгать чётко в тайминг, тут тоже самое, только от мира гонок, вы должны медитативно ехать, не особо разгоняясь, и поворачивать в идеальный спокойный тайминг, чтобы не улететь на обочину. Ну и максимальный минимализм) Вы даже своих соперников не видите, а зачем?) Машинки нормальные, разнообразие в локациях есть, только оптимизации на некоторых просто нету, что на dx11, что на 12, играешь с жуткими проседами фпс, что как-то мешает овладевать "искусством ралли". Музыка обычная, в ретро стиле.
В целом, я 2 часа кайфовал, сам от себя не ожидая, тут та самая формула - "просто, но залипательно", а потом уже стало сложновато.

[code]Подписывайтесь на Кураторство: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37365104/
Добавляйте меня в друзья, будем игры обсуждать :)       [/code]

[h1]DEVS: What with optimization in some locations?? GTX 1650, amd ryzen 5 1200, terrible lags on dx11 and 12. This makes it very difficult to enjoy the art of rally)

review:
为什么我会喜欢赛车
某些人认为这就是一堆富豪游戏罢了
还有某些人认为这就是一些纨绔子弟闲得慌来花钱找乐

赛车是极限驾驶的艺术
赛车是人类工业进步史
赛车是车辆新技术的试验场
赛车是在对绝对速度发起挑战
我热爱赛车
我喜欢他快
我喜欢那种征服赛道与赛车的快感
我喜欢那种一遍一遍的打破极限的荣誉感
我会跑到我再也跑不动的一天
我会怀抱我那种微不足道的荣誉离开

author: {'steamid': '76561197970371835', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1686313070}
review:
I waited way to long till I decided to buy this game since a lot of Indie Games turn out to be without much replay factor. Art of Rally however bundles up everyything I love about cars and racing.
Pros:
- The steering is intuitive (Keyboard, controller and wheel support)
- The amount of cars is immense and the game allows you to download original liveries that can easily be installed (drag& drop)
- Game focuses on the important stuff like the handling, sound and a very good learning curve
- Very clean UI
- Loads up in an instant
- Free Updates with new cars and courses. Where do you get that nowadays?
- Replayability is massive since there is always a second you can improve or test a car that you didn´t try the last time.

-Negatives:
- Although you can adjust the graphics settings I didn´t notice and performance boost
- Handling in rain can feel too over the top, especially when you use keyboard, but never unfair.
- Depending of graphics settings there can be massive FPS drops when a lot of couse assets come into view
- I wish the courses would play a bit more with varieties to the tracks like water ditches uneven surfaces etc.

Fazit: I really wish we will get more of these games from Funselektor. Maybe a Tourenwagen game that gives you the DTM championships of the German Tourenwagen with the Nordschleife and some cool 80´s racers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120682974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1653456402}
review:
TL:DR: Great aesthetics, decent soundtrack, good amount of content, terrible controls

I've been a lifelong fan of racing games (especially sims) and I have to say, this game feels worse than any other I've played. My biggest issue is the way the game handles vehicle weight and weight distribution. When going over a bump or crest, your vehicle feels weightless with how easily it becomes airborne. When steering side to side though, the vehicle's weight gets violently thrown around, which results in you being tugged from side to side way more than any car would in real life (you can even see this in action in their trailers). Speaking of steering, there's an awkward delay in the steering with every car (on controller anyway). On top of this, cars turn more sharply when going faster speeds which at least I never could get used to. Another thing that is just way too sensitive is the brakes. Even with ABS turned completely off, i'm able to slam on the brakes and instead of them locking like you would expect, I slow down from 60mph to 0mph in about 1 second. My point with all of this? ANy experience you have is not going to help you in this game because this game does not handle like any sim you're used to, like any arcade racer, or even any real life car. It handles like... well... it.

If you're looking for a racing game somewhere between sim and arcade, I'd recommend the Forza Horizon series, Dirt 3 or 4, or Initial Unity. Skip on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023616542', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2038, 'last_played': 1701064719}
review: Art of Rally is a racing game that explores rally's golden era with an unabashed fervor and tasteful minimalist (but not too much) graphical design. The game has such a passion for the sport and driving in general, that it resonates through the whole experience. Is there a plot? Not in a traditional sense. Every stage is a story, from popping your tire when you decided to cut on a hairpin or nailing that upcoming corner after hitting an incline flatout. A narrative isn't necessary, because the experience communicates to you what the era of driving is like, as you see the vehicle grow immensely in power, adapt all-wheel drivetrains, and feel in your own hands the exponential speed the technology was growing as you struggle to keep up with the extra power as many drivers at the time did, as it was at the end of the Group B era of fast but dangerous experimental race cars. It's perspective might not be standard, but is welcome in malaise of similar looking racing games, especially so since you will not be hearing from a co-driver. The cars are all here and you'll recognize them not just by how they look, but how they drive too, each feeling sublime in the hand but distinct as well. Evidently, the developers passion didn't end at just making the game itself as they continue to release updates since the games release. This is fantastic, especially considering the games relatively niche status. Don't let a $25 price tag scare you, it's completely worth asking price. It's the Alfa Romeo of racing games: not many people are going to own it, but it is nonetheless a treat for those who do and an absolute gem that bleeds passion. If Forza Horizon gets you down with shoddy online racing, if Need for Speed is too cheesy, if Assetto Corsa is too involved, if Wreckfest is too lacking in sportsmanship, and if Gran Turismo is too on Playstation, Art of Rally will be here to pick up the pieces, tell you everything is alright, and to focus on the one thing that matters: the drive. What beautiful drive it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561199158150101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1677580850}
review:
Я в восторге от этой игры. 
Во первых она оказалась неожиданно красивой,

author: {'steamid': '76561198158031367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1678488671}
review:
First of all, this game is beautiful. From the lighting to the simplified, stylized environments, it's never ending eye candy. The driving experience is incredible too. As someone who's fairly skilled at racing games, this one still has enough of a skill curve to keep me entertained for a long time. But somehow, it's still accessible to new people too. A friend of mine who doesn't play racing games was able to get the hang of it after only around 10 minutes.
I can't believe how much improvement has been made on this game over Absolute Drift, from the freeroam aspects to the events and incredible soundtrack. It's just fun, though there are a couple design decisions I would change. I kind of wish that different campaign events were locked to a certain set of tracks rather than being randomized, it would help me choose my car better. I also wish there were a way to listen to the unlockable songs from the main menu, and generally hoped there would be better rewards for the free-roam collectables. 
But in the end, this game gets all the basics right. Incredible driving physics, tons of unique feeling (and balanced!) cars to experiment with, and a stunning environment. Definitely worth the money

review: The game has a great art style and that is why most people bought it, i bought it for that and a challenging simcade, and boy did i get that, the game has amazing stages which seem realistic with a side of "hm i wonder if i can drift that 90 degrees" with nearly every corner. Originally i was skeptical of this game because i heard this runs on a tweaked version of the Absolute Drift engine, which i've played and not liked, but was pleasantly surprised to find it somehow makes a great rally engine?! That also explains why you can drift nearly everywhere, all in all, i've had the game for 2 days and i have 15 hours on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260401907', 'num_games_owned': 1964, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1650250555}
review:
[b]You were probably tempted by the beautiful minimalistic visuals of the trailer and you're thinking that it will be nice to drive inside this vivid world especially if the gameplay is good too. I had the same thoughts. Yeah, It can be fun enough when you get used of it but everything on this game feels generic and unfinished. Undesigned menus and HUD. Poor, repetitive, cliché level design using only few "representative" for each country models multiplied everywhere. Weird gameplay, even for an arcade, with too much drift and over the top slipperiness. Collisions and physics are jokes. Sounds are mediocre and there are some controversial decisions, like crowd's behavior. "Art of Rally" is an overpriced mobile game still on beta and isn't worth its price.


Manometer: 3/10[/b]


The good
- It has some artistic value visually. Nice, minimalistic graphics with vivid colors. Each level has its own chromatic identity. Lighting is good and atmospheric especially during the golden hours.
- Stages are usually narrow and It requires precision and soft use of the pedals in order to take steep turns properly so it can be extremely rewarding when you succeed it. Although physics are a bit problematic with too much drift, it can offer you some pleasant hours of gameplay.
- Good amount of cars and liveries. Cars' models are very nice. They have both minimalistic aesthetics and some nice details too. They're like miniatures.
- Cool music. It gives you some rhythm without getting tedious.
- Except of the career there are some more modes to play like time attack, custom race and free roam. Also there are daily and weekly events to compete against other players online.
- You can take some gorgeous screenshots using its built in, well implemented photo mode.

The bad
- I know this is not a sim but physics are problematic even for an arcade racing game. They wanted to make it more fun with a lot of drift but this ended up being over the top and weird. Everything is too slippery like driving on ice. The handbrake is a joke. Even at extremely low speeds it will turn your car 180 degrees (or more). Although you'll get used of the gameplay by the time, it just feels unrealistic.
- Collisions are tragically bad. Whether you hit on a light fence or a sheep(!) or even a huge rock or a tree it is always the same. They're all steady as hell and you will just get stuck behind them. There should be some differential between lighter and heavier objects.
- Levels' design is extremely poor. It feels cheap and generic. For each level they have designed six or seven models and then just multiplied them. After a few hours you have seen every asset of the game and it feels repetitive. This is not minimalistic design. It's more of boredom and lack of work and creativity. It looks like concept art for a future, unfinished product.
- The concept behind each stage's design is simplistic and silly like they were making some touristic card postal. They have designed some cliché assets that look like a representative sample of each country and multiplied them everywhere. Japan is full of pink trees, Kenya has everywhere zebras and antelopes, Finland has icebergs and Germany has tanks (lol!). Easily one of the most unimaginative level designs I've seen in a video game.
- The whole game from the menus to the HUD lacks graphical design and looks generic like they have used some default Unity engine's assets and fonts. It looks like it's still on beta.
- Cars' sounds are dull and not convincing at all. After a while they get tedious. Crashes' sound is the same no matter what's the object you hit on. Exhausts' sounds are a bad. You'll think that something broke somewhere inside your car.
- Career mode could have a sort of scenario or some special stages or at least some special objectives. It just forces you play all the game levels again and again with just different cars. I can do this at the time attack or custom race mode too. Also, the results after finishing your race seem to be generated based to your performance which is weird.
- A lot of frame drops and popping up objects. Unacceptable for a game with this level of graphics running on a high-end pc with an rtx graphics card.
- Crowd's behavior makes no sense and it's not funny at all. People are getting inside the road to only step aside just before you hit them. It's a random mechanic like those in old flash games. On top that with the crowd inside the stage you cannot see road's boundaries or some obstacles (like rocks or fences) with a result of crashing on them.
- A lot of tall objects near the road (like trees and buildings) are momentarily hiding the road ahead. Although you still see your car, it can be very distractive and annoying.
- It's too punishing for no obvious reason. If you step outside of the road even for a few meters it resets you and gives you a 5 seconds penalty. If I'm not stuck, let me do it by myself please.
- I wanted an in-game map or on screen navigational instructions about at least the next turn. There's a reason that a copilot instructs the drivers at WRC.
- It's too pricey. It looks like a cheap mobile or unfinished game. Most mobile games like this are free or cost no more than 2-3 euros.

review: Art of Rally walks a good balance between sim racing and arcade racing. The game isn't easy, it'll kick your teeth in if you try to play it full on the throttle and you have to learn braking and gearing if you want to get through the courses at a decent time. Its hard to wrap your head around at first but once it clicks, the game becomes very rewarding and satisfying as you combo turns together into one fluid motion. I keep coming back to this game time and time again and would definitely support the developers in any way i could.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973490601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 18144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13751, 'last_played': 1669522767}
review:
This game is easily my favourite single player racing game and has been for about 3 years or so. I love physics based racing games with good drift mechanics and satisfying manual gear mechanics. I played in automatic initially but after playing for so long I wanted to add some difficulty. I am gonna break down my points in a bit of a section style starting with visuals:

Visually really beautiful, especially if you like games that have retro inspired graphics but without any limitations to lighting and with lots of added variation. It has great weather and time of day represented through the sun position, really pretty sunsets and sun rises, rain effects and snow. Also night racing which is pretty sketchy too and adds a bit of difficulty. With lots of nice detail and clutter around the tracks to make it feel lived in and interesting to explore even though you are usually passing through too quick to notice.

Mechanically really enjoy the feel of the driving, especially in manual which gives a lot more control in drifts in this game, every car has super unique handling, different styles of driving suited better for different tracks or weather conditions.
Really tough to anticipate though as it is pretty random what the weather is like (which adds to realism for me), and the set pieces that make up the track each time is randomised which I really appreciate. Others might want to be able to prepare but having that random unpredictability is what has kept me coming back to this game for multiple years. Feels a lot less repetitive this way. Extra challenge in the difficulty levels of the AI in career and in the damage sustained from your mistakes and accidents are really nice ways to increase difficulty without just making weather and track conditions just being arbitrarily harsher.

I really appreciate the attention to detail with concern to the damage the car sustains. from the gearbox to cleaning the mud off, when your repair comes in a long season on career mode, you feel the relief. Very well designed and very carefully balanced. There  are other game modes that I haven't really explored yet as I am still in the process of completing all career seasons and getting 1st with highest difficulty and most realistic damage with manual gears. So there is plenty of gameplay to get out of this game for the price I think definitely worth it.

They have clearly put an insane amount of effort into the control and feel of each car as well, I cant stress that enough.

It has the right atmosphere for me. And I enjoy the super hard core racing mechanics and punishment for mistakes whilst having a more arcade like camera view and graphical style. Definitely captures a bit of a minimalist feel, similar to Lonely Mountain Downhill which is also an awesome game.

I would say it takes quite a great deal to damage a wheel and affect your turning from doing so, this is probably unrealistic but also increases quality of life in game play. In a game like wreckfest where realistic damage is on and one wheel is damaged, it does mean you will almost 100 percent of the time have to restart instantly so I actually kind of prefer this way although initially I found it to be too weak.

Im pretty sure these devs have been consistently updating this for the entire time I have owned the game. They have been working on the set pieces and increasing the amount of variety in the generation of courses.

Really love this game. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058358115', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1709058436}
review:
This game is fun! It has a difficult learning curve, but in my opinion it's worth it anyways.

The stage and environment selections are quite good for the genre, but where Art of Rally *shines* is its car roster. Every historical rally car you could want is here, including ones that never saw production, or ones that were only used sparingly. They all feel unique to drive, and you'll quickly find your favorites among the huge roster if you experiment.

The physics feel *amazing*, drifting is an absolute dream, and going sideways is both fun and almost always optimal. RWD feels absolutely wonderful here, and while certainly harder to drive than AWD or the rare FWD, they're definitely worth learning. You'll find yourself sliding around like a pro after your first few hours, and enjoying the hell out of it all the while.

But for those first few hours, the game is quite challenging. Learning the limits of the game and how to tell your speed from the unusual camera angle is no easy task, and the game's default assist settings don't help either. This is a lovely game, so if you want to get into it, here's my advice:
1: Turn off stability assist as soon as you can. You want to be drifting, and this assist prevents you from doing so. If you're having trouble keeping your car from spinning out, turning up the counter steer factor is a much less intrusive and more useful way to help yourself out on those tough corners.
2: Brake more and earlier than you think you need to. Whether going over jumps or heading into a corner, just apply a *bit* more braking than you think is necessary. Being a bit slow into a corner or not getting huge air might feel awkward, but it's a surefire way to stop the much more embarrassing feeling of flying off into a tree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198454263419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1675429562}
review: Добротная, красивая игра про ралли, где вы найдёте практически все легенды мирового ралли "золотой" эпохи и эпохи 90-х (жаль, что модели не лицензированы и давно знакомые силуэты скрываются за невнятными названиями). Графика весьма симпатична, хотя и неожиданно требовательна (у меня на 1660 есть подтормаживания на не самых высоких настройках). Немного задротское управление на клавиатуре, но можно привыкнуть. На гейм-паде управление куда более удобное, но просто не будет - создатели игры постарались, чтобы рулить было трудно и увлекательно. Есть возможность ставить моды на оформление машины (так я превратил безликую t22 в боевую LADA EVA Стасиса Брундзы!). В целом приятный таймкилер с симпатичной графикой и синт-вэйв саундтреком. Можно брать!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049068041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1699686632}
review:
art of rally is a driving game unlike any other. To begin with, the OST for the game is INCREDIBLE. I believe that almost every song is original to the game and all of them SLAP. The graphics are simple yet inspired - despite the relatively low-poly look of the game, because of the way that lighting is implemented, performance was not fantastic, certainly something to think about if you are looking at this game because you think it looks easy to run on your crappy PC. 

At its heart, art of rally is based around the idea of creating an incredibly tight, easy to learn, difficult to master driving mechanic. Learning where your skill and the grip of your tires meets is the central goal of art of rally - its not about the graphics or the awesome music, its about the best driving model you will play with outside of Forza or NFS. You constantly feel like you are fighting these historically-inspired rally beasts as you try your best to not spin-out in the corners or blast off the track. The more you play, the better you get at cornering and braking and recovering from mistakes. The first time you successfully drift around a corner without completing pulling the brake or stopping the gas will be when the game suddenly "clicks" for you. 

All together, art of rally packages cute graphics, an incredible OST, and an enjoyable driving model all into a decidedly pretentious, artsy package that somehow makes the whole thing that much better. If you like racing games, this should be an easy pick-up for you. Forget spinning a wheel for a free car or trying to outrace the cops, this is the game to play if you want the only challenge to be keeping your car on the road!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110358927', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1692, 'last_played': 1647997653}
review:
Alıştığımız ralli yarış tarzına az da farklı bir bakış getiren bir oyun. 

Büyük bütçeli oyunları oynadınız birde orta bütçeli veya aşağısı oyun oynayayım diyorsanız tavsiye ediyorum. Oyunu kuş bakışı bakış açısıyla  oynuyoruz. Bir çok ülkeye ait araba çeşiti bulunmakta. Kariyer modu, özgür modu, online event ve istediğiniz haritada yarış yapabileceğiniz oyun tarzı bulunmakta. Japonya, Kenya, Almanya, Norveç, Finlandiya, İtalya gibi ülkelerde yarıştığımız haritalar mevcut ama bu haritalar arasında dış görsellik dışında pekte fark yok. Oyuna başlamadan önce ayar değiştire biliyorsunuz.  Yarış zorluğu, AI seviyesi, araç hasar seviyesi vs gibi.
Kariyer modu grup yarışlarına bölünmüş ve yarışları tamamlayınca yeni araçlar açılıyor. Açıkçası kariyer modu gereksiz uzatılmış. Aynı haritalarda birçok kez yarışıyoruz. Son iki grup gereksizdi bence.

28 saat te oyunu %100 başarım ile tamamladım. Daha önce Xbox'ta bitirmiştim. Steam de bitirmekte eğlenceli oldu. Xbox Game Pass sisteminde oyun mevcut. Steam versiyonunu indirimde almanızı öneririm. 
  Iyi oyunlar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981203183', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1675468065}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162802897', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6988, 'last_played': 1699781616}
review:
Great Aesthetic
Great Soundtrack
Great Car Selection
Great Track Variety
Great RWD Physics

Overall a great game to zone out to once you get into a groove.
I do find AWD cars to have an unrealistic correction force that makes it hard to maintain a 4 wheel drift unless you constantly steer in. 

Game is best played with all assists off.

Note: Received game for free due to helping provide feedback during the closed alpha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198976414880', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1703362955}
review:
This game im on the fence about recommending.
Ive played the demo and took me a while to get the full version.

Game is kinda fun, but imo it gets very repetitive after not so much time. Other than the palettes, all the stages feel pretty much the same. And handling takes a while to get used to.. meaning you will probably start to get bored before you get any good.
Also, maybe its my system (rtx2070+10700k), but performance is quite crappy for such simple graphics.

I personally think this game is a bit overpriced.. if i could go back in time i would probably wait even more for at least a 50%-70% off sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198064983667', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2830, 'last_played': 1710885589}
review:
i'm redoing my original review of this game.

This game has easily become my go-to driving game and titled as my pleasure game, plug in your controller of choice and strap in for a "few" hours of pure driving pleasure.

The music alone has me hooked outside of the game and it has that feeling of not getting tired of it, although i suspect it will one day but i'll have more than enough memories to cherish both in-game and when i drive my daily car which will always put a smile on my face.

Gameplay wise, i have finished the Career mode but thanks to the synergy of the soundtrack of the music (obviously) car sounds, enviromental sounds goes almost criminally well together.

i'll assure that you're gonna have a good time as well if you're able to look past the simplistic looking textures in this game.
100/100 score

review: I don't usually play racing games but this one I like, it's something special. You will learn about the history of Rally cars and championships with nice artwork and cool music, awesome! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198342861890', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1712297536}
review: Una muy buena compra y un divertido juego para mi. Con graficos "minimalistas" pero con un muy lindo aspecto. Su manejo es arcade y simulador, y no es el simple juego de autitos, se debe maniobrar bien y ademas cada tipo de auto segun su categoria tiene un diferente manejo segun su traccion y potencia. Tiene modo un jugador para las etapas que tu quieras y un modo trayectoria que te hara correr con todos los autos clasicos del rally, desde los inicios de los rally hasta los 2000s. Por otra parte el modo online consiste en un evento diario y semanal, para ver quien hace el mejor tiempo entre todos lo jugadores. Si te gusta correr etapas para hacer los mejores tiempos en los tramos y poder superarte o solo por correr y ver que tal, juega art of rally

author: {'steamid': '76561198334260280', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1711698374}

review: I would not suggest the Art of rally for people looking to play a racing game because the controls are very annoying, the view is way too far away, and you can barely drift or do any cool stunts. author: {'steamid': '76561198050756460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 29, 'playtime_at_review': 3012, 'last_played': 1711572817}
review:
Un style graphique simple et efficace.
Une bande son qui donne envie d'écraser l'accélérateur.
Un pilotage qui fait mouche, on prend plaisir à conduire propre pour battre tous les records ou alors à la jouer avec style en tapant des gros drifts à tous les virages, et parfois un peu des deux.

Le mode carrière se finit rapidement mais les leaderboards sur chaque tracé boostent la durée de vie du jeu pour quiconque veut se mesurer aux autres.

Un jeu à avoir dans sa bibliothèque pour tous les amateurs de courses auto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145393927', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1712315089}
review: Staple of arcade racing games, it absolutely blows my mind that a Unity game like this put's Forza Horizon's physics and handling to SHAME given how much more realism-based the FH series claims to be. The camera, despite being what sets the game apart from the rest of it's competition is the main limiting factor holding it back from surpassing it's competition. I would love to see a sequel with a traditional chase camera, even if it's just an option. Can't recommend this more to anyone with an interest in racing or motorsport, even if you aren't into rally itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965401568', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1645151730}
review:
나오자마자 샀는데 다시 해보려고 하니까 엄두가 나지 않음
장점
1. 아주 아름답고 예쁜 그래픽
2. 한계를 넘나드는 인간과 기계의 몰아일체 '랠리'를 쉽고 간결하게 표현함
3. 랠리 레이드를 쿼터뷰로 표현함. 의외의 접근방식으로 나온 게임

단점
1. 키보드, 휠, 패드 그 어떤 입력기기조차도 녹아들지 못 하는 기괴한 조작감이 일품. 죽었다 깨어나도 개선해줄 생각이 없어보이는 조작감임

author: {'steamid': '76561198069544201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2297, 'last_played': 1694639039}
review: Fun from beginning to end. Easy to play, hard to master. When you start, you're a poor driver, and the cars are less responsive. As you improve, so do the cars. By the time you're driving Class S, you have developed the confidence to drift at will, and the wisdom to know when slow is fast. Take your time and enjoy improving your driving! Every car feels different, and every course has its own flavor. Experiment. Tweak the assists to your liking. Take in the cheers of the spectators!

author: {'steamid': '76561198353014882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1645441508}
review:
(hours are wrong)

Fantastic game. Great art style, better soundtrack. Physics are passable, if you can get your settings right. Good car selection. This game is a must buy if you see it on sale, a maybe buy if you really, REALLY like rally.

The only negative thing I have to say about this game is that there isn't a camera option that's as zoomed in as I'd like it to be. The default setting or "camera 1" is far away, and the other options are even farther. I turned my FOV all the way down almost immediately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437746147', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1700892963}
review: 美术风格清新的拉力游戏，车多边形数量不多却很有神韵，风景更是一绝。操控部分难度并不小，刚上手时一个弯都过不好。但在控制速度后慢慢找到了手感，再逐步提速逼近极限。10小时，玩了3个阶段的生涯模式，解锁了两个自由探索地图，初步上手。一次次调整走线、提高过弯速度、优化刹车时机，和自己较量，颇有些禅意。

author: {'steamid': '76561198234109108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1709243695}
review:
What I like: Challenging game, beautiful visuals, and that sense of proudness when you do that turn just right. Well maintained, with ocasional content added. You can play it surprinsingly decently with a keyboard. Great for long sessions as well as short ones for when you need a break, it sometimes can be difficult to drop the controller and stop playing.

What I don't like: it's more graphically demanding than it seems (although it can be played with low settings relatively well). Camera mode has a lot of collissions that make it cumbersome. Not directly compatible with a wheel (I think it can be made to). I'd love an in-game livery editor (can make liveries outside of the game, and it's the kind of thing I'd expect these devs to add tbh)

author: {'steamid': '76561198201843680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1633500968}
review:
모바일게임을 연상시키는 가벼운 조작감의 랠리틱한 레이싱게임
간단한 그래픽과 가볍고 단순한 조작으로 편하게 즐길수 있는 게임이지만 더트랠리, WRC, RBR/NGP 같은 페이스노트가 없어 직접 눈으로 보고 달려야한다
1인칭 뷰를 지원하지만 페이스노트가 없어 앞을 모르기에 코너에 처박히는일이 다반수라 3인칭 드론뷰를 강제한다
천천히 달리며 현실에서 직접 페이스노트를 작성해 보면서 달리면 해결되는 문제이지만 랠리게임에 페이스노트를 작성하거나 기본적으로 주어지는 페이스노트가 아예 없다는점이 엄청난 마이너스
멀티플레이또한 지원하지 않아 의미없이 주구장창 맵 돌아다니기와 앞을 모르는 트랙들을 손수 페이스노트를 적어가며 속도를 단축하며 자기만족 하는게 게임의 목표
1만원 이하면 살만하다

author: {'steamid': '76561199229822782', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1693220769}
review: Relaxing and casual driving game that has beautiful minimalist design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970541037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1709895554}
review: Charmingly minimalist yet effective design from menus to ingame graphics. Amazing handling and tracks that are a lot of fun with plenty of variety. All the cars from different era's are represented here, with their appropriate handling characteristics.  And while the actual branding is nowhere to be found, the descriptions of the cars themselves more than make up for it. A true indie gem that has kept me glued to my screen for many hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993690896', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1666382149}
review:
I'm fed up of trying to solve the stutter issues. Other than that the game is amazing, would be a game of the year for me. The driving model is fun and addicting, I want to play this more, but the stutter issues ruin this.
I recently reinstalled this to see if things got better, but no, still the same issues I had before. The game came out more than a year ago and at this point I'm just done with it, which makes me very sad, because this would be one of the best games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210982451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2137, 'last_played': 1672598654}
review:
[h1] доедаем? [/h1]

Первые часов 10 я реально был готов рекомендовать эту игру всем и каждому кто угарает по ралли гоночкам. У игры отличная задумка - избавиться от отвлекающих визуалов и оставить только саму суть ралли, а именно быстро и красиво делать [i] ЗЗУЗУЗЗУУУУУУУУУУМ [/i] по разным дорогам разных ебеней на всеми любимых бибиках(у игры очень большой автопарк и все машинки ведут себя по-разному, за это очень большой респект). Даже присобачили онлайн соревнования ежедневные и еженедельные на которые дается одна попытка а потом твой результат висит в таблице лидеров. Прикольно. Кайфово.
И, по началу кажется, что у игры всё очень даже получается, но чем серьёзней ты воспринимаешь её, тем больше критических недостатков всплывает на поверхность.

[h1] Дед доест но точно не я? [/h1]

Теперь перейдём к той хуйне которая просто вымораживает.
1) При пролагиваниях игра ведет себя очень тупо. Например, поворачивая в момент пролагивания игра меняет положение машины но не меняет направление ускорения. Т.е ты не по инерции вылетаешь уже а как будто бы всё это время ехал тупо вперед.
[b] если не настроить графику чтобы всё стабильно работало, ваши потуги кататься на машинке умрут обоссавшись и обосравшись [/b]

2) Трение и сила тяжести работают очень странно. Спокойно можно ехать на скорости 15 км/ч, проехать одним колесом по кочке и авто уже летит делать тройное сальто и ты плачешь потому что проебал время ведь кочке тотально на тебя похуй она твой болид массой в тонну может шатать как ей захочется. 
Трение о заборы это тоже легендарная хуйня. Во всех других гонках трение о забор не вызывает проблем, он тебя тормозит, ты о него трешься но всё равно едешь. Здесь же заборчик только коснувшись тебя тормозит машинку с 200 до нуля МОМЕНТАЛЬНО. Ему похуй. Просто. Похуй. Столкнувшись с забором на максимальной степени повреждений он не только лишит тебя всей скорости, но еще может поджечь твой двигатель. Почему? Потому что ему похуй. Просто. Похуй. Так же потому что столкновения с объектами работают очень тупо и непредсказуемо.

3) [b] Дождь сосать [/b]
 А теперь та хуйня из-за которой просто хочется всё удалить. Дождь. Дождь на трассах сделан абсолютно халтурно, это просто так называемое "мыло" из-за которого машинка скользит при любом повороте. Бред, при чём очень конченный. Каждый раз когда попадается трасса с дождём ты думаешь: "Озон терпел и нам велел" и сквозь скрипящие зубы проходишь это говно. 
И ты, читатель, разумно предположишь что только Я сосу бибу на дождливых трассах, Я просто [i] ебучий казуал [/i], но к сожалению, всё не так просто. Обычно, проходя трассы я занимаю топ 500-400 мира. Это неплохо, хороший результат. Но когда я иду на дождливую трассу, то занимаю топ 50-40, а это уже тревожый звоночек. Мне кажется, что никто не понимает как играть на дождливых трассах, потому что это тупо рандом, а не какой-то дар занимать топ 50 мира на АБСОЛЮТНО КАЖДОЙ трассе на которой есть 
е-бу-чий 

ДОЖДЬ.

4) Погодные условия одинаковые на всех трассах и абсолютно равномерные. Как в анекдоте, но тут грязь она и в Африке и в Финляндии и Германии она абсолютно одинаковая. Уникальных климатических условий, присущих каждой стране, тут нет. Если написано, что гравий, то это будет абсолютно равномерный и сухой гравий без единого дефекта. Никакой тебе лужи посредине трассы, потому что лужи бывают только в дождь. А что мы говорим дождю? [spoiler] см. пункт 3) [/spoiler] 
Но, честно говоря, это уже не такая критическая претензия как всё другое вышесказанное. Ну одинаково и одинаково, чё бухтеть-то? 

[h1] Так всё-таки доем? [/h1]

Так что делать? Думаю, требовать от челов вторую часть, где они делают первым делом нормальную физику. Пренебрегая полигонами действительно можно было бы сделать физику в игре гораздо приличней чем она есть на нынешнем уровне. У игры уже есть отличный автопарк, поэтому тут претензий нет. Разнообразить трассы уникальными сегментами типа луж или более сыпучего гравия итд. 
Получится отличный прикольчик который я бы купил. 

Если ты просто хочешь под пивом погонять на машинках, то действительно можно доесть на скидоне, это будет даже не постыдно, очень даже.

Но если же ты average rally enjoyer и как бы себя ты уважаешь, в необкашлянные вопросики не лезешь, либо жди вторую часть AoR, либо бери Dirt Rally 2 паскидону за 200 рубасиков и не лебези. Да, там есть свои проблемы, но там есть хорошая физика.

Рекомендую, но только на полшишечки. Не более.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133495934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1644157381}
review:
Só joguei o mundo aberto e uma fase, mas já deu pra sentir algumas coisas.

A ambientação e o cuidado com os detalhes é bem alta, o jogo tem uma quantidade grande de conteúdo e só ficaria melhor se fosse licenciado. Ainda assim, muito interessante, muitas referências aos carros reais, sem disfarçar. Visualmente o jogo é bem interessante, mas uma GTX 1660 não sustentou o ultra com a estabilidade que eu esperava. Ainda assim, tive uma boa experiência. A física do jogo é bem interessante, não é só sair acelerando e pronto. Certamente dá pra perder algumas horas aqui.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125112267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1645628601}
review:
This game has a few critical problems that made me regret my earlier positive review.

>There is an enormous control delay, like I had never seen on a racing game before. It makes the controls intentionally artificially difficult. It can be very frustrating. It forces you to anticipate your every move on a very bad way. It feels like your controls are lagging badly as if there was something really wrong with your controller.

>When using a controller, the controls are really unpredictable. Sometimes big clicks to turn don't do nothing, sometimes little clicks put you sideways in the trees. There is a problem there, and it makes it incredibly artificially difficult to keep the car on the track, specially on fast sections.

>Car recovery when out of bounds (5sec penalty routine) are way too unpredictable. Sometimes you cut a corner by going beyond the tree lines, as seen on world record replays, and nothing happens, sometimes a little touch on the grass and its reset with +5s penalty. Its as if this game penalise honesty and prizes cheaters. Since there is no indication whatsoever of where the boundaries between valid track and 5sec penalties are, instead of driving well to be fast, you're looking for places where you can abusively cut corners without been penalised; penalised not by a natural feature, but by an artificial invisible boundary. Its not consistent and it's not fair.

>There is also no mini-map or pace-notes and often the ground ahead is covered by a hill or tree line; a tree line well placed so you can't see the blind corner behind; just like a trap. This means that to drive fast, you need to grind and try the same track several times in order to learn where the artificial traps that are covered by the terrain are.

>Cheating. Career AI times are adjusted automatically to an average of the "multiplayer" leaderboard. For a stage like group-b noormarku morning, which is not a fast stage, the average speed of the #1 of the current leaderboard is 172km/h AVERAGE! HOW CAN THIS BE POSSIBLE? And worse, this affects directly my career AI. FIX the damned cheater FFS!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961284152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1643482052}
review:
Sehr nettes Game, aber nicht unbedingt Arcade! Es handelt sich um eine einfacheres Sim.Racing. Dabei finde ich die "überraschenden" Umgebungseffekte bzw. deren Pysik echt gelungen .. wie Auswirkung von hängenden Kurfen oder unebenen Straßen, Kuppeln mit anschliessenden Fahrbahnschrägen ... auch Schotter, Asphalt oder Schnee spiegeln bedürfen ein differentes Fahrzeughandling! 

Ist auf jeden Fall den Preis wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015470775', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1658862243}
review:
I usually drive sims. iRacing, Dirt 2.0, and WRC, but this is the perfect game for when I just want some casual fun. The style is wonderful, but it's the nuanced gameplay that keeps me coming back. It's demanding of your attention without being too punishing.

I would like to see more unique stages, detailed textures, and a variety of mini-games for unlockable skins, just to shake things up a little.

All in all, AOR is a 10/10. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408892566', 'num_games_owned': 2279, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1644118495}
review:
Como entusiasta de los juegos de Rally debo admitir que este juego resulto ser una grata sorpresa, cuenta con una historia sencilla, un estilo de arte old school que atrae desde el primer momento, es desafiante pero con un nivel de dificultad adecuado, muchos coches iconicos y un modo foto sublime.
Un "must have" para los amantes del Rally.

Recomendado como Simulador? Sí.
Recomendado como Arcade? Sí, pero recuerda frenar.
Recomiendo comprarlo? Sí, definitivamente.

Gráficos: 10/10
Física: 10/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Music: 11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089392098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 6983, 'last_played': 1712156107}
review: A true homage to the sport. Such a fun game to play in and of itself, but also great to play in the background. Enough content that it really doesn't get boring quickly, even though it's such a simple idea. Controls are simple and really easy to pick up, but there's so much room for perfection if you want the best times. Plenty of variety in cars, inside jokes about drivers and points in history, and beautiful, plentiful maps to drive on. If you love rally, you'll love this game even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013394103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1668, 'last_played': 1706914522}
review: This game is an experience different from Dirt Rally. Both are great games, but most days I'm going to be more in the mood for what Art of Rally delivers, with no co-driver and a camera that gives you a view of what road lies ahead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318031481', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1656356495}
review: This game is a masterpiece. Its an almost perfect rally game. the art style, the variety and feel of the cars, the sounds and music, its all amazing. I was a little afraid this game would be really hard to pick up after hearing others saying it had "simulator-like" handling. After coming from dirt rally 2 and wanting something a little less difficult than that, this game is right in the middle between simulator and arcade handling. The selection and variety between cars is one of the best. 10/10 best rally game. I can't wait for them to release more new content for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834277257', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1679086735}
review:
中文的在后面Hxdm
Please Pardon my English It is not my first language
结论：电脑配置好或者真的很喜欢这个风格的话可以买
Conclusion: Buy it if you have a really good gaming PC or really like this genre
Art of Rally is no doubt an amazing game. It is one of the best racing games for me. You get to drive some really niche rally cars, and the synthwave music is also great. It takes some time to master, but once you do, it's really rewarding. It tries to create a retro rally theme and does it really well with the crowd and the overall art style. The long rally stages in the later game are kinda boring but still fun if you are patient enough.
Yet I almost want to vote not to recommend this game. Because the optimization is shit. I play this game on my laptop with 2060 and an i7. I can play RDR2, death stranding, and 2077 with no problem. BUT NOT THIS LOW-POLY GAME. I get that the devs are indie and probably don't have a lot of resources to do optimization, but this is just too bad. After one hour or so on medium graphics the game starts to drop frame rate and becomes laggy. The game becomes unplayable when you reach two hours. Oh yeah, if you want to quit the game, it takes about five minutes. AND SOMEHOW IT ONLY USES ABOUT 10% OF THE CPU. This game is supposed to be a slow-paced game that builds up your experience. but the lag ruins it. Plz fix this 
中文
AoR的美术，音乐和车单都非常nb 整体营造的那种复古拉力的氛围我超级喜欢 平常开的时候路边还有观众 见到你会往后躲 后期游戏可能会有点烦 车辆手感需要一段时间去适应 但是都挺好开的（除了B组那几辆后驱orz）
但！是！这游戏优化也太烂了罢！ 我用的是我的笔记本玩的 2060和i7 平常打个2077 死亡搁浅都没啥问题 但是这个lowpoly的逼玩意儿竟然能这么卡 这游戏打个一小时就nm开始卡顿了 还是中画质 大概打两个小时就卡的不能玩了 退个游戏要花五分钟 而且CPU貌似只用了10% 这游戏本身就挺慢节奏的 被这么一整 基本上没什么心情玩了
电脑配置好或者真的很喜欢这个风格的话可以买
