author: {'steamid': '76561198269468076', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1643766623}
review:
Overall I'm kind of on the fence with this. It just depends on what you want out of a racing game, and for me a lot of that boils down to consistent physics. They're good, but also pretty flawed.

As others have stated, this has some great physics traits of a racing sim, but some others that contradict it in ways which don't make sense. It can be frustrating for anyone used to racing sims, as it's inconsistent. That's about its only major pitfall but its enough to put me off. 
Otherwise its a beautiful game with an amazing car list, and expansive detailed rally locations. If you like challenging arcade racers, or are just a rally fan,  then you'll probably enjoy it a lot. 

The bad:
-It has one of the WORST steering delays I've experienced in any racing game, regardless of how fast the car is moving. Very unrealistic choice there. Raising the steering sensitivity doesn't really help either. 
-Counter-steering is pretty inconsistent, sometimes it just doesn't react, almost as if the tires are locked up but you're not even braking. 
-Its also much better with the assists turned off, like the strange counter-steer-multiplier. That assist, paired with the steering delay makes for some infinite fish-tailing from over correction. 
-Has this weird forced over-steer tendency with most MR/RR vehicles, but its only really like that when you're accelerating. It should only behave like that when you hit the brakes in a corner (i.e. lift off over-steer). Gently accelerating in a slide should give your back wheels a bit more grip via weight shift, not significantly less. It makes said MR cars act like FR drift machines. 
-It really seems like the assists don't actually switch off in group 4, and it feels wildly different compared to both group 3 and group B (when comparing FR cars for consistency). I might be imagining things or it may be a bug, but group 4 feels like the other two but with the assists maxed out, not sure why. Just a hunch.
-The vegetation cut-out is useful but flawed, it just gives you tunnel vision on the top of your car, but nothing ahead of it. This especially affects camera #1. 
-Brushing against some guardrails will literally stop your car and/or spin it, instead of just slow you down like usual.

The good:
-Great car list! Many famous rally cars from different classes, including some experimental ones that sadly never got to race. Would love to see a couple of my favorites though, like the infamous Celica GT4 st205, and the '87 Silvia 200sx/s12 seV6. 
-Beautiful locations, and expansive free-roam maps as well that are excellent to drive around in. They're pretty detailed and the scenery does not disappoint. The mountain roads in Japan are great, and I love the addition of the muddy river in the Sahara. 
-A banger of a soundtrack in my opinion. Synthwave (w/ a bit of Eurobeat) makes for some fantastic driving music.
-For racing games, both this and especially Absolute Drift, have a nice relaxing vibe to them that's pretty unique. 
-You don't have to compete in the career mode in order to wander around the free-roam maps, and some vehicles from every class are unlocked from the start. 
-The ability on PC to add custom livery mods is a plus if you're into that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351517812', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1631453514}
review:
looks great, has all the greats of rally, even has a running in the 90s parody as one of the songs, i love everything about this game...

apart from the fact that it's a game, i really don't recommend buying the game if you like driving cars, it's like it wants to be a simulator, but also won't do any of the things needed to make it controllable (mainly the terrible camera angle, lack of weight to the cars and the requirement for fine yet quick inputs that aren't consistently produceable on most hardware)

the best advice you can get is to drive like a grandma and avoid pushing the limits, literally the opposite of everything that defines rally.

author: {'steamid': '76561199094153780', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1664281904}
review:
overall a very nice and well put together game. The art style is incredible  and the amount of details they have included to the cars is jaw dropping. though it took me nearly 2 and a half hours to get the hang of the driving mechanics, don't let that stop you from getting Art of Rally. 

both the free roam mode and career mode are great though it can feel repetitive after awhile. I recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a racing game and wants something deviates from the norm. 

Overall I rate this game 8.5/10

review: Ich habe mich offenbar auch vom guten Marketing und Pseudo-Minimalismus blenden lassen, um mir diese Beta zu kaufen. Ein gelungenes und eigenwilliges Konzept, das jedoch leider schnell langweilt oder sogar nervt. Die Performance ist – auf meinem System – konsequenterweise auch retro. Schade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015233312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1712493993}
review: Ich spiele seit Januar 2018 nur noch VR Titel. Was "art of rally" hier abliefert, hat mich allerdings wieder vor den Monitor gebracht. Mit hoher Wahrscheinlichkeit nur für dieses eine Spiel, aber hier hat der Entwickler alles richtig gemacht. Das Fahrgefühl ist grandios und eine gelungene Umsetzung von Fahrphysik und Handling. Die Optik ist einfach phantastisch. Auf jeder Strecke merkt man auch tatsächlich, wo auf der Welt man sich gerade befindet. Die dabei doch recht einfach gehaltene Grafik besticht dadurch allerdings durch einen unglaublichen Scharm. Die Fahrzeuge sind mit wahnsinnig viel Liebe gemacht und lassen jedes Rallysportfanherz (geiles Wort :-D) höher schlagen. Man merkt trotz arcadigem Einfluss immer, welche Antriebsart das Fahrzeug hat und wie viel Power. Jedes Fahrzeug fährt sich anders, aber die Leistungsdaten und Fahrphysik ist jederzeit nachvollziehbar. Ich könnte hier noch ewig weiter schwärmen und bin eigentlich auch deutlich mehr in Simulationen unterwegs. Aber diese Spiel bereitet sogar ohne VR unglaublich viel Freude und ist eine wunderschöne Hommage an den Rallysport der alten Tage. Vielen Dank für dieses Meisterwerk!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071916587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1664389084}
review:
Excellent chill-out racing game with pleasing graphics. The model of physics is simple, but really fun to play with and challenging at times.

At the beginning you will struggle to keep the car on the road (greetings to Samir), but if you take it slow and gradually build up your confidence, soon you will be going flat-out through fast corners and drifting on medium and slow ones.

Really, really fun, great variety of cars, each driving differently and getting more powerful further you go. If you think group B is madness... there is group S and A waiting for you!

Played the whole game on a controller - with pressure sensitive buttons (triggers) for throttle and brakes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271695393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1680734233}

author: {'steamid': '76561198151854786', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1678855838}
review:
Купил игру, так как очень понравился ролик к игре в магазине. Получаю огромное удовольствие от этого ралли симулятора, прекрасная передача управления в различные погодные условия и при езде по разному дорожному покрытию, ощущается вес автомобиля и избыточная мощность на слабых грунтах, несмотря на простоту в графике. На данный момент наиграл 15 ч. и о том, чтобы останавливаться даже и не думаю.
Дави на газ, полный вперед!

author: {'steamid': '76561198351930524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1719, 'last_played': 1700226059}
review:
ぱっと見のイメージとは裏腹に動作はかなり本格的でやりがいのあるラリーゲー
ラリーゲームのとっつきにくさの一つ「コドライバーの案内聞いて走る」を俯瞰視点にして解決してあるのでコースはわかりやすいですが、爽快にドリフト決めるには結構な練習が必要になります
難しいですが思い通りに走り抜けると大変気持ちいいです、思い通りに走れた時の爽快感はこれまでやったレースゲー中トップクラスです
反面少しでもぶつかると止まるので調子悪い日はストレスたまります（キーボードでまともに走るのは難しいと思います）

あと、結構重いのできれいなグラでやろうと思うとそこそこPCスペックいります
うちの2070だと、4Kでやると低設定でもGPUメモリ8GB使い切ってカクつく時があります
もうちょっと動作軽快になるともっといいかな

コースには日本も含まれますが、コースはいわゆるrallyjapanモデルのコースではありません
「haruna」とか「asama」とかいう山の峠道が入っています
道端に金閣寺があったりするトンデモjapan峠道を、rotaryとかZとかいうどこかで見たような車でドリフトで抜けながら下り最速を目指します
下っていくと最後の方に連続ヘアピンが用意されてたりします
競争はできませんが、世界観的にはRallyJapanというよりはﾁｮﾒﾁｮﾒDの世界観で大変楽しいです

飽きるかなと思いながら買ったが意外と飽きず、長いことやりこんでます
レース好きのかたはこれ買って下り最速を目指しましょう！


あ、ハチロクは出てきません

review:
Don't let the cartoony graphics fool you - the gameplay is much closer to the spirit of rally racing than anything I've seen from the likes of Codemasters or Electronic arts for years. I've been loving this game since the first minute of launching it. 

I would advise buying the soundtrack in a bundle at the same time - The songs are awesome and I regret not doing that and it's now twice as expensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085401246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1642576179}
review:
PS4コンで初期設定のままやってたら難しすぎて嫌になったけど、いろいろ変更しているうちに思った通りのコーナリングができるようになってきた
コントローラで操作する場合はとりあえずスロットル感度を最低まで下げると微調整できて曲がりやすくなる
あとは復帰ボタンをスティック押し込み以外に割り当てるのも必須
これのせいでコーナリング中に無意識に押してジュゲムされることがしばしばあった

慣れるまでは根気が要るが、ある程度動かせるようになると車体を横に流しながら曲がるのが気持ちよくなってくる
グラフィックはローポリだが不思議とマップは美しく、特に光と影が良い雰囲気を出している
エンジン音も車種ごとに異なっているなど、カジュアルな印象に反してこだわりを感じるゲーム

author: {'steamid': '76561199008191545', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1710016042}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044121245', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1674668977}
review:
На мой взгляд art of rally не достигла той цели, для которой игра была задумана. Судя по всему, идея была в том, чтобы игроки красиво кидали бы автомобиль в управляемый занос из одного поворота в другой и кайфовали бы от процесса управления раллийным автомобилем. 
Но на деле вышло совсем не так. В игре плохо передана скорость, ты не чувствуешь насколько быстро едешь и насколько эффективно тормозишь. Что касается дрифта - машинку действительно можно пустить в занос, можно пройти поворот красиво и быстро, но потом ты открываешь видео мирового рекорда для этой трассы и видишь, что для того, чтобы ехать по-настоящему быстро тебе нужно было просто срезать повороты в нужных местах.
Серьезно, достаточно посмотреть видео лучших заездов, чтобы понять что с игрой не так. По-моему это ненормально.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001471900', 'num_games_owned': 1320, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1643060154}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122409817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1712143510}
review:
トップダウン型のラリーゲームを遊びたいならこれが一番。
可愛い雰囲気とは裏腹に難易度は高いです。

ダートラリー並みに硬派ではなくもう少しカジュアルよりですが、
トップダウン型の硬派なラリーゲームとしては丁度良い調整だと思います。
慣れてくると、きれいにドリフトが決まると気持ちがいいです。

また、1ステージ2~5で終わるのでサクッと遊べたり、AIの難易度も丁度良いです。

ただ、ペナルティエリアが分かりにくく、
コーナインを攻めすぎてタイムペナルティを食らうことがあるのがマイナスです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198074935491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 2224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2027, 'last_played': 1642361590}
review:
Аrt of rally раллийная аркада с добротной и понятной физикой! В игре золотая эпоха ралли с 70ых по конец 90ых! В ней представлены все легендарные машины той эпохи и много машин мне не известных но которые реально существовали! Появился повод поизучать вопрос!))) 
В игре идеальный баланс стильной графики и ретро-вейв музыки! Единственно что не понравилось это камера....она слишком высоко и при перепадах высоты и в крутых закрытых поворотах машину плохо чувствуешь, слишком камера высоко!!! Но камера не помешала мне пройти Аrt of rally полностью, привык к ней со временем!))
Прошел игру на расслабоне! Я отдыхал а не напрягался как в хардкорных раллийных симуляторах!))

author: {'steamid': '76561198084515981', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 21703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 50, 'playtime_at_review': 4234, 'last_played': 1712437417}
review:
I've had a spiritual experience playing this game.

I'm playing and listening to the whole Lateralus album. Suddenly I notice the controller is gone, and so are my hands, and me.

We'll ride the spiral to the end
And may just go where no one's been
Spiral out, keep going

I'm blasting trough the Indonesia map on the liftback and in the curves of the road I can see the shape of my life, past, present, and future. Time stops and I feel I'll lose traction and blast off a cliff but I never do. There are tears in my eyes, I don't understand why, but I feel as though I do. That's all I can recall or put into words.

Thanks for reading my trip report. Play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123095026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1641202012}
review:
Was für ein grottenschlechtes Spiel! Ich frage mich ernsthaft, wo die vielen positiven Bewertungen herkommen. 
Zunächst einmal kommt in diesem "Rally"-Spiel überhaupt kein Geschwindigkeitsgefühl auf. Egal, ob man 30 oder 100 km/h fährt, es ist überhaupt kein Unterschied zu bemerken. Noch dazu ist die Steuerung auch mit einem Controller sehr schwammig und man hat, egal auf welchem Untergrund das Gefühl, wie auf Seife zu fahren. Spielspaß? Fehlanzeige!
Und dann die Grafik! Nett gestaltet und schön bunt, ja, aber die ständigen Pop-Ups, selbst bei niedrigster Qualität, auf einem 2020er MacBook Pro nerven unfassbar. Ich frage mich, wie die Programmierer das angesichts der ja doch relativ schlichten Grafik überhaupt hinbekommen haben. Und was zum Teufel sollen eigentlich die Panzer an den deutschen Strecken? Soll das witzig sein? Einfach nur dumm und überflüssig. Finger weg!

author: {'steamid': '76561199020512747', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1708874825}
review:
this might be one of my favorite racing games of all time.

it's the perfect balance of easy to learn but hard to master. it's fun and relaxing while being just challenging enough to not get boring. the maps are excellently laid out and the courses are perfectly designed to have something for everybody. there is almost too many cars to choose from all with there own unique physics. the physics themselves are perfect. I don't think there's anything truly bad I can say, please do yourself the favor of picking up this amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025768067', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1703878894}
review: Amazing art, great music, good game design and, most importantly, absolutely sublime physics and driving model. If you have been looking for a game that does not simulate the modern Rally sport but that captures its legacy, spirit and essence, this is it. Note that you still need to develop the proper skills though, this is no arcade game. Amazing work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051895239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1608782083}
review: Put about 10 hours into this on switch before deleting it. Maybe the devs haven't actually driven a car before, but in reality, cars don't fishtail wildly or spin out of control going 10km/h.  Seriously, the handling in this game is atrocious. It's like every road is covered in black ice. Remember the ice levels in Mario Kart? It's like that, but less fun. It isn't a difficultly thing, just poorly done and frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971177806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 101, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1712474782}
review:
Don't believe the people who say this game's controls are poor. Use a gamepad with analog throttle and brake (xbox controller is what I use). Turn off Stability Control and ABS, set the countersteer to 100% and have fun. Gravel, Snow and Asphalt are all controllable with Group B cars (as far as I've progressed in career so far). You don't have to brake or gas 100% all the time, your cars will lose control exactly as real ones would.

Game is very rewarding and it is clear that the designer loved rally as all the cars and tracks are homages to the sport.

review: I love this game! Big car guy here, so this game is naturally appealing to me. However, you do not have to be a car person to fully enjoy it. To describe the game in one word is "simple". The graphics, mechanics, and controls are all very simple. All the information about the cars is put in layman's terms and is straight to the point, which I love. Overall, a very fun and relaxing game. Easy to pick up and learn, but difficult to master. Final rating: 8.5/10. Controller usage improves game play significantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049688576', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1639755508}
review:
Fun little rally game, semi-realistic handling and great driving experience, however there are plenty of smaller issues that are downgrading this title to no-recommendo zone.

-Obnoxious texture pop-in
As stated by many before, the texture pop-in is really bad even when draw distance is set to max, and with such a super minimalistic game, it is really annoying especially in the forest stages.

-After race UI
You finish one season/year and you have to click like 6 times to get back to the group menu and everytime you do this, you hear this annoying children cheering soundbank sound, only to receive a really, really ugly "bonus" livery. Great to see banter in the cars descriptions, but what about weight, its distribution or some other stats?

-Liveries
Thank god for the 3rd party liveries as those in-game are just scuffed, like some other parts of the game. There was so much potential to make the original ones at least somewhat nice and minimalistic looking, but they are really ugly. Not to mention those "bonus" liveries, which are essentially just copypasted patterns and look like trash with zero thought about how it looks in a car.

-Roads
Literally same width of the track in each and every stage. Maybe I am nitpicking, but it is adding to the monotonous and later boring gameplay. One more negative point about roads is the scuffed corner cutting system - sometimes you can cut corners like Nasser, sometimes the game will recover you straight away when you barely touch the corner. Why, why, why is this somehow at least consistent?

-Optimisation
This point was said in so many more reviews, for such a minimalistic game, it is quite demanding and does not run well, fps drops are quite common.

-Lack of variety
After few hours of playing, the game feels monotonous as each track looks similar and the only thing changing are the colors and some assets around the track. Once you get to the best rally part of group B, the game is already boring and massively repetitive  due to this issue. The career is also just bloated, doing the same maps again and again and again and by the time you get to better, faster cars, the tracks just feel boring and you come to recognition that the career mode could be much shorter and the experience would be so much better. Even Ignition from 1997 had so much more variety and career mode felt less scuffed and bloated.

-Price
Nowhere near the quality for 20,99 euros. For 10? Maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561199055622815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1703898460}
review:
God, what a game. 

Growing up, I always watched the rally on TV with my dad and granddad, they were both car guys and it was an easy way to get some two for one bonding time. But time happened, as it always does, and my granddad died and I moved onto other things.

Firing up this game felt like a window into the past. It's hard to describe, but playing this game made me feel like I was 7 years old again, sat on the carpet in front of my granddad, watching rally with him. Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073147247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1707933498}
review:
This is an absolute marvel of a game!
Love the artful graphics, the sounds and sound track and the overall driving experience.

Just a warning that this game is more resource-hungry than the retro-style graphics suggest.
When run on a low end living room system (Core2 E8200, 4GB, GT1030) I had to put graphics settings to minimum and even then had to fight the occasional stuttering and more importantly, there is constant controller input lag, which makes the already challenging controls completely unbearable. Fortunately I was able to compare with my higher end desktop system and there I didn't have any problems and the inputs feel challenging, but manageable.
So it seems to me there is a lot of room for performance optimization.
Maybe something the developers could improve upon?

author: {'steamid': '76561198095182264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1654, 'last_played': 1699316063}
review:
[h1] The love letter to rallying, you didn't know you needed ! [/h1]

Great gameplay, simple yet challenging, big learning curve.
The game is entirely focused on a great gameplay, realistic driving feelings and a minimalistic art direction.

Photo mode, daily events, free mode, time attack: extremely complete game for just 20 bucks.

Relieve the golden age of Rallying, with cleverly made stages to remind you of the real world, and ingenious names for your favorite rally cars.

However, sound design could use some work in my opinion, especially engine sounds, but at this point we're just nitpicking.

Bonus point: The game receives regular updates !

author: {'steamid': '76561199092677348', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1687141792}
review:
1.赛车过于滑溜溜了，稍微转向一点点就有可能撞柱子，撞柱子之后基本上也只有重启赛车一个选项，但凡是一小点失误都可能造成很严重的后果。如果游戏的初衷是做好一款硬核的赛车游戏，这样过于卡通的画风明显吸引不到这些玩家。所以，在我的默认中，这款游戏的上手难度并不会太高，可是让我出乎意料的是，上手难度出奇的高，为了不失误，你可能需要长时间的练习以及一位优秀的领航员在身边，而且还需要对地图的熟悉度相当高，总的说来，没有二十个小时你是不可能开好这个赛车的。但是这与我买游戏的初衷又违背了，这款游戏我是单纯冲着卡通的画风来的，在我的认知中，这就应当是一款以休闲为卖点的游戏，而不是一款相对硬核的具有竞技性的赛车游戏，所以从我的体验来看，我是不建议购入这款游戏的。
2.但是这款游戏又有相当的优点让我难以舍弃，优秀的画风设计，即使让它到仓库吃灰都值得，每一款赛车都有不同的驾驶手感以及喷涂，让玩家可以找到自己喜欢的赛车款式，别出心裁的透视设计，让我看到了对一款好游戏的细节打磨，我当然理应给一个五星好评，但是我恰恰没这么做，反而给出了steam上的处女差评。
3.地区设置中明确将香港台湾定义为国家，厂家是没看过地图还是脑子掉下水道里被僵尸吃了，我可qnmlgbd，不尊重我大中华，把我们中国玩家不放在眼里，这个差评给的就是你这样的shadiao公司。

author: {'steamid': '76561198416081365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1691387546}
review:
Such a cool ass game, so addicting. Beautiful visuals and environments that make you want to take a photo from every stage replay. Good variety of stage designs tailored to different locales (Kenya update stages are fantastic). Each driving surface feels unique, so mastering them individually takes time and is very satisfying.

The only things i'm not so keen on are the inconsistent cutting allowances (game heavily encourages staying on the road), making cutting very risky sometimes. And the lack of some sort of pacenote system, but its understandable.

Awesome game overall that makes me want to go for all of the achievements. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964189188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3184, 'last_played': 1692613770}
review:
-Entertaining and addictive.
-Hard and punishing your mistakes.
-Beautiful aesthetic and good handling.

If you love classic rally albeit in an arcady fashion. If you want a challenge and a game you can (and have to if you want to finish it on the hardest difficulty) master.
This game is probably for you.
I love it in its pure, punishing and gorgeous form.

Note: I play on keyboard, which is not ideal but I like it like that. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076764192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2545, 'last_played': 1641576779}
review:
A really fun and technical game with an unique retro vibe, thanks to its lovely low poly graphics, lots of historic rally culture references, stunning visuals and pretty neat landscapes carefully packed in this "back to basics" 40h gem that reminded me everything I've loved about playing SEGA Rally at the arcade.

Big up for crowd animations, amazing lofi music and relaxing yet engaging overall gameplay mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169996775', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1683102133}
review:
большая игра с маленькой буквы

Красивый визуальный стиль заставляет пересматривать реплеи половины гонок с целью запечатлеть красивый кадр при помощи фоторежима, за который отдельная благодарность разработчикам.

Сами гонки и нахождение в игре сопровождаются прекрасного саундтреком, который остается таким же прекрасным и в отрыве от игры.

Локации на этапах выглядят большими и комплексными, однако ограничиваются небольшим "коридором" близ основной трассы. И, несмотря на размер, каждая локация не кажется пустырём с дорогой, наоборот, локации "живые" и "цветущие".

 Из минусов можно отметить физическую модель, но данный недостаток нивелируется при рассмотрении игры в отрыве от серьезных симуляторов вроде Dirt. Если воспринимать игру как веселую аркадку для расслабления - физическая модель неплоха и из претензий к ней только недостаточное ощущение наличия или потери сцепления с дорогой, что не позволяет красиво закладывать во все повороты с заносом задней оси.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044702871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 5813, 'last_played': 1711850763}
review:
This game is amazing.

The physics are close to real life, yet the game doesn't take itself overly seriously.

The driving experience is about as far from "arcade style" as you can get. There are some modest adjustable driver assists in the settings, but in general the game will not help you to smooth out your inputs. To stay on the road and go fast, you have to think about weight transfer, tire slip, timing, and positioning - just like in real life. Surface changes, elevation changes, and sudden dips/ crests, will upset the car's balance and it's up to you to manage all of that. FWD, RWD, AWD, front/ mid/ rear engine all matters in this game for how a car behaves and rotates.

The graphics and illustration style are fun and minimalistic. The music is great, too. It's clear that a lot of care and attention went into making this game.

The game has great replayability if you are someone who enjoys driving IRL. Since the driving in this game is genuinely challenging, there is always something to improve on and it's very rewarding to find more speed and more control.

I have no real gripes with the game. It would be nice to have some sort of navigation or codriver voice to let you know what turns are coming. The overhead view is good enough most of the time, but the night courses and blind corners increase the chances that you're either going to go off the road or slow down too much for corners. But I don't see a way to add this to the game and still retain that casual minimalism that I like so much, so I give it a pass on this issue.

Overall I would recommend this game to any driving enthusiast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198398071913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1651838719}
review:
打折购入，还是很值得的。
首先被吸引的是这清奇的画风，和拉力元素能组合在一起确实蛮有趣的。
然后车辆操控上，有优点也有缺点，但总体上还是很惊艳的

优点：不失拟真性，over和under都能较好地表现出来，轮胎抓地力的变化也是给人感觉挺真实的，各种材质提供的附着力变化也能够很好地感受出来
缺点：腾空落地瞬间的抓地力异常地大，远超过轮胎的极限附着力，导致落地瞬间基本是失控的（不像尘埃拉力那样落地会先有滑动，这里直接是落地瞬间直接拉满附着力的)

然后提几个建议吧
1、可以的话加个第一人称视角
2、开放适度的改装空间给到玩家，微调悬挂、齿比等
3、部分小物品设置的也是不可撞动的逻辑（像护栏网这种）与现实认知有些不符，每次失误了出去都是直接撞停，稍感魔幻
4、与部分物品的碰撞优化下，现在基本是在切向会有一个巨大阻力的，缺少了车身可剐蹭的表现效果

author: {'steamid': '76561198078127921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1700941493}
review:
Que jogo incrível!

Esse é o famoso "lobo em pele de cordeiro".

Você não dá nada para o gráfico do jogo (que aliás é simples e muito lindo!). Porém a dificuldade proposta por esse jogo é algo fantástico e DIFÍCIL. Sim, muito difícil (traz os princípios das pilotagem do propío rally real).

Outro ponto forte é a história, o jogo traz uma história do rally com as principais carros históricos da categoria.

Vale muito a pena cada centavo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991769067', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1706366347}
review: Easy to play, very difficult to master! Art of rally is a very fun game, but make no mistake, the arcade style doesn't mean you can just "pedal to the metal" and steer right or left, controls are difficult to master, especially on slow tracks. Everythin is attractive, the graphics, the old cars, the lovely tracks and the lighting, but there's also a con, which are the penalties. Sometimes you get penalties even when you're just on the side of the road, and the mechanism that rules them feels whimsical, to say the least. If the devs can fix that, this title would almost be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000712986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8190, 'last_played': 1666726493}
review:
[b]Um excelente jogo de corrida e uma declaração de amor a história das corridas de rali.[/b]

A apresentação visual do jogo é simples mas muito bem feita e o seu estilo representa perfeitamente todos os carros e pinturas históricas que se espera de cada época. O estilo visual do jogo juntamente com a trilha sonora faz com que seja divertido tanto buscar os melhores tempos em cada estágio como simplismente pegar um carro e estágio aleatório e só correr por aí.

O gameplay é ótimo, com cada carro apresentando uma característica distinta de dirigibilidade e com saltos de potência e aderência notãveis entre cada categoria. O jogo pode variar de mais arcade até quase um "simulcade" graças as assistências que podem ser modificadas ou desativadas, como câmbio automático e ABS. 

No áudio, destaque para a maravilhosa trilha sonora que ajuda em muito a complementar o estilo retrô dos gráficos e da época de ouro dos ralis. Os sons dos carros acabam sendo mais simples; não chega a comprometer em nada o jogo, mas poderiam ser mais caprichados.

Além do single-player, o jogo conta com desafios diários, semanais e tabela de time-attack online, onde os jogadores disputam pelo melhor tempo.

Os desenvolvedores já disponibilizaram updates gratuítos adicionando novos carros e uma nova localização, com pelo menos mais uma nova localização confirmada para o futuro.

Os únicos defeitos para mim são os replays que ainda tem muitos problemas de atravessar o terreno (mudar a câmera normalmente resolve, mas ainda é um pouco chato) e a certa folga para "atalhos" em alguns estágios. Entretanto, não são nada que atrapalhem o jogo.

Recomendado se você é apaixonado por rali ou se procura um jogo de corrida arcade para passar o tempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440017105', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1699746758}
review:
[h1] Dominar a arte do rally não é uma tarefa fácil. [/h1]

[i]art of rally[/i] é um simulador que te prende. No começo pode ser bem chato e complicado controlar um carro de rally com 500 cavalos de potencia mesmo com as assistências ativadas. Mas, a cada tentativa, você vai melhorando, e se arriscando mais e mais nos estágios. 

art of rally é um jogo indie bem desenvolvido, a ambientação retratando fielmente os estágios mais icônicos de rally, os carros, a fisica, tudo isso consegue agradar todos os tipos de jogadores de jogos de corrida. Desde o ortodoxo dos simuladores até o casual que procura apenas um jogo para passar o tempo.

review:
Как фанат CMR и Dirt, говорю некоторое фи юзабилити: штурмана нет, обратной связи по своей позиции на треке нет, управление топорное, а изометрия в сочетании с лоуполи не дают оценить высоту трассы и половина вылетов на внезапных снижениях.

Получаем очень топорные гонки, хуже первых раллийных поделок для телефона времён Nokia 5800.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035630985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4342, 'last_played': 1702974102}
review:
It's fun to slide around in this game, and i somehow get faster times playing on a keyboard than with a controller.
Also if you ever check out some of the top player's ghosts and notice that they somehow go faster than you on straights with the exact same vehicle, thats because they just slam the clutch on a straight, giving them a speed boost because PHYSICS.
Still really fun tho, price tag might be a little steep for the game you get, but otherwise i would absolutely recommend it, and is a great improvement over Absolute Drift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013035947', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1669633841}
review:
HOW is this priced at $36AUD with no appreciable sales when it's so bad?! What were you thinking? At time of writing, Dirt Rally 2 is less than 1/4 the price of this game, with all its DLC. That game has way more cars, more stages, more disciplines, more choice, better handling, better visuals, the works. React with jester awards all you like but you can't argue with the fact that this game is a rip-off.

The game runs TERRIBLY. Easily the worst optimisation I've seen in memory. The camera angles make seeing subtle elevation changes impossible, but you are required to do this - this makes every single stage just trial and error to deal with the bad camera system the game forces on you. To compound this issue, the game's shading seems deliberately designed to HIDE elevation changes. It's genuinely like the developers have not played this title even once, because these issues are so easily fixed and ruin the game so badly. 
The game is RAILROADED and barebones as all hell. Very little to no reason for a player to do anything other than have their hand held. There are no choices, there is no strategy, there is no complexity. 
The handling model feels good at first, but as you learn how it responds, you quickly find it is far, far less detailed or realistic than it seems, with auto-countersteer and auto-recovery forced on with no way to disable. This is presumably due to the developer's determination to stick with the terrible camera angles at all costs (the dev even has snarky forum posts about this; they have contempt for players who don't love the camera). 
Menu transitions are at least 4x as long as they should be. 

This is a meme game with AAA pricing, and whoever was silly enough to overestimate its worth to that degree is insane, stupid or both. 

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198020753868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1638123183}
review: While the game is visually fun, and somewhat playable, the controls leave much to be desired.  Most cars are extremely twitchy, so the hardest parts of a run are the completely flat straight bits. Quite the opposite of being behind the wheel IRL.  Ive changed around the setup a lot, and cant seem to tame this trait. Im playing on expert and extreme damage with success...its just frustrating to lose a rally because driving in a straight line is overly difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271105938', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1664473491}
review:
I've never counted myself as a racing-genre's enthusiastic but I did end up enjoying Absolute Drift game on Nintendo Switch and thus bought Art of rally when it arrived ported also to Switch.
However... that Switch portion is to be completely honest worst visual downgrade I've ever seen when compared to other platforms release. Thus I ended up buying and playing Art of rally on PC.

On surface driving car in track(s) may sound boring but when you start to handle your car in high speed and slow down just enough that you can get from 45 degree turn without flying off the track/ crash it just feels so good. I also felt how different car's handling worked when compared between vehicle groups.
In actual racing only negative/ disapointment that comes to my mind was how repairing mechanic felt too forgiving, given how I played in normal difficulty and crashed many times to trees/ rocks I've never had to repair my vehicle outside of just cleaning it up from dirt. Really would have liked to be in situation where I'd choose which part of my car I repair in limited resources.

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
Whatever you do, DON'T buy this game on Nintendo Switch.
But if there's tiny bit within you that enjoys racing games and have a controller, Art of rally is a great indie racing game to buy and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127984022', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1636638506}
review:
Si eres una persona con mucha paciencia quizás te sea interesante, porque para el aficionado común de los videojuegos el tema del descontrol del coche es una locura, tiene que gustarte mucho este tipo de juegos para probar este, necesitaras dotes fuera de lo común.

Gráficamente me gusta mucho, para el aspecto retro que tiene se ve genial, tiene detalles curiosos como la foto, varios modos de juego, pero debería contemplar poner un modo arcade para los jugadores torpes, porque las físicas pecan de ser muy extrañas, parece que controlas una bola sin rumbo.

Desde mi punto de vista de aficionado, tengo que negar el recomiendas el juego, y sólo recomendarlo a gente de muchíiiiiisima paciencia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124846987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1694040194}
review: Probably my favorite non-sim racing game out now. It has an enthusiast focus, so don't expect art of rally to deliver typical basic bitch arcade racing and "gamey" [strike]gimmicks[/strike] features. It's a "drivers' game" through and through. The physics aren't overbearingly realistic, but have enough realistic mechanics to feel natural and dynamic enough for a seasoned driver, a perfect match for the game's overall caricaturization of rallying. Cars handle more simplistically than they do in real life or sims, but with variables like drivetrain type, road camber, and weight transfer still affecting the way you drive, being quick in-game means you have to understand the principles behind driving real cars fast. One wrong move and your stage is pretty much over- but that's what makes the good runs rewarding. Historic liveries and humorous little blurbs for each car add to this game's charm as a love letter not only to rallying, but to car culture as a whole. Doesn't hurt that fresh content other devs would release as DLC is available to all players for free. Pair with a little Eurobeat and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867802169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2113, 'last_played': 1708957652}
review: В эту игру можно поиграть когда друзья ещё не пришли или через 30 минут тебе нужно уйти. Графика приятная.  Купил игру потому что: разработчик Absolute drift, простой и незамысловатый геймплей, яркая картинка, очень классная музыка, и потому что ралли.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972418400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1636414415}
review:
The game is good however there's a couple of questions you need to ask yourself before purchasing it.
1. Are you prepared to get good at it?
This game is no arcade racer and can be very frustrating if you just go in thinking lets throw this car around and get from A to B asap. I quickly found a certain degree of feather was required on the brake and accelerator.
2. Are you ok driving on your own with no other cars to be seen and no real feeling you're in a race?
Yeah i know that's what rallying is but it can be sobering experience driving without any visible stimulus.

I liked the game hence the recommendation however i didn't love it and at times found it a bit boring also the graphics for this game get a lot of praise and yes at times it can look very pretty however a wet foggy night in Kenya is like a mud party in a sewage plant.
The graphic style though is pleasing and the sound was decent and driving through the different era's of rallying was fun just be prepared to put the time into mastering the techniques you will need to win.

The one big thing i hated in this game was gravestones at the side of the road......anyone who has played this will know what i mean ;)

In summary - Good game but tricky to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993617025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1708816587}
review: This game is actually aesthetically flawless. It's beautiful, a little bit wry, minimalist but not sparse. It's a fun rally game, which is made somewhat irrelevant by the fucking peerless design. It's not just the visuals but the little blurbs about the cars, the UI, the names of the opponent drivers. [b]art of rally[/b] is focused and exacting in a way that makes it a wonderful place to spend time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982935027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1702356156}
review:
It's a distillation, the essence of rally, the Journey of rally. 

Your high viewpoint replaces your co-driver and you can't setup your vehicle among other streamlining, but it's serious enough to support a steering wheel and clutch! But it feels like this was set up for controller foremost. While I wish I could switch to bumper cam for that extra precision, it's a great game and a lot of fun. Just remember to take care of your car and favor consistency over bursty crashy driving, you will often find your competitor have sudden complications, such as:

chassis failure
toilet emergency
bird in cabin
radiator failure
brake failure
need caffeine
forgot pacenotes
detached exhaust
wheel gone
hungover
dropped cigarette
puncture
gearbox issue
turbo failure

Letting you win the rally even if you don't win individual stages!

Rask-120211108V1

author: {'steamid': '76561198826097582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3507, 'last_played': 1636976405}
review:
レゴプロックのような可愛い見た目に反して、なかなか歯ごたえのあるラリーゲームだと思いました。急なハンドル、ブレーキ、アクセルでタイヤが滑り出し、不安定になる車をうまくコントロールしながら走る快感があります。

見下ろし視点で走行し、コースの先が見通せる感じの視界でプレイします。レゴの風景もとても綺麗なので、良かったです。その代り、ラリーの醍醐味とも言える、助手席のナビゲータによるコースの読み上げがありません。私は見下ろし視点は良いと思いました。このゲームの雰囲気だと、読み上げは逆に邪魔になるかな。

デフォルトで車体を安定させる補助機能がONになっていたり、難易度イージーなら簡単にラリーに勝てるので、初心者も安心だと思います。(私がそうでした)

キャンペーンモードで、昔からのラリーの歴史が追体験出来て、勉強になりました。車名は実名でないのが少し残念ですが、権利の関係で仕方がないのでしょうね。

ステージは、いくつかの国がありそれぞれにいくつかのコースがある、という構成になっています。国ごとに箱庭風のオープンワールド(であってるかな)になっていて、「自由走行モード」でその中を自由に走ることができます。日本の山の上から、つづら折りの峠道を見下ろすのがとても乙な感じがしました。このモード、何気によかったです。

総じて、カジュアルな見た目と、リーズナブルな価格に反して、かなり楽しめるゲームだと思います。
私だけかもしれませんが、昔やった「峠」シリーズに似た印象を感じました。もっとおふざけモードとかストーリーモードを充実させたりした、第二弾を期待したいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198015870072', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1687892207}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994505615', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2750, 'last_played': 1703397536}
review: I love this game. It has an interesting art style, challenging physics, very customizable controls and I love the music. I needed to change the braking settings before I really hit my stride with the game. This is more of simulator than an arcade style racing game. If that's what you enjoy, this is worth it full price in my opinion. I recommend playing with a keyboard instead of a gamepad. Just preference!

author: {'steamid': '76561198300952175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1673990157}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962160968', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1684688476}
review:
I can't really vouch for how 'good' of a game this is compared to others like it, nor do I have some long detailed pro/con or quippy rant to sway anyone. I just sort of ran across this title and picked it up on a whim. Some people probably wouldn't like it for X or Y reason, and that's fine.

All I can say is that this surprise is one of the most sublime, fun, and satisfying game experiences I've had in years, and I'm so happy the developers took the time to dream this up and make it. The homages to classic rallying, the wry-yet-reverent commentary, the minimalist design, the WRC legends I dreamed about as a kid, the fun and challenging driving. It all came together right. Thank you for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198928065031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1692905256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198889056403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2690, 'last_played': 1699252979}
review:
I'm not the kind of person who plays racing games. I had pretty much no experience coming in other than a bit in some arcade racers. This game is super fun though, the cars handle well, with a lot of variety and what I assume is pretty realistic physics. 

Just driving through tracks is super fun, and there's quite a lot of variety in both tracks and cars. It's a relatively chill game, although with a very high skill ceiling. There are also free roam areas which are great fun to explore and also just slam cars around with no consequences.

Also the graphics are great. The game looks fantastic, and I have spent quite a bit of time just in the photo mode taking shots.

I still suck at it, but I'm having fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198414130303', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1690397380}
review:
Я люблю ралли. И люблю  дилогию Dirt rally. И эта игра пропитана любовью к ралли.
─▄█▀█▄──▄███▄─
▐█░██████████▌
─██▒█████████─
──▀████████▀──
─────▀██▀─────
Думаю, что тезисное описание в рамках обзора будет уместно:
- Есть Lada Samara S-proto (EVA) (OwO(Вау(наконец-то русские тачки в играх))).
- У каждой машины есть свой характер, и это чувствуется.
- Физика хоть и аркадная, но крайне приятная. Уровень сложности позволит занимать первые места с любым уровнем навыков.
- Машины открываются НЕ за монеты, а за прохождение компании.
- Есть свободный заезд .
- Есть ливреи, но скорее всего вы будете пользоваться только стандартным.
- Много карт (Даже Япония есть) с разным покрытием (как и должно быть в раллийной игре).

Игрой полностью доволен, рекомендую всем. Даже тем, кто не играет в гонки и раллийные симуляторы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108169270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 4014, 'last_played': 1711581060}
review: Very good for a relaxed but challenging racing experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298208527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1646592781}
review: Schickes kleines Arcade Rally Game mit hohem Suchtfaktor, minimaler aber dennoch sehr geiler Grafik und einem top Soundtrack. Ich zocke es mit GamePad auf einer RTX2070 in 3440x1440 mit angepassten Settings. Auf Standard sieht es schon genial aus, bei der Fülle an Grafik Settings geht aber noch einiges zu optimieren. UPDATE: Nach längerem Test muss ich meine ursprüngliche Wertung (9/10) etwas nach unten korrigieren. Die Präsentation bleibt absolute Spitze, die Motivation lässt jedoch nach, besonders wenn schnellere Fahrzeuge verfügbar werden. Das liegt daran, dass die Steuerung dann doch eher schwammig wirkt und kein echter Spaß für mich mehr aufkommen will. Trotzdem bleibt es ein kurzweiliger Fun-Racer! Ich gebe 7,5/10 Punkte und empfehle im Sale zuzuschlagen ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067083986', 'num_games_owned': 3478, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 1761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 135, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1712011164}
review:
This game could just as easily appeal to a jaded sim racer or someone who's never raced anything beyond Mario Kart, and that's a laudable feat.

If you like driving cars in video games in any capacity, get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029986085', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4400, 'last_played': 1693354770}
review:
It's remarkable the amount of realism they were able to cram into this adorable looking indie race title.

Cars all handle differently, learning to drive each one to its limits requires time and patience. The physics are fantastic. The atmosphere and sounds just absolutely nail the feel of rally. Everything from the crowd nearly being run over, to the blow off valve and afterfire from the Audi Quattro S1's exhaust, it's all here.

The difficulty is much higher than you would expect, especially if you're competing in the top 1% of players, where every thousandth of a second counts. The skill ceiling is just mind blowing.

Some use this as a relaxing, care free title. But I'm not one of those people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059110622', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1636249138}
review:
It looks like the developers have never driven on gravel. The game is very, very fun and chill yet I was expecting something more arcade than simulation,
I will note the negatives becasue the game is still fun:
-Phisics are floaty and slippery (even on low speeds)
-When tou reach max speed, the car keeps doing that annoying sound like it needs to go one more shift up.
-The rendering distance (not the draw distance) is WAY TOO CLOSE, to the point is very distracting.
-A mini map! please add a mini map!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048100094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1701897774}
review:
Безумно стильная, завораживающе красивая, ни на кого не похожая не просто игра про раллийные гонки, а электронное произведение дающее в тоже время челендж для искушенных игроков. 
Если вы любите игры в жанре гонки - берите не дожидаясь скидок!
Если вы поклонник хороших игр - берите смело по полной стоимости!
Если вы ищете нестандартный взгляд на классический жанр - смело кидайте в корзину!
Ну а если вы вдруг новичок в играх и не знаете во, что можно поиграть вечером - берите не думая!
Продукт как для искушенных геймеров и фанатов гонок, так и для начинающих любителей видеоигр.
Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025523664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1947, 'last_played': 1660586681}
review:
You come to in a carpark in Finland. 

Given the glare, the hangover is implied. 

Your in-game father, a giant, low-poly golden Buddha statue, phases up through the ground, gives you a short history of the noble and eponymous art of rally, warns you about trees and then, just like your real father, fucks off until you've made him proud.

You promptly floor the accelerator, wildly overestimate your skill level and chuff yourself into a ditch. Neither of your fathers are proud.

But you try again, regardless. The road ahead of you winds, bucks and narrows, outraged that you'd dare try to traverse it - or at least, travel it without the proper respect. You're thrown off. Glumly, you read the fun slogan on the bottom of your car as it sinks into the Sicilian ocean.

You try again. Funselektor makes trying again easy. The music swells and pulses, four hours' worth of bounding synthwave that begs patience, calm and focus as it weaves and spins; like Gandalf on rollerskates. Like a real life Gandalf on rollerskates, it is irresistible and you follow it, and try again.

You book it into a fir tree. You try again.

You misjudge a jump and cartwheel past impassive cows. You shame them and yourself. You try again.

You entirely underestimate the stopping power of a hay bale and lose valuable seconds doing a 13-point turn. You grit your teeth, and try again.

On a rainy night somewhere in the Japanese hills, you perfectly drift an 80s Volvo around a hairpin. You are aroused for longer than four hours and need to phone your doctor.

You learn to fear Germany and the precision its landscape demands, but love its automotive children.

You learn to take your eyes from the car below you, positioned, as you are, as a phantasmal observer high above yourself - out-of-vehicular-body experience entire - and watch instead that distant horizon, reading it like an augur. You might be moving in the present, braking and sliding around the current corner, but your mind is two turns ahead, six seconds; you are racing the future.

At a certain point, you will realise that you've been reacting to the pitch of your car's engine, listening as it instructs you when to lift off the accelerator, so that you can clip the apex of the corner and still be facing the right way to floor it into the next. There will come a time when you fight not to make up seconds, but shave off milliseconds. art of rally is a language, and you have become fluent.

You come to in a Finnish carpark, blinking owlishly at your screen. The HUD tells you that you've just finished a stage, but you're not entirely sure which one; the wave of the music, the rhythm of accelerate-brake-turn, the hypnotism of that ever-moving horizon has lulled you and you forgot you were racing. You weren't even really thinking. 

The leaderboard puts your time in the top 5% of drivers. 

That is the art of rally.

Somewhere at least one of your fathers is proud, probably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364306415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1711273687}
review:
Art of rally is an amazing game in every way- don't be fooled by the quirky and amazing art style cause it's got a surprisingly realistic and robust handling model.

The only downside is that the scenery is so beautiful I'll get distracted midstage and send the car flying into a tree!

Oh, and the music? 11/10 for vibes

author: {'steamid': '76561197981041315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1630278429}
review:
Je n'ai pas trop aimé.
C'est sympa au début, ça change des habitudes, les graphismes mignons (bof), et tout ça...
Mais en fait, c'est assez quelconque: le pilotage est très loin d'être aussi jouissif qu'annoncé, et avec certaines voitures c'est carrément désagréable pour tout dire (voitures lourdes, sensations de glisse contre-intuitives), on ne se fait pas vraiment plaisir et c'est vite ennuyeux et très répétitif, notamment à cause des spéciales pas fameuses.
Je voulais terminer le mode "carrière", mais même pas, je m'ennuyais trop...

review: This game is just amazing. Rallying in it's purest form. When you actually get to a point that you are able to drive a certain car you love really fast it just gives insane amounts of satisfaction. One of the best racing games ever made, just buy it, and remember, when in doubt, flat out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198253318032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1995, 'last_played': 1683048140}
review: Я, будучи криворуким уродом, вкатывался в физику этой игры, наверное, первые часов 10. За всё время игры мне встретился единственный баг, и то, случайно заспавнились две мои машины, обе повторяли действия с клавиатуры, но за одной была закреплена камера и телепорты из обочины на трассу, а на второй- нет. Графика-потрясающая. Жаль компьютер слабый, на максимальных настройках окружение удивляет своей полнотой и живостью. Физика- ничем не хуже, чем в серии Dirt, абсолютно. приятно удивила возможность выживать сцепление с клавиатуры, оно мне открыло совершенно новый способ вхождения в повороты. Абсолютно офигенно чувствуется инерция автомобилей, выворот колес, полка крутящего момента на двигателях, отличие переднего привода от заднего и полного. Музыканту, который написал саундтрек обязательно нужно поставить памятник. Синтвейв в его исполнении- услада для ушей. Каждая композиция достойна высочайшей похвалы. Если думаете, брать или не брать игру- определенно точно брать. Она стоит всех денег, которые просят разработчики. Настоятельно рекомендую пройти эту игру. 10/10. Ниже поставить не могу

author: {'steamid': '76561197993762724', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1678922392}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009416615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1671659090}
review: Io sono un amante dei Simulativi di corsa con volante e pedaliera (Assetto corsa , rFactor ,Dirt Rally ecc) ma spinto dalle recensioni e dalla curiosità ho preso questo Art of Rally e devo dire che sebbene sia un arcade da giocare con joypad è un gioco davvero interessante e divertente, questo è un gioco che consiglio molto di piu agli amanti dei simulatori che non a chi gioca con Need for Speed . Qui chi ama i simulatori ritroverà con delle vetture da controllare con decisione e delicatezza giocando con gas e freno ad ogni curva. Qui le vetture senza licenza (ma facilmente riconoscibili) hanno comportamenti quasi reali e non si potrà semplicemente schiacciare il grilletto dell'acceleratore come in un qualsiasi Arcade. Consiglio vivamente questo gioco ad un pubblico da simulatori che sono sicuro ne resteranno meravigliati. Sicuramente non ha niente a che vedere con un simulatore resta sempre e comunque un giochino ma pieno di sorprese. Consigliatissimo per passare qualche ora di gioco più di svago ,comunque impegnativo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231877624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1702806342}
review:
Yes, you should get this game. No, it's not good, it's amazing. Yes, you can drive a logging truck in the same rally stages as a Subaru WRX. 
This game is the perfect blend of complex gameplay and chilled out athmosphere. You can play this hardcore and aim for the perfect runs or just have fun driving. The new Kenya update is amazing and the stages are fantastic to just drive around. 
This deserves to be more recognised, it's a hidden gem and there's a car, class and stage for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282777819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 38765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14912, 'last_played': 1692210931}
review: This game feels as good to play as it does to look at.  The soundtrack is fantastic and original.  There are tons of cars and roads to select, with different times of day and weather.  So much replayibility.  You can tryhard on the leaderboards or go on a photography shoot in the replay mode.  It's a simple game that has a ton of depth.  The discord community is incredibly friendly and welcoming.  Really amazing game that lets you play the way you want to play it.  Just try it. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198049840197', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 382, 'playtime_forever': 7727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5673, 'last_played': 1708070127}
review:
My feelings on this game are mixed and come with a great caveat. 

Don't play this if you feel like you have to come in first place every race. 
Thankfully Art of Rally isn't balanced to require constant victory, but its still annoyingly hard.

I'll start positive because there is some good here.
Firstly the amount of content is unbelievable, 53 cars across 10 classes, and nearly as many tracks. All of which can be raced forwards or backwards, at three times of day, with fog, rain and snow as weather options depending on the track. There's also four surface types (dirt, gravel, snow, tar) with their own handling characteristics AND many tracks will mix paved and unpaved sections together.

All of the tracks are well designed and offer varying levels of challenge. Some are just flat out sprints while others are much more technically challenging with lots of hair pin turns and narrow road ways every track tries to have at least something unique going on.

Another feature I like is that you can create your own liveries but it does require that you have photoshop or something similar that can read and edit PSD files. Still its a lot more creativity than a lot of racing games are willing to give.

Game play wise the game is tough, some of it is fair but a lot of it isn't. 
Thankfully the AI doesn't have a consistent running order meaning its actually possible to win a season without having to finish in first place every single race.
The cars don't exactly feel the most realistic, but they do drive well enough to be fun and interesting. I wish the stat cards would have included more detail like engine size and placement and that we could have cars with more than five gears (looking at you Celica.) 
The worst part though is the camera. It's birds eye view and by default gives you NO idea where your going at all. If you tilt it so you can see forward then expect a performance dip because it will cause more of the game to be loaded than is really necessary and you will see loads of object pop in.

Honestly that's one of the worst problems, graphically the game looks alright. It's cell shaded with minimal details but the camera makes it look so much worse because it hampers game play and draws attention to the stupid amount of pop in. 

Another issue is the AI. By the time I was consistently finishing in the top 40-50% of players I was still consistently loosing to the AI. It took me almost 20 hours to achieve that kind of skill and not only was I still doing "above average" I was getting my ass kicked on NORMAL difficulty. 
I can't imagine that being fun for any body. Thankfully you never need to win a race to unlock anything or progress but it's still stupid to expect someone to start achieving consistent top 10% of players type speed before he can start getting some consistent wins.

Another area where the game lacks polish is car damage, there is no visual representation which part of your car gets damaged seems utterly random. 
Since every race is on an empty track (excluding time trial ghosts) you never have to dodge other drivers wrecks or get an opportunity to pass them.
There's no pace notes or mini map, so you just have to drive every course until you know it. If you angle the camera it helps a lot with being able to see the upcoming track but it just makes the game feel lonely with no co-pilot or other races inside.

Lastly my biggest problem is there's not time comparison or checkpoints. 
So you never know if your ahead or behind until you finish a race and you have no idea where you've gained/lost time which is a huge deal for time trials and trying to be top of a leader board. 


Honestly, I'd almost recommend Art of Rally. 
Sure the AI races aren't fun but the leader-boards are active and the game has a lot of content. 
And with the promised release of mod support maybe we'll get to see some fan tracks or new cars?
If you like racing games then by all means, its a bit meatier than your average kart racer but its not so much of a sim it should scare anyone off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112552578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1640348654}
review: There are some game design decisions I don't like, e.g. the 5 sec penalty mechanism, no co-driver / pace notes but goofy restart system etc. But none of that really matters, the game is focused like no other I've seen in years. It's no-nonsense driving from the very beginning without extra crap, beautifully balanced and polished progression. It's not difficult, but it's definitely not easy to master. This is how I like my games. Extra point for the glowing brake disks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352232316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 11807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1508, 'last_played': 1705428238}
review:
This game's physics are pretty fun, even on a keyboard, though I don't know how realistic they are.

I really recommend getting an old PS4 or Xbox 360 controller to connect to your PC with this game, you can go slightly faster when you can add a little bit of gas in a corner. If you can't then at least try using a/z as forward/backward and ,/. as left/right. I tried to use the manual transmission, but after switching back to automatic I realized I was switching gears at the wrong time the whole time and that the computer does it much better. Do not go sideways ever, even on the sharpest turns it's faster to slow down enough so that the car doesn't drift. Watch some world record runs on YouTube if you don't believe me, that guy never drifts.

Also, do not be fooled by the cute graphics, this game is very un-performant and requires a good PC to run. I have an M1 Macbook and even on the lowest settings, from time to time it will just drop to like 20 fps for a minute or two. Dirt Rally 1 runs much better than this game on my laptop.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971972173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1642406596}
review: Superb top down rally racing game. Very competitive single player game with tons of cars and some great tracks. I play with a Xbox One controller and it handles superbly without much having to change the settings from default. This is far more skilful and realistic than some first person rally games - a better representation. Loving this game - very much like the games of old - the addictive playability element holds strong. Worth it at full price - which I paid for. You can also match your scores against other online racers. This game positions itself in my games library in a very unique way - there is nothing else out there as good as this in what it offers. The handling of the cars, the playability and replayability value are superb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007855978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13618, 'last_played': 1709962862}
review: This game is an amazing simulator style rally game. It is endlessly replay-able and highly rewarding and challenging. The developers continue to add cars and stages, although I defiantly race the F40 clone in every track. The team nails the handling properties and road phyisics. To be fair, compared to a game like Assetto Corsa, this experience is a bit easier and less punishing. Notably, when running far off track the game will respawn you back where you left with a relative time penalty. There is no customization besides the livery schemes, but the selection of cars is epic and historically relevant despite the car designs being unlicensed. Great for kids and adults, not highly demanding hardware requirements, online time trails. I would like to be able to race head to head, but besides that minor gripe this game is the complete package rally sim. Ok, one more gripe: how about some pace notes, WRC style?

author: {'steamid': '76561198040267951', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1632716616}
review:
Review from a sim racing esports driver (whatever that may be worth to you, it's not important but I guess some people might want to defend this game by suggesting I'm a bad driver or something):
This game is very cool in concept (I absolutely adored absolute drift) but the controls and, kinda sorta, the physics, let this game down big time.

In another review someone mentioned that the controls don't scale for speed, they get tankslappers, etc. From what I can tell that's not actually what the issue is, the issue is a lack of something called "self aligning torque." If you've ever drifted your mom's Nissan Sentra you'll notice that in the middle of the slide, your steering wheel will automatically countersteer as the tires follow the inertial path of the vehicle, and as the car straightens out, the steering wheel essentially aligns itself. This is a natural force that you use for any car that you're going to be using lots of oversteer, say on dirt or gravel, to turn the car, and in many cases you can kinda just let the car do all the work.

The problem with art of rally is this force doesn't exist in the game, meaning you have to do all the countersteering, and time it perfectly. If you countersteer for a fraction of a second too long, you get in a tankslapper. If you don't countersteer enough, it acts as if you're turning into the slide as opposed to letting the wheel self center. 

Uninstalled after about 3 hours of gameplay. If you want a fun laid back arcade experience with elements of weight and realism (and rally cars), I recommend Forza Horizon 4 (or maybe 5 since that's coming out soonish.) In my opinion, the lack of this simple yet crucial physical mechanic in the steering makes the game simply not enjoyable and not worth playing.

Some may tell you it's a skill issue or that it's supposed to be a difficult game, but it's only difficult because you are fighting the poorly made controls, rather than the difficulties of driving a monster rally car or a technical rally course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014564033', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 47, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1712149419}
review:
This is a game that i don't know i need.

Graphics : 10/10
Stylized, calming and old pc friendly

Gameplay : 10/10
It looks like an easy game to master, but boi I was wrong. Knowing where and when to brake, when to use the handbrake, what car to use for the particular stage, it was really fun. It feels so satisfying when you finally can drift smoothly from U turn to U turn, very satisfying.

Sound : 100/10
The BGM was banging. It's reallllyyyy goood. Period.

I really wish that the option to save replay exist just to see how smooth our driving is.

And also, if the devs made a similar game, but centered on GT race, endurance etc, I'd throw my money instantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264717157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1703970819}
review: This game is great. First off lets get this straight this game is not a racing sim by any stretch of the imagine. However, what it does it does really well. First this game is beautiful the art style is second to none. Second the the driving backs up the art style. This is the perfect arcade racer for any Motorsport fan, (specifically rally). If you figure out which cars are which it makes the game more enjoyable as well. I highly recomend this game to anyone looking for a great racing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131722640', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1578, 'last_played': 1632545608}
review:
SIM 랠리게임을 가볍게 즐길 수 있도록 아기자기한 그래픽에 경량화한 게임

그말은 즉슨 아기자기한 그래픽이지만 유사SIM정도의 물리엔진을 가지고 있다.
보조기능을 끄고 널널히 점수를 주자면 포르자 호라이즌정도 된다.
랠리에 필요한 브레이크 테크닉, 카운터스티어, 엔진브레이크, 엑셀링 등 모두 구현이 되어있고 쓸수록 기록이 단축되는 것을 볼 수 있다.
어느정도 수준있는 게임은 하고싶으나 헤비하게 플레이하기 꺼리다면 이 게임 적극 추천

단점이라면 차가 너무 가벼운 느낌이라 언덕 점프하는 순간 차가 저세상으로 날라간다.
헤어핀중 작은 언덕도 있는데 감속 제대로 안하면 하늘나라로 날라간다.

커리어모드만 해도 플레이타임 20시간 이상은 뽑으니 정가도 아깝지 않다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032402056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2475, 'last_played': 1682712990}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978568184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1632423939}
review:
IDK, the steering feels really weird for me but it's maybe because I was playing with a keyboard. It's a cool little game but keyboard control and overall physics of the cars seems a little off to me. I'll give it a shot with a controller though.

The cars physics do seem to be off. It's like they don't have enough weight and too easily slide from the smallest of turns. They don't seem to turn in well enough after hitting the breaks and the tendency is for the car to turn but then just slide sideways. Tires have grip on them unless these tires are completely worn down. In bad weather it's basically like your driving on ice. I think the  car physics need some serious work.

Still, I really like this game . if you can adjust to it's particular style of driving, it's very fun.

review:
Внешний вид игры может ввести в заблуждение, легко не будет. Ну, во всяком случае мне не было. 
В режиме карьеры (у меня вышло около 13 часов) можно покататься на машинах разных эпох и разочароваться в своих водительских навыках в каждой из них. 

Восемь с половиной турболагов из десяти.

P.S. Побочный эффект: вы будете ненавидеть Германию.

review: Very very fun game. teaches the history of rally in a cool way. Driving is challenging yet rewarding. The only down sides of this game are finding a car that suit your driving style can be a bit difficult. Bridges will eat your car if you're not careful. Thew thing that really annoys be is the off track reset can be a bit aggressive. Situation in which i could was was saving the car from crashing i get reset and handed a five second time penalty. Other than those little gripes. If you like rally then you like this game. Can be played super seriously or casually. The graphics are simple yet pretty, photo mode is very powerful (i currently have a 22B sliding a corner as my pc wallpaper). Buy it you wont regret it.
