review: "Strasznie wczoraj pojeździłem. Zacierałem silnik do piątej rano. Film mi się urwał jak wjechałem w baobab, teraz nie działa mi chłodnica. Trochę się podreperowałem, ale musiałem jechać, bo mam etap do wygrania. Niektórzy mówią, że nie można taranować drzew jak ma się pozycję lidera, ale to nie prawda. Można tylko trzeba nadganiać na prostej. Na tym polega sztuka rajdów."

author: {'steamid': '76561197992556689', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1643228798}
review: One of the better racing games I've played. Beautiful, elegant and focused, in a genre with desperately little of those qualities. Not the most realistic, nor most diverse, but easily the most pure rally racing game I've played. Plenty of fun to be had for your money, even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084229538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1692720418}
review: Los coches que se usan al principio no me convencieron mucho, estuve a punto de dejar el juego, pero cuando te pones a jugar con los grupo B, S, A...  mejora mucho, mucho mas entretenido y los sonidos de los coches son otra cosa, muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180521675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1634253703}
review:
我希望开发者不要让垃圾的物理毁掉这个好的游戏构想，有个主要问题希望你们重视：

重力加速度 - 我敢保证目前的重力加速度设定绝对不是9.8m/s^2，游戏里的数值远低于这个，估计只有3~5m/s^2，开发者可能是想借此增加赛车飞坡腾空的距离，但这么做导致了赛车在通过具有地形变化的弯道上反应非常不真实。例如当我经过一个位在凸起山坡上的左弯时，一经过坡顶车辆就完全腾空，车辆一定会飞出赛道（除非让车子的速度降到几乎要停止的程度，和现实物理完全不同），因为当车辆经过高点时，车辆落下的速度远低于正常的情况。



I really don't want the junk physics destroy this brilliant aesthetic design and overall scheme. I hope you pay attention to one main problem:

Gravity acceleration - I can guarantee that the current gravity acceleration setting is not 9.8m/s ^ 2. The value in the game is much lower than this, which is estimated to be only 3 ~ 5m / S ^ 2. The developer may want to increase the car's flying distance off the slope, but this makes the car's response on the curve with terrain change very unreal. For example, when I pass a left turn on a convex hillside, the vehicle will completely takeoff when passing the top of the slope. The vehicle will certainly fly out of the track (unless the vehicle's speed almost stops, which is entirely different from the real physics), because when the car passes the high point, the falling rate of the vehicle is much lower than the normal situation.

If this part is improved, the experience of the whole game will increase a lot. Please sacrifice the feeling of the car flying on the ramp and strengthen the physics of the vehicle when passing through the terrain. I believe it is easy for you. Just change the gravity acceleration value of the game. Of course, there are other physical defects in this game, But now I hope you can eliminate this critical defect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036363375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2237, 'last_played': 1633395971}

review: Beautiful, and surprisingly fun. What worried me most was the camera angle, yet I believe it has succeeded in execution. A lovely little game, great with a controller, however there are some visual bugs that sometimes irk me, such as vegetation pop-in and light-flickering on some terrain, even on highest settings. I happily look past these minor errors as the game is content-rich, feels fantastic, and is just overall great. Happy to support the devs with this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051335577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1701106154}
review:
Il remonte à loin le temps des jeux de course avec un bouton pour accélérer, un autre pour freiner, et ce en "tout ou rien". Là je réapprends à jouer en dosant l'accélérateur, et finir une course sans sortir de la route est déjà une victoire pour moi! Plus tard je tenterai de maîtriser les virages au frein à main.
Ceci-dit, pas de partie "apprentissage", ne serait-ce que théorique. Ni même d'indication des virages à venir, bien qu'à force on finit par reconnaître les pistes de mémoire.
La simplicité des décors est superbe, la gestion des lumières sublime, la conduite exigeante.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961252412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1638288991}

author: {'steamid': '76561198199899383', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1694289796}
review: A magnificent homage to the history of rally. Everything about this game just feels right, the physics, the environments, the cars, its a distinct and extremely fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970466767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1669538416}
review:
Addictif à souhait !
A part le mode exploration libre où je ne comprends peu l'interet, tout le reste est top. Le must est de jouer avec des amis qui ont le jeu car on peux se la régler a coup de chrono très facilement, et les courses hebdo/quotid donnent envie d'allumer le jeu juste pour la petite session journalière.
Gameplay avec une physique agréable et cohérente, les sons sont top et représente bien le type de véhicule, et il y à pleins de clins d'oeil au monde du rally et à son histoire dans les textes.

Bref pour le prix, et en plus si vous êtes dotés d'une manette pour la prise en main, c'set un must have !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970858434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1682468202}
review:
Art of Rally is a beautiful and soulful celebration of rallying in an accessible package.  Even though I don't get most of the references, you can tell a lot of love and care went into every aspect of this game.

Because rallying is just you and the road, the handling has to be great.  Art of Rally's biggest accomplishment is nailing the feel, characteristics, and "soul" of rallying in a controller-friendly and accessible way.  Even though you're so high above the car, you get a great feel for how to take turns, how to get your car straightened out, and when you're going WAY too fast.

This is a perfect "zen" game if you're into rally or racing games.  Just throw on your own tunes and handle the turns as they come.  Probably one of the best rally games of all time, up there with Dirt Rally, Rallisport Challenge 2, and Richard Burns.

review:

Good soundtrack and stage design as well. The daily challenges are great too.

I do think performance wise the game is a mixed bag. Yes it does look good but no reason it should be more taxing than most sim racing games with IMO look far better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046202248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1712451126}
review:
This little game is such a joy!
What may look like a gimmick game at first glance actually does a darn good job at capturing, you guessed it, the Art of Rally. Ironically, moreso than some recent AAA titles did ;) 

The only thing really missing here is some..."crunch".
Much like the low-poly artstyle, cornering can often feel too clean. The soundscape isn't quite there to give you feedback of how much your tires are biting into the ground.

Be warned though that the game has a relatively high learning curve. 
It definitely isn't a pick up and play experience and requires some sitting down and getting used to things.

But yeah, highly recommended! A beautiful little loveletter to the sport!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032244018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1712383510}
review:
As an avid rally gamer this game is deceptively brilliant.

It may look lo-fi with the simple polygon non-textured graphics and sound arcade-y with that pulsating synth-wave music throughout, yet under this exterior is one of the best car physics simulation I've come across in any rally game (yes, I've played many over the years).

You may think "yeah but why would I play this when I have [insert rally game] which also has awesome handling, an in-car view and proper realistic graphics?" the answer would be:

- the soundtrack is great
- the courses are fun with a bit of challenge to them

and most importantly (for me at least):

- the handling with a controller is the best I've come across

Of course it's not just a case of downloading the game and it handles great out of the box, there are fine-tuning options for the controller settings, and I would recommend playing around with these to get across the handling.

Overall this is an excellent simulation of rally beneath a very arcade-looking veneer, and the devs have continued to add new locations and cars since the release - I have definitely got my moneys worth.

review: A great, relaxing rally game. There is a decent selection of cars, each with different handling, liverlies, and engine audio. There's a nice career mode following rally history which will unlock more cars as you complete races. The graphics are splendid with a nice minimal aesthetic, however the lighting and colors of the different locations are fantastic. I definitely recommend for a chill racer, its one of the rare indies where you can feel all the developers passion being dumped into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028441712', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1611457304}
review:
[h1]74 / 100[/h1]

[i]Top-down racer taking more a simulation route than the usual arcade. Although offering a reasonably solid, no-frills rally experience, I felt like I spent more time fighting the controls than mastering the stages. Physics & weighting of the cars feel as inconsistent as the surface traction, often resulting in more frustration than fun, despite dialling in the controller sensitivity adjustments. Not all bad though; beautiful biome design, good stages with smooth camera control & great atmosphere.[/i]


✔️ Generally varied & well designed stages.
✔️ Smooth camera transitions even around complicated or sharp turns.
✔️ Less is more. Minimalist HUD & visual styling with strong seasonal/location themes that all look great!
✔️ All rally! No micro-managing of car setups or repairs.
✔️ Higher level of stage mastery promotes replayability as you attempt to best the leaderboards.
✔️ Supports Ultrawide 21:9 resolutions.
✔️ Regular post launch updates & content additions by passionate developers.

 ●  Could take great advantage of Steam Workshop, mod support / track editor.

❌ Terribly wonky car physics model; cars weight is too light, while traction feels non-existent much of the time.
❌ Dull engine, environment & crash sound effects.
❌ Corner cutting penalties are inconsistent.
❌ Limited value proposition due to relatively short 10-15hr career mode & limited mode variations. 
❌ Some optimisation performance issues, with infrequent stutters, frame drops & lighting issues (1080Ti).
❌ Awww .. you can't kill the stick spectators!
❌ Anti-capitalist :p .. Devs don't like capitals... anywhere!


[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6857016/][u]True Blue Reviews[/u][/url]

review: Incredible game! Beautiful art style, lots of great looking sceneries with numerous race tracks. The driving itself is easy enough to get started but challenging to master; each car category, down to each car itself, feels, drives, drifts and sounds completely different. On the topic of sound, the car engine sounds are impressive, and the soundtrack top notch. Career mode, free roam, custom events, and online daily & weekly events - it's all there. "art of rally" may look like a simple game, but it holds up to all the other racing games surprisingly well.

author: {'steamid': '76561199171008111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2581, 'last_played': 1704299728}
review: Such a fun, wholesome, and challenging rally game. It may look simplistic, but the skill required to drive well in this game is high. While you try to master this challenge the game is blessed with beautiful landscapes, an incredible set of soundtracks, a very detailed photo mode, online events and leaderboards. If you are looking for a rally game that has a perfect balance of beauty, skill, and fun, this game is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964576200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 62297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 283, 'playtime_at_review': 12907, 'last_played': 1712414240}
review: This game is a masterpiece. Yes, it may be a top down arcade game, something that could make sim fans look elsewhere, but its physic engine really puts many sims to shame (for me, it's the second best rally game after the great old Richard Burns Rally). Once you get the hang of the driving model, you will be hooked forever, AoR really is a work of love, and it shows it every moment you play. The only downside for me is that wheels are not officially supported, so they can work or not, but it's not a great problem in the end. It's a game meant to be played with a gamepad, but it's surprisingly good with a keyboard too. At the moment it has about 50 cars (plus some "extras"), ranging from group 2 to group A, and 7 rallies (Finland, Sardinia, Japan, Norway, Germany, Kenya, Indonesia) with another one incoming, for a total of 84 stages, considering normal and reverse versions (complete with daylight, night, fog, rainy/snowy conditions). Graphics speaks for themselves: Its wonderful, minimalistic art style is simply beautiful to look at, it's like looking at a childhood dream come true, with little cars running in amazing dioramas. It has beautiful replays and an A-M-A-Z-I-N-G photo mode to make every virtual photographer happy, especially now that you can create and/or import custom made liveries. It also has an amazing soundtrack. If you love cars, rally, or simply a game that you can easily pick up and play for a few minutes (but remember, this is one of those games where you say "just five minutes more" and then you look at the clock and hours have passed :) ) there's really no reason for not buying Art Of Rally. Do it. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051572731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1702982870}
review:
Good:
 - Charming graphics (I love this art style, remonds me of an old favourite, Frontier: Elite 2, but YMMV)
 - Challanging, but rewarding controls. Not a simulator, but has enough depth for car enthusiasts as well.
 - Short races, many chances to suspend/save progress. Makes it deal for playing in cofee breaks.
 - Funny car names and descriptions. 
 - Achievemnts are rewarding, can be pursued while having fun, without much grind. Also not having infinite achivements, inflating the value of them.

Bad:
 - Occasional lags
 - I was foolish to not get the OST. Would be nice playing in the car for night drives.
 - multiplayer is missing (though understandable both from tech, also from rally gameplay perspective)

author: {'steamid': '76561198241541324', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1685957600}
review: Excellent, simplistic, and beautiful rally game with quite a bit of challenge

author: {'steamid': '76561197987332666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1692845931}
review:
The game delivers on its premise of a more stylized rally experience. The cars are easily recognizable and the tracks are well designed.

My sole and major issue with it is that the default camera is far too zoomed out and your only options are to zoom it out even further, which makes it hard to navigate harder courses and judge jumps.

So this is basically a nominal recommendation, but I really hope the camera issue gets addressed at some point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970410699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1712110943}
review: I love the style of Art of Rally and it's super fun to play. I keep coming back to it, and it's easy to jump in and just play a stage or two if that's all you have time for. I have to give a mention to the sound design which Is tereffic; great music, and the cars all sound really good as well. One of my top picks for a casual racing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316495070', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 138, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1712496078}
review: 一旦上手非常上头的游戏，较好的驾驶模拟，简化但是也很实际的损伤可以带来非常好的游玩体验。难度可控，辅助不带辅助，自动挡手动挡都有很好的体验，适合入门到高手的所有阶段，非常推荐的一款游戏。希望可以加联机模式和一些赛道用来和朋友联机。

author: {'steamid': '76561198065327991', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1630214006}
review:
This game is very cute, and most of the time very fun. I enjoy whipping little blocky cars down the gravel and dirt.

However, when playing the career mode it gets insulting to be told driving my heart out is 7th place, when I did all I could to WHIP my neutron star with bald tires down the gravel track. All of the cars feel weirdly heavy, and as someone who does a lot of driving in real life, sometimes in questionable terrain, the amount of grip (or lack thereof) makes the cars feel too loose. Cars in the real world - especially on tarmac - will corner *way* harder than you think they will before they lose grip.

Maybe it's because I'm playing it with a controller, but to me the physics makes the cars feel dialed a few clicks in the wrong direction.

Overall though, it's still a blast if you're not playing for times, and I recommend picking it up. Especially if it's bundled with the author's other game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992719626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 34, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1712436718}
review:
Ich muß meine alte Rezession verwerfen.
Nach dem ich das Spiel nun mittlerweile fast durchgespielt habe,muß ich schon sagen das es wirklich zu empfehlen ist.
Es gibt schon ein/zwei Strecken die etwas nervig sind,weil Bäume oder Häuser in entscheidenden Ecken im Weg stehen und der Kreis mit dem man hindurchschauen kann schon ein bisschen klein geraten ist. Aber im großen und ganzen merkt man,daß viel Liebe drin steckt.
Und ich liebe diese Lichtspiele mit den verschiedenen Tageszeiten. Die Atmosphäre ist einfach nur geil!
Die Steuerung ist sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig,aber mal was anderes. Wenn man sich reingefuchst hat,macht es Spaß.
Ich habe aber nie das Gefühl die Autos zum 100% unter Kontrolle zu haben. Das ist vielleicht der Perspektive geschuldet und so gewollt.
Trotz allem kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121470942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1700197873}
review: fell in love with the trailer of this game when first announced, loved the demo and played on game pass. loved the game so much i went and payed full price here on steam so i could support the devs. couldnt recommend the game more, specially for people who love rally

author: {'steamid': '76561198858672439', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1658003073}
review:
Este juego arruinó mi vida, descuidé una relación de 6 años con mi prometida, no asistí al funeral de mi abuelo, no fui a mi propia graduación, robaron muchas de mis pertenencias, me despidieron del trabajo de mis sueños y el poco dinero que me quedaba lo desperdicié en este juego comprando ayudas para cada carrera.
Ya no tenía ni siquiera dinero para comprar una botella de agua, tenía que beber del grifo de mis vecinos y cuando me veían haciéndolo me daba pena voltear a ver, me avergonzaba de mi mismo, un hombre sin asearse por semanas, desnutrido y con poca habilidad para caminar bebiendo agua del grifo de mis vecinos mientras ellos me veían con decepción, me doy asco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025929158', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1647830750}
review:
As a big rally/driving game fan, I highly recommend. Some people were complaining about the controls on Xbox controller- I use an Xbox one controller and have zero issues.

I think it's important to note that while this game has chill visuals and looks casual, the driving mechanics and gameplay are closer to a more hardcore driving/rally sim - if you are looking for serious driving mechanics you will be happy for sure. If you usually play more arcady driving games I think this would be a great game to pick up to start to get into more hardcore driving games. 

Overall highly recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561197994033639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 115022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2502, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1712495554}
review: Really good game. I was initially on the fence about trying it. Then I saw they made Absolute Drift, which I loved. This is that game with better physics, no finicky scoring system, and way prettier. My only complaint is that the auto reset when you go too far off road can be a bit trigger happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047353869', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1707446414}
review:
I recommend art of rally. Everything is designed for a beautiful racing experience.

The presentation is great when the courses are saturated with colour but can still be appreciated in less vivid courses such as snow or desert based environments. The presentation never distracts when racing but the game did make me reevaluate my own computers brightness and contrast settings which I think is a positive thing, after all.

Despite the minimalist presentation, art of rally can still be quite CPU intensive so I hope optimisations can continue to be made.

The driving is great and generally satisfying but as other reviews have stated, the steering sensitivity can be improved. Such as implementing speed-dependent sensitivity and additional settings to provide the user with the stability they are comfortable with to greatly improve the experience. It's not the cornering I have most difficulty with but it's the longer stretches of track where I am discouraged to steer discreetly due to the high sensitivity.

I like the majority of the courses but the addition of signs or some indication of the condition of the approaching corner will greatly improve the game. Playing the career mode would be a great way to learn as you play but the rallies are chosen by random so the time it takes to learn specific tracks is now exaggerated unless you go out of your way to learn on specific tracks, in my opinion.

A much smaller criticism is how the crowds work. The density is great, especially at the low setting but I found it distracting how the crowd can move onto the track to avoid your car which I think is silly.

In combination with the highly sensitive steering, sometimes the car can be thrown unfairly upon landing from even the smallest of elevations. Continuous improvements to the ground will be appreciated.

High praise goes to the soundtrack. Especially because of it specifically being instrumental (at least from what I've heard so far). In my experience, soundtracks in racing games tend to be varied enough to create a sense of personality that clashes with the game itself, creating a disconnect from the experience. In this case, the soundtrack is so listenable that it feels as vital as the visuals or game physics are to contribute to art of rally's charm.

In conclusion, if you value the simple joy of racing with a delightful presentation and immersive soundtrack, I don't think you will regret this purchase, especially on sale. The game will just get better and better and I hope my concerns here will be ultimately addressed in some capacity in future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149825332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1644872023}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073615658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1638510978}
review:
The only game I know that can put up a fight with The Witcher 3, when it comes to its sunsets.
Although the handling is brutal and it takes a while to get used to it, the pride and joy I got from this game when I pull a perfect slide, or when I finish a stage with no damage or penalties whatsoever, is amazing.
I honestly think it can be enjoyed even by people that are not into racing or car games, just because of the marvelous art style and its music. Also, on a last note, this "little indie game" has better car and engine sounds than any other game I've ever played, and that's saying something. Truly worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135568961', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1701007313}
review:
ポップな色調で描かれたWRC題材のレースゲームです。世界観としては「グループBが1986年限りで終了することなく、そのまま1987年からグループS規定が施行されていたパラレルワールドのWRC」を追体験するゲームとなっています。

一昔前のチョロQシリーズを彷彿とさせるような可愛らしいルックスとは裏腹に、挙動はさながらDiRT Rallyシリーズに近いリアル寄りの味付け。コーナー進入前にはしっかり荷重を前に移動して、スロットルコントロールで車を曲げていくゲームです。リアル寄りとはいうもののデフォルトのアシスト設定でゲームパッドを使用すれば難易度は絶妙なバランスが保たれています。

グループSの行われたパラレルワールドという世界観に相応しく、登場車種も定番からマニアックな代物まで抜け目なく収録されています。LADAの試作していたEVAプロトやルノー17など、巷に出回っているラリーゲームではなかなかお目にかかれない車種も多く、100点満点と言ってもいいでしょう。

コースや車種はアップデートでどんどん増えているため、とりあえず買っておいて損は無い作品だと思います。RaceDepartmentでユーザースキンが導入できるのもメリット。

author: {'steamid': '76561198121458573', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1702152277}
review:
Jsuis très partagé: ça se répète très vite, et c'est soit incroyablement addictif, oit incroyablement frustrant. Et y'a pas d'entre deux.
C'est en fait soit le meilleur jeu de rallye que je connaisse, soit le pire.

On part sur une approche historique du rallye, depuis sa genèse en groupe 2 jusqu'au groupe A. Après ça, on embraye sur les propulsions, puis l’avènement des 4 roues motrices.
Deux modes de jeu principaux: Carrière et CLM. La Carrière peut vite soûler, mais c'est par là que je conseille de commencer. Les CLM sont beaucoup plus relax, mais ça reste véner.
Question gameplay, le mélange décors/voitures est piégeur: attention aux arbres, ravins, et limites de terrains qui peuvent mettre la voiture hors-jeu...  Trop facilement. D'ailleurs, jouer avec certains modèles s'apparente plus à de l'autoflagellation que du jeu, vu leur comportement... Le survirage et le sous-virage sont présent, même si avec le déclic, au final, les voitures inutilisables sont plutôt rares. Sauf les voitures à moteur central, propulsion. Elles sont toutes inconduisibles. Ironique, puisque c'est censé être le type idéal pour le sport.
Bon je dis ça mais les véhicules ont la tendance désagréable à "s'accrocher" aux barrières, comme s'ils étaient aimantés. Je sais normalement ça rebondit pas non plus mais y'a un entre-deux... Quand je suis scotché à un mur alors que je l'ai éraflé, c'est un "chouilla" frustrant. Oh, et le drift, il faut oublier. La perte d'adhérence à basse vitesse est si pénalisante que c'est juste à faire pour le fun.

AoR, c'est ça: un côté lowpoly un peu relax, contrasté par une conduite qui nécessite une précision plus ou moins au pouillème près. Avec des voitures plus ou moins maniables et des étapes où il peut neiger (urgh) ou pleuvoir (aled). Steam censure le verbe neiger? C'est hilarant. Bref, la difficulté, la spécificité de la voiture et de la carte rends le pilotage très... convaincant, hypnotisant même. Arpenter des kilomètres en bagnole n'as jamais été si... Primal. Quand on a dé-cliqué. Le jeu te fait kiffer si t'es sur la bonne longueur d'onde mais te fait trimer à des niveaux assez salaces sinon. Il pardonne pas.

Il y a des choses bien (la réparation de caisse toutes les 2 spéciales), mais il manque des trucs. Un chtit briefing du parcours sur le point d'être arpenté? Le tracé, le dénivelé et quand la route change de type? Svp? Une animation pour le podium, au lieu d'une triste liste? Plus de voitures? (R.i.p Opel mantas, kit-cars et cie). Ah, et pendant qu'on y est, peut-être changer la physique de certaines barrières, qui sont apparemment faites en béton? Après si tu les touches pas tu verras pas la différence. Mais faut le déclic.
En parlant de customisation, un éditeur de niveau permettrait d'avoir des choses plus variées et plus rapidement. Je sais que les dévs font des màj régulièrement mais c'est pas assez. Me resservir la même carte à l'envers  en tant que nouvelle spéciale ça commence à me soûler.
Un workshop serait la solution évidente... Qu'est-ce qu'on attend?

Bon. C'est quand même Incroyable. Malgré l'aspect lowpoly, le maniement des voitures est très convaincant. Un peu trop même. C'est les MicroMachines rétros en rallye: c'est dur, parfois très satisfaisant, parfois très frustrant. Et maintenant j'aime ni les bottes de foins, ni l’Allemagne. Par contre j'aime l'Italie  <3
"A love letter to rally", ouep jsuis bin d'accord. On sent la passion des dévs et ça ça déchire.
21 boules, c'est ptet un chouilla cher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058880966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1683502480}
review:
That feeling when it all connects, you carve the perfect line, dropping into second as you glide through a corner like you were born to rally, feathering just enough throttle to maintain perfect traction, pop into 3rd and roar into the straight away like a lioness taking town prey....
And then you slam into a boulder at 60 mph because you'll never be that perfect again. It's a drug, and the beauty of that brief moment has you hooked, scrabbling through the dirt until you get your next hit. This is a wonderful game. As frustrating as it is beautiful. Exactly what it should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962124686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1631789555}
review:
操作難易度は高いけどミスには寛容なゲーム性。
dirt rallyの難しさにへこまされてきた人を温かく迎え入れてくれます。
初心者はダメージ無し、イージーでやれば10回ぐらい
コースアウト事故しても1位取れるほどぬるいのでお勧め。
これがdirt rallyだったら2度以上事故ったらまず上位入賞は無理なので
その違いが良くわかると思う。
道も広くて路肩のスピードペナルティも無いので走りやすい。
これも路肩に乗り上げただけで制御不能になって事故るdirt rallyとは
違う点になります。
このへんがカジュアルかなと思いますが、
操作はdirt rallyに近いと言われているほどシビアです。
ドリフトもdirt rallyよりかはしやすく感じました。
そんなカジュアルさとリアルさとが混じった塩梅が心地よい作品です。
ゲームテンポもよく気づいたら2時間ぶっ続けてたとかよくあります。
純粋に面白いです。お勧め。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072936119', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1691805820}
review:
When I play other racing games, I never really get that feeling of doing something cool. Going 200 mph in a desktop chair versus a car seat are very different feelings, but, that is the reason a lot of people play racing games. That reason being the pursuit of that feeling. Art of Rally doesn't really care about that feeling, but in that same breath, do a great job of giving you that feeling. If I can pickup a game and be really good at it, it doesn't really make me feel something when I do something good. If i can pickup a game and be completely terrible at it and then I do something cool, that feeling of accomplishment is much much greater. Art of Rally is a pretty hard game first starting out, you cannot just effortlessly glide around corners. I wanted to touge drift initial d every corner, but you will learn very quickly that you can't. This lack of familiarity is a breath of fresh air for the racing genre. If you are good at one racing game, you are good at 95 percent of them. If you are good at 95 percent of racing games, you are not going to be great at this one. Approaching this with a xbox controller, I was barely finishing on the podium in the campaign until half way through. Then, I somehow managed to drift 3 consecutive hairpins and gunned it on the straight, and let me tell you, that feeling was amazing. The sense of accomplishment tied to the feeling of this game is so unique that once you get a taste you will not let go. So whatever you do, don't get frustrated at quit 2 hours in because you are bad at the game. Give it some time, and then, when you hit that crazy drift, you will feel what I'm feeling.
Buy the fucking game idiot

author: {'steamid': '76561198089139830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1699577732}
review: What do you want out of a racing game? Most people want their favorite cars, customization, and multi player capabilities. All I want out of a racing game is good physics and good tracks, and this game delivers tenfold. The cars are all based on real rally vehicles, and the tracks real locations. There's plenty of opportunities to throw the cars sideways, reach high speeds in long straightaways, and wipe out of you aren't careful. It might not be for everyone, but I personally LOVE the simplistic art style combined with realistic driving physics, and the soundtrack is impeccable. What more COULD you want from a racing game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198054004608', 'num_games_owned': 3276, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2433, 'last_played': 1626864896}
review:
Art of Rally is a beautiful game with smooth controls, good soundtracks and pleasing aesthetics. Mechanically it's great and gives an adequate challenge for those that are really good in these types of rally games. I personally aren't really good in rally games, but driving on medium difficulty was fair enough for me with a decent amount of challenge. I thoroughly enjoyed this game and some of the achievements got me chuckling.

I recommend this game if you are a fan of rally type games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130557897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1660591876}
review:
This is a very nice, addicting and beautiful game and I totally recommend for the racing lovers that are looking for drifts, car noises, cool references for old school cars that made history.

What standout for me: People on the tracks passing in front of the car, like we see on the old rally videos made me feel more like a rally pilot.
Nature and animals all around made everything more wild and real, which is a big part of the great art style we find everywhere in this game.
Lots of references to old tracks, cars, liveries and brands with similar names to the original ones, so you'll have to guess which car, oil company, or livery is it irl (this was clever and way more fun to try and remember the original names than I was expecting) including some paint jobs that reminded me of the 80's cigarette brands on cars which I appreciate.
Also, if you manage to turn your cars upside down, you'll find hashtags that are a fun touch, so let me just say #PASTA, since it's my most beloved rally car of all times (you know which one is it, right?).

 Some suggestions: More than only 5 different banners on the tracks would be appreciated.
The animals could move more and maybe even walk around.
Short (5 to 7 seconds) cut scenes when arriving at a new country country, or even leaving it (maybe an animal crossing the road, trucks working on the tracks, people arriving for the race would give each challenge more engaging.
Only two countries for each group would make the next one a completely new game and in order not to shorten every part of the game there could be more tracks in each country, for example: In group A we have Finland and Germany, but each with much more tracks, in different places and weather conditions, so then group B could be only Italy and Kenya (and so forth).
I know that it would break a little the original chronology of how the sport happened irl, but this is a game and I hope to see Brazil, Australia, Russia in the future, for example :)
Instead of only smoke and ash, visible bumps and crashes would be awesome.

Cons: After you finish the second group, everything start to become a bit boring, nothing changes, only the crowd gets bigger, but you feel like repeating the game hundreds of times, only with different cars.
I don't really care for the vans, trucks and others, but I understand there might be some people that like it, so why not make a competition only for those? like a part of the game, a sub group in the desert maybe, with jeeps and trucks.

Anyways, there is a lot more I'm not mentioning here, but for the size of this review you might get the point that I enjoyed it and hope to see not only more tracks, but also more flavor to the game, more challenges, lore, videos, cars, old school propaganda, a narrator maybe, customization.
That's it, congratulations for the game, I'm probably going to plat the previous one now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029817113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1631483493}
review:
I was impressed at the depth of this game. I was expecting a very simple driving model, but within a few minutes of playing I realized that the driving model is deep enough to give the player a lot of the key components of rally driving. Weight transfer is modelled, allowing you to tuck the nose in by lifting of the gas, or if more rotation is required, stabbing the brakes. Weight transfer also allows for the scandinavian flick. The e-brake is modelled, for when weight transfer isn't enough and more low speed rotation is required. The clutch is modelled, which allows for clutch-kicking to get the rear out, similar to using the e-brake but when you want to gain speed/radius instead of decrease.

I was not expecting to get much enjoyment out of the game since I'm accustomed to the realism of rally sims, and also real life rallycross. But they've got just enough of the core driving tools to make it interesting.

My only complaint so far is that some of the engine sounds are terrible. In a game trying to distill rallying to just a few core pillars, with sound being one of them, it sticks out like a sore thumb. Cars with very unique engine sounds like 911s and Imprezas have very generic 4-cylinder-like sounds in this game and it kind of takes me out of the experience.

TL;DR:
Pros: More realistic driving model than expected, with tools such as weight transfer, e-brake, clutch kicking allowing you to sort of drive the car like you would want to in an actual rally sim.

Cons: Engine sounds on some cars with very unique engine sounds in real life, instead have very generic sounds in game that take you out of the experience.

Summary: Really fun and complex enough for someone that's used to rally sims or real life rallycross/stage rally.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970151998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1629270146}
review:
This game has so much potential.  As has been mentioned in lots of other reviews the driving model is great.

Unfortunately if you want to play with a controller it has what is for me a serious flaw.  The steering is not proportional to speed, so it's very difficult to keep the car on the road during the fast sections.  The result is that you end up trying to just bump the stick slightly left or right and it's not a pleasant way to steer the car.  

It also makes it difficult to position the car for the corners.

The game doesn't have controller sensitivity/dead zone settings.  For me there is too much of a dead zone that again makes it difficult to make small corrections at high speed.

There is a way around this, and that is to turn on artificial stability, the game defaults this to 100%, like that the issue with steering the car in the straights goes away but the car doesn't feel great to drive to me.

To make things worse, if the stability control is below 100% it seems to come in and out in a way that makes recovering from slides around corners more difficult and leads to fishtailing. 

So I found myself in a position where if I wanted cornering to feel good I had to turn off artificial stability, but then it's almost impossible to tweak road position at high speed.  Or I could turn on artificial stability to max, and be able to control the car at high speed, but lose a lot of the feel around corners.

That's been my experience, it took me more than two hours to figure all this out so I'm not likely to get a refund.  I write this review as a warning to others.  If you buy this game and find the controls weird take the above into account and maybe see if you need to get a refund within the two hours.

review: Love this game. On the surface it looks to be a potentially shallow game of 80's style synth music and a low poly retro feel but under the covers it is an approachable fun rally driving game that uses its visual and audio to cover a pretty great driving model. Well worth the money and a great game for a controller.

review: Beautiful game that's easy to play but hard to be good at—strikes a great balance between fun and challenging. The minimalist aesthetic may be deceptive: this game has lots of depth, with career mode, time trials, daily/weekly challenges, and free roam mode. And it doubles as a history lesson. All around, an example of really brilliant game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982837520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1656947489}
review:
Art of Rally,

Let's be honest, I'm really not good at this game, but I'm having fun playing while rying to best my stage times.
Are the controls realistic? I dunno; I never had the opportunity to drive a rally race car, but who cares. It feels okay in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300504677', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1659942553}
review:
This is a fun pick-up-and-play game, and looks nice. Two nitpicks.
1. on some tracks my winning strat is lots of jerky starting and stopping just to keep the car on the road. For instance if the car is too fast, or there's water everywhere. This is not very fun.
2. there isn't an indication of the upcoming track, unlike most rally games. So sometimes you just are guessing/gambling what's coming up, which feels out of place. For example, if you have a long straight road leading up to a crest, what do you think is after that jump? You either memorize the track or have to gamble on going fast or slow.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980125810', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1608024736}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198000490800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3188, 'last_played': 1700197231}
review: Fantastic controls, despite being very much an arcade style rally game, the controls and accessibility are well implemented and feel tight. By far my most favorite rally game (and personally racing in general). Each car is unique and handles as different as the last and offers a learning curve to each map and car.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031600521', 'num_games_owned': 1597, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1677429129}
review:
art of rally sieht zwar fast schon "niedlich" aus aber es ist knüppelhart. Anders als bei anderen Rally Sim Spielen wie Dirt Rally, liegt der Fokus bei art of rally jedoch nicht auf Lenkrad support und man kann auch sehr gut mit Gamepad das Spiel erleben. Als Anfänger sollte man erst mal versuchen, ohne Schrammen bis zum Ziel zu kommen, anstatt sicke Drifts abzuliefern und damit kommt man bereits sehr weit in der sehr großen Kampagne durch die "goldenen Jahre" des Rally mit Gruppe 2, 3, 4, B, A und S und all ihren ikonischen Autos, auch wenn diese eher "abstrakt" bezeichnet werden da dem Entwickler schlicht die Lizenzen fehlen.

art of rally hat eine gute native Linux Version, die Proton Version läuft ein wenig schlechter zumindest für mich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000142789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1685555248}
review:
BRRRAAAAAAP, BRRRAAAAAAP, BRRRAAAAAAP… SQQEEEEE… BRRRAAAAAAP, BRRRAAAAAAP. 

As you emerge into the world of ‘art of rally’, you instantly become engulfed in the beauty of this game. The graphics are not pushing any boundaries, but it is a glorious throwback to simpler times that gives you a fuzzy feeling. The sounds the cars make are addicting. I look forward to each shift just to hear the gear engage. The sounds stick with me even in IRL (see above). The music is enjoyable and suits the game nicely. Controls are a solid 9/10. I’m used to simulators like ACC, and I find the controls intuitive and crispy, especially for a controller game. ‘art of rally’ is a refreshing masterpiece. It’s relaxing, fun, and easy to jump into even if you only have 15 minutes to play. At ~$25 USD this is must have. If you are thinking about this game; stop! Just buy it and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262925215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 168, 'playtime_at_review': 15888, 'last_played': 1712500651}
review:
The vibrant art style, scenic landscapes mixed together with an amazing soundtrack and challenging, yet enjoyable gameplay. Unforgiving at times but also provides maximum satisfaction when you get it spot on. The game isn't trying to be as realistic like Dirt Rally 2.0 but retains some realism with it's decently complex physics. Every car in each group felt mostly different to one another except for group S where most cars felt understeery and straight to super oversteery when trying to input more turning. Overall, this game is truly a love letter to the rally heritage made with lots of dedication. Definitely would recommend trying it out.

Also, turbo go tsutsutsutsu

author: {'steamid': '76561197987658658', 'num_games_owned': 1431, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1708862845}
review:
[Code] Retrouvez mes avis par tonne ici : https://steamcommunity.com/groups/LEDODO/curation [/code] 


Il y a des jeux, on a vite compris où ils voulaient en venir, je veux dire, en 30 minutes, je peux déja vous dire que ce jeu indé est un vrai petit joyau fabriqué avec soin et minutie, on sentirait presque l'obsession maladive du développeur, son perfectionnisme transpiré à travers les pixels.

Jeu de rallye au confluents de l'arcade et de la simulation. L'interface est sommaire, pas mal d'épreuves, qui parcourent différentes époques du rallye, des années 60 aux voitures S des années 2000, chaque parcours est généré aléatoirement, ce qui donne un renouvellement constant des pistes. Son côté sommaire rebute clairement, pas d'enrobage, pas d'histoire, pas d'amélioration à débloquer ou de progression, outre la puissance des moteurs et donc la difficulté du contrôle et de la gestion du rapport puissance/adhérence.


Une fois votre épreuve choisie, vous vous retrouvez avec une vue du dessus de la voiture et vous devez réussir votre course en évitant de vous foutre dans des décors qui sont, il faut bien le dire, très joli, je pense qu'on peut dire qu'ils sont low-poly et très coloré avec un très bon travail sur la lumière qui donne vraiment une ambiance apaisante. Ambiance qui contraste avec l’exigence de la conduite. La musique electro est...sympa mais j'aurais voulu autre chose, quelque chose de plus doux, en accord avec les environnement. De l'electro plus ...dépressif m'aurait plus d'avantage, étrangement.

Sincèrement, ne prenez pas ce jeu pour un jeu de rallye arcade, ce n'est pas du tout sa niche, c'est plus proche de la simu que de l'arcade, les voitures sont lourdes, glissent facilement et il n'est pas question de foncer et d'esperer que ça passe, surtout que le jeu ne tolère pas le moindre écart. Et c'est dans cet aspect du jeu qu'on voit que le dev y est allé à fond. J'adore les sensations de conduite, la physique et les environnements, c'est vraiment une bonne surprise.

J'aurais voulu un vrai mode campagne, autre que ce mode qui demande de finir premier sans redémarrages dans toutes les épreuves (bon courage): une galerie? des cosmétiques a mettre sur sa bagnole? une progression plus ...pertinente… 

Reste un excellent jeu de bagnole pour se vider la tête et se concentrer sur une tâche plus complexe que son esthétique ne le laisse paraître. Réussir une course est vraiment gratifiant et le développeur a vraiment trouver un bon mix qui prend bien.

Je  sais qu'il déploie des mises à jour gratuite, toujours une bonne chose, une marque respectable d’investissement à saluer.

Un excellent jeu de bagnoles, ne passez pas à côté si c'est votre truc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034143744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1668973417}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021676273', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1652983345}
review:
Идеальный способ познакомиться с ралли, а тем, кто уже знаком - почилить и приятно провести время (удивительно, но это гонка про ралли, в которой можно расслабиться, а не вытирать всё время пот со лба).
Подробнее о плюсах:
+ Кайфовый визуальный стиль. Эта игра вновь пробудила во мне игрового фотографа (не знаю, как ещё это можно назвать, но из фоторежима меня не вытащить)
+ Ретровейв и весь этот антураж 80х с золотой эпохой ралли
+ Довольно интересная физика как для аркады, не дающая при всём этом заскучать
В общем, своих денег точно стоит, рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121930280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1646435252}
review: its not hyper-realistic like the dirt rally series or as arcade-y as the dirt main series, still gives the impression you're swinging an unwieldy machine over loose gravel at 200kph while also giving the impression you should have no care in the world. You're gonna crash but who gives a shit LOOK AROUND! there's no punishment if you fuck up... just run it back if you want to, or continue advancing into this alternate universe of rally... it can be relaxing, it can be exciting and the best part is that it's up to the player to decide which they want. i immediately love this game... needs more camera positions though, would like to have a driver view camera

author: {'steamid': '76561199052620414', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1628774866}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998818164', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1689758807}
review: This is a game that rewards  you for as much time as you're willing to put into it. This is not a silly little arcade game. This game isn't something you'll jump in and be amazing  at in your first go. This game is EXACTLY what it says on the tin. It's a game about the art of rally, and like any art it takes practice. I first picked up this game and hated it. it isn't as easily fun as Absolute Drift (the designers previous game) and at first I hated how bad I was and how I could barely make it through a stage without getting penalties or crashing or flying so far out of bounds that I might as well be playing a catapult simulator. This frustration changed from rage to acceptance to focus to zen. Now I peacefully am working on a time attack and slowly climbing the ladder. You can race against your own PB and just keep trying to beat it, slowly racking up ranking on the leaderboards and for some reason it's just... perfect tranquility and a delightful time. So... would I recommend this game to anyone? no. But I would probably recommend this game to anyone who's read this far.  If you've got the patience for my rambling then you probably have what it takes to really like this game because getting fun out of this game isn't about being good, it's about being zen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127664979', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1702501488}
review:
This is not [i]Absolute Drift, but with rally cars[/i]. This is a rally game. The view is not top-down, it's actually regular third-person "chase"-camera, just set up at higher altitude so you can see more of the stage. Consequently, there is no need for co-driver calls. I'll quote Michèle Mouton here: "No pacenotes – just you in the car having to do the fastest time. This, to me, is rallying."

Every location is its own island that can be explored in free roam mode like any open world. The stages are laid out as routes through existing roads. One thing to note is that most of the stages aren't that sophisticated, the roads are flat with not a lot of jumps, crests or sharp turns. Neither is there any long straight sections to go flat out on. You'd be lucky to push 200 km/h in this game. And only a couple of late-game cars can go that fast anyway: all Group B ones are feel underwhelming and noticeable slower than later cars. (Apparently that is because in this universe events of 1986 have never unfolded, therefore Group A regulations are much more loose, with Fujin/95' Impreza pushing over 800 hp instead of 300 in our world, so there's that).

My favorite location by far is Japan, this is the most technical one, with lots of hairpins, and also the largest one. Though i also also like Kenya and Sardinia. I wish there were more locations like this. Finland and Germany is frankly unimpressive and not at all what you would expect coming from other rally games.

Good game, 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152061530', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1731, 'last_played': 1704128777}
review:
20 quid might be a bit of an ask for some people but there is a lot of content with the different stages, cars, and freeroam areas with collectables. The driving feels great and you can tell they put a lot of thought and effort in to making each car handle like their real life counterpart. There is some replay value too as you need to complete the rallies without using all your restarts to unlock bonus liveries.

All round I'd say its worth picking up if you are a rally fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969937629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1675363228}
review:
Ce jeu est vraiment très bon !
La maniabilité est géniale, on est clairement du côté des simulations, on prend vraiment plaisir à jouer et rejouer.
Les graphismes sont hyper sympas et rafraîchissants.
Le son des voitures est pas top, mais pour un studio indépendant franchement c'est du super boulot à tous les niveaux.
Et que dire de toutes ces voitures de légende, c'est ce qui est le plus énorme à piloter dans les jeux de rallye.
100% recommandé, en plus pas cher, vivement du contenu supplémentaire.

author: {'steamid': '76561199019311003', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1675962626}
review:
Если в случае с Absolute Drift можно было отключить всю помощь и полностью контролировать свой болид, набивая при этом гораздо лучшие результаты, то тут просто жесть... Машина, как утюг катится туда-сюда. Невозможно управлять нормально. Я пытался часа два привыкнуть к управлению, под конец просто включил АКПП, все абс и тд. и тупо стало неинтересно. В итоге удалил.
Я не скажу, что игра плохая, но управление явно не мне не зашло. В остальном же, она прекрасна.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164491825', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1693943168}
review:
[i] Казалось бы... [/i]
Расскажу немного об этой игре. Очень круто на самом деле, для фанов ралли пойдет, но есть нюансы.
Не бейте, отзывы пишу не часто, очень не часто)))
И так, давайте по порядку:
[h1] 1- Графика [/h1]
Сделано круто, даже в таком стиле. Графоdroчеры проходите мимо, эта игра не про графику.
Очень играбельно, и в целом то что нужно именно для этой игры. Глаз не отвлекается на всякие детали касаемо окружения, все так как надо, имхо. Иногда возникают сложности при определении уклона трассы, что создает проблемы при ее прохождении, подробнее в физике...
P.S. Поверьте, качество спецучастков не оставит вас равнодушными даже при такой, казалось бы, малополигональной графике)
[h1] 2- Атмосфера [/h1]
Заставляет прочувствовать ту эпоху, когда ралли было на пике своей популярности. Начало всей раллийной эпохи как части автоспорта, рассвет группы б, полного привода, бешеных машин... В общем атмосфера здесь крутая, можно почувствовать вот эти моменты 80-90х годов.
Можно читать повествование и краткие рассказы каждого десятилетия в ралли. Так же у машин есть описания, что еще больше может погрузить в историю ралли. Описания порой бывают забавные, а некоторые вовсе смешными) Те кто знают некоторые факты из истории в ралли - оценят)
Даже присутствуют немного исковерканные имена Знаменитых раллистов, что тоже придает маленький нюанс к атмосфере, будто ты гоняешь действительно там, с ними, в то самое время...
[h1] 3- Геймплей [/h1]
Как такового сюжета тут нету. Есть карьера, где вам предстоит пройти 5 исторических эпох ралли, начиная от Renault Alpine и заканчивая вплоть до Subaru 22b Колина Макрея. Ну и естественно всеми любимая audi quattro там тоже есть)
После прохождения карьеры мы можем баловаться в свободных заездах и настраиваемых гонках, либо же мериться [strike] пиписьками [/strike] скиллом прохождения трасс с другими игроками по заданным трассам с заданными машинами при заданных погодных условиях. Так же есть несколько открытых карт, где можно поездить и пособирать ачивки, поделать фоточки, понаходить интересный транспорт (в том числе можно найти машину [i] разработчиков [/i])))
За победы открывают новые автомобили и стили покраски. Некоторые из стилей совсем не характерны для ралли и выглядят забавно)) Реально забавно))
Так же в игре есть 43 достижения, которые не дадут вам заскучать, так как выбить их все тоже нужен скилл и интерес.
В общем и целом, если вы останетесь играть в этой игре больше 200 часов, то вам либо понравилась графика с музыкой, либо вы мазохист, потому что особо в этой игре делать нечего.
[h1] 4- Физика [/h1]
При всем моем желании, назвать эту игру по физике добротной я не могу. Очень она специфичная. Сначала кажется что она не сложная, но как только вы захотите ехать быстро, на том же максимальном уровне сложности - вэлком страдать попоболью, потому что штурмана в этой игре нет, и нужно будет заучивать трассы дабы проехать быстро. Любой трамплин - рулетка вероятности, потому что неизвестно как у тебя приземлится машина, и, соответственно что с ней будет при приземлении. (P.S. Совет для начинающих - первое время на трамплинах не прыгайте! от слова совсем. потому что может повлечь  за собой либо вылетом с трассы, либо столкновением с деревом или другими препятствиями.)
Даже не думайте лезть в онлайн состязания, если на последнем уровне сложности вы не будете стабильно ехать на тумбе (1-3 место по времени относительно ботов). Не нужно будет себя огорчать проездом с плохим временем среди людей которые изучают уже тонкости спецучастка где можно ехать быстрее, потому что в онлайне если не будешь чисто ехать и много срезать - не быть тебе в топе(
Так же хочу отметить расположение камеры. Она здесь расположена нестандартно высоко, относительно любых гоночных игр. Как будто ты наблюдаешь за настоящей радиоуправляемой машинкой сидя в вертолете. Как то так.
В общем в игре можно как просто поовощить, так и страдать с привыканием к физике.
[h1] 5- Саундтрек [/h1]
Боже, это прекрасно. Я не думал, что сочетание Ретро-вейва с ралли будет настолько крутым. Самое интересное, что треков здесь около 50 штук, и написал их [u] украинский [/u] музыкант! Музыка просто шедевральная, даже и сказать больше нечего. В трейлере тому доказательство.

Теперь если кратко:
[h1] Плюсы: [/h1]
[olist]
    [*] Крутая атмосфера
    [*] Прекрасный саундтрек
    [*] Живописная и красивая графика
    [*] Множество трасс и машин
    [*] Прекрасный режим фото и повторов
[/olist]
[h1] Минусы: [/h1]
[olist]
    [*] Специфичная физика (что то между аркадой и горе-симулятором)
    [*] Достаточно короткая карьера (проходится в зависимости от сложности, но 10-15 часов игры будет)
    [*] Трамплины и их последствия
    [*] Достаточно однотипные трассы
    [*] Мало активностей
[/olist]
Проект еще обновляется, будут обновления, так что посмотрим что будет из себя представлять эта игра в последствии, но а так, могу сказать это игра которая тебя цепляет, особенно если ты фанат ралли. Поиграть определенно стоит! 
465 рублей за такую игру, которая была сделана очень качественно (без принижения и шуток) внутри Ford Transit - я считаю вообще не много.
Спасибо за прочтение)
P.S. играл я в нее на пиратке, потому что были сомнения, но потом купил игру в стиме, прошел карьеру, поиграл в онлайне и решил написать отзыв) а так суммарно провел в игре где то часов 150 на данный момент.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024977157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1956, 'last_played': 1701345187}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000831544', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23379, 'last_played': 1703039231}
review: Its style, driving model, tributes to real rallying, locales, absolutely INCREDIBLE soundtrack and focus on progression and self improvement will suck you into a zen-like driving experience I have not been able to find anywhere else. I drive for WRs, but don't think you need to be hyper-competitive to enjoy yourself. Every improvement, every corner you master, every jump you land on all four wheels and every rally you conquer gives you such a sense of satisfaction that you'll find it hard to end your session in a timely manner. I can do nothing but commend funselektor and all the devs behind this for making an absolute masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007854860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1631839156}
review:
Great simcade physics.  Difference in car feel between RWD, FWD, front or mid engined, and weight differences between high / low cylinder count engines, are all there.

Great variety of cars, tracks, environments, weather, many of which you'll recognize if you're a rally fanatic, and they feel much like they should in any other simcade.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993880742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1701546162}
review: I´ve been playing racing games since late 80s, and I love motorsport. And all I can say this is beautiful, it brings back the love I had in my youth, and the music flows through when I progress through the years. I´m frankly deeply in love with this, for all the right reasons :) It isnt a sim, but it doesnt need to be, because it takes the essence of what wonderful this world is, and connects memories with dreams. It´s art, of course, it´s in the eye of the beholder. And this is masterpiece <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198383090558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 1311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1630078054}
review:
Análise honesta de um Rally Racer profissional:

Este jogo faz as coisas um pouco diferente de outros títulos que simplesmente oferecem uma experiência de direção de rally.
Art of Rally faz simplesmente o que o título oferece; Arte.
O estilo de arte neste jogo é incrível. É colorido, detalhado e relaxante.
A direção também é incrível neste jogo, embora simples, ainda é desafiadora.
Nenhum canto é igual, cada vez que sou cuspido, reajo de maneira diferente.

Os carros também estão muito bem montados neste título. Até máquinas icônicas com pinturas lendárias.
Os efeitos sonoros são excelentes. Pequenos detalhes como chamas de exaustão também estão incluídos.

A música neste jogo é divertida e relaxante.

No geral, eu classificaria este jogo como 11/10.

Além disso, não sou um Rally Racer profissional. Eu moro no Canadá e dirijo com todos os outros idiotas na estrada durante tempestades de neve, então eu diria que sou a coisa mais próxima de um motorista profissional.

ta ai fiz video de análise gameplay :D
https://youtu.be/yCo4_ZzbAdo

author: {'steamid': '76561197974383629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1642182841}
review:
I'll start by saying this game is hard. It's not an arcade game, so if you're expecting that back away now. 

But, that first time I power slid my Mk1 escort over a rise into an off camber left hander I felt like a driving god. This game will reward your practice and punish you if you push too hard. The cars are wonderful. The style is....art. 

There are a few niggles, the engine sounds are a little weak so far, the brakes work a little...too well. But all in all it is a superb driving game. It's like an evolution of the old micromachines games. Utterly love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079747060', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1705629510}

author: {'steamid': '76561198302656994', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1689741892}
review:
What I Love: I absolutely LOVE the graphics style and scenery in the game. The gameplay itself is simple, yet concrete and addictive. The campaign is a trip through time, from the late 60s to the early 2000s. 
What I Don't: As of right now, certain portions of the game feel lackluster and incomplete in my opinion for spending 25 dollars... there are mobile games that have more content for 5 dollars. This game needs a more complete Group A class as well as one for modern cars. A few more locations on top of that to keep the game interesting would eventually make it worth 25 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561199078672341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1628352408}
review:
Don't know how people enjoy this game. The starting car feels like a complete boat and there's no way of knowing what's coming up ahead. No co-driver, pace notes or map. High camera irons out all elevation in the road which can really catch you off guard because what looks like a fast flat section ahead may have crests or cambers that you just have no way of knowing about.

It's kinda cutesey looking and I can get on board with the general premise of the game, but it plays like complete garbage. May be worth it on a heavy discount or if you've a lot more patience than me, but I wouldn't recommend it on it's own merit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067192653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1627161142}
review:
TL;DR: Paid too much for something that isn't fun.

I really like the aesthetics and soundtrack, but the game isn't satisfying to play. 

The first glaring issue is the camera. There is no cockpit/hood/1st person view, so you're stuck with the worst 3rd person angles I've every used. Maneuvering low speed corners is a chore because you're too far away. And when you speed up the camera pulls back making the car fall further down the screen.

Also, there is a setting to cut out a view of the car if it's hidden behind an object. But it's almost meaningless when the road ahead is still hidden from view. There is no map or a call out of upcoming turns so each stage will almost always lead you into blind corners(unless you want to unlock and memorize the different maps). But you know what you do get? a bar. a bar without numbers.

The first few groups have a handful of rallies to complete and the cars are compliant enough to help you get a feel for the physics of the game. But when you hit group b and s you've got to play through double or triple the number of rallies with cars that are just obnoxious to handle. I've just unlocked group a and they are actually easier to use, but that means I've got play 10 hours to have fun?


4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040548983', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1711311939}
review:
What looks like a playful low poly arcade racer is actually a super fun sim style time attack racer.
With accurate low poly renditions of copyright free 1970-1990 rally cars this game, down to fun great noises with the turbos, superchargers and backfires. 
The progression is fun, in career you don't need to win to progress so great for all ability levels, you can win extra car skins by not resetting and there's a nice relaxing free roam mode where you get collectables.
I've been on a bit of a racing game hunt lately, and this combined with assetto corsa has really scratched that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152321646', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1700184273}
review:
Art of rally is a really fun game that anyone can enjoy. It's definitely not a simulator, but it doesn't feel like a super ''arcadey'' game like some other racing games. It took me a few hours to get the hang of the driving mechanics on a controller and I could also see this being really enjoyable on a wheel.

Some of the things I like about it were:
- Art style that is simplistic and fun to look at with some cool environmental effects.
- The car choices, car names and all the extra vehicles are a really awesome touch.
- Courses; Unique, fun, and challenging at times, but overall a good time. It's refreshing to not play the same 10 courses that every other rally game has.
- Settings that allowed you to fine tune all of the various in-game driving assists. I wish you could turn everything down to 0%, but that wasn't a big deal.

Some of the things that I did not like:
- Camera settings were odd at first. I wanted to a closer 3rd person view and after playing it awhile I totally understand why they want you zoomed out so far(no co-driver so you kinda need to see the turns ahead of you). After awhile I got used to them.
- Some of the Norway locations, when you drove on the ice sections, during sunset were practically blinding. It turned your screen almost a pure white and could hardly see the course. One of my biggest complaints that hopefully will be adjusted in the near future.
- Some parts on various courses the road was really jagged and bumpy that didn't seem to get built properly.

It took me around 15-16 hours to complete the campaign and another 4-5 was just messing around and playing in free roam. The daily/weekly challenges are a nice touch to the online game play.

Overall I would totally recommend this game, I got it on sale for $17 USD and I feel that price is perfect for what I got out of it. At $25 USD the price is a little steep with the little features and vehicles there are in the game. I don't think that takes anything away from the game itself, because it was a fun and relaxing game to play in the end. Great job to the small team of people who work on this game! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198990924400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1696866451}
review:
art of rally is a aesthetic rally game with a minimalistic look and retro vibes. The game is very simple in design but still exciting to play and it brings something different to the market with a topdown camera and it's design. 

Pros:
- Cool and unique artstyle.
- Great tracks and cars.
- Great replay mode.
- Good photo mode.
- Amazing synthwave soundtrack.
- Daily and weekly events.
- Support for making own skins. The creator even includes templates for the cars.
- Randomized events.
- Difficulties are good.

Cons:
- Game gets a bit boring after 10 hours and is mostly the same through the whole game.
- The cars have a few unique paintjobs and the rest is just regular colors. 
- No live multiplayer. Would be cool to race others live on the tracks.

art of rally is a nice little game made by only one guy and is better than most racing games nowadays. It's best to take breaks from it now and then so it won't get boring. Just go in and take a few rallies or design some paintjobs when you feel like it. It's not a game you play for hours on end but a game that belongs in your racing collection on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105970005', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1690376262}
review:
This game is such a blast. 
Lovely environment, satisfying physics and a great semi-realistic driving model. 
Love the weather and the night/day cycle. Cars sound great, music is also really good and suits the game.

It's a game to play when you want to chill, but it also has the online leaderboard system, daily and weekly challenges and solid AI toughness (looks like it will take you a while to be able to beat the hardest setting, im on 8 hours in and I cant beat Hard AI without spending all of my restarts in one rally) so you can also be competitive on it.

Only thing that is slightly annoying are the requirements. It feels like a game that should be playable in lower-end systems, but even with my laptop which has a 1050 inside it sometimes drops bellow 40 fps on low-1080p. 

Other than that, amazing work for something that came out of a small indie dev. Awesome work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046461487', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1701052613}
review:
This is one of the few games that truly captures the rally times of the 70-00's.
Great music, Excellent handling for beginners and hardcore people. "Easy to learn, hard to master."
Graphics are unique and special. And they will always distract you from the track in a good way. Sometimes..
If you are a fan of the golden era of rally or any rally race games: This is a must have. Even on full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003597199', 'num_games_owned': 2530, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1648239043}
review: Každý kdo mě zná ví, že hodně hraji plošinovky a baví mě závodní hry, především zaměřené na rally. Zkusil jsem snad všechny hry ze světa tohoto skvělého motosportu co Vás napadnou - od skvělé série Dirt, po lehce nadprůměrnou sérii WRC, k dodnes nepřekonanému Richard Burns rally až po tragický V-rally 4. Kdyby se mě někdo zeptal, jak by vypadala špičková rally hra ze světa nezávislých titulů, tak bych řekl art of rally. Pěkné pestrobarevné grafické zpracování, dobře vyřešená kamera - nepřekáží Vám žádně objekty, slušný vozový park, jízdní model, velký počet tratí a  dobrý soundtrack. K příběhu s budhou na začátku si asi řeknete WTF a možná Vás občas překvapí nějaké menší problémy s fyzikou auta - prapodivné odskoky při srážkách s objekty. Celkově hru hodnotím velmi kladně byť cena nějakých 300 Kč ve věrnostním balíčku může působit jako poměrně vysoká...85%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014602000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1663896445}
