author: {'steamid': '76561197962688090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 33396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 195, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1712440641}
review:
Only 111minutes in is enough to know that I should not have held back on this title for so long. Yes, late to the party I am, but now I finally see for myself: what a simply brilliant piece of joyful fantasy this game is. A true instant classic in the purest sense!

Did hesitate because I doubted it would be enjoyable without being a master at using a gamepad. I have honestly never owned a single modern games-console utilizing that sort of device - and I otherwise do faithfully prefer the most-realistic[i]ish[/i] driving-games / "sims" (or even "simcades") out there, complete with full force-feedback wheel-support and recreating the most authentic driving-dynamics possible at their core.

But this is different. It feels so oldschool and yet so fresh: finally an arcade racer that captures the character and essense of the sport it tries to portray! Vehicle-movement makes sense even to real drivers. And yes: keyboard-only play is not only supported but actually implemented really well !

Hats off to the wonder of the "Art of Rally"!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964048853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1669805959}
review:
This is the only racing game that's ever put me into a "flow state" similar to Tetris.  In tune with the car, drifting serenely through obviously pretty environments.  I appreciate the campaign mode has no requirements to be a god at the game, anybody can progress and unlock everything it has to offer.  There's no penalty if you have a bad season, unless its the sort of thing you take personally.

I also appreciate the story is short, surreal, and most importantly, [i]stays the hell out of my way.[/i]  If I play one more driving game where I constantly get hassled by an insufferable personality about my internet popularity I might swear the genre off for good.

My one gripe is with fade in with certain areas.  Japan is particularly bad.  The plants and shadows are instantly generated (or LOD increased) before your eyes - other areas the draw distance is both much further and the fade in more gradual, making it less noticeable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198379056390', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11194, 'last_played': 1635015911}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970533815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1625764670}
review:
Do you love rally car games but are tired of spending half of your time setting up before playing ? Because that's me.
This game is really easy to enjoy in half-hour chunks, which is perfect between breaks from SO/kids/homework.
It's fast to get in to, and enjoyable once you're there. The game also does a great job of making each car feel different and each succeeding class way more capable, faster, and grippy than the last. By the time you get to the group B, S, and A class cars, you'll be impressed by the speed but also slightly terrified of the chicanes. Definitely worth a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230080824', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1659738875}
review:
art of rally offers a radically different approach to the rally racing genre. The lack of pacenotes is a big change, but this is ultimately offset by the top-down camera angles, which gives you excellent visibility of the road ahead (most of the time). These changes allow you to appreciate the games synthwave soundtrack, and the beautiful scenery as you send your Group B monster hurtling towards a crowd of spectators!

The graphics and UI are minimalist in design, which is refreshing compared to other rally games that strive for photorealistic visuals. Much like the graphics, the cars have a caricature look to them, with a distinct lack of branding. The lack of licensed content means that each car has a knockoff name, but the shape and colouring of each car makes them instantly recognisable compared to their real-life counterparts. In a way, the lack of licencing for the cars is a huge benefit, as the game has a healthy selection of iconic and more obscure prototype rally cars from the '60s through to the '90s, with the prospect of more coming in future updates.

The stages, which are set in a range of geographical locations such as Finland, Norway or Japan are fast and flowing, with many opportunities to initiate drifts and handbrake turns. Many stages feature multiple surface changes, so you will need to adapt from gravel to tarmac for example. My only issue with the stages is that you are often penalised for cutting corners too much, whereby the game will reset you back to the track with a five second penalty. Since corner cutting is a big part of rally racing, I feel like the game is actively punishing me for wanting to take the fastest possible line through each corner. A remedy for this would be to design the stages in such a way where the boundaries are more clearly defined (by a wall or foliage), so you are fully aware of how much you can cut each corner without being reset. More locations will be added in the future, so there's that to look forward to!

Don't let the minimalist graphics deceive you.... art of rally has extremely demanding, but rewarding physics. Keeping the car balanced through each corner is a challenge, especially as you will need to set the car up for consecutive corners. Go too wide on one corner and you will lose momentum for the subsequent corners. Stages are narrow with many roadside obstacles. Some parts of the stages are even obscured by large crowds of spectators, so finding the correct racing line can be tricky. The physics overall seem more akin to a simulator than an arcade racer, but that makes the overall driving experience far more rewarding as a result. On higher difficulties, the AI will certainly give you a run for your money.

To conclude, art of rally offers a refreshingly different approach to rally with its top-down camera and lack of pacenotes, a healthy selection of classic rally cars from the '60s to the '90s, beautiful stages in a range of locations, and demanding but very rewarding physics. All this content is presented in a beautiful minimalist art style, complimented with an ambient synthwave soundtrack.

If you are a rally fan, this is an essential purchase.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198021701955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1677535093}
review:
Look, I know it seems weird to refund a game but leave it a positive review but hear me out and it'll make sense as to why. Its a nice looking game, the cars look nice and feel good to drive for the most part, the tracks feel+look pretty decent as well and the unlocking system for new cars/liveries seem fair. 

So why I have asked for a refund? I can't be certain it's 100% the game (only because there is a small chance it's my controller) but when driving straight the cars seems to wander left or right with no steering input. For me, it's a deal breaker for the game, since I can't look further ahead on the track and not look at my car to make sure it's not running off the side of the road. But the bigger issue is when I'm heading to a jump and then car suddenly wanders slightly to the left or right. Of course it leads to accidents, spins and time loss through no fault of my own. Which is annoying and is a big deal when it comes to rally racing games. I had it with 2 different RWD cars the esky v1 and the la montaine. However, like I said I can't be 100% sure that it's the game or my controller, but either way it makes the game unbearable for me. Not gonna lie, is a crying shame because I believe the game is very enjoyable and worth the price I did pay. 

The only other things I'll say is that, the game feels better if you turn the stability in the options to 0% since it's on by default at 160% if I remember correctly, if you're already counter-steering yourself but finding that the car isn't sliding round the corners how you would like. You may find yourself spinning out a bit but once you've readjusted yourself it feels a lot better. Also once you get use to the game, moving up a difficulty up to Skilled (2nd highest) was a relatively quick move for me. Which I can also imagine happening to others as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124324407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 5176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2293, 'last_played': 1707869271}
review:
Každé druhé vozidlo se chová naprosto chaoticky a nelogicky. Některá vozidla bez turba mají turbo lag jak hovado (Metro), kdežto hromada oturbených nemá vůbec žádný (Peugeot 205). Auta co by měla vážit okolo 800kg mají setrvačnost jak supertěžký tank (Delta), kdežto některá těžší drží jak přilepená (typicky báwa s motorem vepředu). Některá auta mají doslova splašené řízení (Stratos), kdy se stačí sotva dotknout klávesy na to aby se vymaxoval rejd až skoro na maximum, kdežto jiná nezatáčí prakticky vůbec (hlavně ta první 911). Hru jsem dohrál, ale doporučit ji nemůžu. Fyzika dobré poloviny vozidel je prostě naprostá blbina a zasloužila by totální předělání od základu.
Pokud by se tvůrci rozhodli to opravit, tak by při tom rovnou mohli i komplet předělat charakteristiky vozů v menu. Chápu že se hrozně bavili s těmi slovními popisy a sršeli sarkasmem na všechny strany, ale zbytek údajů nad tím je prakticky komplet na prd.
1) Uspořádání válců v motoru je irelevantní.
2) Nikoho nezajímá výkon, když nezná hmotnost.
3) Místo typu sání vzduchu (atmo/kompresor/turbo) by stačilo dát kolonku "turbo lag: ANO/NE"
4) Když už by tam uváděli hmotnost, tak by se zasloužilo alespoň přibližně uvést rozložení hmotnosti
5) A pokud tam nebude rozložení hmotnosti, tak by se alespoň zasloužilo uvést kde se v daném autě nachází motor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048213761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1625512359}
review:
Es muy bueno en todos los aspectos EXCEPTO que tiene pocas pistas y escenarios. Si tuviese creador de circuitos y/o escenarios, seria la gloria. Pero bueno, los creadores pocas veces liberan esas cosas porque siempre buscan segundas partes.
La comparativa entre cantidad de vehiculos contra tramos esta muy desfazada y hay muchos mas coches que pistas , lo que da la sensacion que siempre corres en los mismos lugares.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008506901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1625488606}
review:
Задумка достаточно интересная и необычная.
Минусы:
Исполнение по физике на 3, мне не очень понравилось поведение автомобиля. Нереально быстрое торможение на любой поверхности, буквально за пару метров можно уменьшить скорость в два раза.
Так же не хватает индикатора штурмана, не всегда понимаешь что за поворотом спуск и нужно активнее снижать скорость или брать внутрь поворота.
Плюсы:
Картинка очень яркая и приятная.
Необычное исполнение
Хорошая и приятная музыка
Простое управление
История ралли

author: {'steamid': '76561198023821735', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1626223056}
review:
There's clearly a lot of [b]love[/b] and [b]passion[/b] poured into this game, which is in my opinion the most important thing for an arcade-y racing game. You really get a sense that the developers care a lot about the history of rally and how they could apply that to this game.

Each vehicle class is a new experience, but it's never [i]so[/i] different that you feel lost.

The minimalist visual aesthetic is incredibly charming and fun to look at, especially in Japan where you have twisty mountain roads, green pastures and pink cherry blossom trees.

AI difficulty and driving assist options ensure that anyone can have fun with and complete this game, from casual drivers to hardcore simulation enthusiasts.

From a longtime racing game enthusiast, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006658407', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 3078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1652395624}
review:
Really a top-tier racing game. Very challenging and in some ways like a full blown driving sim, but with a touch of arcade-y goodness because this is a game and you should still feel amazing when you nail the gameplay. Easily one of the best racing games for solo play ever made.

The first few hours were tough and the game can definitely induce massive frustration, but the feeling when you perfectly drift through a tight corner, or hug the inside edge and left foot brake to power through a narrow turn at high speed, is worth all the effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5710, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1628209629}
review:
This is a love letter to rally history and chock full of iconic cars from every era, albeit unlicensed and with liveries that are color-correct if anything else.  Make no mistake, the clean, low-poly look of the game undercuts its unforgiving physics engine - this isn't an arcade racer and it [i]will[/i] punish poor driving.  While it doesn't quite push the sim side of things, it most certainly leans that way and you'd best be ready to drive smart if you want to make any headway here.

This is for those folks who want to run a simcade rally experience from time to time, but can't have a permanent wheel set-up ready to go to run Dirt Rally, or really anyone looking to have fun with a controller and push for fast times.  The top-down view means there's no co-driver here giving you the lay of the land - you can see it for yourself and part of the trick to getting good is learning how to read ahead.  The other, more meaningful side of things is just getting a grasp of the physics engine.  While at times your car can feel floaty and weightless, and while you will likely encounter frustration early on, after some time it will simply click and you will figure out exactly how to make the car do the things you want it to do.  Like its predecessor, [i]Absolute Drift[/i], once you get that "aha" moment, you'll be tearing around stages like you gotta take a dump real bad and the bathroom's at the end.

It would be grand to have a little more control over your set-up, but with so many cars to go through and each of them feeling incredibly distinct, it's not really that big a deal.  The most powerful cars don't necessarily equate to the fastest stages, so it's all about getting into the car you're most comfortable with and hauling butt as fast as you can.  Like true rally, you're out there on your own and there's idiot crowds waiting at various places to muck up your vision.  The enemy here besides the clock is yourself.

The game features quite a few modes that will keep you occupied.  Career mode will have you run the gamut through rally history starting with the 60s.  Time attack mode is here, too, and you will be looking to post times against other players on the leaderboard.  There's also a free roam for each country, allowing you explore and practice while finding random collectibles should you so desire.

Overall, I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this game.  It is wonderful, a lot of fun, and while it takes a while to get used to, any racing enthusiast is going to have a good time.  Just don't expect Ridge Racer and you'll be fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115936168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1688000286}
review:
Haven't played for many hours... yet.
If you want a rally car game that chills you out, let's you tear through beautiful landscapes across the world in some of the most iconic rally cars ever made from the 60s to 90s. 
All the while listening to an amazing soundtrack, that fits the style and mood so damn well while chasing online times or completing the career mode.
Then this is the game for you, highly recommend with regular updates. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198846852852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1629384145}
review:
REWELACJA!!!

Art Of Rally to podręcznikowy przykład gry robionej przez pasjonatów dla pasjonatów.
Tytuł stanowi hołd dla rajdów lat 70/80/90, z dużym naciskiem na (nie)sławną grupę B i sposób w jaki twórcy oddali klimat tej gry jest po protu wyśmienity.

Art Of Rally wygląda bajecznie - dosłownie i w przenośni. Otoczka wizualna odcinków specjalnych jak i ogólnego krajobrazu, mimo swego kreskówkowo-kubistycznego stylu prezentuje się obłędnie. Na osobną pochwałę zasługuje również kapitalny soundtrack skomponowany również w klimatach stylu synth-pop/dance lat 80. 

W kwestii mechaniki, gra przy wyłączonych wspomaganiach pojazdu zapewnia wiele frajdy, natomiast staje się wymagająca i mimo sporego doświadczenia w dziedzinie gier rajdowych - musiałem przyzwyczaić się do modelu prowadzenia, który po 3h gry mogę skomentować jako niezwykle dobre połączenie arcade'u z symulacją. Każdy samochód prowadzi się nieco inaczej, nie mniej jednak każdy zapewnia tyle samo pozytywnych emocji, bo modele mimo braku licencji prezentują się obłędnie, biorąc pod uwagę ich wspomniany - bajkowy wygląd.

Polecam każdemu fanowi motoryzacji, jest to jeden z lepszych tytułów W OGÓLE jaki ostatnio grałem i jestem przekonany że z chęcią będę do niego wracał. 
Art Of Rally to niesamowicie udana alternatywa tytułów takich jak DiRT czy WRC, dla mnie natomiast ma jedną zasadniczą przewagę, nad swymi "pełnoprawnymi" kuzynami, mianowicie KLIMAT, który sprawia że w grę chętnie odpalić dla samego podziwiania widoczków przy akompaniamencie świetnych instrumentalnych utworów.

OCENA KOŃCOWA: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042399825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1689114175}
review:
Not someone who posts reviews usually, but I felt like this one deserved it

GAMEPLAY: Very tough to get a handle of first. This isn't as arcade-y as it seems judging from the graphics. The cars all have individual weight distributions, characteristics and drivetrains making them all incredibly unique in the feel that they have. Cars are weighty and have significant inertia, it isn't as simple as just turning and braking but keeping a balance between the inertia of the car, the grip of the surface and tires. Once you get a feel for how the cars drive, it is a very satisfying experience


SOUND: As for sound, from the sound of the cars to the squealing of the brakes to the crowds you're moving past. Just the soundtrack alone is great to hear on it's own. Each car's note fitting the aspiration and the engine configuration that they would have had during the time for the most part. 

GRAPHICS: The graphics are very simple but pleasant on the eyes, at least for me. It is hyper stylized in it's presentation but it has a very simplistic beauty that I personally really enjoy, it is one of those instant love it or hate it sort of styles in my opinion. But for what it is, it's going to age very well.

So you might be wondering why I don't recommend this game at all from my perspective? It's one simple reason, the thing doesn't work. After trying to troubleshoot and mess around with various settings, the game either hard crashes or hard crashes my computer, despite having the specs for it, and otherwise running smoothly. I really hope Funselektor can fix this issue because otherwise I would give it glowing praise, I just can't recommend it as is though with how unstable it is on my rig.

Otherwise the actual game itself is great, as someone who is a fan of the sport it's nice to see the very different "Eras" of the sport lovingly represented in the cars that they show, although not licensed each one is easily recognizable as an iconic part of the sport. The gameplay and sound are also lovingly tuned in to the vision this studio had for the game. I Just wished the thing worked on my PC

author: {'steamid': '76561198969241358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1677509606}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042717064', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4261, 'last_played': 1709875401}
review:
This game absolutely achieves what it sets out to do. It is a fun, deceptively hard (realistic) take, on the most famous years of WRC. I recommend their first game "Absolute Drift" if you are new to the developer, as ANYONE will have a hard time with kbm controls in a 3rd person racing game, but at least learning some of the basics in a stress free environment  will be the main key in enjoying these games.

Art of Rally is the graduation into the "real" simulation side of these games. The tracks feel real (and some are in fact based off real roads), as well as the different surfaces. Not to mention the (almost) name brand cars, that when you know, YOU KNOW. These cars not only look the part, they sound, drive, and FEEL just like you would imagine them in your hearts mind.

SUCH and project of passion for these developers, and hope to follow everything they come up with next...

review: I like a lot of things about this game. Art style, rally lore, unlocks and events, sound and atmosphere are all really nice. I really wish there were more camera options though as you aren't able to have as much precise control over your vehicle with the available options. There's also a lot of pop-in in the environment, especially in the outlying vegetation which to me was distracting. If I could I would definitely rate this game "neutral" but I can't so I'm going with "No" seeing as I'm a pretty average gamer and I really did't enjoy the actual game play so much as I enjoyed the idea of the game. I definitely wouldn't say this isn't a good game but at the end of the day it wasn't for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198880713754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 95, 'playtime_at_review': 12417, 'last_played': 1712214850}
review: I've been playing since around 1.10 and the game has only gotten better and better the more I play. The achievements and car unlocks are fun and challenging, and flow well with the main campaign. This is my first ever racing game and I found myself having fun through every stage of progression, from learning how to maintain a drift, to mastering trail-braking, it's rewarding every step of the way. Only at 200+ hours am I running out of things to do in game, but (at the time of writing) luckily the Kenya Update is soon around the corner. I joined the Funselektor Discord soon after purchase, and the community has been incredible. From beginning tips, optimal setting adjustments, and sharing custom liveries, the community surrounding this game has helped tremendously. I seriously can't recommend this game enough, 10/10 experience all the way through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109068122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1630812053}
review:
do not attempt this game without a controller that has a variable throttle input (such as the trigger on an xbox-style controller). if you are trying to play this with a keyboard, you will have a bad time. 

also make sure to adjust the levels of braking, traction control, and all that stuff to your personal liking. if you don't turn off some of the automatic assistance, the game will take control and helpfully try to straighten you out while you are sliding around a turn, and understeer you off into the trees.

review: This is exactly the kind of game that I was looking for! A relaxing racing experience. If you are like me and didn't really feel like a challenge, don't let the "Difficult" tag put you off - there are easy settings so you can properly switch your brain off and get absorbed by the amazing visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053228543', 'num_games_owned': 1176, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1682306587}
review: I really don't know why I haven't reviewed this game before now. Quite frankly, there isn't much I can say beyond the simple fact that this game is my Best New Game of 2020, and I play a lot of games. It's the perfect mix of cathartic and competitive, and (while not needed to enjoy the game) if you have the slightest background in cars or motorsports it packs a heavy punch of nostalgia. The movement flows beautifully, the controls are tight and responsive, and the art is breathtaking. This game is a minimalist masterpiece, and I could not recommend it enough.

review:
The driving is hard to get the hang of at first, but it's fun to learn and improve. All the cars handle differently adding more depth to the driving, as well a different road surfaces and weather effects.
Overall a casual, fun game that presents enough challenge to be engaging, but not too much that it's frustrating to learn and play. The music is also great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080042497', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1681560800}
review:
Bought this game on a whim, just because how it looked and was not disappointed.
Now, I'm not really a racing fan having only played one or two older Need for Speed games - so I can't speak from the point of view of someone who knows a lot about racing games. And I won't.
Instead I'll review this from the point of view of someone who wanted a simple racing game to play once in a while. And I can say that I got what I wanted.

What I liked:
- looks really good. I like this type of minimalist low poly look and I think it works well with how minimalist the gameplay is
- simple gameplay. Pick a game mode, pick a car and drive. Nothing is distracting you from the actual core of the game - driving.
- realistic. Or what I imagine driving in real life is like. Every car feels different, every type of terrain feels different and it took me some time to learn how not to fly off the road on every turn. (Small tip: set transmission to manual in settings. Doing this gave me more control and made driving easier)
- music. I wouldn't listen to this OST on it's own, but it works really well with the game

What I think could've been better:
- my results info. When you finish a race you are given info like (5410 | 50%). Maybe it's just me but it's not clear what these numbers actually mean. I wish there was a tooltip or something with explanation for this
- map in free roam. When in free roam and looking for collectables I end up pressing Esc way too often and it breaks the immersion. I think it would be great if there was a setting to display a map in free roam mode.

To conclude, I think this game is great for someone who wants a pretty game to just drive and not be distracted by irrelevant tuning, carrer or other mechanics

author: {'steamid': '76561198000399343', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1670706316}
review: I really can't speak highly enough about this game.  The art is fantastic, the updates introduce new content at no additional cost, the soundtrack is pretty good, and the handling model is great as well.  There isn't anything that I feel that this game does not do well, and I feel it was a great step forward from Absolute Drift, which I loved as well.  Definitely give this a shot if you like DiRT Rally, Absolute Drift, or rally in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993583988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1623358782}
review:
Parto da una premessa: Art of Rally è un titolo divertente, molto divertente.

Punti di forza
- Stile grafico minimalista ma molto piacevole
- Stile di guida impegnativo ma appagante
- Giusto mix fra progressione/soddisfazione del giocatore 

Punti deboli
- Sistema di collisioni da rivedere, almeno per quel che riguarda la parte anteriore della macchina: ogni volta che toccavo con lo spigolo antriore destro/sinistro o anche solo sfioravo un ostacolo, la macchina andava sempre in testacoda. Non è un arcade ma in determinate situazioni penso che la macchina scivolerebbe anzichè bloccarsi e girarsi
- Motore grafico: bello e piacevole ma occasionalmente vittima di cali di frame rate davvero grossolani e su una 2070 non l'accetto. Per quanto ci siano tanti effetti su schermo questi cali sono davvero fastidiosi e succedono
- Musiche: scelta personale, le ho tolte. Non perchè non sono piacevoli solo che preferisco concentarmi sul rombo del motore.
- Gli scenari dopo un po tendono a ripetersi, magari evitare sessioni troppo lunghe

Come voto per me è un 8, è da tanto che non mi divertivo con un gioco di macchine come con Art of Rally, l'ultimo è stato Split Second.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030637029', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1706867342}
review:
Apres Absolute Drift le studio Funselektor nous reviens le très bon art of rally. on y retrouvera leur maîtrise du drift.

gameplay : https://youtu.be/V8ki2_HWLMg

le jeu est très complet
plusieurs modes de jeu classique
[list]
[*] carrière plusieurs courses successive avec un podium final. le jeu se démarque avec des carrières aléatoires donc les pays et courses ne seront jamais dans le même ordre
[*] contre la montre 
[*] rally personnalisé
[*] exploration libre : on explore une zone ouverte dans les 5 pays disponible avec des collectables à récupérer pour débloquer les autre zones libres
[*] événement quotidien et hebdomadaire pour lesquels nous n'avons qu'une seule tentative
[/list]

le jeu a de nombreux points forts
[list]
[*] la direction artistique visuelle ou sonore qui est énorme.
[*] il existe différents types de sol et de météo pouvant impacter sur la conduite
[*] différentes catégories de voitures des 60's jusqu’à aujourd'hui avec différents skins (toutes les voiture existent mais avec des nom détournés : la porsche 911-> la das 119, mini austin->meanie, etc...)
[*] le jeu dispose d'un mode photo vous permettant de prendre des clichés pendant les courses
[*] quelques options permettent de personnaliser l’expérience (facteur de contre-braquage, vitesses auto/manuelles, ...)
[/list]

toute fois il existe quelques défauts au jeu mais aucun ne pose vraiment problème
[*] les fleurs sont sujettes au clipping
[*] peu de caméra disponible (une derrière la voiture et plusieurs plus zénithale. toutes permettent de voir la route mais certains pourront regretter l'absence de caméra au volant ou plus cinématographique comme on a pu voir dans les GTA
[*] le son des moteurs m'horripile mais en baissant le son spécifique des voitures il n'y à plus de problème
[*] l'absence d'indication sur le tracé à venir pourra en chagriner certain mais globalement la visibilité est suffisante
[*] le gameplay n'ai pas forcément évident à prendre en mains si, comme moi vousn' avez jouer qu'à des jeux de courses qui ne font pas dans la simulation
[/list]

en conclusion un jeu non sans défaut mais pas moins excellent et surtout, un jeu qui détonne par rapport au reste des jeux de courses

review:
It's a serious rally game.
This was also ported to the Nintendo Switch recently. 

After 10 hours you will have mastered more than the basics and should be able to reach class 4 Grand Prix/Season.  You will unlock faster motor classes as you progress in race event and year. Progession happens by increasing your overall driving skill  meaning if you don't win you won't advance in the season and get new unlocks. 

It's very fun and every car has it's unique feel when driving it. 

EDIT: With the recent updates the game got very polished and all the small details got fixed. I can feel the game getting even better. NICE

review: 这款游戏对于喜欢开车游戏，且有一定基础的玩家来说真的很不错    {当然是拟真赛车游戏}   qq飞车 极品飞车  还得做好心理准备，画面清新干净，不管是日本清晨的竹林还是德国的黄昏树林，透过树荫照过来的体积光，相信都会深深打动你。拉力车的手感还是很不错的，主流水平。

author: {'steamid': '76561198045326675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1623833321}
review: Another easy to learn hard to master game by this team and its just as good if not better because of visuals and control.  This is a game that asks for you to try each stage multiple times while not only slowly memorizing the course but also memorizing the speed, angle, gear, and even how much brake to apply for each curve.  Sounds obvious for a racing game but this one does so in a very simple and straight forward manner that i didn't realize that i missed from older games.  Extremely simple menus and every button you would want for a game like this is there for you (While also being able to change inputs for any button you want).  I always love it when people making games understand what they can do for quality of life for their players way before people ask for it in the first place.  Add on top to this that the multiplayer leaderboards are extremely well thought out and you have yourself a big winner.  Any racing lover should pick this title up and really keep an eye on this teams future products.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022419304', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2218, 'last_played': 1630602478}
review:
[i][h1]To do something dangerous with style, is art…[/h1][/i]

[i][b]art of rally[/b][/i] is a minimalistic, bird’s eye view racing game. Your goal is to win championships spanning from the 60s and through to the mid-90s.

[h3]Beauty in simplicity.[/h3]
One of the most striking things about [i][b]art of rally[/b][/i] is the presentation: a wonderful, vibrant low-poly visual style, which also includes atmospheric volumetric lighting. Driving towards the setting sun on evening stages is a sight to behold. On top of this, a photo mode is available for your pleasure. It lets you enjoy the lawyer-friendly rally cars blasting through the track, leaving trails of thick smoke in their wake and with their brake discs glowing and sparking. The trackside spectators being cubes may seem odd at first, but they actually complement the game’s aesthetics very nicely.

Despite its simple and unassuming looks, this game is quite intensive. I managed to get a consistent 60fps at 1440p on my [i]Ryzen 9 3900X, 64GB RAM, 1070 Ti[/i] system after lowering the “quality” option one step from the maximum. It only seems to affect vegetation density, and the game still looks fantastic with the remaining options at maximum. Otherwise, I’ve not encountered stability issues with this title.

[h3]Ride the synthwave.[/h3]
For your listening pleasure, please enjoy the [b]four hours[/b] of sensational retrowave soundtrack created by Ukrainian-based composer [i]Tatreal[/i]. It successfully captures the high stakes nature and intense atmosphere of the motorsport and will make you want to drive [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iXUZwhQ6-Ac]way too fast outside of the game as well[/url]. Beyond the music, this title nails the sound effects with the same elegance that it wins me over visually. The clusters of spectators whistle and cheer, the Finns shout “oy oy oy!” as they should, the cars sound properly beefy, and later on the backfires sound closer to [i]gunshots[/i]. Now that’s how you burn fuel in style!

[h3]You are here to become a master of rally.[/h3]
This is a racing game entirely devoted to the eponymous motorsport: you must complete point-to-point stages without wrapping yourself around trees or guardrails and try to beat the other opponents vying to do the same. Consistency is king - overdriving can waste valuable time, if not outright ruin your race. 

Defying tradition, you don’t get a co-driver or pace notes throughout events. The absence of these hallmarks of rallying can appear jarring, but [i][b]art of rally[/b][/i] makes up for it with the camera; it is placed high and far behind your car, letting you see well into the distance and anticipate the changing road conditions. You can even alter its rotation speed, height and field of view, so you’re pretty much guaranteed to find something comfortable. A big challenge that the camera system faces is how to convey elevation and banking changes, and that is also resolved through clever darkening of the track and marking possible jumps with the classic rally gates. 

[h3]It began with humble little cars…[/h3]
From your starting roster of 60s passenger cars all the way to the monstrous prototypes, each vehicle feels satisfying to handle. They have the right balance of accessibility and depth to their handling, and you’re certain to find your favourite rides quickly. You’re going to have great fun tossing these things around hairpins, regardless of using the keyboard, a gamepad or something more exotic. 

There’s the odd steering re-centre speed when coming out of a slide which may catch you off-guard or indeed send you into a guardrail, but it can be thankfully minimized through the plentiful assist and controller options. There are just so many options! What next, blood type? [b]There is blood type and you can say that yours is saké. Excellent.[/b]

[h3]Becoming a master will require patience and determination.[/h3]
In the career mode, you will participate in championships spanning over 30 years of rally history. Each race group has five championships that are randomly generated with a sequence of stages; later championships grow longer and more complex. Every region has unique characteristics, both visually and mechanically. As an example, Finland is the classic high-speed dirt roller-coaster with plenty of chances to catch air time, while Germany is top speed asphalt racing on tight roads. 

Spectators litter each rally stage in large clusters, frequently near opportunities to catch big air time or power-slide through a hairpin. These blocky fellas are absolutely nuts, they try to get close to your car even as it barrels towards them – much like in real life rallying! I’m hesitant to claim these people's ability to occasionally leap onto building rooftops as “realistic”, but it sure is funny. 

On the other hand, the damage system feels rather undercooked. Moderately fast impacts into trees and rocks have only a chance of degrading your components, while merely scraping against a rail at top speed wrecks your car and can force a restart. The consequences of low part health also seem imbalanced. Suspension understandably makes you pull to one side and worsens your stability, while critical engine condition has you drive an impressive fireball through the stage. That being said, the remaining components could do with better feedback as they sustain wear and tear. Very rarely, you may get a tyre puncture, but in all my time playing I only suffered this twice. At the end of the day, the damage modelling serves as a basic yet functional incentive to not make like Samir and break the car.

The stages are open, and the roads are fairly wide, but you must curb your instinct to cut corners too deeply. It’s not just because of dangers like ditches, rocks and trees; instead, there’s an aggressive corner-cutting prevention that resets your car onto the road with a minor time penalty if you try to gain too big of an advantage. It’s understandable why it exists, I just wonder if it could have been done more smoothly, or have that measure removed in its entirety. 

Your goal through each championship is to finish on the podium without retiring. Complete the five championships in a group to advance to the next one; complete all groups to win the game. Simple and straight to the point. You unlock new vehicles as you progress, and finishing championships without exhausting your restarts also unlocks a bonus skin for each of your cars. It keeps to the spirit of rallying, where just finishing in one piece is commendable, yet at the same time it doesn’t explicitly demand perfection. Do note that the [i]Master[/i] AI difficulty is rather unbalanced, as they can score seemingly impossible times on early or mid-game stages, then suddenly forget how to drive in rainy weather. At least their mechanical faults are amusing; “bird in cabin” should say enough.

You can expect the career mode to last around 20 hours. This may be on the lengthy side for some, given that you only ever race in a single discipline. Players who crave for more, though, can cruise around separate free-roam maps and collect their goodies; these include extra music tracks, beauty spots and the developer’s real-life van, hidden somewhere in each level. The long-term longevity comes from this game being a collection of time-attack courses, and with six tracks per region, reverse layouts plus leaderboards for dry vs. wet for each car class, becoming the best in the world will take a long time.

[h1]Now go forth and remember: trees are not your friends.[/h1]
[i]A true love letter to the motorsport, [b]art of rally[/b] is a great racing experience with outstanding presentation and passion worth the price point.[/i]

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43817454/]Check out Tomato's Bag of Games for more high quality reviews on great games.[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198116097134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1698937276}
review:
When was the last time you played a racing game? For me, it had been years. When I stumbled across art of rally, I decided to give it a try because it seemed to focus on mechanics over graphics and user experience before realism. In practice, this gave the developers the excuse to make assets that look aesthetically pleasing without aspiring to look like real life. It also allowed them to fine tune each car for the perfect (at least compared with other racing games) mix of respect for its real life counterpart and arcade-y motion.

As you may have gathered already, I have an appreciation for this game that allows me to sing high praises, but there are a few points of criticism I hold as of the date of posting this review. Firstly, it would be nice to select a "ghost" to race against outside of one's own runs in order to better understand the mechanics. Second, any tutorial present cannot prepare one for the vastly different styles of driving required between cars--providing a tutorial for driving different cars might be a welcome addition.

Overall, the game is a pleasure to play. There are no DLCs as a barrier to driving cars, only a simple unlock system. This is a no-frills racing experience that takes the best parts of racing games and leaves the rest out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342745072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1703672812}

review:
This Game is just a Loveletter to Car-Enthusiasts.

-It looks beautiful
-its really fun and authentic to drive
-most of the cars sound good.  i dont like some of them, but i also really love a few of them.
-the soundtrack is great

-the only bad thing i could say about art of rally is the highest difficulty. it could be a bit more punishing for my taste. 
there are leaderboards though, if you really want to push yourself.

Edit: Nevermind, the AI just got buffed and feels much more challenging now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972273699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 121, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1712432699}
review: Fun little game which is also driveable with a keyboard, if you take the time to set it up for your needs. Some assets seem a bit misplaced (modern wind turbines were not in use until the ~80's, skis on gondolas in full-bloom spring), but apart from that it is worth its money. Thanks for a fun little racer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979400471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1698553985}
review: An absolute gem! This comes across almost deceptively, but the stylize artwork is just gorgeous, the soundtrack is relaxing and not tiresome, and the overall game is a true work of love. It is evident in the descriptions, the gameplay, the sounds, the cars and more. It deliberately ignores the trend of other rivals all striving to be more real than real, and instead stays true to its mission of providing a seriously addictive experience. You will start confused and crashing left and right, but this passes as you learn to handle the cars, speed and more, and I have only played with training wheels on. One can manage full clutch and gear changes. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010849331', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1710636361}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060418301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1699138759}
review: Such an amazing game! Just from the 13 hours I have played so far I can tell you that this game can be difficult, but its difficulty makes it that much more satisfying to pull off. Starting out you may slam walls and reset a bunch, but as you keep playing you will notice your progression and it will feel so good. Highly recommend this game to anyone who appreciates rally/drifting, it is a masterpiece. No surprise though, Absolute Drift is also a fantastic game!

review: A top down rally game like nothing else on the market at the moment. The graphics are very bright and colourful, the maps are well made and have plenty of variety in the straights,jumps,corners,camber,uphill and downhill sections. The game never gets boring plenty of content and cars to unlock in career mode.Plenty of other mode;s to mess around in too. Highly recommended game with hours and hours of game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062872129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1700494627}
review: Super fun game with a fantastic aesthetic and solid gameplay, I've been playing it for hours and I have no intention to sop anytime soon. I especially appreciate the number of unlockable cars and skins in the game (with mod support) and no microtransactions in sight! My one big gripe is that it can be super unclear what corners are okay to cut and which ones will land you a 5-second penalty. It can be super frustrating to be on a roll, building up a ton of speed, only for that to be unceremoniously cut off because I cut a corner I apparently shouldn't have.

review: I absolutely love this game, I've always loved rally racing especially from the japanese manufacturers and this game is a blast to play. That being said, this game has horrible crashing issues for me, whenever I try to exit to the main menu, my PC completely hard crashes. It was almost enough for me to give it a negative review, but the gameplay, soundtrack, and art style are too good for that. Please look into that!
developer_response:
Hey we definitely want to sort that bug out, can you go to http://artofrally.com/ and submit a bug report?
Glad you're digging it despite!

author: {'steamid': '76561198235734144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1627980908}
review: This game is honestly one of the best driving games I've ever played. I love how every car has it's own description with a bit of history to go with it on the car it's based on (If you know about rally cars of the time you can tell what they are). The simplistic visuals, along with the music and how good the cars sound just works so well. There's also a decent amount of cars to unlock which all feel uniquely different to drive with simplified versions of real liveries and colour options. All at a price that is just too damn good to pass up; even better if it's on sale. If you like racing/driving games...BUY THIS GAME. It takes some getting used to at first, but when you do the game is just so much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982143710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 4123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2818, 'last_played': 1704342889}
review:
Some of mine favorite driving games are Euro Truck Simulator 2 and Dirt 2.0. More a bit of simulation games, then why I do love this game I do not know. Music is fantastic (which is understatement) Graphics look simplistic but that gives them charm and in my opinion look much better then in some other games. Also it would surprise you that driving actually is not easy, and that it does looks and sounds in rally games. Of course it is not 100% simulation but it is not arcade either, vehicles get damaged and they slide through and weather influences on track big time.
Also you get option to free roam on maps if you like just to drive to relax and maybe unlock some skins or cars.
And also you can disable damage if you want even more relaxed drive but that is up to you. 
I would say get game 100% if you like driving or rally games. If you are bit unsure because of graphics or how it is done I would say get it on discount. But this team put so much great work in this game that they deserve full amount. I got game on discount but it really enchanted me totally so I bought one for a friend at full price because it is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046157951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1682260884}
review:
For a while, I wanted a driving game which doesn't necessarily require a wheel to fully enjoy.
I didn't want a game with complex menus or gimmicks, I just wanted the sensation of driving, sliding, drifting, attacking an apex, and if possible, in a relaxing way.

Art of Rally IS that game. I couldn't exactly put into words what I wanted from a driving game, but Art of Rally really scratched that itch.

It's clean, it's pretty, and it accomplishes the feat of being demanding while being soothing. A nice learning curve, different modes...

A gem I am very happy to have discovered and would have feel a steal if I had waited for a discount.

The only thing I would like to see in the future, some sort of "turn warning", either a little minimap or just a pictogram of turns to come.

Congrats to the devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176490186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1663030659}
review:
Whoever made Farschweiler and other German stages with those tombstones, I hope you get whatever you deserve... Don't get me wrong, they would have been awesome if this game was designed to be played with a wheel. Alas, it was not and so they're simply not fun. But the game is SO GOOD that it compensates. Seriously, it's really good. Graphics are beautiful and dripping with style. Stages are designed well (except Germany). Handling is riding a fine line between realism and arcade, but close enough to realism that simulation fans like myself who normally can't stand arcade racing games can still have a good time. Cars jump a lot even after the update, but it fits the style. I think it would be weird if they didn't jump that much. The differences between cars of the same era aren't huge, mostly it's about the wheelbase and body length, but it's enough to give it color. And the car names and descriptions are a riot. I'm truly in love with this game, despite the few flaws it has. It's one of the games in my PC that I don't think I'll ever delete, because it's the perfect game to play when you have 30 minutes to kill. If you're a sim fan or an arcade fan, doesn't matter, if you like racing games, I'll bet my left testis that you'll like this game.

*And don't come at me with that "Those stones are there in real rally stages" bullshit. This is a game, you ignore things to make it more fun. In real life, you have only one single chance to do a stage right. But nobody complains that this game gives you multiple chances. It's so that it's more fun. Farschweiler stones should have been ignored, or other stages without stones should have been chosen. But don't get me wrong, I wouldn't be complaining so much if I didn't love this game as much as I did. It's all out of love and passion :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995004508', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1700163438}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047791097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1701733303}
review:
Something different but deceptively deep.

On the surface this seems like a cute racing game with a simple and appealing graphical style, but underneath that is a genuinely deep and challenging rally game. The physics are solid and consistent and the cars all handle differently with some better at certain surfaces than others.  
Of course the art and music are wonderful, giving a truly zen-like sense to the courses. The difficulty settings allow you to relax and take it slow, crash your way round like a noob, or really push yourself. The options for damage and the limited time to repair mid-season add some fun extra challenge and realism too.

In the true spirit of rally there are no AI cars on the track, it's purely time trials. It might have been cool to have a head to head super special stage sprinkled in but it's not a deal breaker.
The love for the sport is clear with classic cars like the Group B monsters represented. It's a bit of a shame the cars are not licensed but if you know anything about rally you will know what they are hinting at and it's a cost-saving measure that makes perfect sense for a small dev.

If you enjoyed the style of Absolute Drift and/or love the classic WRC then I think you'll enjoy this.

review:
It's fun. The soundtrack is a banger, the cars drive like a charm and after you git gud the game is just satisfying to relax with. Im still learning the knicks and knacks, but when you clear a track nearly flawlessly... it's a very nice and memorable moment. Art of rally gives you a very stylised experience, without letting you down in the driving departement.

If you can spend the bucks or if it's on sale, get it! Especially if you wanted to experience rally without the need of a steering wheel and pedals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041128605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1623693913}
review:
This game is just extremely good. And I really didn't expect it to be. 

I usually don't play single player games anymore. I am not an enthusiast for minimalistic/stylized graphics or indie productions. I don't think I really would've ever bought the game if I hadn't been so annoyed by long loading times of other games (Forza) or would my friends have been online to play some multiplayer game. But damn am I happy I did.

This game... 
it reminds you of better times. For me it feels like a throwback to being younger, playing old video games, but at the same time it is such a unique game and concept. This game is innovation while being traditional to what is already really good in racing games. Its relaxing and thrilling at the same time.
It's beautiful, innocent and quick. It hooks me just the way Need for Speed (2:SE, 3:Hot Pursuit; Most Wanted 05; Underground 1/2...) did when I was younger, but I can't describe the feeling really well. And in all of that it tells the real history of rally. It truly is art.

Its. just. r(e)ally. Good.

It also has leaderboards, which is surprisingly enough to keep my multiplayer addiction satisfied.

After playing I almost feel obligated to also buy Absolute Drift as well, just because it's the same developer.

And not to forget one of the best parts: 
From starting the game to being on a rally track it takes around 20 seconds. No BS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079230337', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1678335628}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971046069', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1706953587}
review:
Un bambino di nome M. era in vacanza al mare, le stesse vacanze, lo stesso mare da quando era nato. Amava andare al mare perché al mare c’erano le sale giochi. C’erano anche nella città in cui abitava ma inspiegabilmente i suoi genitori non lo portavano mai nelle sale giochi della sua città. Il suo gioco preferito era World Rally: Championship ma quello lo scoprì solo molti anni dopo. In quegli stessi anni i sindacati proclamarono lo sciopero generale della scuola e M. non capiva bene che cosa voleva dire, fatto sta che quel giorno M. rimase a casa da scuola e dopo varie avventure in una città vicina se ne tornò a casa con un gioco molto simile a World Rally: Championship che però poteva giocare dal computer famigliare. M. giocò poi a tanti giochi di rally e andò a vedere anche tante prove speciali e sognò, dopo aver preso la patente, di gareggiare in qualche rally. Qualche anno dopo M. scoprì che era uscito un gioco che si chiamava art of rally, tutto minuscolo, e quel gioco gli piacque molto perché sembrava World Rally solo fatto meglio, molto meglio, anche più divertente e tra le altre cose non chiedeva neanche gettoni tutte le volte che distruggevi la macchina contro un albero. 
Poi le musiche sembravano davvero uscire dalle sale giochi del mare dove M. andava in vacanza.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041680698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1677282995}
review:
The game gives only the most crucial parts of a racing game to players, making them easily focus on nothing but driving. I got a feeling of returning to my childhood enjoying the racing game by smoothly cruising on one track after another.
The music and art style creates a soothing gameplay environment for players. Though the controlling feedback is rather hardcore, the overall experience never makes me feel stressful or exhausted while playing. The game manages to maintain a balance between joy and simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084036084', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1676588873}
review:
The camera angle takes a little getting used to, and it could be better optimized, but damn this is a great game. Once it starts to click, nailing a hairpin drift feels orgasmic. The cars are humorously nicknamed after real rally icons, of which there are plenty, and they sound and feel simulator-level amazing to drive, or close to it. Just turn off assists, crank up the difficulty to Master, and keep trying. You can do it. 

This game is good shit

author: {'steamid': '76561198039536027', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1699215896}
review:
Ein Spiel der alten Schule. Emotionen, tolle Physik, super viele Modelle, tolle Stages. Kein Bullshit, keine Microtransaktionen.
Das Geld ist es definitiv Wert!

Positives:
- Jedes Rally Auto was man sich wünscht
- coole original Liverys
- Beschreibungen der Autos zeigen liebe zum Detail und sind reichlich originell
- Geile strecken
- Physik die sich Realistisch anfühlt
- Die Menschenmengen - das unerwartete Haupt Feature! Es sind war nur kleine vier ecke ABER ihr zurseite springen ist einfach unglaublich befriedigend und macht atmosphäre!

Einzige negative Punkte:
- Der Sound ist nicht soo unterschiedlich. Wer authentischen Quattro 5 Zylinder gebrüll erwartet wird enttäuscht. Die Autos klingen zwar cool (auch mit geilem "stututu") aber eben nicht so wie in echt.
- Sprünge / kuppen sind schwer einzuschätzen. Nicht wild aber manchmal fliegt man halt einfach ab
- Strecken werden schnell Repetitiv (macht es aber nicht wirklich langweiliger weil man dann immer schneller wird)

Was wünsche ich mir für die Zukunft:
- Bessere Sounds
- Mehr Strecken
- 1st Person Kamera (ich glaube fas man kann so besser fahren)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014576230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1711573087}
review:
I don't play many driving games, but I really enjoyed Absolute Drift a couple of years ago and despite rallying being the least interesting racing to me after F1, I decided to give this game a try. In brief: this is a driving game anyone can pick up if you are happy to spend a little time getting used to it, and I think that time investment is well worth it.

The driving itself feels crisp and consistent, so much so that after a while you find yourself making instinctive changes to your speed/angle in the approach to a corner, without having a good explanation as to why, but when those instinctive changes are right and you slide through the corner perfectly...there's few experiences like it.

You can play this a bit like Absolute Drift, where you explore the open areas and find collectibles/do challenges, or you can do what I did and absolutely laser through the career mode after you do your first race. There's something incredibly compelling about knocking out just one or two more stages, gambling with your restarts to try and get a better placement, trying out a new car and struggling with its nuances. 

I like the game a lot because it rarely makes you repeat stuff, you usually only repeat if _you_ want to do better. Really messing up a stage isn't that uncommon, but this is not a game where you make one or two mistakes and have to retry to proceed. It's not so much that it is forgiving, as that pretty much every driver is going to have screwups and slow stages across a rally. So if you come 5th in a stage, and you don't feel confident in a rerun, just let the cards fall where they may and you could have a huge time advantage after another stage or two. Get used to using the 'back to road' rescue button though, just because sometimes you'll waste far more than the 5-second penalty getting yourself back.

*If you are struggling early on:* Try more cars! I found the initial group a bit of a struggle to get to grips with, possibly just because getting used to the control system, but I probably stuck to one of them for too long. I was afraid of failing badly in season mode with an unfamiliar car and being 'stuck' but you can always just try again. Worst case, quit the season and try another if it's feeling bad after two races. Or if you're better at preparing than me, try the car in single races instead of in a season!

The music bears mentioning all on its own for being truly great, a serious contributor to the relaxed feeling I have when proceeding through a stage that isn't going terribly. Tatreal did an unreal job and I went directly to Bandcamp to buy the OST.

Thank you Funselektor and especially thank you for the continued updates, I hopped on pretty late (only a couple of months ago) and there is a TON to see and do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971390170', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2452, 'last_played': 1707626628}
review:
I've been a long time racing game fan but only dabbled in rally in the past. This game makes rally interesting and approachable in a way that most games can't (Absolute Drift had a similar vibe for drifting as well). I love that the game progression demonstrates the history of rally in a fun way while introducing more advanced cars.

The simplicity of the interface, art style and uninterrupted synthwave soundtrack make for a game that is easy to get lost in. I really enjoy the visual style of the game. I find the simplified models and textures compliment the good lighting and camera focus effects. 

The sound design is great with interesting and unique engine sounds for each car that are pretty true to the real life counterpart. I'm a fan of synthwave and the soundtrack is great! I love that the music just continues between stages uninterrupted.

The controls are simple but intuitive. The game is great on an xbox controller but can also be played with little setup required on a racing wheel (though no force feedback).

This is one of the few racing games that I've participated in online events. It's just so fun and easy to do a weekly or daily event that I usually do the ones available each time I play.

Overall, I've really enjoyed the experience and will still continue to play in the future. The developer is working on extra content updates and will be expanding onto consoles soon. I'm excited for others to get hooked too.

review: Amazing vehicle variety, beautifully simple graphics, perfect "Simcade" with plenty of asset adjustment for those not great at racing games, plenty of free extra content and cars and one of the best soundtracks I've heard in a game in a very long time (so much so I bought it for real world driving.)  if you like either driving games, rally or retrowave you'll love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960722378', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2316, 'last_played': 1619017120}
review:
✅ Recommended
Fun driving mechanics, but sadly mostly in the late career where the cars are more reliable in terms of stability and more fun in terms of speed. Environments are great but too few. The music is awesome!

So this was a close call to be honest, but in terms of recommend/don't recommend I'll still recommend it. Here are some more specific things I want to mention that may or may not turn you off. I'm going to sound more negative about the game than I actually am, but I feel like others may not overlook these things in the same way that I did.

* Career overstays its welcome
One of my main gripes with games in general is when devs don't understand the value of their product or how to keep things fun. This game is fundamentally a good game, for sure, but the fact that the career mode is so so long is just barely worth it. The same environments are just looped over and over again with the same tracks but with slightly better cars. It could have been cut by 75% and I would still buy the game, I would even give it a better score. Which similarly brings me to the next point.

* Early cars are boring
Quite frankly, the first few cars of the game are simply boring to drive. They are slow, front-wheel driven cars that almost made me quit the game right away. While they're at it, take out the next category of cars as well.

Now combine these two points for a great career experience!

One final point I want to make is that I really like the way you can set up your own difficulty in the game's options menu, very appreciated.

I know there are more environments coming, which is great and I look forward to playing them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014659127', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1710874676}
review: Most pleasant surprise in a long time. First off I don't like the way you are dropped straight in to free roam upon starting up the game. Boot me to the main menu please so I can choose. I came for the stage driving, not the free roaming. I was literally about to refund the game, and decided to quit to the main menu to see if there was another way to play and there is the career mode. Now I can play a rally game as I intended to, and it's awesome. Really really good. Nuanced handling, plenty of cars to unlock, nice tracks and none of them gated behind a paywall. Graphics are nice and the sound isn't bad either. I think the price is borderline. If more content comes out for free then the initial price is worth it. Recommended even if you're a die-hard rally fan.

review:
Optisch etwas minimalistisch, aber wunderschön. In Kombination mit der Musik wirkt das Spiel fast schon entspannend und beruhigend.
Das Fahrzeugverhalten ist (auch durch die Kamera-Ansicht) etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig und alle Autos fahren sich ein bisschen wie Allradfahrzeuge, was dem Spaß aber keinen Abbruch tut. Wenn man die Hilfen verringert/ausschaltet fühlt es sich echter an, wird aber auch anspruchsvoller.
Sehr coole Auswahl alter Rennfahrzeuge!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992004173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1617920459}
review:
Nope. Why? Because - REASONS (c) mr.Torgue En/Ru

tbh. 1080ti have problems on "auto" settings. omg - for this mobile style. srsly?
particle effects? cmonnn. who did this? can i shake his ar... throat? smoke/dust don`t spawn as huge blob under yourt hood. mutafaka. it slowly appears after wheels. can tweak particle system for ya if it ue4. ruin all my experience in replays. No, it not "style". it`s lazyashhhhhhholecontent setup.

Physics from "absolute drift" or maybe tweaked to worse. I know how car moves on tarmac, gravel or snow. Do a little difference, cause now it seems same behavior on any surface.

And sound no so good as AD.

Нет, Потому что!

Серьёзно, эта мобильного вида игрень нагружает 1080ти хлеще любого дума, и при "авто" на 4к лагает как сволочь, что... мягко говоря ужасно странно.
Спецэффекты/Системы частиц/VFX - покажите мне этого гения - я пожму ему горло. Пыль, она не огромными кусками из капота появляется а поднимается из под колёс, плавно, если бы это было на уе4  - я бы даже настроил им это бесплатно. Нет, это не стиль - это рукажопопсть. И если во время заезды ты ещё можешь смириться с этим, то на реплее - нет, отвратительно.

Физика машины видимо из "absolute drift", но там это хоть оправдано. Разницы в покрытиях нету, вообще, я представляю как машина едет по асфальту*гравию/снегу. Нет, я понимаю, что это упрощённый симулятор виражей, но не настолкьо одинаково же, никакой радости.

Ну и если в AD саунтрек был ХОРОШ, то тут он не приближается к этой высоте.

брать по очень большой скидке или нужде, а с учётом что ф4 стоит только в 2 раза дороже...

review:
Art of rally es una experiencia que vale totalmente la pena, es una combinacion entre simulador y arcade que te hace aprender la manera adecuada de conducir cada vehiculo tanto en curvas como en terreno y si bien a veces es deseperante, la satisfaccion de hacer una curva digna de Initial D no tiene precio.
Eso y sumandole el magnifico soundtrack que va de la mano con los paisajes minimalistas y paleta de colores 
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996460955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1666076957}
review: Easily one of the best racing games on PC, and in general to come out in awhile. It's pure. The courses, especially starting midway thru group 3, are fun challenging. Even the reverse and flips race so differently, some you have to do racing lines and come back at it with rally lines on the uphill version. When I put down the game, I feel satisfied, I had a great time, and it leaves me wanting more. When you have the car that matches the road type, a song beat you feel with the track, weather is jiving with your paint scheme and you're just flying across the dirt in a groove, this game is bliss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042128312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1850, 'last_played': 1706990113}
review:
One of the best games I have ever came across in a long time!
Simplistic graphics with some semi-realistic physics that matches up with games like Forza, and the fact it supports custom liveries is worth every penny I've spent for this! :)

The rivals however, need a little tweaking though, especially in master difficulty, there will be times I set great time records reaching top 50's to top 10's in online leader boards but still get gapped by the rivals by 5-10 seconds even if my stage run was flawless with fluid maneuvering and no mistakes, also I notice that the rivals are handicapped by adverse weather conditions.

Did a little experiment, I tried playing the same stage with different weather, I noticed that I will easily have a 15 to 20 second lead in rainy or snowy weather even with a couple crashes and mistakes. But when in dry conditions, night and fog, I usually get a 2-4 second lead and when I'm unlucky, I fall behind the pack by 5-10 seconds no matter how well I handle the stage.

Mentioning this as I'm trying to have 100% victories and no restarts used but kept on getting unlucky with the end results of some stages no matter how fast I went. The impossible podium finish problem became an issue for me when I reached the 1986 season of Group B, I only get lucky when the stages are either raining or snowing.

That aside, the game is still a lot of fun, I also enjoy the photo mode a whole lot, I can happily make some desktop wallpapers for my other fellow car enthusiast friends with the photo mode lol

Hoping to see more cars and locations to be added, this game has lots of great potential! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971305092', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1617346792}
review:
Ich habe den Key via Keymailer erhalten. Vielen Dank an die Entwickler. Leider wird das Spiel dort trotz 3 Streams immernoch nicht als "covered" angezeigt. 

Meine Review
Auf den ersten Blick wirkte das Spiel durch die Screenshots komisch auf mich. Meine Neugier war geweckt und ich habe den Key angefragt. Und dann auch erhalten. Nun möchte ich mal meine Meinung kund tun.

Grafik:
Ich LIEBE diesen Grafikstil. Für so eine Art von Spiel vielleicht ungewöhnlich. Aber ich finde den Stil so gut. Sei es die Gestaltung der Autos, die Darstellung der Umgebung und auch der Streckenbeschaffenheit. Einfach alles passt. So viel Liebe zu den kleinsten Details ( wenn man diese denn bei dem Tempo überhaupt erkennen kann )... einfach nur grandios! Und jede Etappe sieht anders aus, jedes Land wird neu ( manchmal etwas überspitzt ) dargestellt. Eventuell stehen in Deutschland aber nicht an jeder dritten Kurve irgendwelche Panzer oder andere alte Militätfahrzeuge :D

Belohnungen:
Ich mag Spiele dich mich bei Erfolgen immer mit kleinen neuen Sachen belohnen... mir ein Leckerli zuwerfen. Das macht das Spiel gut. Neue Rennklassen, neue Lackierungen, neue Autos, neue Strecken. Mehr braucht ein kleiner Kenny in diesem Spiel garnicht um glücklich zu werden. 

Fahrgefühl:
Ihr müsst euch im Klaren sein, dass es hierbei um ein reines Arcade-Spiel geht. Und trotzdem fährt sich jedes Auto auf jedem Untergrund sehr unterschiedlich. Sogar innerhalb der eigenen Klasse merkst du deutliche Unterschiede. Gute Arbeit. 

Sound:
Hier kommen wir an einen Punkt, den ich leider nicht so feiern kann. Die Musik im Hintergrund ist ganz ok. Aber der Motorensound ist leider garnichts für meine Ohren. OK. Ich muss zugeben, dass ich schon einen kleinen Fetisch habe was Motorenklänge angeht und vielleicht auch etwas verwöhnt bin. Aber hier sagt es mir leider so garnicht zu. 

Was mir noch fehlt: 
Keine Ahnung unter welchen Punkt ich das hätte packen können. Mir fehlt für ein Rallye-Spiel ( auch wenn es "nur" Arcade ist ) ein Beifahrer der mir Ansagen macht. Sowas gehört einfach in Rallyespiel. 

Fazit: 
Tolles Spiel. Wer Bock auf einen unkomplizierten, trotzdem spannenden und anspruchsvollen Arcade-Rallye-Racer hat, macht hier definitiv nichts falsch! Vielen Dank an die Entwickler. Gute Arbeit =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198122994714', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1653068747}
review: takes a short while to get used to, but well worth the journey. I started out thinking I could hurl the 1950s wagons you start with round every corner, pulling the handbrake and trying my best scandinavian flick. I found that the most enjoyment from this game is when you just enter a sort of flow state, and not outdriving your own abilities. this is an excellent game in that regard, the visuals are gorgeous and the general aesthetic is first-rate. I would recommend purchasing this game at full price, something which I don't do very often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067206910', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1630131658}
review: Really well-made, fun, and challenging game. The soundtrack is so utterly incredible, I've never been more tempted to buy a game's soundtrack. Very few bugs, unlimited gameplay, many cars to drive, and some beautiful landscapes. I hope this game continues to get updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198980302246', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1706290069}
review: Franchement, c'est l'un des meilleurs jeu auquel j'ai joué, son design "Low poly" est juste magnifique, la conduite jouissif quand on la maîtrise bien, et une BO exceptionnelle qui met dans le rythme de la course et nous met dans un état second où chaque mouvement a son importance. Les devs sont très actif (sur le Discord), les bugs corrigés rapidement et les mises à jours à venir pour l'ajout de nouvelle maps, voitures, musiques ou autre ne manque pas. Art of rally possède de beau jours devant lui, je vous le conseil fortement si vous êtes fan de rally ou de jeu de conduite arcade.
