author: {'steamid': '76561198006687252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 36, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1712356349}
review:
This is an excellent arcade/sim rally game. I say arcade/sim because although it has an easy control scheme (a gamepad works great) there are somewhat realistic physics and the cars all behave how you would expect them to. There is an amazing soundtrack and the game just looks and runs beautifully.

I highly recommend this game to anyone interested in racing games, especially the golden age of rally.

review: Really a great game. Super easy concept to understand but really takes some time to master. Start slow and follow the career it will really help you get a grasp for things moving onto the more powerful cars. If you love cars and love rallying I highly suggest this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104525443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1866, 'last_played': 1707814845}
review:
Como en todo juego de coches las primeras clases son flojitas pero cuando empiezas a llevar coches de clases más avanzadas la conducción pasa a ser como untar mantequilla, es una delicia de control. Si además  te atrapa lo bonito que se ve y los feelings nostálgicos, no sé que haces que no lo estás jugando. Lo más destacable es, sin duda, el pilotaje arcade y el diseño de los trazados, ambos son sublimes. Y por cierto, tiene musicón también.
PD: Para cambiar la cámara es en la cruceta derecha, pon la que es más baja para apreciar bien los desniveles y anticipar los próximos virajes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004618234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1616847261}
review:
+ J'aime les graphismes
+ j'aime la musique
+ le son des voitures.

- Pistes répétitives
- C'est quoi cette adhérence ? Quand on freine on tire tout droit, quand on tourne au ralenti on tire tout droit. Quand on tourne doucement on quitte la piste.... Sérieux? C'est ça la définition du fun ?
- L'accélération de certaines voitures se fait instantanément après le passage de la 3eme, la vitesse est alors bcp trop élevée pour envisager quelconque virage sans manger de l'herbe (stages avec bcp de virages)
- Jeu léger et pourtant moins de 60 fps avec un Intel 9900K et une RTX 2060. What ??
- 20€ !!!

Donc non désolé, ce n'est pas "l'art of rally".
On n'y est pas du tout et si vous voulez l'acheter car la vidéo de présentation fait baver... regardez plutot des vrais gameplay car ce n'est vraiment pas ça.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138458749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1609, 'last_played': 1710120977}
review:
Saw this in a youtube video and thought it looked cool. I wasn't disappointed. The low poly, minimalist graphics look way better than you'd think, and the cars sound excellent. The handling is great and much more complex and nuanced than you'd think given the arcade-y aesthetic. Controller recommended.
One tip would be to pay close attention to the road, the camera angle makes it hard to tell when you're traveling up or down hill or approaching a crest

author: {'steamid': '76561198202823299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1690237012}
review:
Really pretty and it's easy to get the hang of" - My fiance

Very fun game with a lot of group B nostalgia and fun packed in. The only thing I'd wish for is more maps and more camera angles (not first person but something a bit lower to the ground). Also some pace notes would be fantastic. All in all a very simple but fun game that is quick to learn and hard to master

author: {'steamid': '76561198233419732', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 3279, 'last_played': 1712366783}
review:
An absolute banger of a game, even for someone who might not think they like racing games. 
The driving mechanics strike a balance between realistic, fun, and fluid, while the art style is as beautiful as it is simple and clean. 
the cherry on top is the soundtrack, speeding you through every corner with focus while having a good time. 
One quirk with the game is, despite being able to adjust the camera with a couple settings, you only have the option between a too far back chase cam, or a very far helicopter cam. If only we could get a proper chase cam and cockpit view. (There are no pace notes or minimap of any form during the race, hence the exclusion of these camera options, though they would still be greatly appreciated ;) pls
The career also brings you through rally history, with descriptions for the time periods, and cars. Though I am not familiar with rally culture, it is clear this game pleases that aspect. 
The cars all reference real cars as well, and especially across groups and even within groups they can drive very differently. Take the rotary b7, a rwd car in group b that is very difficult to control(at least for me). I was determined to master it, though I never have.
Point is, this game offers so much for the tiny price it is asking. If you have doubts, stop

author: {'steamid': '76561198009431140', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 1541, 'last_played': 1712326050}
review:
A truly worthy successor to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/antisol/recommended/320140]Absolute Drift[/url] (a game that's also worth picking up)

Take the physics-based driving of absolute drift and change the mechanic so that it's now a racing game - racing against the clock, the world leader board, and/or AI times, with a ghost car in time attack mode.

Difficult to master, but super addictive and fun. Career mode means hours of gaming that isn't repetitive. 

Career mode gives an excellent progression through the history of rally, unlocking faster and better cars as you go. With limited restarts and bonuses for remaining restarts at the end of the season, there can be an element of strategy.

Time Attack mode is great for mastering one track / car and playing against the world leaderboard. Great for a quick run or for hours of fun.

Free-roam mode gives you a bunch of areas where you can drive around at your leisure and find collectables.

Big. Has TONS of cars and lots of tracks.

Nit-picks:
 - High System Requirements
 - framerate issues on the Linux version. But hopefully we'll see this fixed. The support community is helpful.
 - I don't think the music is quite as good as absolute drift, but that's a minor thing. The music is still good.

Recommendation:

I think that the AU$40 price tag is steep, but given the size of the game it's worth it if you can afford it. If not, it's well worth $20 on sale. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030874160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1616422762}
review: Nice to look at, a bit tongue in cheek, but surprisingly difficult to master, especially with the more powerful vehicles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995686247', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1666061816}
review:
You'll crash a lot at the beginning and think the physics are floaty, but the synthwave soundtrack will keep you in a few stages more... Then it finally all clicks together and you start chaining corners in a strangely relaxing manner. Truly a neat little gem for all racing fans.

PS: Experiment with the different camera views, they can vastly change your experience / enjoyment of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000503647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1663132690}
review:
Art of Rally is a love letter to the whole history of rallying. As you go through the story you get better cars, that naturally go faster, and segments that were a breeze now are harder to handle. Things really get heated once you get to Group B, where i stopped. If i were to compare it with something. It's Dirt, but also it's Micro Machines.

This is definitely a game i need to finish at some point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961529123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1662743424}
review:
Great idea! But...

It has it's own way of handling controls and don't expect any realistic feeling as it does not seem to be the goal of the game. It feels like a drifting game made into a rally game and it creates a highly challenging experience that I personally find mostly frustrating. 

The game is not ready and is filled with basic bugs.

Not worth the price, should be much lower to meet expectations but streamers playing the game made it possible to set the price higher, so you know what you pay for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063064312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1653733027}
review:
When it comes to racing games I would see myself as a rather casual gamer. I was intrigued by the visual style of "Art of Rally", but I admit I also was holding back on buying it fearing it would have rather hardcore physics and handling. BUT: it's fun! Soooo much fun!

I am well aware that I will never compete with any of the top players here, but this game can be a joyride for everyone even slightly interested in rally, drifting and racing. The freeroam mode gives you the chance to testdrive cars, get used to the mechanics/physics of the game and will enable you to get an overall feel for each car's handling. Plus there's tons of secrets to find to unlock paintjobs etc.

Career mode is where you unlock most of the cars (afaik), and you can adjust the difficulty to your liking. Fantastic job here @devs!

Soooo... all in all - as a casual racer - I have only good things to say about "Art of Rally". The visual style might not be everbody's cup of tea, but I personally love it. Performance is very good (taken into account that my PC is not top notch anymore since a few years now). Hardcore racers might nitpick on the engine sounds, but in my opinion they fit to the overall stylized graphics and "let's have fun" attitude of the game.

If you're a casual like me: give it a try! If you are a hardcore racer that is up for competition: give it a try, too!


Now in what direction did I throw my car?

author: {'steamid': '76561198047370754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1680372295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198219201899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 106, 'playtime_at_review': 3107, 'last_played': 1711557123}
review:
Not really arcade, not really sim, art of rally is a compelling top down racing game with multiple layers to be discovered and a high skill ceiling. Chill but also competitive, it's demanding enough to stay interesting but the whole atmosphere, beautiful aesthetics and a banging soundtrack also make it a relaxing and memorable experience. 

The different cars have a weight to them and feel amazing after a bit of a learning curve, you feel completly in control. The difference in handling is really noticeable between the vehicules, the best example being RWD vs AWD. If you're familiar with racing/rally you'll find techniques like weight transfer, handbrake turns and drifts can and should be applied here. You can even clutch kick. The game offers manual or automatic transmissions and controllers and wheels are supported. ( And highly recommended, please don't play this game on keyboard.) There is A LOT of cars to try and mastering them will take time, some will fit a specific driving style, some will control you more than you control them. Most engines sound great, some better than others, but they are pretty decent overall. 
The lack of pacenotes is justified by the top down camera which can get some getting used to, although it is entirely customisable and you can get it closer to your car while still having vision of the turns ahead ( in some rare cases visibility can be a problem, but honestly nothing dramatic ) My camera settings : 1/35/70/30.
The replay and photo modes are well implemented and a welcome feature.

There's five locations with six unique forward/reverse stages, playable at any time of day plus the addition of rain. Five free roam locations with collectibles/unlockables. All this with an interesting career mode will keep you busy for a while.

But for me the game really starts once you start getting into leaderboard attack. There's nothing quite as satisfying as finally getting that top 100/50/10 you've been setting your eyes on. This is where you can really feel your improvements and skill refining in the game. This is where most of my time playing the game is, because it is honestly addicting. 

I don't have a lot of negative things to say about the game.  
Stages all have the same width. I wish there was a night mode, that UI background is bright. More stages and locations, replay viewing/import from other players ( just to see what other planets some drivers live on... ), more custom cameras. Less bouncy jump landings. Optimized vegetation/less popping. 

Favorites cars : 

group 2 : das 119i
group 3 : the rotary 3, il nonno 313, the zetto
group 4 : das whip, turbo brick, the cozzie sr5
group b : the cozzie sr2, das hammer v1/v3, il monster ( the rotary b7 in this category is probably the car I dislike the most)
group s : the rotary s7, the umibozu, il gorilla e1
group A : They're all good. But it's the fujin. My personal favorite car in the game. 1500+ km driven, top 100 in all stages with a few top 20/10 here in there. If in doubt... just flex :D

Special mention to the 4 hour long exeptionnal soundtrack.

Now should you get it? 

Don't care about racing or time attack : hmm??
You like racing : yes. 
You like rally : what are you waiting for?! stop reading this book of a review and buy it.

review:
Very cool aesthetically and has strong handling and physics, but is unfortunately let down by very weak stage design and a lack of variety within it - all of the different locales play nearly the same, and you'll have seen every stage in the game at least twice before you even get to the Group B cars.

If this game had good stages, it would be amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986739038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1615225243}
review: Repetition of tracks begins to show its face in the first 2 hours. The group B cars don't feel as powerful as they should. Handling is very similar to the drift game the same developer released, it feels too "heavy", these cars were rocket ships in their time, essentially skating across the dirt. As such it is a fairly underwhelming game, worth picking up on a sale. Sadly not worth £19.49, normal price being around £13 would be ideal. At £10 it's a definite buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199076365033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 10344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1710674115}
review:
Yes, I do recommend the game. Art of Rally can be reasonably challenging but is also lots of fun. Tracks ranging in lengths from 3 to 12 kilometres are distributed over Germany, Japan, Sardinia (Maybe Spain), Norway and Finland and the game provides a big selection of the the most famous rally cars from the 1960s onwards, with brief and interesting anecdotes about each of them. Needless to say, the driving experience with each of them is unique. One could call it a wholesome game. 

With updates, they are adding new cars and other features like ghost cars etc. responding well to the feedback and suggestions of the community. The game also has a stripped down but very efficient version of the online daily and weekly events like what you find in the Dirt games. Overall, I find it a complete and very accessible rally racing game, especially for those with less time on their hands and seeking a reasonably challenging but not very tiring racing experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995849278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1682936830}
review:
[h1] ¡El Rally hecho Arte! [/h1]

Modo de juego: Sim-Cade desafiante
Tipo de gráficos: Exóticos, bellos, impresionantes.
Sonido: Excelente
Banda Sonora: Sobresaliente. Sintetizadores de los 80, para nostálgicos como yo.
Físicas: Impresionantes. Parece el Dirt Rally pero en "versión mini"
Manejo: Compatibilidad total con mando. Aun le falta la compatibilidad con volante.
Interfaz: Limpia y sencilla.
Modo de juego: Rally (sin copiloto) 
Atmósfera del juego: Relajante
Requerimientos PC: Hasta con un PC de baja gama se puede jugar.

ADDICIONAL: Desarrolladores pendientes de feedback y actualizaciones puntuales. Variadas skins que se consiguen según se ganan campeonatos, así como atomóviles desbloqueables de todo tipo. Sentido del humor y creatividad en los nombre de los autos y de las trayectorias. Y mucho más. En definitiva, una experiencia de rally relajante pero desafiante, cumpliendo todos los objetivos que cualquier fan de rally quiera a excepción de poder cambiar los ajustes del coche y de un modo multijugador. Nota: Grado A+

[spoiler] Mil agradecimientos a https://www.twitch.tv/capjimmy por regalarme semejante joya. [/spoiler]

review:
Such a awesome game. Really I absolutely love it. 
The cars are really cool and true to form and personally I like the driving model.

Now I would like to see some more tracks and some more every-person JDM rides. Like a Honda EG hatch or coupe, or at least a last gen CRX(mine was taken from me by a drunk driver, so having one in this game would be awesome). 
Honestly I would support paid DLC for such a unique game, and you should definitely give this game a go. Such a chill OR competitive experience can be had.
Thank you for such a needed breath of air in a sea of samey racing games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041407443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3882, 'last_played': 1696087749}

author: {'steamid': '76561198448204847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1615929351}
review:
Ouah il est joli ton jeu! C'est quoi? C'est "art of savonnettes": tu pilotes des savonnettes à pneus lisses. 
Redevenons sérieux, voulez-vous? Art of savon... euh rally est un jeu très kawai avec ses jolies couleurs pastels, ses effets de lumieres et ses décors tout jolis. La foule qui sécarte sur votre passage est marrant et la conduite de nuit est très bien rendue.
MAIS les voitures sont juste incontrôlables ! On dirait qu'elles sont toutes sur pneus lisses. Et la pluie..; Ce n'est pas de l'eau mais de l'huile, pour vous dire on glisse moins sur la neige! Les routes en graviers sont aussi glissantes que la pluie alors qd vous cumulez les 2, bonne chance pour rester sur la route. Et les collisions: j'ai fait 5 tonneaux en heurtant une botte de paille à 40 km/h !!! Le nombre de voitures est aussi artificiellement gonflé en mettant les meme caisses mais avec des couleurs différentes ou des catégories différentes. De toute façon peu de changement entre le pilotage de ces caisses à savon. 
Bref un bel emballage pour un beau savon. Dommage!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991393882', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1708551361}
review: Great game. Not really a simulation, but a challenging yet relaxing game, with a great visual appeal. Races are varied (asphalt, gravel, snow, night time, fog, rain…) and free roam is just perfect to chill. A must have for all rally fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034435919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1701247431}
review: 游戏不予置评。国家选项为什么有“台湾”和“香港”？！

author: {'steamid': '76561197997579060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1683986073}
review:
とっつきやすい見た目とは裏腹に結構シビアな運転をキメていくゲーム
ひとまず触ってみて、ハンドルの感じが合わなかったら設定をいじるのがおススメ。
初期設定だとカウンターステア係数が160％にされているので、僕は100％にしてから操作しやすくなった気がします。

ここからはプレイして気になったことを書いていこうかと思います。

まず一見難しそうに見えるマニュアルの操作ですが、実はクラッチ操作をしなくてもシフトチェンジは可能みたいです。もちろんアクセル抜いて、クラッチ踏んでシフトチェンジっていう方法でも可能です。
とにかく楽しいなと思う方で運転すればOK!

車や塗装などはキャリアを進めていかないとアンロックされない形式です。
とは言っても、レベルをイージーにすれば問題なく優勝できると思います。
リトライを1度も使わなければ、塗装も2台分手に入るので結構楽ちん

晴れの日のダートは人気が高く、リーダーボードで順位を上げるのは難しい。僕は大体3500位を行ったり来たりしています。
雨の日だと人気がないので割と簡単に350～200位くらいまで上がります。上手くなった気がして嬉しいぞ!

車両によって癖がある。気がする…
自分に合った車両を見つけるのも楽しくていいぞ!

カメラモードの時、絞りや焦点距離がいじれるのでスクショ撮りがめちゃくちゃ楽しい。
あと撮ったスクショがタイトル画面で表示されるのもなんか嬉しくなる!

まとめると
操作に癖があり、最初は難しいかもしれないがイージーでキャリアを進めつつ慣れれば楽しいぞ!
art of rally の名前は伊達じゃない!

author: {'steamid': '76561198232080584', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1614973512}
review:
Simply B E A U T I F U L 

Theres nothing else like this on the market, It the music and the aesthetics blend in so incredibly it somehow manages to capture the essence of rally so good without taking it too seriously and managing to be really relaxing at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069400163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1582, 'last_played': 1703834501}
review: More technical than arcade. pump the graphics up and enjoy the eye candy. Great title thus far. A must for fans of rally!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091496468', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1710192473}
review:
J'aime:
- style graphique low poly très sympa
- couleur de l’environnement très vive
- Une soundtrack juste EXTRA dans le style synthwave.
- des environnements bien reconnaissable en fonction des pays. (je veux dire, des Tanks pour l’Allemagne?)
- une énorme quantité de voiture (environ 60 je crois) de différentes époque.
- des petits easter egg sous les voitures (oui oui dessous).
- un mélange entre arcade est simulation.
- Les voitures ont toute un son de moteur bien caractéristique .

J'aime moins:
- la conduite est un peu "molle". Pour être précis on sens une sorte de latence entre la commande est le déplacement de la voiture, ceci étant sûrement du à la camera très éloigné. mais on s'y fait.

Conclusion:
On sent que le jeu à été fait par des fans pour des fans. Une certaine nostalgie se dégage du jeu. Un très bon jeu de rallye.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047592003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 21, 'playtime_at_review': 3421, 'last_played': 1711738128}
review:
It looks like a cheesy arcade game, and it does indeed have an extra helping of "cheese", but only in the best way possible... :D

The driving, even with just a keyboard, is absolutely sublime. It's really difficult to pick my favourite aspect of it: The way the car's grip goes light over crests, digs in with extra grip through the dips, wobbles in a mostly controlled manner over bumps, and then still varies believably across different surfaces, is all just downright amazing.

This is not a simple arcade driving game, this is a proper rally game that presents a good challenge, and rewards you as the driver in ways that only screenshots, videos, and manic giggling can dare to shake a stick at...

Most fun thing to do in this game? Well, that's easy: clutch kick the Rotary S7 in 2nd gear around *any* nice tight corner. First few times (with headphones) actually gave me goosebumps. Also, the "frozen peas falling on a computer case" (Google it) make for very believable gravel flicking sounds.. :D

If you have ever, even once, randomly, spontaneously even, enjoyed a rally game... BUY THIS NOW! You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998277382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1680263314}

author: {'steamid': '76561198254310958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1704935226}
review:
Have you ever you spend days playing Sega Rally, Collin McRae and V-Rally?? 

In case your answer is yes, this game is for you. 

If  you want to go fast (as you should) and don't have the best CPU you may want to lower the graphics. Fun game, classic cars, cool graphics,  good game overall. I stlll think it's a little bit pricey but...I don't go to bars anymore, you know

author: {'steamid': '76561198127612688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'playtime_at_review': 2183, 'last_played': 1711655409}
review: Eu fiquei receoso em comprar esse jogo por que eu vi "poxa, deve ser só um jogo de carro, nada demais", acabou que esse jogo é realmente muito, gosto bastante da gameplay, ela é imersiva e competitiva, os visuais são de tirar o fôlego de tão bonitos, o único "problema" que eu encontrei foi nas minhas primeiras horas, por que eu achava muito difícil controlar o carro em alta velocidade, mas fui aprendendo devagar e depois fui aumentando minha ousadia nas curvas. Recomendo demais o jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028551958', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1701939191}
review:
Incredible game, really a piece of art, just like rallying!

I'm amazed by the love for detail, lovely graphics, incredible soundtrack and overall great gameplay. You can truly feel the passion for rally that has gone into this, absolutely recommend.

One of the best racing games for me, 10/10

Also check out Absolute Drift if you're looking for a similar fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561199124620923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1615836660}
review: This Game is simply beautiful, the simplistic art style, the throwback music, it all just wraps together into a perfect game about a perfect sport. Rally has gone unappreciated in the past few decades, the art of full sending it around a dirt corner with all 4 wheels spinning, a scene of controlled chaos. This game perfectly captures the feeling of "oh shit that was too fast". the fact that you have to be so precise with your motion really sets you in the drivers seat. the diversity between cars and the feel of how each one drives is phenomenal. the casual driving of freeroam is so relaxing. there is only one problem i have with this game, and that's the fact that it hasn't been recognized enough. Props to the creators of this one, you just gave a man a piece of his childhood back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402675126', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 5005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4487, 'last_played': 1620103522}
review:
[h1]优质的画面加上流畅顺滑的操作手感，光冲这两点就足以给一款rac游戏好评了[/h1]
 
首先说一下画面,这个游戏最大的卖点就是它的卡通风设计，加上完整的色彩建模，明亮的颜色搭配看着也很舒服，每条赛道还有不同的特色贴图：撒丁岛的建筑、日本的樱花等等，做的也很用心，还有不怕死跑上赛道的观众……我一个女孩子对这种可爱风格完全没有抵抗力，猛男也是必备；
 
其次是游戏的手感,整体的操作我一个尘埃老玩家觉得没啥大问题，确实有评论区反映的过于丝滑的现象，赛道抓地力不是很足，刚开始玩的时候经常会发生推头入弯后又突然甩尾而掉头的现象，后驱开得我很难受，和尘埃4很像，花点时间适应之后就还行，加上本作简化了很多操作，这样子的设计换句话说也更容易做出drift来，但是需要练习一阵子，拉力游戏嘛，没个几十小时你想上手？
 
值得一提的是游戏自创的自由探索模式针不戳，把拉力游戏的可玩性拓宽了，而且无形之间还能让玩家适应车和赛道，这种边找东西边看风景放松顺带练车的idea很有想法；
 
下面的部分就要说一下游戏的缺点了,我给好评的原因并不是游戏没有瑕疵，相反毕竟是小厂游戏，瑕疵是真的不少，只是我觉得这些问题对游戏体验影响不大：
1.视角虽然可调但都是第三人称视角，作为一个习惯了头盔和保险杠视角的玩家来说，前十几个小时我都在为了适应上帝视角而努力；
2.可能是第三人称视角的关系，游戏全程没有路书，只能凭自己感觉判断1234567，平地倒还行，但是对于上坡之后的出弯，因为是完全看不见的盲弯，因此只能减速；
3.画面虽然做的很棒但是仅限你的车在赛道上的时候，一旦你开出赛道，各种穿模随之而来；
4.无论是车还是操作设置都没有可调节选项，必须去适应每一辆车的原厂调教以及游戏固定的操作风格；
5.操作系统大幅简化，可以骚操作的空间极限压缩，这使得作为一款rac游戏，本作反而没有什么可深度挖掘的点，不像尘埃，每一辆车光调教就要花上好几个小时，每一个赛段的刹车点、是否手刹、换挡我都可以跑个几百来遍，这个游戏可能跑个几次玩个十几小时就腻了；
 
讲了这么多，如果你是拉力新人，想通过这个游戏入坑拉力，那我是不推荐的，上帝视角没有开拉力的刺激感，简化的操作与不够拟真的手感也不适合作为第一款拉力游戏，想入坑的话那必须推荐尘埃（5就算了）；但如果你是一个拉力老人，或者像我一样是一个拉力狂热爱好者，那这款游戏必入，不贵的价格、丰富的赛道、大量尘封历史的车辆，足以把你带回b组那个拉力黄金年代爽快个几十小时；
 
最后，游戏有个不得不提的彩蛋——原型是b组蓝旗亚Delta S4那辆车，它的车底写的是1986年驾驶该车在比赛中撞车起火身亡的芬兰车手Henri Toivonen的名字，游戏里有个成就叫“group b”，你需要驾驶一辆着火的车完成赛段也是在向历史致敬。

author: {'steamid': '76561198205345613', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1695163261}
review:
Em 2020, excepcionalmente, tive oportunidade de poder jogar vários títulos com temática de corrida voltado para Rally englobando os Drifts. Seja de franquias com status de triple AAA e também os jogos indies, títulos dos mais variados como WRC 9, Dirt 5, Inertial Drift e também Art of Rally. É em Art of Rally, que será o foco desta publicação. Acima é possível acompanhar um gameplay sem comentários.

O jogo foi desenvolvido pela Funselektor Labs em 23 de setembro de 2020. Portanto, também joguei antes do lançamento oficial. Mas somente agora resolvi escrever sobre. Art of Rally que tem sua visão de cima para baixo, diversificando dos demais títulos, com visão angular por detrás dos carros ou em primeira pessoa de dentro do cockpit do carro.

Arte do correr
Uma das grandes tendências nos últimos anos que vem ganhando mercado são jogos com gráficos em low-poly, diferenciando dos em cel shaded e até os mais detalhados como WRC 9 apresentava gráficos realistas, Art of Rally, é minimalista com seu design gráfico. Embora, seja multicolorido, mas com seu redesenho simples, carros com estilos MicroMachines, para quem não conhece a franquia, é uma série de jogos famosa nos anos 90 e início dos anos 2000, mostrando carros em embates em formato miniatura —; recomendo pesquisar sobre. Toda vegetação também segue os padrões do minimalista, bem como os espectadores que aparecem em trechos pré-definidos ao longo da pista.


Aos jogadores que não estão familiarizados com jogos de corrida que exigem uma certa perspicácia para o controle dos comandos, existe um tutorial ensinando como sair bem-sucedido em cada curva e utilização do drift. Entretanto, utilizar as derrapagens em tutorial é uma coisa, agora valendo tudo se torna um pesadelo para os iniciantes. Acabei optando por jogar com controle, apesar de possuir dois volantes com compatibilidade com console e PC, ao utilizar o Dual Shock e também o do Xbox, para minha surpresa, deparei-me com uma sensibilidade altíssima. O que culminou passar pesadelos de direção, até acostumar com os controles. Ademais, nossa visão angular pode dificultar nos frenagem e que muitas das vezes é melhor frear do que simplesmente largar o acelerador para uma curva suave.


Dizer “Suave” chega ao exagero extremo, não há curvas fáceis em Art of Rally, no início o guard rails e a grama será seu melhor amigo sem contar os obstáculos da pista, cortar caminho não é tolerado como em WRC e Dirt, seu veículo será levado trazido peara pista e seu tempo será acrescido no cronômetro. Passado esses percalços logo me senti um verdadeiro Carlos Sainz, piloto espanhol de rali e duas vezes campeão do Campeonato Mundial de Rali, considerado por muitos o maior piloto da modalidade de todos os tempos.

Um jogo romanceado
O jogo nos mostra outras surpresas, com sua arte de rali a desenvolvedora tenta nos colocar em confronto com o detalhe romântico da história sobre os primórdios da modalidade. Exibindo um conceito de paixão e carisma das corridas em estradas, e cada carro tem sua narrativa particular. Mesmo que o jogo não tenha buscado licenciar as marcas — ou tenha não sei ao certo; existem referências no design de cada carro, e os amantes de automobilismo certamente conseguem reconhecer.

Com os mais de 50 carros de rali do Art of Rally que vai dos anos 60, 70, 80, Grupo B, S, A, junto com as 60 etapas de rally inspiradas nas pistas reais de Sardenha, Finlândia, Noruega, Japão e Alemanha.

Os patrocínios como piloto profissional, são marcas fictícias tais como a introdução das marcas de tabacos quando foram permitidas nas placas de publicidades em corridas na época. Atualmente, são extintas de todas as competições ligadas ao automobilismo.

Desafios diários e semanais também estão disponíveis se você quiser competir contra outros jogadores online. O modo livre é algo extraordinário para se jogar já com todos carros liberados.


Por fim, os jogos de corrida são marcados por suas trilhas sonoras vibrantes e a Funselektor Labs trouxe autenticidade para o game. Com músicas retrô utilizando sintetizadores no gênero chill-vibe, nossos ânimos são acalmados pela vibração relaxante em dias estressantes, não tornando em momento algum repetida ao ponto de enjoar e desligar a música.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110688747', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1614981366}
review: Wow, from the moment I saw the home screen, I knew I was gonna be hooked to this game for a bit. As a person who loves car games, cars in general, and racing, this game is a perfect match for my taste. The realistic motion of the cars in this game is fantastic, and is not quite as easy to control as it may seem at first. The career mode is an absolute blast so far, and there are a ton of races, where you are progressing through each legacy time period of rally racing. I haven't quite gone through each of the game modes, but in comparison to Absolute Drift (which I also loved), this game provides SO much more content to spend time doing. The game is very serene and you will find yourself losing track of time very quickly as you try and beat your times and polish your racing lines. Overall, I know it may seem like a game that does not provide a whole lot of content for $25, but if you love racing games that you'll find yourself addicted to, then this is absolutely the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065017924', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1706134947}
review:
[h1] Mon coup de coeur 2020 [/h1]

Pour tous les passionnés d'art et d'automobile, ce jeu est absolument parfait.

Sa bande son vous entraîne au fin-fond des forêts finlandaises aux montagnes nippones 
Vous y retrouverez des modèles mythiques, mais aussi des jamais vu
Le son des voitures est au petits oignons
Et le gameplay est à la fois facile à prendre en main, et dur à maîtriser! Le jeu se montre très exigeant si vous souhaitez aller chercher les meilleurs temps!

Donc sans aucune hésitation, foncez

author: {'steamid': '76561198118963337', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1683913023}
review:
非常好玩非常解压，物理非常厚重配合手柄回馈感受也很合理。忙里偷闲掏出来跑一把很有满足感。
很期待这款游戏的续作或者是后续更新...作为玩家提点个人的建议：
1.下雨的路面积水特效做得很好，但是希望能够在积水的地方加大点拖拽感。
2.利用积水的模板做沥青和冰面、暗冰结合的赛道。
3.虽然是拉力，但个人觉得这种俯视视角很适合加入联机模式一起比拼，能开启碰撞也可以幽灵模式（日本赛道上漂移的感觉真的很头文字D）
4.地图编辑器

author: {'steamid': '76561198051118754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1617200791}
review:
听歌，
在我开车的时候。
看风景，
只有我一个人。
引擎的心跳声，
回荡在我耳畔，
因为我在车的心里，

author: {'steamid': '76561197962809475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1627948326}
review: No upgrades, no currency, no politics, no fluff... Just racing. Surprisingly technical, and challenging. Gorgeous to boot. If you're still undecided: the music is worth it alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021226177', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1684024144}
review: This game is amazing. It's an arcade racer, but it really pushes you to consider the fundamentals of moving a 400hp monster around a tight corner without wrapping it around a tree trunk.  Art of Rally, by the same man who made Absolute Drift, really puts you in a zen state.  Play it for the music. Play it for the singing of the motors. Play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028370605', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2645, 'last_played': 1676829300}
review:
art of rally is quite a unique game that follows hot on the footsteps of Absolute Drift and I think it improves upon it in virtually every way. Even though I find some parts of it rather frustrating, there's just something about it that makes me come back to it.

The art style is very characteristic and clean, emulating the lower poly models of games like CMR 2 and SEGA Rally, which are obvious inspirations in my eyes. Other than that distinction, everything else presentation wise, like sounds and UI is solid but minimalistic. 

So far there's a small variety of locations which will be expanded (hopefully soon!). As of writing this, it includes: Norway, Germany, Italy, Finland, Japan. The stage variety is good, and the layouts can range from high speed wide gravel roads, to narrow tarmac paths with a lot of hazards. Every stage also has different weather conditions. Rain in particular can be quite interesting with the introduction of puddles that can throw your car off balance.

Now, the meat of the topic: gameplay. I have to say that they've done an amazing job at making the cars drivable AND driftable with arrow keys. The system is so good that I'm comfortable enough to do 1% times on most stages with a lot of cars! The driving model is not perfect though; my main strife (which is thankfully slowly getting better it seems) is the weight of the car during jumps and while it is generally unstable seems to be negligible and on occassion it can even be thrown around by the poles on the sides of the road if you hit them in the wrong way. This is just minor though, and it doesn't take anything away from the solid dynamics that funselektor has produced!

Normally, I'm mostly a Dirt Rally 2.0 guy and I also play some circuit sims and naturally that means that I will find some parts of the game frustrating and a little off in a pedantic, subconsciously elitist sort of way. But when I can't be arsed to bolt on my wheel and boot up a sim to slide around in a Group A car, I think I'll be hard-pressed to find a better alternative than this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127815434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1693516071}

author: {'steamid': '76561198157562792', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 9627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1710527402}
review:
this game is created for Sebastian Vettel if he goes to Rallying.
Nah jk. I went oversteering too much and then spun my car, without the assist tho.

okay, but the list of my concerns are : 
+Graphics are simple, not too heavy for some potato PC. The world detail is cool and  necessary, except for the pothole effect when it's raining
+ Steering is very slippy, that is the obvious and challenge for me, after I tried DiRT and rally moded Assetto Corsa, this "arcade control" worth trying.
+ oversteering is always your best friend, but understeering your car is your worst enemy
+/- Mod access is very simple but lack previewing of the mod result (hoping there is some kind of Content Manager just like Assetto Corsa) 

-/+ kinda pricey for this type game, but still worth my time 
- not amateur-friendly, if you are rally pleb 
- the chase camera angle is not my type, need to be careful if you passed a crested road, sometimes there was an unexpected jump and causing the car to understeer or oversteer after landed if you turned the wheel to the right or left.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042281157', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1709025814}
review: A really fun little game, that's easy to learn but truly difficult to master. While the cars fly as if they were in low-gravity when catching airtime, the driving physics are surprisingly great and much better than some AAA games out there (cough cough Cyberpunk). Each car has a unique feel and handles completely differently from the rest, the scenery is downright gorgeous, and you can find yourself completely lost in the game for hours! I recommend this to any and all auto racing enthusiasts who want a small lightweight indie style alternative to Dirt that they can play in class or at the office. The one thing I would really love to see added in the future would be some sort of split-screen co-op mode so I could compete against my friends in races.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041774763', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1671648246}
review: Oh god this is like a dream come true, I've been wanting a game that had sim like handling but with easy to understand controls and BAM this game comes along and delivers just that! handling is great but at times the gravity acts kind of weird, the game also has some pretty good humor in it, car names are of course fake but being based on their real counter part's name or county, for example the Audi Quattro is called Das Hammer, and the Peugeot 205 being called le 502, car descriptions could either be a description of the actual car's achievements and the like, or just amusing, sometimes even a mix of the two! my only complaint is the lack of modern rally cars, but thats okay, the game is supposed to be focusing on rally's golden years anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122424240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1656755871}

review: Противное управление, ужасная физика машин и столкновений с объектами. Невыносимо раздражает система возврата на дорогу в случае вылета с трассы. В описании машин вообще ничего полезного. Сгенерированные результаты гонки напоминают тебе о том, что в игре нет как таковых соперников.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391172919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1619587908}
review:
I wish steam can have a meh, but nevertheless I will give it a thumbs up.

This game sure is very fun, for people who love rallying, especially during the 80s golden era this game is definitely gold. However if you think you can just sit back, relax, and pushing up down left right to have a good afternoon you are totally wrong. 

This game is hard as heck. I mean, I am not particularly good at racing games, but after this 9 hours I still consistently crashing into trees/falling into ditches even with stability assist on full! At the first look I thought this game is "relaxing", but I am totally wrong. The worst thing is in the germany maps there are those little rocks on the side of the road making cutting corners or just driving off the track, ever so slightly, 120% impossible, your car will immediately crash and spin and the only thing you can do is recover the vehicle. Other maps are pretty hard too, driving in the snow essentially means you will always spin sideways whenever you turn, whenever there is a hairpin the car will definitely understeer, etc.  

Apart from that I'd give a 10/10, the art style is perfect, the car introductions are hilarious, the music and the engine sounds are also quite good, every car handles differently, it even runs quite smoothly on my potato laptop. I can definitely see the love the devs have put into this game. Would definitely recommend for the people who are already good at racing games, but for starters this game is a bit frustrating to play at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044931226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1701436029}
review:
Allez, on peut le dire : Art of rally est une perle.

Graphiquement, c'est minimaliste en nombre de polygones, mais les circuits sont remplis de petits détails qui montrent l'amour du travail bien fait. Les disques de frein qui rougissent, la lumière des couchers de soleil ... C'est tout simplement beau. Même les menus sont chouettes.

Côté gameplay, la conduite trouve le parfait équilibre entre arcade et simulation. On sent le poids des voitures, les trajectoires sont exigeantes mais pas frustrantes ... Chapeau.

Il y a plein de contenu (beaucoup de voitures, on aimerait peut-être un ou deux environnements en plus), des easter eggs, la musique synthwave accompagne parfaitement le tout ... Mais au fond, ce jeu vaut plus que la somme de ses qualités. Il dégage un charme, une atmosphère, une passion. Et ça, ça n'est pas si courant ...

(Même si on est dans une atmosphère différente, çe ma rappelle les bons moments passés sur  [url=store.steampowered.com/app/577990/Ignition/] Funtracks ("Ignition" en VO)[/url] vers ... 1997 !) (il est sur Steam aussi )

author: {'steamid': '76561198078146907', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1692959414}
review:
보기랑 다름 굉장히 어려움
뭐 만화스러운 그래픽 레이싱게임 만드는 애들은 시뮬에 열등감있나?
랠리의 역사는 신나게 씨부리면서 랠리의 기술은 단 하나도 안알려주는데
그렇다고 컨트롤이 쉬운것도 아님(키보드 기분)

뭐 키보드로는 탑뷰 레이싱게임도 하지말라고?
아니 생긴거는 방구차나 네오지오시절 Overtop이나 밀레밀리아 스럽게 해놓고는
무턱대고 "헤헿 게임이름이 랠리의 기술이니까 랠리의 기술을 가지고 하세요"야 뭐야?

1인칭이나 되면 '아 그래도 뭐 시뮬성향이나 그런거 노렸나보다. 패드가지고 해야지하겠는데'
탑뷰로 뭐하자는 짓꺼리인지 모르겠음.
그래픽만 보고 사지마요. 그러면 100% 거지같은 게임이니까.
본격적인 랠리겜 원하면 가격차는 좀 크지만 더트같은거 최신판하던가.
아니면 랠리겜 클래식인 리차드번즈나 하던가.

항아리게임이나 WASP같은 변태게임 좋아하면 적극추천
근데 컨트롤잘해도 뭐 티가난다거나 멋지게 나오는것도 아니라 방송이나 유튜브 각조차 안나올꺼임

review: Cute, fun, full of passion for rally and most importantly super satisfying when you get it right. A wonderful pick-up and play style game with plenty of depth and variety, an excellent handling model and a good mix of weather conditions. Really looking forward to more cars and particularly locations becoming available in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354051785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 41680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 600, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1712499770}
review:
This game is incredible! I have played this game for around 7 hours now and it keeps getting better and better. The cars are amazing, it has a wide variety of cars to choose from, all rich in rally history. The graphics are epic! I love racing when the sun is setting because it looks so pretty. 
I cannot recommend this game enough, it is a challenging yet relaxing game which you can play for as long or as little as you want at a time. This has to be one of the best games I have ever played, it combines my love of racing games with my passion for rally and rally history.
For anyone looking for a relaxing game, who is interested in cars and rally history, this game is definitely for you. With cars including the BEASTLY Volvo 240 Turbo to cars like the Lancia Statos and the Audi Sport Quattro S1, it includes content for everyone. 
10/10 - it's the gift that keeps on giving!

Any questions, please feel free to comment, and I'll try to reply ASAP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323277871', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1613395123}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969625388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1613380531}
review: This looks and plays like an actual dream. It's beautiful but unrealistic, in other words. Acceleration is fast, braking is powerful, handbrake drifts are easy to pull off, and crashing just makes your car a little dirty. You don't need a co-driver to call out upcoming turns, because the camera views are 200 feet above you and let you see everything well before you drive into it. There's definitely a good game in here, but it's not the simulation-like rally experience I was looking for more of. If you want a rally experience that is entertaining because it's realistic, stick with the DIRT Rally games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141891135', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1601927045}
review:
Es un buen juego pero si nunca has jugado a un juego de coches te diría que no lo compraras o al menos que alguien te deje probarlo, yo lo compre pensando que seria un juego casual, con un toque de relax la banda sonora esta muy bien pero eso es todo. Para mi la jugabilidad no ha sido ni divertida ni agradable, para mi puede mejorar.
Resumiendo la banda sonora esta muy bien pero a mi personalmente la jugabilidad no me atrae, eso si la estética me encanta.
En cuanto a jugabilidad le doy un 03/10
Y a la OST le doy un 07/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988365551', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1659726507}
review:
21€ for this?
The physics are weird, the music is boring. The car sound...ugh. Graphics neat design but the shadows look horrible. It could also need some more love to detail. The worlds feel static and often empty. Unlike promoted on some cherry picked screenshots.

There's no feel of engine power. It's missing that "oomph! here comes the turbocharger!"  Grinding those tires at 450Nm into the street.... no, it feels like playing slippery toy cars that understeer a lot. Slippery in corners but if you push the brakes, the wheels suddenly develope so much grip and the car stops a few meters ahead, it's super implausible!

Other than that, there are no extras. I was thinking perhaps the game has a little twist to it. Because everything else is lacking and it would do something special about it. No...

Maybe for 4€-7€? but not on sale. Seems about right for such gimmicky quick spare time game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985486156', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1612989055}
review:
I'm disappointed to give this a not recommended since i LOVE absolute drift but sadly in my short time playing this is what happened:

[list]
[*]I had it crash once after free roaming, I had frame drops like crazy and it turned out changing the vegetation settings fixed this
[*]Cars are all locked and I get that as a way to make you play career but there is no way to practice with them first for a course often leading to me quitting and switching cars as some I just seemed to do far worse in
[*]Unlocking things a after season became very tedious just waiting and watching as it unlocked stuff
[/list]

Honestly I can forgive all of the above if it wasn't for the elephant in the room, the feel/physics, because in a nut shell this game isn't sure if it wants to be an arcade drifter or a rally game. It feels like they took what made absolute drift amazing (the arcade style drifting) and turned it into a rally game where you are racing against the clock and it doesn't matter how slow you go you'll end up drifting. 

The problem may simply be caused by how you don't feel the speed you go, frequently I would spin out on a corner while it feels like I couldn't go any slower but when looking at what speed I was doing I was at 20-30mph and that clearly explains why I couldn't take a hairpin. I consciously would force myself to go slower in the bends and did notice a big improvement in my times and staying on the course but then I would end up not drifting but still skate sideways as the game really wants you to drift the corners.

So overall I found this amazing to look at, a fantastic soundtrack but sadly it really let me down in the feel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177144265', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1709769394}
review:
I had wishlisted this game for a few weeks before eventually just buying it full price and as of now I would say that it was 100% worth it. I honestly did not expect to like this game as much as I did considering I had never really played a game with even semi realistic driving before.

The art style is beautiful, the music is killer, and the game is incredibly fun. I love trying out each car and trying to do well in each race even if I'm not the fastest. There's a bit of a learning curve to be sure but I am excited to keep practicing and getting better at the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198024942939', 'num_games_owned': 1557, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1624046431}
review:
[H1]A flawed but respectable middle-ground between top-down toy racers and hardcore sims[/h1]

Absolute Drift provided a surprisingly robust simulation of the interaction between tires and terrain, considering it was the work of a single creator. Now, that creator has taken that simulation and applied it to a rally format. Rather than the abstract dreamscape of its predecessor, Art of Rally sees you carving your way through more realistic outdoor settings, and more carefully recreated real-life tracks. Overall, the level of visual fidelity is a mark above Absolute Drift, even if it's not quite as [i]a e s t h e t i c[/i].

In order to earn first place - even on normal difficulty - you'll need to develop a keen awareness of how road types and elevation change effect your traction. This is not an "arcadey" racer; in fact it's quite punishing compared to many titles in the genre. That's where some of its more irritating aspects become more visible.

Glancing a guardrail will frequently bring you to a dead halt, rather than merely slowing you down while you slide against it. The curved terrain outside the track is many polygons short of smoothness, creating jagged edges that kick you into the air if you contact them. Worst of all, the off-road area to either side of the track has invisible boundaries that - if crossed - will fade out the screen, put you back in the center of the road Lakitu-style, and penalize you five seconds. [b]There is no consistent indication of where these boundaries are.[/b] They are not a set distance from the track - they seem wider on the outside of turns and more restrictive inside of corners - and even in the late-game I found myself accidentally crossing them, without having lost control of my vehicle. Penalizing me for cutting corners is fine, but at least give me a visual indication of how much cutting is too much for each turn!

There are also, it must be noted, a couple of really grindy achievements - one which requires you to drive 555 km in one of the cars, and another which requires you to complete 1000 races (for context, it takes <250 to complete career mode).

If you want the mechanics of a proper rally game with a low-poly aesthetic, Art of Rally is the game for you. Just be prepared for frustration with the track boundaries.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988710021', 'num_games_owned': 1562, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1647805965}
review:
If you like the visuals and the idea of a zen driving experience that still requires skill and can be as intense as you choose to make it, I think you can't go wrong with Art of Rally.

I also believe that this game is the perfect introduction to more realistic driving physics (term used loosely here, I realize that someone with a lot of racing/car-sim experience might not describe it this way) for people like myself who enjoy racing but have mostly stuck to arcade experiences in the past. There's a lot to learn but the game isn't very punishing and the chill visuals & soundtrack help alleviate frustration while learning.

If you're at all interested in the game, do yourself a favor and just go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198196100341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1636647186}
review: This game perfectly nails the difficulty level between casual and a real feeling of accomplishment and satisfaction with stringing together a set of corners perfectly. Turn off the steering and drift aids and suddenly it has the right weight and momentum... Knowing the cars and the courses is essential, and once you do it flows, like, perfectly... until you ^%#k it up and even then the gorgeous colors, great cars, and awesome soundtrack help to keep enjoyment levels high. This is a terrific rally racing game and has enough depth and complexity to keep you occupied for hour after enjoyable hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078794479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1703501761}
review:
Pour toi qui as passé des heures sur la PS1 à user tes pouces sur l'asphalte de Colin McRae, à te tirer des bourres sur MicroMachines et V-Rally avec tes potes et ton multitap (y a que les plus de 30 ans qui ont la ref?), tire un grand coup le frein à main et dis à ton copilote (s'il parle encore après l'arbre que tu viens de te prendre, à 200, le frein à main, c'est un art) de la fermer 2 minutes

Ce jeu est un vrai exemple pour démontrer que les graphismes ne sont pas le plus important dans un jeu mais le plaisir qu'on éprouve en y jouant et ça fait longtemps qu'un jeu ne m'avait pas fait cet effet (demander à ma femme). Le style graphique est vraiment magnifique et permet même de le faire tourner sur des petites config sans rien y perdre au plaisir du jeu. Parce que "Art of Rally", le nom peut paraître un peu prétentieux mais le titre résume bien vraiment le jeu,

Déjà le nombre de véhicules, environ 50 réparties en 6 catégories représentant chacune une période de l'histoire du rally est vraiment une super idée, chacune à son style de conduite et sa puissance qu'il faudra arriver à dompter.

De jour et de nuit, avec parfois un brouillard digne des plus beaux jours de janvier,vous devrez éviter les arbres, les pierres et les spectateurs sur les nombreuses spéciales (50 environ réparties dans 5 pays, pas de Monte Carlo pour se la jouer à la Sébastien Loeb) avec les revêtements "classiques": asphalte, neige, gravier et terre. C'est basique mais rajouter la pluie (ou la neige) qui agit vraiment sur la tenue de route et ça permet déjà une variété de style de conduite à adopter.

Un système de difficultés croissant du mode carrière qui permet de s'adapter progressivement à la nouvelle classe et de gagner de nouveaux véhicules. Il m'a fallu quelques temps pour m'adapter au style de conduite (avec une manette de PS3, je suis de la vieille école) et au moteur physique mais en mode difficile, c'est encore facile de gagner. Par contre, ici pas de pardon dans la conduite à adopter, oubliez les murs de montagne qui vous permettent d'amortir les chocs quand vous avez raté votre freinage. Chaque erreur se paye cash, et si vous êtes à la recherche du meilleur chrono, vous allez faire de nombreux bisous aux arbres, aux pierres et aux bottes de foin qui jonchent vos parcours.

Sans oublier le système de classement qui permet de savoir où vous en êtes par au gratin de la crème des pilotes et le système de mods (que je n'ai pas encore testé mais qui s'annonce prometteur).

Le seul point noir dont je ne sais pas s'il est dû à ma config (même si ça le fait aussi en config minimum en relevant tous les effets), c'est des légers "freezes" qui peuvent arriver de temps à autres. Tant que ça n'a pas de conséquences, ça va mais quand vous êtes à fond de 5 en 205 et qu'il y a une épingle qui se profile à l'horizon, c'est douloureux.

Un jeu génial à tout point de vue, FunSelektor, voilà un studio qui porte super bien son nom parce que leur "Art Of Rally", l'essayer c'est l'adopter et c'est mettre encore davantage entre parenthèses votre vie sociale qu'avec le confinement (sauf si vous êtes célibataire et jouez uniquement après le couvre-feu)

author: {'steamid': '76561199024649004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1705444853}
review: This game is the perfect example of form and function. The art style and soundtrack are perfect for anyone who enjoys aesthetically pleasing games. Also, the gameplay and the way that the cars feel to drive is awesome, and reminds of Dirt Rally 2.0. That is a lot to say for a game that is not marketed as a sim racer. This is the perfect game for casual gamers who enjoy racing fun or people who want to take the game very seriously and compete. Those who enjoy competetive racing will enjoy the leaderboard system, the online racing, and time attack modes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055198478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1706012436}
review:
El juego es una maldita obra maestra. Es difícil de controlar pero no te hace sentir inútil en ningún momento, siempre te demuestra que puedes mejorar y que te puedes adaptar al estilo de conducción de alguno de los muchos (e icónicos) coches que hay en cada categoría. 
Una oda a la época dorada del Rally que cuenta la evolución del deporte a través de sus vehículos mas carismáticos. Un apartado visual y sonoro que raya la excelencia con una elección de colores y difuminados en el horizonte que te hacen centrarte en la carretera y sólo en la carretera, resultando una experiencia increíblemente satisfactoria. Paisajes idílicos se entremezclan con el rugir tan diferenciado de cada uno de los motores que portan las decenas de coches, mezclado con una música de carácter electrónico que le pega mucho.
Su única pega es que tienes que capar el Framerate o sufres popping y rayas horizontales en el paisaje que se viene delante tuyo. Desactivar la sincronización vertical y caparlo a 60 en calidad Muy Alta (auto), y fluye como el agua río abajo.
NI TE LO PIENSES, VALE CADA CÉNTIMO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041041436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1630424911}
review:
Un jeu sensationnel ! :)
J'apprécie beaucoup ce "petit jeu" de rally, malgré ces graphismes simplistes, il procure beaucoup de plaisir de conduite avec une bonne physique de transfert de masse. Ce n'est pas une simulation à 100% mais on peut augmenter la difficulté et ajuster le niveau de réalisme avec les dégâts.
C'est surtout un pur concentré de l'une des périodes la plus mythique du rally automobile, le groupe B. Quel fun de déraper, de rupter dans les virages avec la fameuse R5 turbo, ou la 205 T16 ! :)
C'est un jeu qui ce prête parfaitement à de petite session de jeu de 30 minutes ou 1 heure. J'ai rarement joué plus de 2 heures d'affilé. C'est idéale pour faire une spéciale quand on a envie de jouer à un jeu de voiture qui monopolise pas trop de temps.
Personnellement, j'ai directement commencé le jeu avec une difficulté "difficile" quand on a une bonne expérience des jeux de voiture. La difficulté est progressive, même si au début cela ne va pas très vite et bien on s'amuse quand même ;)
J'ai également bien aimé les différents environnements. Mon préféré c'est celui du Japon avec ses successions de virage sur le bitume où l'on "drift" constamment ! C'est le top.
La musique est vraiment bien, pour moi c'est important dans un jeu et certains titres sont parfaits et nous mettent dans l'ambiance. Parfois je la coupe et je mets de la musique House Progressive qui va à merveille.
Bref je remercie les développeurs de ce jeu, et si il y a une suite avec plus de pistes, avec des voitures que l'on peut modifier et personnaliser, je suis preneur :)

review: The care and attention that's gone into 'art of rally' is top notch.  It's fun, but very challenging to post quick times. It has a unique look, that works really well, and the 'just one more go!' factor is tremendous.  Having the online leader-boards adds to the competitive nature. Well done to the dev team for putting this one together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044771780', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 11154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2755, 'last_played': 1654595178}
review:
[h1] A simply wondrous, fun and beautiful racing game 95 [/h1]

Art of rally is a top down view racing game exclusively focusing on rally discipline in point-to-point special stages. What sets this game apart from others in the genre is it’s stylistic visuals and a handling model that is satisfying to learn.


[b] Mechanics 20/20 [/b]
I have played only with the Switch Pro controller so far. The handling feels distinctive, and while playing I feel to be in complete control  of the steering. The game can be played with a keyboard, however. Something about the handling mechanics and the camera perspective evokes the feeling of playing around with matchbox cars and the like from my childhood, it is a very enjoyable and playful experience!


[b] Gameplay 17/20 [/b]
The game features dozens of familiar looking rally cars from different decades beginning from the 60’s, along with six locations in Finland, Japan, Germany, Norway, Italy and Kenya.

The career mode puts you through randomized sets of special stages with different car classes of each time period. In addition, time trials, custom events and community events are available. 

The gameplay is simple, and fun. The focus is on the experience of racing itself at is what makes it so enjoyable.


[b] Design 20/20 [/b]
The designs of the environments and cars are top-notch, and the visual aesthetics mesh well together. The game is also coupled with a soundtrack that fits the aesthetic to a tee.


[b] Graphics 18/20 [/b]
The game runs well enough on my laptop, I do not have complaints regarding optimization. 


[b] Entertainment 20/20 [/b]
For the price of the game I have received tens of hours of enjoyment already and look for more as I am learning to master all the car classes and environments. 

And in addition to that, the developers have added in the ability to mod your own liveries for the cars in image editing programs. The possibilities are limitless. Combine this with the robust screen capture mode and you can have countless of hours of fun hunting for perfect photo opportunities capturing your sleekest drifts or highest jumps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058356827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1653768905}
review:
Il est très beau, un style graphique fort sympathique. Le plaisir de jeu est là....lorsque vous maitriserez cette conduite. Pour les fan de Rally, de jeu de simulation, ce jeu sera rageant. Il est certes beau, sympa, mais très punitif à l'instar des jeux de notre enfance dit "Retro" aujourd'hui; toucher ou même effleurer un mur et c'est le tête à queue ou l'arrêt de la voiture. Je suis pourtant un bon joueur de simulation tel que Dirt Rally ou Project Cars, un grand FAN de Rally et ce jeu m'intéressait par son approche différente des jeux de simulation. Mais il à su me faire rager par sa physique propre à lui et son aspect punitif à la moindre erreur. Pour le prix de 25.- (CHF) je suggère d'attendre une promo si tant est que ce jeu vous intéresse.
BREF: Bon jeu de Rally style Retro auquel on prend autant de plaisir que de rage ;-D

author: {'steamid': '76561198043807454', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1692014583}
review: Incredible rally game. At first I tried the old itch.io demo and hated the driving mechanics but the mechanics in the final product have been changed dramatically since then. Great for both a quick casual race while talking to friends and a competitive one trying to bolster your leaderboard position. Art style is also gorgeous, however I do wish that there was a true 3rd person camera mode (akin to your more traditional racing game), rather than the topdown/isometric mode. I understand that it's unique camera angles gives the game a unique identity, but I feel like it would still be nice as an option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158328694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1705199081}
review: This game, just like absolute drift, is a love note to all fans of rally. It's simple beauty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981404767', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2955, 'last_played': 1689037109}
review:
A LOVE LETTER TO GEARHEADS AND RALLY FANS!

Uma carta de amor aos amantes da velocidade e à categoria. 

Apesar dos gráficos simples e estilizados, o jogo tem um pezinho na simulação (não é um simulador) com uma jogabilidade que representa muito bem as características de cada carro. É preciso prática para dominar as diversas máquinas disponíveis no jogo, mas quando você entra no "flow", tudo acontece naturalmente.

É um jogo relaxante e recompensador de ser jogado, o som é OK pra melhor e a trilha sonora merece ser ouvida a parte (está nos meus baixados sempre no Spotify). Existe o modo carreira que, por ser aleatório, pode ser jogado sempre de novo e de novo, modos de time attack com rank online e fantasmas e um modo de free-roam com alguns objetivos em grandes mapas.
O jogo conta com um DEMO mas que não é tão representativo da jogabilidade mais recente.

Recomendo desligar as assistências de direção, deixando apenas o ABS com alguma força. O uso de um controle com gatilhos analógicos é quase obrigatório para se ter uma experiência completa. Também deve-se perder um tempo achando uma configuração de câmera ideal para seu gosto (eu cheguei a ter náuseas com algumas padrão). Por ser um jogo relativamente leve, pode-se "fuçar" nos drivers de vídeo para aumentar a qualidade de imagem, principalmente quanto a filtros AA.

RECOMENDADÍSSIMO! Na minha opinião, melhor jogo de corrida de 2020.

Vida longa ao art of rally!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993835324', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1708020505}
review:
This game is awesome, hands down!
First of all, it has a soul, a heart. You can feel the good ol' days' atmosphere back when rally was THE real deal.
The concept of the graphics is great, though some optimisation would be more than welcome.
Music choice is great. Gives the vibes of old racing games from Namco.
The physics are just great. You are challenged constantly.
Maps, locations, cars, everything about the content is just great. Although, I kinda wish there would be some "fun" details just like we did in the maps of the Ignition game. Like some weird noises, some interesting decorations here and there, some "life" in the maps would have been great. Hope the developer would bring it too.
Overall, I recommend this game with all my mind and soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167141711', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2516, 'last_played': 1700162253}
review: This game is honestly all that I expected and more. At first the camera and controls felt a bit wierd but that went away in about an hour. There really isnt anything that I can rag on this game for. It looks fantastic, runs great, tons of content, and a steady flow of updates. I came here from absolute drift and had high hopes for this game and it blew past all my expectations. 10/10 would buy twice to support the devs and would absolutely reccomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198996292010', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1695704345}

author: {'steamid': '76561199123436877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1669903890}
review:
Let me preface this by saying it now: No, I didn't get this for free, I had to pay for it.

TL;DR: It's worth it if you love racing, it's even more worth it if you're a motorsport fan. My god this is a fun little racer.

While I don't have a whole lot of time logged into the game yet, I can say that I'm at least enjoying this like crazy, and don't plan on dropping it any time soon. The art style is so colorful and relaxing, which acts as a contrast to the surprising precision that the driving requires out of you.

Learning to balance between the gas and the brake pedals is key to taking these tracks on. Elevation changes can occasionally be a little tough to spot, and taking on these too aggressively will result in you making a big jump and subsequently losing grip and control.

I wouldn't call this a sim, but it's far from a casual racer either. It's also a wonderful love letter to the most insane era of motorsport, that being the height of Group B rally. I love this game, and if you love motorsports (particularly rally racing), this is definitely worth the pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198852106002', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1706877107}
review:
I mean, rallying is a sport worthy of Formula 1, heck, it is basically an off-road version of Formula 1. The game also provides good cutscenes that also serves as a history lesson of rallying.
I seen a lot of negative reviews citing the bad control mechanisms, and I don't blame them, because that's what rallying feels like. Cars drift extremely easily and it's what makes rallying fun.
-------Summary-------
Price: Just right
Soundtrack: Once in a lifetime experience
Hardware requirements: GTX 1660Super for 4K 60 gameplay
Additional notes: Controller strongly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198041114907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1689865430}
review:
Крутые тачки, азот, неон и лютый андеграунд. 
Не здесь! Игра показывает ралли как искусство. Визуал из звук создают великолепную душевную атмосферу. Минимум мишуры.
Предупреждаю, что ралли, это не про тапок в пол, а тут ещё и вид высоко сверху (из кабины нельзя), кому-то может не понравится, что не так ощущаются бешеные скорости, нет размытия и пр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844934275', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1706280408}
review: Visually amazing. Mechanically hard. Don't let the arcade-like art style make you think this game is easy to get the hang of it. But here one can easily get lost in the game's ambience, the music, the art style, the engine's sound. Everything is just perfect. Play it, you will suffer and adore this, gleichzeitig.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976692606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1607369378}
review: Compared to it's predecessor 'Absolute Drift,' art of rally got all the beauty and colors absent from the other.  This game is the more comprehensive buy.  After playing this game, Absolute Drift feels like a shell of a game.  And that is not a knock against Absolute Drift and its technical prowess as a drift puzzle/sandbox- its just a testament to how full THIS game feels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232972768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1634303039}
review: Fantastic game. Brilliant aesthetic. Very well made and designed. Progression feels worth it by allowing you to unlock cars and liveries for performing better. The game is very well thought out, with a huge focus on accuracy within Rally Sport. An absolute must if you want a game which you can load up and have a chill time playing, or can be grinded hard. Also very pleasing soundtrack and use of sound in general. Cannot big up this game any more, would 100% recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198265701321', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1628958890}
review: A rally game where an alternate universe of Group S exists? That's quite creative if you ask me. This is one of those relaxing games like Hotshot Racing and Horizon Chase Turbo and it's a good thing. A perfect game to play after a long and tiring endurance race. Or, if you just want to chill out with your friends on Discord voice call while playing this game, be my guest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981984890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2497, 'last_played': 1703511128}
review:
Крайне затягивающая гоночная аркада с приятной физикой! Есть намеки на инерцию и перераспределение веса при торможении, но тормоза при этом почти не блокируются даже с отключенной АБС. Также из настроек оказалось правильным переключиться на первую камеру (ближе к машине), отключить систему стабилизации, чтобы ехать боком и уменьшить контрруление до 80%, чтобы машину меньше раскачивало. Даже с геймпада заехал в топ 10% тайм атак на всех этапах в Финляндии в группе Б, несмотря на скудный опыт в гоночках до этого.
 
Что же касается ралли, расстраивает, что не доложили штурмана с легендой и, чтобы показать хорошее время, приходится проезжать трассу по несколько раз, заучивая, где можно прыгать, где надо тормозить в пол на перегибе, а где влетать в закрытый поворот на полном газу, или, проезжая трассу в другую сторону, интенсивно замедляться на пологой дуге.
