author: {'steamid': '76561198015211347', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 5523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 59, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1712500271}
review:
All in all: This game is a masterpiece!

This game has so much potential and so many hours of pure fun. The game design is brilliant. The sounds are awesome. The cars, the maps are beautiful. The enviroment is also wonderful. 
BUT THIS ISN'T A CASUAL RALLY GAME!
You must concentrate in every stage and every corner because the game will punish you for every little mistake you make. But when you complete a single stage without any mistake, your reward is priceless!

Buy it now and start your practice now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970956829', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 2401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1707774009}
review:
Gra może nie jest taka tania jak na Indyka... Ja dorwalem taniej plus jeszcze zniżka za pakiet z Absolute Drift, które mam od dawna 😁 Tak więc chyba za niecałe 40 zeta dorwalem....

Gra jest cały czas rozwijana, Devsi nawet na Forum Steam odpisuja ludziom na pytania/sugestie! Co jest dużym plusem! No i są regularne updaty.

Graficznie jest prosto ale bardzo estetycznie i przez zastosowane filtry i efekty, to wygląda bardzo ładnie wg mnie. Chodzi też ok, ale mogłoby być lepiej ale na szczęście Devsi cały czas pracują i nad silnikiem gry, i są poprawy wydajności. Aha, żaby nie było, to mam mocny sprzęt i gra mi działa super płynnie! Ale optymalizacja dla słabszych sprzętów też by była ok.

Muzycznie jest BARDZO ładnie, w moim guście 😁

Grę polecam i w tym stanie jakim jest! 

Aha, mięsko! Czyli prowadzenie pojazdów! No jest wg mnie takie jak w Dirt, czyli dobrze z plusem 😉 Jest takie trochę arkadowe, z nutą realizmu. Aha, można bardziej realistycznie jazdę ustawić, są opcje.


Polecam inne moje recenzje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072648530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1703952695}
review:
I am not someone who knows a lot about rally or racing. The only experience that I have with racing games is playing some of the earlier Need For Speed games ~15 years ago. However, I came across a video of art of rally on YouTube, and thought it looked gorgeous and might be interesting to try out. And wow, what an adventure it has been.

The game (I will only be reviewing the career mode) is divided into 6 "worlds" or "groups", which each have 5 rally races, consisting of 2-5 tracks, within them. Each group has a certain specification of car, and the farther you get into the game, the more powerful the vehicles are. The earlier groups have shorter rallies, and as you progress, the rallies get longer, with multiple stages. 

The graphics and aesthetics of the entire game is absolutely stunning, as seen from the screenshots. There are a wide variety of tracks that you get to race down, with varied landscapes, from frozen lakes, to rocky forests.

Playing with the controller is a sublime experience as the rumble and vibrations really help to get across what's happening in game. As you drift, the controller vibrates in accordance with your drift, and as you straighten out, your engine roars, but the controller becomes steady, matching your experience on the track. 

In a piece of beautiful design, unlocking a rally only requires you to have completed all the previous rallies. There is no need to win. This means that the entire game is just a long series of experiments to see how the cars work, and what is the best way to move all that power through the long and winding tracks.

Being an absolute newbie to the genre, this experimentation was liberating for me. In the first world, Group 2, I struggled to control the vehicles. I searched a bunch on YouTube, but there were no guides for this game available. So I ended up watching a lot of real world rally content, as well as content for other rally games like Dirt 3, and I learnt that the "Meanie", with its front-wheel drive should be a lot easier to control, and I finished up the first group driving just that one car.

Entering the second world, Group 3, however, I saw that there was no front-wheel drive available, so I was forced to actually learn how to handle the hefty backsides of the vehicles, sliding all over with a mind of their own. I realised that once the car is drifting, pressing the accelerator will tend to prolong the drift. This is useful in the early stages of a drift, if you have realised that you started off too early. However, this also means that if you are sliding uncontrollably, trying to straighten your vehicle on a straight, it's best to just lay off the throttle and allow the car to settle down. Slowly I learnt to understand the cars behaviour and got an instinct for nailing the throttle at the exact moment that the car has regained grip, and that was exhilarating.

I found myself doing fairly well on the "Normal" difficulty, so I thought I would up it to "Skilled". The races became more challenging, and I found that I seemed to have a very wide range of performances depending on the surface. I struggled to perform on tarmac, and I dominated in rainy conditions. Again, I went back to watch some real world rally content, and saw my mistake. I had been treating all road conditions as equal, and was just drifting through all corners to my hearts content. I learnt that on high-grip surfaces like tarmac, it is better to spend as little time as possible drifting, as you be a lot faster by braking late and accelerating out of corners. On snow and rainy conditions, acceleration was much slower, so drifting was useful to maintain speed through corners.

Progressing further, I decided that I wanted to try out manual gear transmission, just to see what it would be like. So I started off Group 4 by shifting the difficulty down to Novice, and checking the controls to see how to shift up and down. It took a while to get adjusted to, but soon it was even more fun. I slowly learned that shifting a gear up in the middle of a drift just because you engine is over-revving is not a good move, because once the drift ends, you will be a lot slower, and will need to be on the lower gear. I found that it is better to be on the lower gear and quickly shift up, rather that being in the higher gear and slowly gaining revs. However, I also saw that if stuck in a higher gear, it was better to swallow that loss than to shift down and shift back up, as it tended to be slower overall. It seemed that shifting into a higher gear near the end of a drift, can end the drift and get you accelerating out of the corner (however I am not entirely certain that this is the case, as it just might be that I have figure out the exact moment that a drift ends, and just happen to shift gears at that instant). The game got a lot more involved, and a whole lot more fun.

Moving to Group B, I was back at Skilled difficulty, but now with manual transmission. The rallies were getting longer, and multi stage rallies were becoming more common. Now that decision to unlock progress based on completion rather than wins started to shine through and allow for some truly memorable moments. I was on the last track of a rally, and in second place behind one of the Finn AIs. I was around a minute and 13 seconds behind, with the Swede in 3rd being more than 2 minutes behind me. With the last stage being a 2.6 mile tarmac course, it was unlikely that I would be able to gain that much time. So I just blundered my way around the course, confident that I would keep my second place regardless of the result. I ended up finishing the race in 6th, but to my surprise, was leading the rally. Turns out that the Finn in first had hit a house on the race, and ended up 4 minutes behind the winner. I would never have been able to experience that rush of joy and relief if I had been forced to restart the whole rally for the sake of winning to unlock progress.

Group S was when it all started to gel. I suddenly learnt the power that is available in first gear. The pure boost that you get coming out of a corner was almost palpable through the screen. I learn to take hairpins on 2nd gear, and then shift back down to first, as I straightened the car out of the turn. I felt the thrill of gunning down a straight on 5th gear, having absolutely no idea where the next turn would be, and absolutely fearful in the knowledge that there was a 20% chance I would not be able to slow down in time, and would probably throw myself off of a Scandinavian mountainside into the sunset. I found myself perfectly shifting gears as I slid sideways over the snowy track in the middle of a frozen lake, inches away from the edge of the road, which would be a slippery slide into oblivion (commonly experienced as a forced reset and a 5 second penalty).

I cursed those pillars along the sides of the German freeways, which instantly kill all your momentum. I prayed that as I slid off the Japanese downhill slaloms, a tree would manifest itself, and perfectly kill my momentum, and leave my car facing in the correct direction. I finally learned to quickly recover from a spin-out, by shifting all the way down into reverse, gathering a little momentum, and start the rotation to face forward, while quickly shifting into second and maintaining all that momentum with a perfect J spin.

I am currently in the middle of Group A, the final group. But the more I play, the more I realise that though I am almost done with the career mode, I am not close to finishing the game. I am probable going to go back through, and play on the highest difficulty, and try to win all the rallies. Maybe move to time attack mode, and memorise a few tracks and perform better on them. Maybe return for the daily and weekly challenges as well.

This game has been an incredible experience for me. From learning about racing and all its intricacies, to to soaking in the Sardninan sunsets. I would give art of rally 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024637608', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 4083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1612551280}
review:
Расслабляющий и очень приятный, если можно так назвать, автосимулятор ралли. Мой совет, сначала поиграть в игру от этих разработчиков "Absolute Drift", в ней вы почувствуете механику заносов и поймете физику машины, хоть в Art of Rally дрифта по сути нет, но управление машиной на повороте и в заносе получается лучше, если поиграть в первую часть. Так же, в отличии от первой части здесь намного больше контента - карьера, свободные заезды (в которых нужно собирать кассеты и буквы, чтобы составить слово R A L L Y), заезды на время и т.д.
 
!!! Для тех, кто будет проходить игру на 100% достижений !!!
В игре 43 достижения, на выполнение 42 из них у вас уйдет примерно 20-25 часов (мое время), далее останется одно достижение - "if everything seems under control, you're not going fast enough - complete 1000 stages", на которое уйдет не менее 20+ часов. Я не знаю, что было в этот момент у разработчиков в голове, что они решили сделать именно 1000 треков. На момент окончания основной карьеры у меня было 200+ треков, получается что мне еще нужно потратить 20 часов, чтобы набить еще 800 для 1 достижения. И это при условии, что нужно проходить только короткие треки, длина которых не более 6,0 км и прохождение по времени не более 2-х минут, а лучше 1:30.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140418482', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1621993558}
review:
Me encanta el juego, su apartado visual es precioso, sin embargo, acá te escribo una lista de pros y contras que tiene este juego:

[h1] [b] Pros: [/b] [/h1]
[list]
       [*]Su apartado artístico y precioso.
       [*]Es muy entretenido y desafiante.
       [*]Puedes explorar en un modo libre algunos de los países en los que se desarrollan diferentes rallies.
       [*]Recorres las épocas más representativas del Rally, desde el Grupo 2 en 1967 hasta el Grupo A en 1996.
       [*]Tienes a tu disposición una gran variedad de vehiculos, desde los típicos vehículos de Rally, hasta camiones 
           forestales.
       [*]La banda sonora del juego te motiva a seguir compitiendo, es muy buena.
       [*]Los desarrolladores se han comprometido a este año 2021 continuar agregando actualizaciones con más contenido, 
           más vehículos, más mapas e incluso más música.
[/list]

[h1][b] Contras: [/b][/h1]
[list]
      [*]Las físicas de colisiones están hechas de manera regular, no toman en cuenta el lugar del impacto, sino la velocidad, 
          me ha pasado más de una vez que voy a 160, rozo una puerta con una barrera y me da daño fatal.
      [*]El juego no está optimizado de la mejor manera, es mucho más exigente de lo que debería para todo lo que ofrece 
          de manera gráfica.
      [*]El popping es horrible en ciertos puntos, la vegetación puede spawnear a solo un par de metros del vehículo, lo cual 
          quita un poco de inmersividad, pues es bastante brusco el popping.

[/list]

En resumen, ¿vale la pena? completamente, es un juego muy barato para todo lo que ofrece, eso sí, has de tener una PC medianamente decente para poder disfrutarlo a 60fps, compralo si puedes y si está en oferta, mucho mejor!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065661869', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1704498449}
review:
8/10 

Great game to just pick up and play. Good physics, fantastic car selection, and amazing graphics that still look good even when playing on a lower end computer. Give it a try if you are burnt out on racing sims and just want a game that you can start up and just have fun without having to worry about championship standing or car setup. 

There are only two gripes that I have with this game, first is the UI. While a minimalist interface is fine while driving, it is less fine when I am navigating a menu screen and it can be hard to tell what option I am selecting. This is especially prevalent in the repair menu, where the dots to tell you how much each part of the car is damaged can be hard to make out. My second issue with this game is that their isn't much variety in maps. There are only 4 maps and the career mode is not set, it just randomly selects stages from those 4 maps. So, be ready to get sent to the same 2 maps over and over again. Having a random stage selection can also make it difficult when selecting a car, as some cars are better on tarmac stages and some are better in the snow or gravel. Whereas if it was set I can pick a car better suited to the rally. A wider map selection and career mode being set rather than randomized would be greatly improve my experience with the game.

Besides those two minor gripes I have with this game, it is a very good racing game with just realistic enough graphics that it is challenging, but not so realistic that it becomes frustrating. Give it a try if you are tired of crashing into trees in Dirt Rally.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995251370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1628911258}
review: Just love this game. It's definitely the coolest racing game I've played. Great art design, great music, and a slick  interface. The game plays great too. the driving is fluid and intuitive, yet scales well too, with the upper class races getting tricky just as you start to get good. Also, there is a huge variety of cars (cleverly named) and they each have their own feel. My only critique is the graphic optimization doesn't seem great, I've got a good machine, but the game stutters occasionally on the highest graphic settings, If you like racing, and I want to try something a little different, check out this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120376610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1663131029}
review:
I am writing this review for Art of Rally because it is simply one of the best games I have ever played - period. 
And I am writing such an in-depth review because this game is such a detailed game.
This review is divided into some conventional and some unconventional sections due to its nature.

[h1] The culture of cars. [/h1]

The developers are obviously gushing car guys like the rest of us (gushing car guys). You can tell they really are in love with cars & motorsport and what they stand for. They would otherwise not have created such a glowing product. The romance that is a man and his car really shines through here.

[h1] Attention to detail [/h1]
Attention to detail is the game's biggest strength. Now - at first glance this might not be apparent. But they really have broken their backs to deliver so much in such a small package. Let me list a few points...
The sponsor's advertisements: The brand names are just so damned awesome. No brand names to speak of really, just typical logo designs for typical motorsport sponsors. I won't spoil them here but as you play through you'll see them and see why they're easy to fall in love with.

The surfaces: The difference in how you drive between different stages really is astonishing for what appears to be such a simple game. You'll see Tarmac, wet tarmac, gravel, wet gravel, snow, surface changes on stage, hydroplaning, slick grass and grass that'll slow you down if you cut (and you should cut, and you shouldn't cut). Elevation changes, jumps, downhill and uphill, pre-turns and tight, tight hay bale chicanes... Really this game is Dirt Rally with cell shading.  It isn't just a simple "turn the stick and nail the throttle" type game. There really is an immense nuance to the handling, physics and surfaces that will have you trying to think faster thoughts constantly to shave milliseconds off your stage time. This game honestly feels like a quality simcade with regards to its physics. You're never going to feel like you're doing anything perfectly... but when you're right on the edge of perfect you'll feel like a million bucks.

The cars: The cars are really awesome. The sound differences between different engine layouts, cylinder counts, aspiration types and manufacturers were really well thought out. I am a huge BMW guy and when I get behind something with an BMW motor I am brought back home... The names of the cars are awesome. the little blurbs about them and the liveries especially absolutely hit the right note. The cars are unlicensed and I think this brings a huge amount of charm to the game because the devs were able to name them how they see fit and they did a great job. To reiterate - they really captured the romance.

Locations: If you're a rally fan, you'll know the classics and when you're playing Art of Rally the classics really  come to life. The precision required for a pavement rally in Germany, the flight paths of Finland, the curvaceous roads of Japan... All of these tracks are brought to life and feel distinct and awesome to drive on.

The little things: The way your brake disks glow and the way they emit sparks under heavy braking. The dirt your car accumulates. The way the gravel and the rain spit from your tires. The crowds the way they feel like true, enthusiastic rally fans and they JUST WANT TO SEE YOU FLYING AT THEM AND AROUND A CORNER... They cheer and honk their air horns. Please do your best to get extra sideways around the fans.

[h1] Art style [/h1]
Beautiful. Just beautiful and made all the more impressive by, again, more attention to detail. Fog, puddles, trees, blossoms... all in the beautiful, colorful subtle design. Night time is absolutely awesome with a full array of headlights and fog lights. Trees, grass, rocks, animals, houses, shacks... The list goes on.

[h1] Sound/Music [/h1]
As mentioned before, motor sounds are awesome and distinct but there is a lot of detail to be heard in headphones and the soundtrack is so awesome. I'm the kinda guy that immediately goes and turns off music in 99% of racing games but here the 80's synthwave soundtrack really fits the driving and the art style and there is just no reason to turn it off.

[h1] Progression [/h1]
Progression is huge. You'll spend 4-5 hours getting to even being able to use an AWD car, but you'll realize by the time you're in the higher end RWD cars that you weren't ready for it anyway. This game does an excellent job of chucking you in the shallow end of a fledgling motorsport and making you really feel like you got in at the ground floor and you're advancing in skill as the technology and the stages become more advanced while the years and seasons go by. You'll never feel entitled to a faster car until the ending races of a particular group. The first 2 groups feel like absolutely helpless little road cars hastily adapted to rallying with their pencil wide tires and low power... But further on the cars start becoming bespoke, faster, more capable, more predictable yet slightly less forgiving in certain situations... Again... Attention to detail.

[h1] How and when to play IMHO [/h1]
Increase the difficulty when you've gotten used to the physics, the handling and the top down view. Make it a challenge. Like a lot of driving games, you can benefit from having a couple drinks and really letting your inhibitions go. Don't use stability handling or braking assists. Make sure to customize your controls (please use a controller) and find an optimal camera setting.

[h1] This game is... [/h1]

Still a better love story than Twilight

A better simcade racer than Project Cars 3

A goldmine for inspiration for other games. Other devs, namely AAA devs. Look. At. This. Game. 

I'm Ricky Bobby and if you don't smoke Righto Cigarettes then F**k Y**

author: {'steamid': '76561198017383483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1682871640}
review:
Art of Rally is a minimalist, conceptually simple game where you go throught the different ages of rally. It projects a very ZEN aura and along with the soundtrack poses a perfect relaxing game. At least in concept.

If I could I would give this game a neutral rating. It is not a bad game. It runs just fine even on lower end PCs. However the gameplay is very flawed. For a game that presents itself as a casual, relaxing game, the controls of the cars are very fiddly, even inconsistent. This is made worse by the fact that you cannot turn of automatic compensation and oversteering, which often results in cars zig-zagging out of the track without you having any reasonable say on it. Not only that, the grip of the car onto the road changes from track to track with no discernible logic. Sometimes I have better control on snow than I do on gravel or even asphalt.

It feels like you're driving on ice cream, is what I am saying, regardless of conditions.

Do not get me wrong, I like the game. But it is very frustrating, very inconsistent and does not deliver the experience it advertises. I am sure I will get derided a lot for saying this, but it does not feel like driving skill (not mastery of mechanics, driving) has anything to do with how well you do in the game and for these reasons I cannot give it a positive review, even though it runs well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836846849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1619351265}

Как погоняешь немного и попривыкнешь к управлению, начинаешь получать удовольствие. Игрушка идет легко, музычка такая приятная, в таком размеренном темпе проходишь чемпионаты один за другим. Hard_Day (Вадим)16.01.2021
Коль, тут просто нужно понимать, что это нечто другое, не дерт, не дерт ралии, не что-то подобное из разряда симуляторов. Это - весьма самобытная и своеобразная игра, наподобие Micro Machines (если кто-то еще помнит такую).  С простенькой графикой, незамороченным геймплеем (настроек машин по факту там нет), это НЕ СИМУЛЯТОР,  и им не задумывалось, а простенькая ардкада, но сделанная для тех, кто в теме, скажем так, для поклонников исторических раллийных автомобилей. И уж тем более, никто никого и не заставляет покупать, просто чуть шире смотрим на мир и мир игр

Я показал вам переписку в чате одного из каналов дискорда (надеюсь ребята на меня не обидятся), которая показывает мнение об этой игре. Лично я от неё не в восторге, но думаю пробовать поиграть в неё стоит, многим зашла...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994263553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1687215522}
review:
One of the better racing games I've played. The physics are pretty good, so the controls take some getting used to. I spent the first group of career events getting used to the controls, but once you get the hang of them the driving is very rewarding.

The game simulates several different weather conditions, all of which put a new spin on courses you've driven before. Rain makes things slick, so you need to take everything a little slower and be more careful, fog varies in different parts of the course which obstructs your vision, etc. This keeps things fresh and helps prevent you from getting bored during the career sections, which can be very lengthy. This combined with trying to get the best time you can keeps you on your toes.

Finally, the free roam mode is fantastic. When you first start the game it dumps you right into free roam, which is a great way to let you play with the cars and get used to how they handle. Once you're ready you can start running rallies. This is a great way to introduce the player to the game.

I highly recommend this for any fan of racing games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999342327', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1610905787}
review:
In the long history of racing, rally is an acquired taste.  It's history spans shorter than other goliaths of the track, but the respect given to the drivers, or survivors in the same breath, is much earned & well placed in the racing community.  To push vehicles to a level expected on private pavement and asphalt, but unleashing it on dirt, snow, gravel, or whatever is wide enough to drive on: it's a level of finesse, adrenaline, & pure chaos and that only be dialed in by a chosen few.  art of rally embraces these connoisseurs of speed with a love letter devoted to the history of the sport.

art of rally's aesthetics will take you into a dream-like world that looks like it belongs in a Micro Machines or a PLAYMOBIL catalog.  Each country is lush with vibrant colors and small details that show an attention to detail while maintaining its overall minimalist feel.  Cherry blossoms surrounding the roads on Japan, the snow capped forests & sheets of ice in Norway, to the teeming tone of sepia & Autumn in Germany: each stage is beautifully crafted & are an absolute sight to behold, especially when fiddling around in art of rally's Photo Mode.  Take your pick of over 50 cars to choose from, spanning different eras of the rally world across 5 decades.  Each car comes with a little history lesson for interested drivers, & a litany of decade-reminiscent colors to choose from.

But the sport of rally has always gotten its popularity & love for the way its drivers handle these combinations of steel & power, so does art of rally extend its love letter in its gameplay?  Well, yes & no.  I'll be the first to point out that I have not played many rally games in my days, but what art of rally achieves is making you feel like a genius in one turn but an absolute idiot on the next.  These roads require, near demand a feathering of both the accelerator and brake & a knowledge of when to floor it to shave any time off your run.  But knowing when to hit these requires more than just a knowledge of the road.  It requires a knowledge of your vehicle, terrain, & knowledge of your past mistakes, & art of rally expects perfection of these aspects to qualify a successful run.  Just don't do what I did: start on career mode.

Career mode takes you through six groups, each spanning a different decade of rally, showing off art of rally's 30 pre-made tracks, becoming 60 with reversed starting points.  Here you will pick your car & difficulty (I played the normal AI difficulty with the standard car damage setup) & participate in five seasons per group, which hold 1-4 rallies with around 2-5 stages in each rally.  It's a strange enigma how career mode unfolds, because in my experience it felt like an elongated tutorial, but with how one-dimensional the gameplay is, I couldn't imagine working on my problems outside this mode.

In broad terms, art of rally masters the feeling of controlled chaos, but the case against this is that there are plenty of times where art of rally's commitment to this cause sacrifices a lot of fun in playing its game.  No matter your terrain driven or car seat sat in, your rally experience will feel like it's on ice at all times, & art of rally's lack of a specific tutorial mode makes the learning experience a tough one.  You will spend the first few hours of art of rally careening off of the road & into whatever is around: walls, trees, rocks, cliffs.  The learning of the mechanics is not particularly the problem I had, since hitting those beautiful hairpin turns in one fell swoop is a joy that is to be experienced.  The problem is by the time you've learned how art of rally works, chances are you've seen everything the game has to offer.

Career mode's rallies are randomly generated, so there's a good chance that by the 2nd or 3rd group, you would have played every stage in the game.  While you have been learning on slower vehicles how art of rally actually works, each group takes you forward to a faster vehicle, removing all the muscle memory from the previous group & throwing you back in the learning bin all over again.  As career mode gets farther in, the seasons become even longer: where in the first two groups you may do 2-4 stages per season, the later groups will have you run 15-20 stages in one season, bloating the career mode to something over 15-17 hours.  I personally enjoy the gameplay for what it's worth, but I was struggling to even bother finishing career mode, and the fact that only 7% of all players on Steam have finished it gives me a clue that I may not be the only one who feels this way.

Another issue is how art of rally's career mode rewards are given out.  Completion of seasons will unlock different vehicles to choose from, while colors are given by keeping a certain number of restarts throughout the season.  While unlocking cars isn't a problem, though having slower cars be unlocked in later groups is a little odd, unlocking colors almost feels brash in execution.  art of rally demands perfection to achieve a truly fun experience; so messing up would instinctively require a driver to restart & try again.  With limited restarts, messing up forces the player to forgo progress & restart entire seasons, which are already long, or stumble through new stages & vehicles with the promise of unlocks after you crawl past the finish line.  To hide unlocks behind a system that would help your drivers understand the game better is confusing & downright rude.

And you will need these restarts, because getting a clean rally is aggravating under certain weather situations.  Players will have their gripes on different terrains, but the addition of snow & rain slows art of rally to a crawl, with rain soaked roads making turns a nightmare & snow capped area requiring a pedestrian touch to even think about placing; it becomes an absolute bore to play & groan-inducing when your randomly made season is a majority of these two.

By this point you've spent countless hours in career mode, with each stage only holding a 2-5min run time: you at this point have played the living Hell out of every stage imaginable.  So its other modes feel almost unnecessary.  Time Attack is a single stage run with a shot at the leaderboard.  Custom Rally is a make-your-own-season category.  Online Events are half-winded, as Funselektor pick a specific mode & stage, daily events are 1 stage & weekly events are a full rally, & lets players duke out for the best time.  Free Roam is the best of the bunch here, allowing full reign over the territories in which the stages are made from, with some collectibles to find: but mostly it's to just launch your car off cliffs at 120mph.

But it's not the inclusion of its modes that feel underwhelming, but the exclusion of modes that would have helped so much.  Where are the challenge modes?  Specifically made stages, like a hairpin turn course or a S-curve track, could not only be used as practice modes but add another chip on a racer's shoulder.  Playing specific terrain w/ the ability to replay spots would help with the lack of a specific tutorial.  This genre of racing requires practice & practice can be made fun & accessible, but replaying levels ad nausea is a rough ask when you have that massive career mode looming in the distance.

So art of rally puts me in quite a bind.  When you put forth the effort & time expected, it's a gratifying run through history & an immensely rewarding experience under specific circumstances.  But the lack of a tutorial for a game that absolutely needs it, tedious playing conditions that bog a tough as nails driving experience, & a 15 hour career mode on 3 hours of content make this a hard recommendation for anyone who isn't balls-to-the-wall for rallying and its style of racing, even if the art, aesthetically and physically, is as beautiful as they hoped.

[quote][h1]Follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33247611/]A Review Is Worth 1,000 Words[/url] for more Steam Reviews.[/h1][/quote]

I really like this game, and the recent update has resulted in much improved performance. The game runs smooth as butter now!

Cons:
-Holy cow, please add an option to make the text larger. Sitting at a 65" TV ~10 ft away, the text is almost impossibly small to read to my eyes

author: {'steamid': '76561198112854187', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1650635811}
review: Las primeras 1-2 horas de juego se hacen duras hasta que te acostumbras al control. Recomiendo pasar esas horas en conducción libre antes de meterse al "modo historia". No es un simulador pero desde luego de arcade solo tiene la pinta. Es un lobo con piel de cordero. Me parece que es un juego que gustará a los amantes del rally (historia del rally, modelos míticos de coches, referencias y ambientación) y los juegos de conducción que quieran algo más casual y diferente al resto, pero también a algunos que no estén tan acostumbrados a este género. Requiere de mucha atención pero es muy gratificante cuando consigues hacer funcionar el juego y hacerte uno con él. Llega un momento que sientes como te fundes con el control y no puedes apartar la vista de la carretera. Cada coche tiene un manejo y prestaciones bien diferentes al control y cada tipo de pista también. La climatología también juega un papel importante. La banda sonora es muy buena, los sonidos de los coches adecuados para el estilo (algunos mejor que otros, pero tiene sonido de descarga de turbo, petardeo...). Gráficamente es precioso y muy limpio, aunque creo que consume algo más de la cuenta para ser tipo low poly. Parece que el juego se actualiza y que este año saldrán más coches y algún que otro mapa. Varios modos de juego (carreras de historia, carrera de libre configuración, contrarreloj, reto semanal y diario, modo de conducción libre con coleccionables...). Muy completo y recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089327516', 'num_games_owned': 1209, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1639127613}
review: Das Spiel macht Spaß, wenn man Rally-Rennspiele mag. Die Fahrphysik ist gut (die Fahrzeuge fahren sich Klasse für Klasse unterschiedlich) und die Grafik zweckmäßig - aber die Umgebungen sehen echt schick aus. Es gibt die Möglichkeiten bestimmte Orte zu erkunden und Collectibels zu sammeln, den Karrieremodus zu spielen, um seine Etappen abzureißen oder auch Online auf Bestzeiten-Jagd zu gehen. Wer ein kurzweiliges Rally-Rennspiel für Zwischendurch sucht, sollte mal einen Blick riskieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020518123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1709790215}
review:
A lot of the buzz I saw about this game made it sound like this very zen, aesthetic experience. It is not that. It is a very difficult and technical racing game, made by someone with an obsessive passion for the history rally racing. You will love this game when, after wildly spinning out into the trees for the 20th time, you manage to drift around the next hairpin *just right*, and you feel like some kind of motorsport god. 
A few more thoughts: Haven't finished career mode yet. I'm not really into serious racing games, This was fantastic though after feeling like Mario Kart 8 was a little too dumbed-down in its physics. My #1 tip (which I've seen repeated by many others): don't punch the throttle! 25 - 50% is plenty most of the time, especially in later classes with higher hp. Hope you enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198966841641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1708364289}
review:
Hello there! I first and foremost want to get this outta the way really quick.... I DID NOT OBTAIN THIS GAME FOR FREE IT WAS PURCHASED UNDER MY OWN FREE WILL WITH MY OWN MONEY.


Secondly, i am a die hard Rally fan and i have been since i was a little child.

I have a lot to say about "ART OF RALLY". 

Graphics : I chose to start with graphics because it is literally the worst thing about Art of Rally, and concidering the fact that the old school blocky art style of this game in my opinion is "COOL", "REFRESHING" and completely modernizes this game in some strange semi-arousing kind of way, only heading up in quality from here is a VERY good start.
The colors are FANTASTIC!!!! The scenery is FANTASTIC, the stages are all randomly generated with an endless possibility of tracks plus the game uses models of "REAL CARS" (with different names) that are super important and only add to the overall immersion. Car models from old Cosworths, Porsche, Lancia, Audi AND SO SO SO much more. I was very VERY pleased with the overall car selection :) And to cap it all off a very simple and easy on the eyes menu system makes for a pleasant experience outside of the car.

Music: The music is actually one of this games strongest points! Growing up in the 80s and early 90s i was exposed heavily to retro music. AND THIS GAME HAS NOTHING BUT RETRO !!!!!!!! Turn the volume up and prepare to get AN EAR FULL OF KEYTAR BABY LETS GOOOOOO!!!!!

Gameplay: Initially i was worried about the game play..... I usually find myself playing games like "Dirt Rally" and "Assetto Corsa" and didn't think this game had a chance in HELL of being anywhere close to as enjoyable as those games to play... BOY WAS I WRONG. This game has VERY good physics to go along with a relatively controlable steering system that makes for an overall very good game play experience. You don't need to be f**king Mario Andretti to play this game is what i'm getting at. To be honest i'm fairly confident that someone who has never played this game could pick Art of Rally up and within one night be drifting corners up a mountain in Japan somewhere.... DON'T BE SCARED HOMIE, THIS GAME IS ULTRA PLAYABLE FOR ANY SKILL LEVEL!!!!!!

Game play Options: Hmmmmm...... where to start??? Free roam mode? yes. Campaign mode?? YES! Time attack mode?? YESSSS!! Custom Rally mode?????? YESSSSSSSSS! ONLINE EVENTS?!?!?! YASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!!

Price: .... This was a little touchy for me.... The game is rather expensive for a plain and simple indie game, however with that being said....... QUALITY OVER QUANTITY ANY DAY! I paid 30$ for this game and have not had a single regret about a single penny! Money well spent if u ask me! And if my 30$ is gunna go towards helping this kick ass DEV. make future badass games like this then i'm all for it!


CONS!!!!!!! YES CONS! This game does have some things that in my opinion are lacking, nothing major.... But perhaps in the future they can be worked on.... Things like car camera views, the game only has about 7 views and they are ALL CHASE CAMS which kinda sucks but i understand the chase cam just fits the feel of the game. However maybe a bumper cam, or a roof cam would be a solid edition. Also i would love the chance to modify vehicles. Not large scale just things like rims, body kits, and suspension. 

OVERALL i am going to give this game a 8.5/10 !!!!! DON'T JUST SIT THERE MAN, YOU NEED TO LEARN THE "ART OF RALLY"! -Thanks Pat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999217667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1664387519}
review:
Wer früher Colin McRae mit der Tastatur gezockt hat, oder einfach fasziniert von der "goldenen Ära" des Rally-Sports ist, wird es lieben.
Grafisch simpel, aber genial - die Entwickler haben das mit viel Liebe zum Detail umgesetzt und die Stimmung beim Fahren kann man als "belohnend" beschreiben.
Kurze Eingewöhnung an die Fahrphysik, ein wenig Ruhe reinbringen und schon absolviert man Etappe um Etappe und stets wird man etwas schneller. Jedes Auto hat seine Eigenarten und die späteren Boliden lassen sich natürlich nicht mehr so einfach beherrschen.
Fazit: ich mag das Spiel sehr, als Gelegenheitsdaddelei und einfach zum Genießen.
Ein paar mehr Szenarien wären gut - vielleicht kommt ja noch was.
Ansonsten gibts eigentlich nichts zu bemängeln.
Von freier Fahrt bis zur täglichen Zeit-Challenge online ist alles dabei, auch kann man nach jeder Etappe seinen Platz in der "Bestenliste" vergleichen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431871753', 'num_games_owned': 1295, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1625963013}
review: El juego sería perfecto si no fuera por sus problemas de rendimiento, urge un update que solucione ésto. Tengo mejor rendimiento en Dirt Rally 2.0 que acá, donde sufro stuttering, tirones y bajones de FPS notorios y molestos. Por lo demás, el juego es maravilloso. Esta hecho con mucho amor. Con amor al rally y con amor a los videojuegos. El juego sabe concentrarse en lo que realmente importa: las físicas, la esencia del rally, en ser divertido y en adaptarse a tu forma de jugar. En lo demás es sencillo, pero bello. La música está piola.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042075082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2507, 'last_played': 1708786154}
review:
First of all, the game is very difficult. In the beginning I used the mini car (fwd) just to learn the controls. Until I didn't need the assist options when playing with controller. In the next rally it is rearwheeldrive only, so you have to learn cornering all over again! It is satisfying to realize you get better every corner. After 40 hours you can finish the last rally on max difficulty :)

The soundtrack is nice, and there are lots of roads and cars. Realistic handling like in DIRT Rally. A lot of content for good price.

review:
Art of rally ist ein sehr schönes und gutes spiel. Die Strecken sind sehr ausführlich und man kann sehen das sehr viel liebe hintersteckt. dennoch gibt es sachen die mir nicht gut gefallen das zurücksetzen der autos ist sehr nervig wenn man 5 meter von der strecke kommt wird man dierekt zurückgesetzt und es bräuchte noch ein multipalyer.
Ich gebe dem spiel eine 9,5/10 ein sehr gutes Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984392377', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1623184095}
review: Once you get the hang of driving, pulling off perfect drifts never gets old.  And the simple graphics are quite visually appealing.  The devs even have more future content planned.  Art of Rally is a real gem. A+

author: {'steamid': '76561198001389680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1704538901}
review:
TLDR - Fun casual racer with high skill ceiling.

art of rally is an excellent minimalist rally racing game, even in its' current state where there are definitely things that could be added to improve it. I've never played Funselektor's other games, but Absolute Drift always looked like an interesting idea for a game, but I wondered how the game would handle. art of rally seemed like a home run to me when I saw it, as I've been obsessed with group b and rally history for a while recently. The game both has almost every historic rally car the average person could name, and has 0 licensed cars at the same time. Right now there are no car customization or modification options, but the cars all FEEL different enough that I didn't miss that feature (plz add tho). I usually play with keyboard, and the cars feel fantastic and unique. It's a perfect balance of something like gran turismo, where the cars feel heavy and realistic, and something like RC Pro AM 2 where the cars drive effortlessly and predictably. Its' basically a rally racing game equivalent of an ink blot test: if you want a casual racer to just have fun with, you will have a blast with art of rally. If you want to full send every rally and set world record track times, it has too. The art style is pretty to say the least, and the free roam mode is an unstoppable timewaster. I also really love how the game motivates the player to learn passively, and that the older cars featured are excellent to learn the basic handling on. Some cars from every era are available from the start, but others require you to complete the career mode (Mitsubishi Evo, Lancia Stratos, Audi Quattro for example are locked at the beginning) which spans the decades of rally from the 1960s through group b to modern day and beyond. 

Right now I'd call it a 9/10.  The gameplay is addictive and fun, and the visuals are gorgeous. The soundtrack is worth buying, which is the highest praise I think I've given an indie game's soundtrack. A few features that could make it 10/10 for me:

-More ghost features: developer ghosts ala mario kart etc would be super fun to race against, and if in single player mode you race against the ghosts of the computer racers that would be awesome and add reference for other drivers in the rally you are up against.

-Damage balance: car damage should be more severe IMHO. We should also be able to turn off car reset after going too far off the track as well for added challenge. Parts of career mode feel too easy even on high damage severity.

-First Person View / VR. First game I've ever played and genuinely wished I had a VR option just to look around. Not at all a requirement to make game better, but would be insanely pretty in cherry blossom trees, winter areas etc.

-More everything. There are tons of fun tracks already in the game, but more dev or community created tracks would be killer. More cars would be cool as well, but there are already a crazy number that all feel unique and interesting to play with.

Bought on sale for $18, worth every penny. Worth full price if you're into rally or racing games, once you start playing it I doubt you'll give it up without putting some hours into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068049868', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1609931439}
review:
Итак т.к. для мееня эталонный ралли сим - это Dirt Rally 2.0 буду сравнивать эту игру именно с ним (с поблажкой на индюшность)

Физика и управление - аркадные, но далеко не простые, все машины очень любят скользить независимо от компоновки трансмиссии, заднеприводные конечно любят скользить больше остальных. Полный привод тут ощущается как передний привод в Dirt Rally, а задним легче управлять. Правда во время дождя видимо в мире игры поливает не водой а маслом, становится ОЧЕНЬ скользко. Визуальных повреждений машин нет (кроме дыма из под капота), но физические - есть и они зависят от того какой стороной въебаться в преграду, можно также проколоть и починить колесо.

Штурман - его нет, нет и стенограммы в каком либо виде. Есть только водитель и дорога. Лично я привык к штурману в Dirt и мне страшно сильно разгоняться на участках, но с другой стороны учитывая широту дорог и высоту камеры вполне можно обойтись и без стенограммы. ОЧЕНЬ советую сбрасывать скорость перед прыжками, иногда они могут быть обманчивыми.

Трассы - самые разные - есть чисто асфальт, снег, и гравий. Локации тоже самые разные - относительно быстрая финляндия, германия с ее длинными прямыми, япония наполненная шпильками и крутыми поворотами. Каждый чемпионат генерируется рандомно, так что скучно не станет. Кстати для того чтобы продвинуться в карьере - необязательно выигрывать все чемпионаты, достаточно просто финишировать.

Машины - реально существующие модели, правда с исковерковаными названиями т.к. нет лицензии. Есть шесть эр - Группа 2,3,4, B, С, A. Шарящий симовик быстро разберется что cozzie - это Ford Escort Cosworth, а das hammer - это Audi Sport Quattro. Вроде как даже есть ЛАДА ДЕВЯТКА, для некоторых это будет большим плюсом. Звуки двигателей очень хороши для инди игры, звучат громко и мощно. Машины нужно открывать проходя карьеру, можно их кастомизировать разными ливреями (которые тоже открываются если проходить карьеру без перезапусков), или можно их загрузить и установить как мод.

Итого - хороший аркадный ралли сим для того чтобы отдохнуть от Dirt Rally. Приятная графика, звук, все довольно аутентично. Однозначно класс!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056449335', 'num_games_owned': 1397, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 2345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1666580399}
review:
Данную игру пришлось ждать прям долго(года 2 с первого показа или около того). С одной стороны, помня их absolute drift, слишком многого я не ожидал, потому как весомым минусом первой игры была именно абсолютно дубовая физика. С другой стороны, ролики впечатляли, да и сама идея аркадных ралли с видом сверху до сих пор не была внятно реализована ни в одной игре. Что ж, результат стоил этого ожидания.

Плюсы:
+Компания предоставляет возможность пройти от самых старых и простеньких раллийных машин, до тех, на которых классическое ралли по сути и закончилось.
+Графика очень прикольно выглядит в движении. 
+Физика на том замечательном уровне, когда она еще не душит своей симуляторностью, но уже достаточно сложная, чтобы развлекать. 
+Большое разнообразие машин(около десятка классов по 5-8 в каждом) и трасс(что то в районе 30, если не считать реверсы за отдельные).
+Если вас напрягает камера сверху, её без особых проблем можно передвинуть на вид сзади-сверху.
 
Спорные моменты:
+/-Саундтрек...ну не знаю.
+/-Открытые площадки. По сути рудимент от прошлой игры про дрифт. Там они смотрелись хорошо, а тут уже как то не в тему совсем.

Минусы:
-Повреждения сделаны супер невнятно. Иногда столкновение с бетонным блоком на 200км/ч не наносит никакого урона, иногда легкий удар вскользь о бортик моста приводит к дыму из под капота и убитому управлению.

Большой шаг вперед для студии. Если предыдущая игра выглядела как типичная малобюджетная инди поделка, то тут уже полноценная игра на твердую восьмерку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087707941', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1610409113}
review: This game is absolutely wonderful and definitely worth a buy. The art style in this game is gorgeous, the car sounds in this game are spectacular and the music fits the game perfectly. But although this game looks charming is a genuine rally game. When you first start of it’s going to be hard. You’re going to be crashing and flying off the track constantly (i know i still am), but once you start nailing those hairpins and drifting those long sweeping corners it feels so amazing. Thats what make you wanting to play this game. It starts you off with slower cars and gradually gets faster and faster while your skills development. Highly recommend this game, truly a masterpiece

author: {'steamid': '76561198446919356', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1664932029}
review:
This game is an awesome buy for anyone who is a fan of rally / rally cars, or someone who wants a simple game to sit down and chill out with. Overall it is fun, gorgeous, and quite well polished.

Pros:
- A short but satisfying career mode which allows you to slowly progress through years of rally to see how the cars evolve, along with a sufficient amount of difficulty tuning
- A unique free-roam with collectables and unlockable maps and songs
- Custom rally and time attack modes
- Arcadey and satisfying driving
- Broad selection of iconic vehicles from all eras of 20th Century rallying, including some unique add-ins
- Simple yet elegant models and eye-popping colors, paired with an incredible soundtrack

Cons:
- A few optimization issues on some of the more cluttered stages
- Only five locations currently exist in game (although more will likely be added)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972981360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 58, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1711677724}
review: I'm not a racing sim fan - the most time I've spent on the track was behind the two pod racing engines. But this game is incredible - yes it was frustrating at first, but I could feel myself getting better and better. Then at some point it clicked and the game became meditative, like it was playing itself. Just an incredibly satisfying game from the minimalist graphics to the controls, to the amusing lore that accompanies each car. The daily/weekly challenges keep things interesting once you've beat the career.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006566871', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1660237177}
review:
A great rally game to pick up and relax with, even for someone like me who usually only plays the more sim-type racing games. Simple and so much fun, but still has a good driving model that is believable enough to be interesting.


-A bit easy even at master difficulty. You can even get away with couple mistakes per stage and still win comfortably. Rain makes AI really slow... Like a minute slower than you on a 2,5 minute stage.

-Has a lot of cars! Every car can easily win it's class, but still have clear differences between each other. I like the imaginary successors of Group B cars! Group A also got beefed up to over 800hp.

-Five different locations that have decent variety between them. Career event stages are chosen at random so you can end up playing same stages a lot and others not so much.

-Runs fine, but you'd expect it to run better given its simple looks. I experienced a little stuttering here and there. Few bugs along the way also, but nothing major.


Collect the five cassettes from Japan freeroam for some extra great tunes!! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039875826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1711651566}
review: Its not Absolute Drift 2 and I mean that in a good way. This game is doing its own thing, it has some of the gameplay from absolute drift but it never feels like a lazy reboot since the rally aspect puts a whole new spin on it. Its more similiar to Dirt Rally than Absolute Drift, as strange as it sounds. Gameplay is amazing, the visuals are simplistic yet gorgeous and the soundtrack is... good i guess? I always listen to my own music. Anyways this game is great and hunting for achievements after youre done with the career is tons of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162279173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1609790325}
review:
Really well constructed game that flows very well together. 

Only had a couple of problems with the game. For some reason, the trees took a while to load on the snowy levels, causing some lag and breaking the atmosphere. Also, the music's biggest strength is also its biggest weakness. Because the music blends so smoothly together, it adds to the flow of the driving and the game as a whole. But because each piece is similar to the next, it sometimes feels out of place with the environment. For example, I was in one of the Japan rallies during a sunset. Yet, despite the peaceful nature of the scenery, the music was very fast-paced and beat-heavy. This somewhat ruined the atmosphere. 

Just keep in mind, though, that these are very small nit-picks. The game overall is fantastic and would definitely recommend buying! (Preferably when its on sale tho)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969039327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1634158001}
review: A driving game unlike any other. The pastels, the blocky yet charming graphics, no one yelling 'left 4 into right 6 don't cut' into my ear, the music, the cutscenes... it's art when everything works together to create a unified ambience, and this is art.

author: {'steamid': '76561199115926690', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1657538525}
review:
자동차를 어릴때부터 좋아해 왔던 한사람으로써, 정말 반가운 게임이였습니다. 아직 더 플레이 해 보아야겠지만, 너무 마음에 드는 게임이네요. 

심플하게 모든걸 표현했지만, 디테일이 떨어진다고 생각이 들지 않습니다. 오히려 이러한 세세한 부분까지 신경썻네 하고 생각하게 되죠. 심플하고 아기자기한 택스쳐와 함꼐, 광원 효과나 색감은 너무나 아름답습니다. 이 게임의 이름과 걸맞는 부분이죠. 

그에 반해, 물리 엔진과 사운드, 그리고 여러가지 글귀들은 이 게임이 단순히 아케이드적인 게임만을 표방한다고 생각이 들진 않게 만듭니다. 점프 할때의 느낌, 눈밭에서의 느낌, 여러가지 다른 흙밭에서의 느낌이 패드로 플레이해본 저에겐 모두 다르게 느껴졌습니다. 핸들의 감도와 코너를 감아 돌아나가는 느낌도 정말 만족 스러웠 습니다. 간간히 플레이 할 게임을 찾은것 같아 기분이 좋네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134917167', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2168, 'last_played': 1706488846}
review:
Incredible game, haven't really let it down since I got it. Super easy to learn and get a hold of, and very nice sound track, and stellar gameplay. A must have for any rally enthusiast in my personal opinion. However with this, I do have some critiques. I would like to see new rallys and stages, if this was somehow included with your mods this would be awesome and a great worthwhile. But the price of 25 kinda seems steep for right now when there are not a lot of rally's or stages, if they added 3 more areas and several more stages for each area then it would be worth 25 hands down.

But with this, I completely support the developers producing this game, it's incredibly great and can be an introduction for most to rallying and similar motorsports.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050251717', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1694728412}

essence of rally's  glory years - 80s, 90s, 00,s

a smidgen of developer heart, soul, determination love for the racing genre. 
add a touch of SALT..... probably from codemasters employees.... *cough cough... 

RESULT! 
A Pure magic rally game. Nae! A racing game for racing game lovers! 
It's just glorious. 
Thank you developer gods!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016026827', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1649501742}
review:
[b]8.5/10[/b]
[b][i]"Micro-DirtRally-Machines."[/i][/b]
At first you would guess that the Art of Rally is an overpriced cute little casual title with few content and only good for in between. But the content and depth AoR actually delivers is quite the opposite and totally justifies the price. For me AoR feels like a grown up and especially evolved version of micro machines - we have never gotten - with the controls and content inspired by Dirt Rally. While still not too hardcore nor too arcady and through the customizations it'll fit almost everyone's difficulty needs. Definitely the new reference for such racing games in this decade. Almost perfect job Funselektor but where's a multiplayer!? 
[b][i][u]Verdict:[/u] An homage to 3rd person cam rally driving.[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198053864674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 229, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1712497846}
review: Excellent racing game. Looks great and it is a decent challenge. You can use a controller with this game but a wheel and pedal system might be a bit better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985213438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1178, 'last_played': 1700865916}
review:
Veramente notevole, da molti punti di vista. Una sorpresa inaspettata: nel senso che mi aspettavo un gioco carino per lo stile grafico e "ambientazione" ma ART OF RALLY è molto di più. 
Il sistema di controllo è veramente fantastico, richiede molta pratica per essere padroneggiato ma, e qui entra un'altra caratteristica che mi ha stupito, la progressione del gioco ti "insegna" a guidare. I vari anni in cui si dividono le stagioni rappresentano (molto bene) anche l'evoluzione della tecnica e quindi avremo auto sempre più potenti e difficili da gestire. Ma è tutto calibrato alla perfezione e non mi sono mai sentito frustrato, anche quando ho dovuto ripetere una stagione. LA dinamica delle auto poi, è rappresentata perfettamente, e non solo per quello che riguarda trazione e potenza ma anche il passo ed il peso sono molto ben rappresentate e ti fanno sentire la macchina.
Parlando dell'ambito tecnico, devo dire che la grafica low poly potrebbe far credere ad una rappresentazione simbolica, ma non è così. Si raggiungono molto spesso luoghi evocativi rappresentati molto bene, ed i giochi di luce sono veramente suggestivi (il primo rally notturno vi farà strabuzzare gli occhi!). Se poi vi scaricate le livree ufficiali dal web il tutto raggiungerà livelli di realisticità notevoli.
Per assurdo ho apprezzato anche le musiche, sempre calzanti e varie, mentre gli effetti sonori sono realizzati anche loro molto bene (diversificati e realistici in base al mezzo utilizzato)

Se siete amanti dei rally è veramente un gioco che non può mancare nella vostra libreria, ma in generale se vi piacciono gli sport motoristici e la guida in generale.

Se potessi dare un voto darei 9,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970576839', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1609667278}
review: Getting close to 40 with not much free time I loved this game, really captured the feeling of my youth playing colin mcrae rally 2 with my headphones on instead of doing uni assignments. Great challenging driving model with a fantastic art style and music to boot. recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198940196550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1613984045}
review:
I bought the game a day ago, and unlike other games it actually made me stop playing civ vi and just enjoy playing 'art of rally'.  I just finished the group 2 in career mode, too bad though that i have to stop now. I have no idea what NOT to like. The physics and controls are great. I love the cars and especially adore the graphic style.


Great game. Would buy again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061059871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1708644191}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995995351', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1691370905}
review: In a year full of flops for racing games, this one is a true gem. Simplistic without being childish, enganging without being too complicated. Driving feels precise and dynamic, and the stable of cars puts to shame many games with official licenses. Just as the name suggests, it feels like driving is an art form, and the more you do, the better you feel about it. Everytime i play it i find something to like about it, and always end up with "that race was awesome".

author: {'steamid': '76561197969744139', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1613745225}
review:
当時車はインプレッサSTi乗ってて、WRCはBSやCSで見続けて、ラリージャパンは全開催年に北海道に行ってたWRC観戦マニアだけど、このゲームはコリンマクレーラリーが出た時と同じぐらい衝撃かも。
確かに見下ろし視点で挙動もリアルでは無いかもしれないけど、ラリーの雰囲気をおさえていてとにかく楽しい。
北海道の寒い秋に午前3時から並んで牛糞臭い足寄の牧場と林の中で震えながら0カー待ってた、あの素晴らしい紅葉の朝を思い出す。
グループB時代が忘れられないバブル爺達にもおすすめだと思うw
キャリアモードやらないと車がアンロックしないという指摘もあったけど、グラフィックが綺麗だしアシスト入れれば軽くクリアできるので全く気にならない。
フリーランもオープンワールド的なマップを自由に走るモードになっているので、ずっと走っていられる。
WRC好きにはおすすめしたい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198064122781', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1687569181}
review:
Great little game, easy to play but hard to master.  Car sounds are great with cool 90's kinda chill BG music.  Love the art style too, just watching a replay back from different view points looks great especially when you nail a stage.  The stick people that line certain points on the stage are great little touch, there is a certain satisfaction ripping thru the spectators and watching them part like the red sea for moses, brilliant touch!
Overall AOR is a superb game that will keep you playing just to get that bit further up on the leaderboard along with a decent career mode.
9/10

review: So, it's really good, but it does need a little patchwork. The distance you can go off the course before it auto-resets you is smaller than the average penis in North Korea, meaning you have no recovery time and immediately get struck with a 5-second penalty, also it needs a few more camera settings, particularly a few that are a bit closer to the car. Extremely well designed and the art direction is god-tier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007647706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1700323360}
review: Art of Rally... Wirklich Kunst,was die Steuerung angeht! Ich hab die Karriere heute durchgespielt und bin begeistert. Zwischenzeitlich bei den Gruppe B Boliden an meinem XBOX Pad verzweifelt,aber es ist wirklich Übung,die den Meister macht! Was soll ich sagen,wenn man´s denn endlich raushat,ist es irgendwie meditativ entspannend über die Strecken zu driften. Die Grafik mag nicht jedermanns Sache sein,aber ich finds richtig schön.Und die Lichteffekte,sehr geil,genauso wie die Musik im Hintergrund....,einfach mal ´nen "Lets´play" ansehen. Mal sehen was noch so kommt vom Entwickler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167295102', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1636580755}
review: Love the driving. It's hard but fun you feel like a god making a perfect corner! Very underrated game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015558738', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1609534631}
review: Не понимаю почему игра так всем заходит. По мне шлак. Визуально выглядит хорошо, играет на струнах души тех, кто фанат ралли и машины тех лет не пустой звук. И игра могла быть просто шикарная, если бы была нормальная физика, она просто ужасная, ездить нифига не интересно, азарта от прохождения СУ никакого. Понятное дело, что это не раллийный сим, а веселенькая аркадка. Но было бы интересно в нее играть если бы машины себя вели хотя бы как в КМР 2.0. Пытался в нее играть и получать наслаждение, но этого нет, так что один жирный минус перекрывает все плюсы. А задумка была хорошая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063116637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1703222746}
review: Art rally is aptly named and is a fantastic game. The cars are fun, the scenery is gorgeous, and the soundtrack slaps. You could get this game for the soundtrack alone and it'd still be a steal. Get this game. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976175171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1671662741}
review:
Easy to play
Hard to master

Smooth, polished and simple gameplay
If you play intensely, the game gets intense. If you play casually, the game gets casual. It gives out the energy you put into it

If this game is $15 or $20, you wont regret spending the money

review: Totally enjoyed this game. It's simple, addictive and fun. If your a rally or drift car sorta person then this will amuse you. It offers a fair few cars all with different handling and a fair few levels at several difficulty settings, it also has a free-roam gather the parts on the map type game and the normal time trials etc, also has daily and weekly events via the game and access to workshop skins for the cars.....I'm pretty impressed to be fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963813187', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 4304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1706617613}
review:
There are a couple of things I don't like about Art of Rally, like how I sometimes slam into hay bales because it's hard to see blocked off roads, or the insistent techno music that makes me think the guy with the chicken head from Hotline Miami is gonna come flying out of nowhere and beat me to death with a baseball bat.

But I get it. The art style and the sound design is the way it is because Art of Rally isn't a game about actual rallying, it's a game about a dream about rallying. It's the place you go when you die if you've spent most of your life dreaming about screaming engines and beat-up suspensions, driven by fearless men and women through forests and country roads across the world. Art of Rally is Ral-halla.

It's still extremely challenging, but the horror and violence of rally has been softened to leave only the beautiful bits. The little matchstick men politely get out of your way as you come roaring through corners, avoiding any chance of repeating real-life tragedies.

It is also extremely fun to play. The camera means you're never quite sure where the front of your car is pointing, so you're constantly correcting and fighting to keep all four wheels on the road. The physics are really good, it actually feels like those little cars have suspensions, shifting the weight and pulling them towards the edge of the road in a corner.

The camera also reminds me a lot of another rally game I used to play on the Sega Mega Drive called Power Drive. Art of Rally is essentially a cutting edge, psychedelic version of that.

Most importantly, it's an extremely clear vision, perfectly realized. There's so much love in it. AI drivers have names like "Atilo Beggeta" and "Michele Moutun". Every car comes with its own beautifully written biography. It feels like a game that has been designed and crafted with love to be exactly what the developer imagined, right down to the last nut and bolt. It is fun, it is rewarding, and it is easily the most beautiful rally game you can play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081837373', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1712438646}
review:
Love it! 10/10

Simply amazing. Absolutly love the graphics, the driving experience and the chill vibes you get with this game. Without the need for pacenotes you can just enjoy the nice music in the game or just put on your fav playlist and vibe. Plenty of cars and I hope we'll get to drive some of the modern rally machines like the Skoda Fabia R5.

There are some things that I'd love to change tho. Sometimes when you go on a straight road buzzing 200km/h you get launched into the air for no reason (happend to me twice). Next thing is that on some roads the limit where you can go off them is little too small and you get a 5 second penalty for it. And the last thing is that the guard rails somewhere are partly invisible. 

But even with these issues the game is lovely and I can do nothing more than recommend it to every racing/rally fan! I'm sure that I'll have more than 16 hours that I have now on this game. 

Great job Funselektor! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198132375552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1692586742}
review: Złote czasy rajdów w fantastycznej oprawie audio wizualnej, grywalność niesamowita, szeroki wybór tras i pojazdów, do tego 100% miodności sprawia że banan podczas gry nie schodzi z twarzy szczególnie po pokonaniu zakrętów efektownymi poślizgami, obowiązkowa pozycja dla miłośników tematu. Gorąco polecam wszystkim i gratuluje autorom świeżego podejścia do rajdów przy których można oderwać się od świata ekonomicznych pierdzikółek  i spróbować swoich sił za kierownicą kultowych maszyn z których konstruktorzy wyciskali ostatnie soki nie będąc jeszcze ograniczani jakimiś pierdołami jak na przykład emisją spalin. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198281992568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1696156379}
review:
Its a beautiful game. Very very nice visually, but becomes a bit repetitive after a while.  

Also game play could be made better. I thought its pretending to be a rally sim a bit too much. Its not a sim. 

A bit more arcade-y controls would have truly made this good game a great  one. Not completely arcade, but more like dial it down 10-20%. A bit more oversteer than understeer, a bit less focus on entry speed into corners etc etc. Like going into turns at 20mph feels a bit unnecessary for this game, I would much rather focus on getting it around drifting rather than having to brake so much every time to keep the car on the road. And going off road kills the speed completely, which is a bit ridiculous (they are supposed to be a rally cars!!). The top down camera angle also doesn't really help as well. 

But it still is my go to game when I just want to relax and have a stress free game for short periods.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970966679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1706224086}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048887920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1706726756}
review: Outstanding arcade racer! Essentially it's a fine selection of 90s racing games combined onto one plate, then served with a wide grin. Recommended for every 90s kid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039517922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1616322660}
review:
I love to play a nice rally game once in a while. Most games are either too realistic for me to enjoy (high difficulty and super lengthy in-depth career mode which doesn't work for a casual player like me) or too unrealistic to enjoy (I do like some realism and not the Mariokart style alternatives). This game hits the sweet spot. Don't let the cartoony style and top-down view distract you. The gameplay is serious and difficult enough for me to enjoy without getting too difficult/serious. The graphics are great too. There's enough to see along the tracks, and various elements even move in a nice way. This is all made with the right balance: enough to enjoy and not distract you.
Also love that I can play this on my Mac with a Playstation 4 controller. It's literally just plug and play, which I hadn't tried before. I would've preferred to play this game on console (Playstation or Switch) but this is a good alternative.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987466650', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1672421550}
