author: {'steamid': '76561198000213089', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1700161293}
review:
Are you looking for a different experience in racing games? A big fan of Rally/Rally games? Then you've come at the right place, art of rally offers a great experience, something not quite the same as other offerings at this time in the Rally genre (like DiRT Rally, WRC, or DiRT 5, etc.).

You probably already noticed the cartoon-ish artstyle, and are thinking it's a casual game, right? Well, you're wrong. The artstyle is one thing, but it handles like a proper Rally game, with a different perspective than what you'd find in DiRT Rally for example, as you don't have access to pace notes. You won't need them anyway, as your POV is very high above your car, like a very far Chase cam.

If you're looking for a racing sim, this is not it, there's no cockpit camera for once, but it sure offers it's own set of challenges, as you can set the camera higher and see more of the road ahead, but in turn can make it harder to see in more detail what's immediately in front of you, the elevation changes, your car's attitude, etc. Conversely, you can get it closer to your car, and in turn lose some of the ability to see the next few corners. The placement of trees and hills will make it less straightforward in just looking ahead, hiding part of the corner, or even how tight it can get, so it keeps the unique challenge that is rallying.

At this time I've only played 5 hours, but I can definitely say that it's definitely a game to at least try for yourself, it's fun, it's beautiful (yeah, it's not a realistic artstyle, but it can definitely strike you with some beautiful sceneries as you slide around multiple countries), it's got a career mode where it'll take you from the late 60s to the mid 90s, completing seasons through every year, with cars corresponding to each era, and each season is randomly generated using different stages, so you can repeat a season and get totally different countries and/or stages. There's no licenced cars, but their replacements are equally unique, with matching caracteristics and feeling to their inspirations, which is something else to take note and practice with.

It's a game that has more than meets the eye, and has a soul that you can feel, unlike some games being released these days from companies that should be doing better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032754056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1676666820}
review:
Un jeu de course atypique, à la fois relaxant et exigeant.

Au delà des graphismes minimalistes, et de tous les petits détails visuels sympas, la conduite est assez difficile, et demande pas mal d'entraînement. Les sensations de conduite changent beaucoup d'un véhicule à l'autre, et les différents groupes, revêtements, conditions météo modifient sensiblement le gameplay (une Renault 8 sur asphalte et une Subaru sur la neige, c'est pas la même, mais du tout...).
De base, je joue très peu à des jeux de course, mais celui-ci donne l'impression de jouer à un shmup ou un jeu de rythme, pour le niveau de concentration et la précision demandée sur les contrôles.

La vue de haut est intéressante pour plusieurs raisons (hormis le feeling Micro Machine V3) : pas besoin de copilote, et on profite davantage du paysage. Par contre, si on voit bien arriver les virages, on repère moins bien les montées, descentes et bosses (ces dernières sont cependant signalées, le plus souvent, par un portail) : il faut donc rester assez vigilant...

J'aime beaucoup tous les petits détails du jeu (le public, les éléments de décors, les sons de moteur...), le choix assez large de voitures et l'ambiance générale qui se dégage du jeu.
Seul vrai regret, pour le moment : les quelques problèmes de performance graphique, avec notamment des cartes récentes mal supportées (problème connu, contournement décrit dans le forum de la communauté) et un clipping trop important pour un jeu en low-poly.

Le jeu est pour l'instant mis à jour, avec des correctifs, des nouvelles voitures, et des nouvelles features (ghosts, livrées custom...).

Au final, un très très bon jeu que ce soit pour se relaxer ou s'acharner sur ses chronos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026360528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1691813442}
review: Amazing game so such simple graphics easy is actually very easy unlike the other rally games so if you are a beginner it will give you alot of leeway and even on beginner you can unlock everything so no need to go harder till you are ready I've been playing the season moving up diff and completing every race easy was a breeze novice is what I'm on now and I seem to be mastering that as well I have 900plus hours in dirt rally 2.0 and I'm not very good but I really enjoy it despite the diff this is a refreshing change of pace I can win alot more than I do in other rally games even the wrc games on easy aren't near as forgiving as they should be anyway not a sim game and the graphics aren't great but there's people littered on the edge and some actually on the track they move out of the way pretty quick but it's funny the first time it happens. only 5 countries but the tracks are well done with lots of bends and obsticles daily and weekly challeneges a leaderboard to see how you measure up the only thing this game is missing is multiplayer anyway I highly recommend it especially if you are looking a fresh take on an old sport

author: {'steamid': '76561197960429042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1629309161}
review:
Just finished my first play through. The game is absolutely amazing, highly recommended!

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics look really amazing. They fit the game nicely and don't leave much to be desired. Don't be fooled by the "simple" looks though, if you want to run this at 144fps on high resolutions/ultrawide, you better bring a beefy PC.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Best gamepad driving experience I have ever had. Once you get the hang of it the driving becomes second nature and you can easily fall into a real flow state, similar to driving a car to work the same route every day. After a few minutes you "wake up" and realize you are still gliding through the amazing scenery. They absolutely nailed it. 

[h1]Content[/h1]
A single play through took about 17 hours. I did not spend any time on the free roam maps or daily/weekly events, so these will add a few more hours easily. The game features tons of cars and stages, with a nice sense of progression throughout the career. It takes you through the different years of rally racing, with the corresponding cars.

Speaking of cars: The cars are really nicely made, with lots of love for the small details. Lovers of rally cars will have lots of fun identifying the cars based on the descriptions and looks (there are no licensed names in the entire game). Same goes for the stages and driver name, many of which resemble real rally drivers and stages.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The music takes you back to the nineties and has a really relaxing vibe to it. Fits the game nicely. The car sounds are very well made and you can clearly hear the different engine characters/turbos/etc. The only thing I found a little overdone was the anti-lag in group A. I know it sounds brutal in real life as well, but I found it a little too loud and overpowering of the rest. The other groups where nicely balanced.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
10/10 would rally again. This is the perfect game if you need a break from your hardcore sim games or just work. Sit back, relax and have a smooth drive through the beautiful scenery. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991016762', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1703465396}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063355502', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1623469557}
review:
開発者のラリーへの愛を感じるゲーム。
ただのレースゲームでなくスピリチュアルな部分があって、それがこのゲームを特別な作品にしていると思う。
フリーモードが箱庭風で広く、コースから外れて草原や林に分け入る事も出来ます。楽しい。
操作はドリフトしまくって難しいです。車の解説に駆動方式を書いておいて欲しい。私にMRは無理です…。
素人でもレタッチソフト一つで簡単にスキンMODが作れます。RaceDepartmentに多くの実車スキンがあるので、カストロールセリカやマルティニのランチアを正確に再現したい人は拾ってくるといいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561199050159730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1705480763}
review:
I almost wrote this game off ... because I kept writing the car off. But after a bit of practice, I started to find a groove. When you're actually driving fast in this game, it will feel slow. That is true to life for me. It's very meditative. It forces you to drive on the gears, and after a while you will develop a feel for the weight of the car.

Still, I've driven enough fast things fast to know that rally-prepped Minis don't just understeer at < 30mph on dry tarmac for no reason. Some of the car physics just feel ... off (as with more or less every simulator I've ever played). The tyres are made of wood, maybe? Overall though, it's good. There's lift-off oversteer available if you know how to access it - which makes me way too happy - and when you shift, there's a little pause as your dude presses the clutch.

I also love the aesthetic (how could you not?), and the focus on the golden eras of rallying. None of your crappy silhouette racers here, but plenty of thoroughbreds like the 6R4, 205 T16, RS200, etc. (although it's a shame they're not licensed). The sponsors are hilarious too - "Oil", "Petrol", etc. It feels like a drivers' driving game, and it's absolutely beautiful. I couldn't vote that down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050846447', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1691816436}
review:
It's an arcade game about rally.

The controls aren't realistic, the car handling doesn't feel realistic. But, when you get the hang of it, it's not that bad. It is fun to go full blast through stages without crashing once.

Don't even try to do a clean stage with a Group B car, they are actually uncontrollable and I don't think the devs really know how these type of cars behave under full capacities. They we're called monsters, but not because they would spin out of control every time you touch the steering. Also, screw the fact that you get reset and +5 seconds on your time for cutting a corner a bit too much, cutting happens all the time in rally, same goes for drifting through someone's crop field. Let us eat the penalties and get back on track ourselves, make the limits further away.

Another thing, Japan never really seen any big rallies, nor did it see all groups of rally. I feel like the developers were trying to put their Initial D fantasies in the game instead of great mechanics, feels like I'm playing a Absolute Drift 2, I don't know about you but mountain rallying? Also, If you really think a rally Subaru pushes 820hp through an EJ22 you are dreaming big time, engine will go kablamo before you even think about it.

I recommend this game for anyone who is a fan of rally, if you have no interest in rally. Don't get it as it will only frustrate you on how much the handling sucks, doesn't compare to any real simulation racing game. The cars are too bouncy and they lose control over nothing.

The art, the visuals in this game are amazing, it goes hand in hand with the music. Though it feels they put all their efforts into that, and not the actual driving.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964604365', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1609381319}
review:
Art of Rally is a fantastic racing game that offers a unique and engaging experience. The isometric perspective provides a refreshing take on traditional racing games, and the gameplay is both challenging and satisfying. The physics engine is incredibly well-tuned, and the cars feel great to drive, with each one providing a distinct and satisfying handling experience.

As someone who loved Dirt Rally (2015), I found Art of Rally to be a great successor in many ways, with a similar level of difficulty and a focus on skill-based driving. The variety of tracks and environments is impressive, and each one presents its own challenges and opportunities to hone your driving skills.

While the graphics may not be hyper-realistic, the stylized art style is a perfect fit for the game's overall aesthetic and adds to its charm. Overall, Art of Rally is an amazing game that offers a truly unique and enjoyable racing experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982304343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1609433663}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029616528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1609172536}
review:
게임을 즐겁게 잘 했습니다. 비록 아쉬움이 남는것은 몇가지 있지만, 랠리 게임의 감성이 돋아나는 아름다운 비쥬얼의 게임입니다.
최신 레이싱 게임들 처럼 자동차 실내에서 직접 운전하는 듯한 느낌을 주면 참 좋겠지만, 그럴리 없다는 부분이 아쉽습니다.
저는 비록 1.2시간만에 게임을 포기하지만, 우리 훌륭한 대한민국 청소년 분들은 반드시 포기 하지 않으시고 끝까지 건승하시기 바랍니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066208832', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1702263364}
review:
I like to slide around to rad music. This game is awesome.
Edit: I've put more hours into this game. Still love it. Finally switched to manual after 25 hours of automatic transmission and it's a whole new game. You have so much more control (duh) over the car once you get the hang of it. The mechanics of this game are simple but so satisfying. Every car handles differently and provides a unique challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370789193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1609161683}
review:
I wanted to love this game but unfortunately it is too hard for me to enjoy, although I've been playing racing games with controllers since Colin McRae Rally 2 and Gran Turismo 2 times :( 
The problems are:
- there is absolutely no change in the sense of speed so you never feel if you're too quick or too slow for a corner
- the unique camera angle and movement makes it hard to judge steering inputs (I tried adjusting things in the settings but that didn't help)
- steering inputs AND physics both feel inconsistent. grip levels and steering sensitivity seem to not change in a linear way that you could anticipate but instead they change rapidly and unexpectedly. 
- you can't judge the terrain in terms of grip and elevation, which leads to going into corners way too fast, jumping over seemingly minor crests and then flying into oblivion, etc...

I don't get it, especially because their other game, Absolute Drift, handles brilliantly and is very intuitive to learn. Very sad for this beautiful game to lack enjoyable, straightforward controllability =(

author: {'steamid': '76561197966705283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1708654602}
review:
Amazingly fun and realistic rally game with plenty of Easter eggs and delightful surprises for anyone that is a fan of the sport. The game is easy to play but hard to master, keyboard and mouse can be very difficult but do-able as controllable throttle is best. 

The games graphics are amazing and will stand up to the test of time, as will the soundtrack which I rarely care about in a game but I find myself coming back to listen to more every few days.

It can be a relaxing game once you get the hang of it, but your first few rides will be a learning experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154469656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1708900748}
review:
au départ, ne voyant ce jeu dans mes recommandations steam, je me suis dis "mouais bof, ça a pas l'air plus ouff que ça", puis j'ai regarder quelques vidéos dessus et lu quelques articles sur le jeu pour vraiment voir ce que c'était, et là j'ai sérieusement commencer a hésiter, si jamais vous aussi vous êtes en train d'hésiter, arrêter et achetez ce jeu !!!!!

coté graphisme, c'est simple et sobre mais ça fait clairement le taff et ça donne une superbe atomosphère au jeu, ponctué par la BO qui vous rappellera les meilleurs sons des années 80, le tout dans votre audi quattro S1 à vous concentrer pour ne pas taper un arbre et niquer votre précieux chrono !!
au niveau des voitures : elles sont toutes là, de la stratos à l'alpine en passant par la lancer evo 5 et la delta s4, vous serez conquis par le nombre de véhicules, tous plus mythiques les uns que les autres, qui risquent d'augmenter avec les mises à jour, il faut également souligner que le jeu dans les descriptions des véhicules, arrive à rendre drôle quelque chose qui se veut à la base sérieux, notamment lorsque l'histoire derrière chaque voiture est racontée

seul petit bémol, la camera n'offre pas encore de possibilité d'avoir des vues plus classiques, comme la vue capot, il n'y a de disponible que la vue poursuite éloignée mais cela va bien avec l'ambiance du jeu

le jeu peut convenir à tout type de personne, d'un joueur casual qui a juste envie de se faire une étape ou deux, au tryhardeur qui va essayer de se hisser le plus haut possible sur le classement mondial sur chaque étapes

il y en aurait encore beaucoup à dire mais encore une fois si vous hésiter, allez-y, vous ne serez pas déçu

UPDATE: VOUS ETES SADIQUES AVEC VOS PUTAINS DE BORNES TOUT LE LONGS DES BORDS DE ROUTES EN ALLEMAGNE? J'EN VIENS A DETESTER Y ROULER, Y A PAS DE PLACE A L'ERREUR CERTES, MAIS VOUS ETES DES MALADES LES GARS, le jeu n'en reste pas moins génial

author: {'steamid': '76561198066193629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1710689985}
review:
This is the second review I've written for this game, and there may well be a third (in fact, see below). I'm having a love-hate relationship with it.

Love the graphics, the music, the feel, the whole aesthetic. Love the fact that things like "hungover"; "dropped cigarette"; "wrong pace notes" appear as reasons for your competitors failing to finish. I'm not bothered that there are no commercial licensing deals, and everything is abstract. It's great, and indeed, it allows the game designers the chance to make little jokes they wouldn't be able to if they were having to get everything past BMW or even Ferrari. Love the structure, all of it, it's great. Except...

The handling. Hate the handling. The actual driving. Look I get that it's not trying to be realistic, it's a game, it's just a bit of fun, and they're trying to encourage drifting. But seriously. I've been playing for 12 hours now and I still can't reliably make it go in a straight line on dry concrete at 30mph. Anyone here ever driven a car? At around 30 mph, on tarmac? Did it go crazy the minute you touched any control? Of course not. This game was written by graphic designers who have never driven anything beyond a fold-up bicycle. Have you ever seen a motorway? Three or four lanes in each direction of traffic moving at 70mph and not a single one of them sliding sideways or spinning round like an idiot! I've driven on dirt, I've driven go karts, and I've played lots of racing games including rally games. This is ridiculous.

The fishtailing problem is pretty serious. There doesn't seem to be any way to stop it other than stop the car. Even just turning into a corner at the moment you intend to is extremely difficult. I think it's too much. I think the game would be better if it was more controllable and more consistent. I don't understand the people claiming that this game is somehow relaxing or chilled out. It's tense, unpredictable and frustrating. I'm half wondering whether people writing stuff like that have really played the game, or if they're just saying what everyone else is saying. That's why I'm giving this the thumbs down: it's a good game, I am enjoying it, and I'm going to keep playing because every so often I get a little glimpse that I might be able to learn how to control it one day. Then I do the same track five times in a row and get worse times each time, the last one a minute and a half slower than the first, and I'm swearing about it again. You certainly can't play this if anyone else is present in the room

Since everyone is upvoting the game for the graphics, the music and the feel, which are all great. I feel like for balance I need to downvote it for the actual driving. They'd have a really great game if only it was possible to control the car.


~~~~~


And all of that was before I'd even experienced the rain. Oh my God. This isn't a racing game, it's a random crash generator. You just go along, pretending to be controlling what's happening on the screen, and periodically the animated car crashes into an object.


~~~~~~~

By 21 hours, I'm starting to get control of the car. I still think it is seriously too unstable to give me the sense of control and trust that makes racing games great, when the (animated) car becomes like an extension of your body. That's never going to happen with this game. But I can now complete a few stages without swearing.

If I could give a neutral rating I would. Because of all the positive reviews, I'm going to leave this one negative just to make the point that some users are finding the control and handling of the car extremely frustrating. I would love to say this is a great game, in every other way it is, but it wouldn't be honest to give a glowing report to a driving game that has a serious problem with the handling of the cars.

review:
Disappointing game, doesn't seem to suit, keyboard/controller or steering wheel controllers.
Could be an excellent game, but currently you don't have enough fine control of the car to make it enjoyable.
The car is like being on ice all the time and you find yourself going very slowly 30-40mph to get around the stage and weirdly you then win it!
Confusing game to me, spent most of the four hours trying to find some good control balance, but have given up for the time being.

NEXT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095247377', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1609272161}
review:
A meditative game in a year of patience worn thin. 

I open art of rally

and immediately, my eyes softly thank me, as the menu is a pleasant off-white

Uh oh I don't know my blood type

gotta ask my mom, maybe put a slip of paper in my wallet--

I love listening to the enthusiastic ramblings of friends. Or, anyone, really, about anything they’re really passionate about. One of my dearest friends is absolutely wild about rally racing. For hours he would go on and on about not only it’s history, but the kinds of cute, little cars fighting for victory and near-death (and sometimes unintentional death-death).

This game in it’s synth-music laden glory presented me immediately with a comfortable and simple UI, giving me only what I wanted. (Maybe an enter button somewhere to click would’ve been nice though, not everyone has the gamer instinct of pressing enter on the keyboard.) I don’t know shit about cars, I own an old Honda Civic 2000 and soon I’ll have to find a replacement, but he’s worked a very strong 20 years in our family. 

I started the tutorial and a buddha emerges and gives me the kind of abridged summary I love to give other people about things I love. Trees are my friends, but I know it’s not a car’s friend. Deers aren’t cars friends either and living in exurban Ohio teaches you that very, very quickly. 

Naturally I chose the chunkiest boy I have available to me. I go at it. I feel cool as I feel out the controls to sick synth music and eat my morning oatmeal. I am bad at the game immediately, but as I get used to things I feel the adrenaline rush (or maybe it’s just anxiety). Crashing into anything is comically funny and that’s always a success in a video game for me. So is letting you just do whatever in a wide expanse to figure out how to actually play.  

The game is downright gorgeous–minimalist `scapes bring a distinct feeling of lovingly crafted miniatures and not a second goes where you lose sight of your car. Anything blocking the vision of your beautiful, tiny, mechanical friend gently peels away in an imperfect circle. None will impede the beauty of your vehicle, and the vehicle will not destroy the precious nature around it. 

Trees can kill cars, after all. 

Every music track is the same. People jump out of the way for your car, but nothing else does. Everything is simple, but the immersion is true. It feels lived in. 

Whether you know how to drive a car virtually or in real life, or know fuck-all about rally racing, it’s a nice time. It’s not really my thing, but I’m already spending more time with it than I thought I would. If you’re even the least bit interested, try it.

If only to have an experience similar to reaping controlled chaos in a Bob Ross painting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068176233', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1639886985}
review:
"Dirt under my wheels
I slid into a new turn
But crashed yet again"

When you get behind the wheel, you enter a new world that you are not accustomed to, you're not controlling your body anymore as much as you are controlling a car, and so your self extends itself to become the car in an almost futile attempt to find common ground in this new foreign shell, in an attempt to understand it. 
Constantly challenging yourself to improve, to adapt to your new shell, you feel the turns, you feel the gravel beneath you, you feel the stress from braking and the inertia kicking in from stepping on the accelerator, the engine sound reverberating across your self as you shift gears. Through all this hard work, in your path filled with failures, you've finally reached success, you've mastered the track, you've mastered the art of rally.

And so the car becomes you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979688751', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 13602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1682015863}
review:
short review :
best played with 1 hand on the control keys and the other one on the chips (or ur fav snacks), and spotify is playing in the background :)

longer review :
one of the best racing game yet, you can easily enjoy this game while sitting back and relax which you dont normally get in thrilling racing games, i really love the "low-poly' like design and very vibrant beautiful colors, the controls are dead simple, has couple interesting easter eggs and humor, the photomode is decent.. quite good compared to other triple A racing games titles to be honest, the game has decent amount of cars, the cars itself has different characteristics.. the auto recover is not as perfect, sometimes it resets the car even if you think you can recover the car yourself, and i hope the developer gives constant updates to this game so we dont have to reset our progress...

final verdict : a must buy! doesnt matter if youre a sim racer or a diehard arcade racer, a 2021 refreshment!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018201450', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1658332726}
review:
Amazing little game, serene music, tense tracks, slide into every corner, a super little car.  The handling of all the cars are very different and the tracks and varied and fun.  If I had to nitpick, I wish there was a co-driver because that is a very rally thing to have missing and there isn't any adjustment to the car at all.  These are nitpicks as its not a sim racer, but I still would love a co-driver giving me calls.

Strong recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028483366', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 195, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1712454597}
review:
if you love rally or the concept of racing as art or having meaning you'll dig this. This is the type of game you will disappear into. Instantly addictive and gratifying, core mechanics are spot on. It's like colin mcraes micro machines with a very meditative vibe. The amount of content both real and fictional (imagining beyond group B to S) makes the price worth it. 
     The addition of exploring open world locations and hunting for collectables with full weather control is a really nice touch, you could lose hours to that alone, ever heard of Funselektor Labs before but glad I have now

author: {'steamid': '76561198013184536', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1670798018}
review: I prefer the more hardcore of racing sims, so I was bit hesitant when picking this up on sale. However, almost immediately I was drawn in. This game is a love letter to the old days of Group B, hardcore, fast, unsafe rally that doesn't make you buy a wheel or understand pace notes. You have a road, you have a car, and that's it. Don't be mistaken, though. This game *is* difficult and you *will* crash. The car's handle beautifully, right up until you careen into a lake when you take a hairpin too fast. It makes getting a podium rewarding as you grind your way to the top specs. Add in a very lovely sense of humor in the flavor text and an adorable low poly art style, and you have a game that will devour your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979953970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 490, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1706915128}
review:
A charming love letter to rallying as a whole and rally history specifically, and all of that without licenses like real cars or drivers names. That's a real testament of the love, passion and care the devs put on this hidden gem. Driving is surprisingly realistic for a top down view arcade racer, making the experience really fun and addictive.

The only downside is performance, I have more stutters and issues here than in Dirt Rally 2.0...

author: {'steamid': '76561198260246137', 'num_games_owned': 4124, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1609149971}
review:
Egyszerű felső nézetes Rally játék, de mégis valahogyan másabb mint az ehhez hasonló kategória.
Egyszerű játék menete van,  a látvány világ szépen kivan dolgozva, tetszetős játék. 

Az autók hangja "szépen" kivan dolgozva. Azoknak is ajánlanám akik a szabad idejükben nincs mit csináljanak.
A játékban megtalálhatók legendás Rally autók, csak licensz nélkül, de így is aki ért hozzá tudja milyen autót  hajt :)

Értékelésem:
Grafika: 4/5
Játékélmény: 3/5
Hangzások: 2/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198927328137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1641640003}
review:
아기자기한 그래픽과는 달리 어느경기보다 치열했던 80~90년대와 그룹b 랠리 감성이 느껴지는 엄청난 게임입니다
전륜, 후륜, 사륜 구동 자동차의 차이가 이정도로 정교하게 구현되어 있을줄 정말 몰랐습니다 그리고 그냥 대충하는 아케이드성 짙은 자동차 게임이 아니라 절묘한 엑셀워크와 브레이킹 포인트를 필요하는 게임입니다.
참고로 저는 레이싱휠 유저인데 아무래도 원래 휠 지원을 안하는 게임이다 보니 h쉬프터가 호환이 안돼고 포스 피드백이 없습니다. 하지만 레이싱이나 랠리팬분들은 꼭 해 보시면 좋을거 같습니다. 그래픽도 대충만든것처럼 보이지만 레이싱게임에서 맵이 아름답게 보인건 이 게임이 처음입니다. 처음 살때는 상당히 비싸게 느껴졌는데 가격만큼의 가치를 자랑하는군요.
참고로 저는 일본맵 벛꽃나무의 거름이 되었습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043187935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1609098929}
review: £15 for a Minecraft racing game? It looks blocky, the engine has a horrible generated sound, after racing through 4 stages, I was driving a rally car through Finland and Japan. Worth the money. Music is neutral, you zone out your thoughts and you get flow, I've missed this feeling. Minimalist racing, with actual racing physics. You need a controller, avoid the amazingly well placed rocks and ignore the people (I wish I could mow them down). Lots of content, active community (mods and skins). Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982912877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1703798890}
review:
Nettes kleines Geschicklichkeitsspiel im Rally Setting!

Pro:
-hübsches Art Design
-Netter Synthi-Soundtrack
-schöne Rally-Strecken in verschiedenen Ländern
-alles da an Rally-Fahrzeugen was man so kennt ab 1960
-Daily und Weekly Event
-Fahrphysik geht auf Antriebsart und Wetterverhältnisse ein (FWD,AWD,RWD,Nebel,Schnee,Regen)
-Nette kleine Sammel Items nach dem man durch ist mit dem Spiel
-paar außergewöhnliche Fahrzeug just 4 Fun

Neutral:
-keine original Lizenzen für die Autos (für mich nicht relevant da man durch die Form und Lackierung sofort weis welches Auto es sein soll)

Negativ:
-Grafik auf dauer doch sehr Detailarm könnte man anführen 
-vielleich noch ein Schadensmodell (da man eh weit weg ist, würde das Sinn machen?)

Ich hatte jetzt 16std meinen Spaß und soweit alle Erfolge außer den letzten 3 die dann doch übermäßig Zeit fressen würden (1000x Events abschließen). Denke so 10-20std kann man rechnen als Spielzeit wenn man immer mal wieder 30min bis 1std reinschnuppert und seine Daily oder Weekly fährt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993218015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1608662864}
review:
Really fun, somewhat steep learning curve if you don't do racing games.  My suggestion for a good play-through...

Settings:
FOV maxed
Automatic (although the shift logic is weird, even more-so with the 4 speed cars)
Camera view closest to the car
ABS set to 60%
Stability set to 0% (This is important, the stability in this game is intrusive and wants to correct over-steer pretty aggressively, made everything twitchy for me.  Turning it off might be difficult at first but plays huge later when all the stuff is 4WD). 

As for difficulty.  I think your first time should be Novice.  Only because you need to learn the tracks.  The German stages get super difficult and you will damage the car like crazy.  This just makes you get frustrated.  Do it on Novice, unlock some cars and livery's.  Enjoy the stage art and get accustomed to the physics of the game (it's not a sim racer by any means).  

Had a blast playing this game.  It really feels like a passion project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083542327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1702783641}
review:
The trailer makes this game look easy, but it is HARD. It will take you several practice races before you stop falling off of the track, or spinning out from hitting a tree. The cars all have some serious weight to them. You can feel the wheels lose traction through the controls. I am used to Need for Speed type games where you put the gas all the way down, but if you hold down the gas in this game then you will struggle to keep control. I had to use the brakes more in one race than I ever did in my NFS career lol. It takes a lot of skill and practice just to get through a track without making a costly error and suffering a 5 second penalty. Getting a good time on a track requires focus and rehearsal. This isn't meant to dissuade you from buying the game, my point is that this is more than just a cheap arcade game. Every car is unique in its handling, and you can tell a lot of love and care was put into every little detail. This is a game that you can keep playing for hundreds of hours grinding for track records if you wanted to. There is also access to community made content, which just keeps the fun going for even longer. If you are looking for a quality rally racing game that keeps you coming back for improvement, this game won't let you down. I'll keep coming back to this game when I want to relax but also still be challenged. 

Oh also the graphics are adorable. I love a good low poly game that plays like a modern high budget project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075957959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1695445411}

Control settings are a bit frustrating though; e.g. the automatic transmission works more like the game is operating (badly) a manual transmission, rather than like a true auto transmission; e.g. you can shift without clutching with no apparent penalty.

Surface traction always feels slippery, unlike actual surfaces IRL.

Otherwise, if you think you'll like this game, you probably will.

...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960397744', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1626467279}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046551706', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1706905032}
review:
Beautiful game celebrating the history of rally. The controls take a bit of getting used to but for me it's the perfect balance between somewhat easy to pick up and hard to master. Still winds me out pretty quickly at the moment, because it feels like i actually have to pay attention, learning something new. Then again it always draws me back after a while, putting together a series of smooth drifts feels oh so satisfying.
Only things that I didn't like too much are:
1) Pace of the campaign: Felt to me like once i started to feel comfortable with a car in a class the next class upgrade rolled around and I had to learn from (almost) fresh again. Drove me to driving around in free roam for now, getting comfortable with different classes.
2) Car sounds: This is probably historically accurate, but quite a lot of cars are unbearable for me to drive because the engine sound is simply too annoying. On the other side a few are very enjoyable, so i just pick these.
3) Campaign scoring / AI times: The "campaign" never actually made me care about how i ranked against the AI drivers, there was no suspension build. Not sure how to make this more interesting, it's not a big problem anyway.
( 4) ) - Just because i suck: German rally tracks. Those goddamn stone pillars on the side of the road >.<

In the end, if you remotely enjoy rally, car racing, cars in general or drifting... go get this :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987847543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1653527530}
review:
Ce jeu est vraiment très sympathique.
Joli, coloré, les spéciales sont bien faites et la distance d'affichage joue beaucoup sur le rendu.

Le gameplay est mine de rien plus complexe qu'on pourrait le penser. Ce n'est pas non plus Dirt Rally, mais c'est pas arcade, et ça demande un temps d'adaptation. Sans compter que chaque voiture a un comportement qui lui est propre, certaines seront plutôt agréable ou simple à prendre en main quand d'autres seront plus traîtresses, certaines qu'on peut anticiper, comme la Stratos qui est réputée pour être un monstre difficile à maîtriser, mais aussi d'autres un peu légère qui vont avoir tendance à "partir du cul", survirer, donc vont demander d'être vigilant. Mais ça reste normal pour un jeu de voiture, au contraire, c'est même très bien ainsi car on voit que chaque voiture a eu un travail particulier, donc c'est très plaisant.

Quant au contenu, sur les voitures justement, il y en a énormément ! C'est vraiment cool de voir un tel choix. Même si on peut s'étonner de certaines propositions, comme le fait de ne pas voir la Fiat 131 Abarth pour les saison 77 à 81, mais y voir la Ford Sierra ou la BMW M3.

Pour le nombre de rally, y en a 5 : Sardaigne, Finlande, Allemagne, Japon, Norvège. Ce qui permet des environnements et surface variés. Plaine et graviers, forêt et terre,  asphalte plat ou de montagne, et bien sûr la neige. Le petit reproche peut-être, c'est le nombre de spéciales par pays, assez limité. Le jeu double ça d'ailleurs en proposant pour chaque spéciale une version reverse. (la faire dans l'autre sens) C'est quand même un peu léger à ce niveau je trouve.

Et ça se ressent en carrière. Surtout qu'elle est assez bizarrement fait. Et on va arriver sur les défauts, qui ne sont pas concrètement lié au jeu en lui-même mais sur les à-côtés. La carrière va vous proposer de faire par groupe de voiture 5 années, donc 5 saisons. Le hic, c'est qu'elle ne sont en rien harmonisée sur ce qu'elles vont proposer. Je m'explique : Vous débutez, 1 pays, 2 spéciale. Puis, 3 spéciales, puis 4 (réparations autorisées après 2 spéciales). Et la dernière année vous aurez le droit à 3 spéciales dans 2 pays différents ! 
Le groupe d'après ce sera un peu plus fourni et vous finirez avec 4 spéciales dans 2 pays. 
Mais pourquoi une telle différence ? On a pas le droit d'avoir le même nombre tout le temps ?
C'est un peu frustrant.
Pourquoi ne pas avoir au pire proposer au joueur une saison longue ou courte ? Personnaliser le nombre de rally/pays qu'on veut faire/visiter ? Le nombre de spéciales voulues ? Cela aurait été bien mieux je trouve.

Surtout qu'il y a encore des trucs étranges derrière. Vous pouvez recommencer une spéciale si vous vous plantez et/ou que vous considérez que vous avez perdu trop de temps. Je fais tout en normal, dégâts par défaut et je n'ai rien changé. Pourtant, au début vous aurez le droit à 5 redémarrage, puis rapidement plus que 4. Ensuite 3, et maintenant je n'ai le droit qu'à 2 redémarrage par année ! Pourquoi ?? Surtout qu'on peut se dire que le jeu se complexifie avec des voitures de plus en plus puissantes et rapides, donc il faudrait justement tolérer les redémarrages. Mais non, on vous en retire.

De même, la difficulté de l'IA ne me semble pas harmonisée. Allez savoir pourquoi, dans un même groupe, plus vous avancez dans les années, plus l'IA sera forte. Sans que le jeu ne vous prévienne ou que vous ayez voulu changé quelque chose. J'ai remarqué ça car en commençant un groupe, vous aurez par exemple 30 secondes d'avance sur le 2nd en finissant dans le top 30% monde du classement online sur telle spéciale.
Vous refaites la même la dernière année, 30% tout pareil, et là vous êtes... 2nd ! (ou 1er mais genre à 5 secondes) Pourquoi une telle différence ? Ce n'est tellement pas logique en plus...
Dites vous que sur une spéciale, j'ai fait plein d'erreurs, j'ai pas voulu redémarrer, j'ai fini 1er alors que j'étais dans le top 80% monde ! Ce qui veut dire que sur cette spéciale en 1ère ou 2nde année de "groupe" de carrière vous 80% des gens peuvent finir 1er. Mais, si vous refaites exactement la même chose en normal sur la dernière année du groupe, vous serez sans doute dernier, puis que même un top 30% ne vous assure pas une 1ère place ! C'est dingue...

Je finirais par un truc vraiment dommageable pour un jeu de rally, même si on peut comprendre que pour un "petit" jeu ce ne soit pas dispo, c'est un copilote ! Même si en soi, les tracés étant plus facile à gérer qu'un vrai jeu de rally, moins piégeux ou étroit, il n'y a pas nécessairement besoin d'un copilote, il manque parfois quand vous n'arrivez pas à anticiper les bosses/sauts. Perso, et sans doute dû à la caméra que j'utilise, mais je n'arrive absolument pas à voir/prévoir les sauts ! Ce qui est très difficile car peut rapidement ruiner une spéciale. (et vu qu'on est limité dans les retry...) Des fois je me rends compte que je vole car je suis au rupteur ! Mais c'est souvent trop tard, surtout si le saut n'est pas bien droit et que du coup j'ai un peu tourner les roues. Hop, la voiture à la réception va pas aimer et me faire partir dans le décor. Donc, même sans copilote, au minimum des symboles visuels pour avertir ne serait ce que les plus gros virages à venir comme les épingles et les sauts ou les bosses, ce serait un gros gros plus ! (surtout si les conditions climatiques sont précaires, brouillard, neige, ou la nuit !)

A part ces 2/3 trucs, je prends beaucoup de plaisir sur ce jeu et je le conseille vivement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074024979', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1675204779}
review:
Really really good. I thought it was too expensive buying it, but there is so much content and polish here. Perfect podcast game. It has a gorgeous art style, and the amount of small details really show how much work the devs put into it. Details like weather effects, crowds huddling dangerously close to car, and messages under your car if you manage to flip it over. 
They've done so much with a simple concept: Just the way the game starts sets the tone. The game finds the "zen" feeling of driving recklessly fast and drifting around the game world. The descriptions for cars and rally competitions is so smartly written, it makes me like game even more, as if the amazing control and feel of driving wasn't enough. 

Fantastic game, really glad I bought it. Highly recommended if you like top down racers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105860665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1702741518}
review:
앱솔루트 드리프트도 재밌게 해서, 이 게임은 발매날 구매했습니다.
그렇지만 앱솔루트 드리프트랑 다른 조작감에 실망해서 한동안 플레이를 안하다가, 
최근 조금씩 하면서 익숙해지니 또 다른 재미가 크네요. (어시스트를 조금씩 끄면서 드리프트 하는 조작이 재밌습니다)

author: {'steamid': '76561197962742880', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4366, 'last_played': 1663980300}
review:
From the absolute drift guys, art of rally is another very-satisfying-if-you-get-it-right top down rally racer, thats already given me 70 hours of fun for a good price. Physics are semi realistic, visuals are minimalistic and clean looking, sounds are solid, soundtrack is solid, enough content to keep you busy for a while. 8+/10

ps; Used an old x360 gamepad for this game, but I believe you can be quite competitive on keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152723884', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1693513616}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056260964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1621534731}
review:
Despite the simplicity of its graphics, the game performance is horrible. People who made the Unity Engine are not stupid, they created an industry standard game engine. It's up to the developers to utilize the engine in a smart way to optimize the performance. Devs of this game assume everyone can throw enough chip power at the game so it runs good no matter how bad the optimization is, but the reality is people who would buy this game are not really invested in gaming that much, they don't want to spend huge cash just to run this one.
So, to cut it short, if you have a machine that can run, say, BF1 at full settings, this game will push it to its limits, not in terms of graphical fidelity though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049797514', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6002, 'last_played': 1708297475}
review: Simple, yet complex - this is one of my favorite racing games ever! The perfect combination of low-poly art and retro-synth music gives this game a one of a kind vibe no matter how many times you start it up. Over 100 hours, 1000 stages, and multiple career playthroughs and I still can't get enough. But don't get me wrong, this game is punishing if you don't have patience. There are a lot of cars and tracks in various types of weather. So the learning curve is steep, but very rewarding once mastered. I would recommend using a controller with manual transmission. Automatics seem a little slow and makes the game feel boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016102184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1670066312}
review: Is Don is good :) Seriously though, I am a sim racer and a rally fan, steering wheel cockpit view etc,  so I was very cautious about this title. What i can say is that if you love car physics, particularly rally physics, then you will get a lot of pleasure from this game. Don't be fooled by the modern art graphics, this is a seriously challenging yet satisfying racing title which grows on you the more you play it. When you nail a powersilde through a hairpin it is incredibly satisfying. Highly recommended! (best played with an analogue hand controller if you have one)

author: {'steamid': '76561198169177791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1600, 'last_played': 1608484066}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024963628', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1633808131}
review:
I have almost no experience with racing games, but there was something about "art of rally" aesthetics that really drew me in, and I had to try it. The first few rallies, I sucked; I couldn't get used to the physics and tried to drive as if I was playing Mario Kart, flying straight through curves and hills. The game doesn't take you by the hand, and that's a great thing; it lets you experiment and explore with its responsive but straightforward controls. Despite how much I sucked, I could not put it down, and eventually, something clicked, that flow that everyone mentions when talking about this game. I don't know what it is. It might be the fantastic art direction, the fluid controls, the realistic physics against the minimalist design, maybe all of these things together. There is something about this game that makes it so addictive and entertaining. There is nothing like surprising yourself by how nice you took that last curve.

My only gripe is that I can't seem to play it with a good framerate over Steam Link, it seems to run with less than 20 FPS, but on PC I can get over 100.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972248861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1700162572}
review:
J'avais apprécié la démo  mais le jeu au clavier  est pas évident. Le jeu complet permet  la manette et là , ça devient vraiment génial ,  la possibilité de modifier les commandes nickel ,  la sensibilité impeccable !  la vue de dessus permet de superbe trajectoire ,  La physique est intéressante  et variée suivant les véhicules qui sont très nombreux et couvrent bien  l'histoire des rallys  . Les graphiques et les caisses  sont  mimi  ,  et admirables sur des replays, permettant beaucoup de caméra !! . De bons effets de lumière discrets. Le  jeu ne se prend pas au sérieux ,  est assez comique parfois .  Bien que assez simple graphiquement,  j'ai noté quelques ralentissement si réglé en  qualité max  .  Une très bonne surprise . En 
 normal ,  la progression est assez rapide ,  on  débloque plein de  véhicule ,  et c'est très  agréable ,  bref  pas de stress , que du plaisir . Bon  j'arrête ma dithyrambe ,  ça va paraître louche . 
Vraiment Je recommande pour les fans de rally !  ce jeu sera certainement un  succès ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198026692961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1608017644}
review:
What a horrible and boring game. 

Feels like you are constantly driving on ice. 

So unless you drive like a grandpa going for his Sunday breakfast, you will be everywhere but he road. Why does every dev think that by making surfaces ultra slippery makes things "realistic" when its the exact opposite. Just plain poor and lazy.

Save your cash for Dirt Rally or Forza4

Besides the poor physics, the game is boring. You start having it chase down the word RALLY by collecting every letter. For some reason the devs decided it would be a good idea to put these letters OFF THE ROAD. 
So now you have to go driving into the forest to go looking for these things, while apparently rally cars can't drive on grass because your car becomes a snail. Grass is not the same as sand. Stop making them act the same in terms of physics. Now, instead of driving on the road, you are now forced to go into this sand/grass area to collect letters. 
What on earth is the point? This is not fun gameplay.

Graphic defaults are also so badly chosen. 

Should you still be daft enough to buy this game, turn off all DoF, Motion blur and all the other crap that makes the game not only look worse, but sucks up your framerates. Their so called recommended settings had me at 40fps on a 2070 super, while after i tweaked it i was solid over 60fps. Come on man.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012896735', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1590, 'last_played': 1700298897}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999803596', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1712349547}
review: Beautiful aesthetic, feels great with a controller (I'm using an old 360 controller), generally relaxing/zen, *IF* you are using a car you know how to handle. Trying out a new car in Campaign mode, getting randomly dealt a rain level, and realizing that you spin out from even breathing on the gas pedal, is anxiety inducing. But if you stick to one car in each class/group, and get used to how they handle on different surfaces/conditions, this game is a rare opportunity to experience "flow" state. No opponents to race against, just going for best time. And you progress through the campaign and unlock everything, even if you suck. I'm almost done with the main campaign, and looking forward to taking a pathetic stab at some of the leaderboards :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198109707566', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1685912900}
review:
Cute game for rally fans who just want to chill. The physics are great, and some advanced techniques such as trail braking, controlled oversteer or handbraking are surprisingly important for an arcade game. The difficulty is increasing, you don't have to master driving in the snow or on wet dirt for your first rallyes, which is great.
The only flaw is the environment diversity at the beginning of the game: I don't want to hear about Finland or Japan anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002738528', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1707400499}
review:
Not what I expected. I purchased Art of Rally expecting a unique looking arcade racer with some great music. What I didnt expect was the outstanding physics and unique car characteristics. With over 400 hours in Xplane 11 and almost 100 more in the Project Cars series, I am into simulation and realism. From the initial free play in Art of Rally I was hooked. Currently I am completing Series S and intend to play game through again with all assists off and manual transmission (its going to take a while).

The physics of the cars and their interaction with the differing road surfaces is second to none. Each race, track, and weather conditions present unique challenges for the driver and car. Every car has unique characteristics. Every bend, curve, and undulation in the road forces the driver to maintain constant control correction and think about every input. 

The art style, graphics, and music are why I purchased Art of Rally in the first place. All three exceeded expectations. Art of Rally was supposed to be a relaxing break from the hard core racing and flight simming I normally do in VR (speaking of VR, Art of Rally would be a top notch VR experience).  Instead, I cant put it down and find myself challenged each race and struggling to find myself anywhere near the top of the global leaderboards. Art of Rally is a challenging racer which will likely exceed your expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336116124', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1662096804}
review: динамика игры

author: {'steamid': '76561197968823015', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1607902096}
review:
[h1]Oui mais ... Non ![/h1]
En ce qui concerne Art of Rally, tous les voyants étaient au vert : un concept sympa, des screenshots vraiment jolis et de bon retours.
Hélas, cela ne s'est pas exactement passé comme ça...

[b]POUR[/b]
- C'est effectivement joli, si on aime ce style low-poly.
- Les menus sont bien faits, la navigation aisée.

[b]CONTRE[/b]
- L'énorme souci est le comportement des véhicules. Ce n'est pas de l'arcade, ce n'est pas de la simulation. J'ai vraiment l'impression que le développeur a voulu se faire plaisir en faisant une sorte de jeu de drift étrange,  avec une physique qui sort de nulle part et des voitures mi-tank, mi-savonnette. C'est déroutant et surtout très désagréable.
- Les bruits des moteurs sont tout horripilants.
- Pour du low-ply, je pense qu'il y a un souci d'optimisation, le framerate chutant très sévèrement à certains passage.

Au final, ce jeu n'a pas beaucoup de défauts comparés à certaines grosses productions ultra buguées, mais ils sont pour moi complètement rédhibitoires.
C'est très dommage qu'une démo n'existe pas, cela permettrai de se faire une vraie idée avant d'acheter plutôt que de se baser sur ce que les autres en disent.
Personnellement, j'ai demandé le remboursement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044617878', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1664260092}
review:
Art Of rally scheint zwar einfach und hübsch zu sein, aber sehr erstaunlich

Die Erklärung der Autos wirkt nicht nur Interesse an Rally in 1980s,

sondern systematische Bewegung der Autos auch so sorgfältig,

wie man bei den anderen Auto-Spielen( DIRT, Projekt Cars, usw. ) finden kann.

Wenn Sie sich gern Auto-Spiel amüsieren und fantastische Landschaften geniessen wollen,

lohnt es sich,  Art Of Rally zu spielen.

Vielen Dank für ihre Aufmerksamkeit.

Gesundheit


------------------------


아기자기한 그래픽에
쉬운 게임이라고 생각하면 
 매 우 큰 코 다 친 다.

구동별 차종제어
언더-오버스티어 컨트롤
카운터 스티어링

등등 레이싱 게임 관련 사전지식이 없다면
플레이는 거의 불가능 할것이다.

저러한 물리엔진이 매우매우 깔끔하게 잡혀 있고,
게임 옵션으로 증가 혹은 감소시킬수 도 있다.
(하지만 매우 어렵다)

2020년 최고의 레이싱 게임이라 불려도 전혀 이상하지 않다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014621207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1663874248}
review: This has become one of my favourite ever driving games in the space of a few weeks. You really can tell that it has been crafted by people who are passionate about cars and rallying. The art style and soundtrack is excellent, as are the engine sounds. Playing the game on an Xbox One pad with all assists turned off, the handling model feels in-depth enough not to be slapped with the derogatory 'arcade' label. Each car feels distinct enough to make you want to sample them all and you'll certainly find that you can pick favourites. Driving just feels so 'right' on a controller in this game (not an easy thing to achieve), it is worthy of comparison to Gran Turismo in that sense. If this game is supported with future updates including more cars, locations and modes, it really deserves to become a cult classic. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973680587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1699389733}
review: Art Of Rally : wat een leuk spel met een origineel concept tot de graphics...  Alle grote rallywagens zijn er in terug te vinden op hun eigen typische weergave.  Car-handling is zeer goed uitgewerkt.  Na enig oefenen drift je als geen ander.  Tevens heel goed speelbaar met de toetsen alleen...  Eén klein minpuntje, de vangrails of rand-afbakeningen zijn te 'rubber-achtig'.  Hier bedoel ik mee dat je heel schuin tegen de rand-afbakening aan rijdt en toch een 360° spin zult uitvoeren terwijl de wagen naar mijn mening meer moet afketsen op deze afbakening...  Maar, het spel is zeker zijn centen waard en speelt zoals een rallyspel zou moeten zijn...

author: {'steamid': '76561198079368303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1651204190}
review:
when im driving my wrx and crash it into a pile of snow in real life, i dont downshift from 3rd to 2nd to 1st to neutral to reverse, but thats how it works in art of rally.  i would appreciate a 1-tap reverse key, would improve a game that isn't doing too much wrong.

i feel other reviewers overrated a decent game with exaggerated claims, which is why i "do not recommend" the game with my steamthumb.  its not a bad game but not really doing anything too unique either. 

the soundtrack dlc is out of my budget, even if the music is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011479184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1700327398}
review:
[h1] 適度にアシスト入れて走りましょう [/h1]
コンセプトの良さだけで6万点くらいあげていいのですが、ゲームとしての出来は粗いというのは否定できません。
例えば挙動面だと、荷重がかかればかかるだけグリップが増す仕様なので、ジャンプして着地した瞬間やコーナリング中に勾配が変化する瞬間に予測不可能な動きをすることも多く、結構難儀します
また、見下ろし視点で先が見えるからペースノート不要っていうのはカジュアルなラリーゲーを作る上で最高の回答だと思うのですが、だったら徹底して全くのブラインドコーナー、先の見えないクレスト、観客に隠れて見えない障害物は失くして欲しかったなんて思ったり
と、まぁそんな目を三角にして走ってるとそういう粗が目に入るので、適度に挙動のアシストを入れてゆるーく走るのが一番正しいこのゲームの楽しみ方かなって思います
特にGr.B以降はアシストのあるなしで難易度が大きく変わりますので、頑なにアシスト0%で走ってるけど事故りまくってイライラしたなんて人は是非アシスト50%くらいで一度試してみてください

author: {'steamid': '76561197972360573', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1606100014}
review:
I'd recommend this game if it was a lower price. Maybe $15. Sure, its pretty. Its also somewhat relaxing . . . But it just feels like a shell of a game. Like there needs to be more. Other cars on the road maybe. You just feel SO alone in this big pretty world. 

The menus are also like that of an unpolished beta. 

If you want to charge $25 for a game, there should be more to do. 

I played and enjoyed it for 4 hours, but have literally not had any interest in playing it again. Even when I look at the pictures, I get a bit of that feeling of, "Wow, so pretty . . . I want to drive there". But that's where it ends. Because I know I've already driven there, and it was lonely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070888112', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1707598853}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114076368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1607484930}
review:
A fun little rally arcade, gift from a friend.

3rd person view only.
Tends to suffer from stutters on pretty much any machine, disabling vegetation cut out under advanced graphics helped a little, other settings not at all.
No exclusive fullscreen, regular Unity commands for it are ignored.

Don't expect a simulator and you're good to go.

Final car group has so much tyre grip that you can roll it in a corner over the tyres, and it's power levels are over 2x higher compared to reality. Beware.

Enjoyed it, no multiplayer only time comparison vs other players and friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033696054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 9014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1708993827}
review:
Art of Rally is very perfectly named. It's clear that the artistic side of things is a big focus in the development of this game and no matter how many times I screw up a perfect run, thereby ruining my chances at getting 1st place in the season, I never leave (too) angry simply due to how gorgeous every single thing in this game is. From the UI, to the cars, to the crowds and buildings, hell even the specific font and point size all work together to create a true work of art! Especially the music!
Every racing game I play, I play with the game's music off and my music on.... except for this one. Art of Racing's soundtrack is fantastic! It's synthy, calm, and perfectly blends into the background while you race. While some racing games opt for literal songs that can only last 2 to 4 minutes each, AoR's music is way more atmospheric and "background" in nature, which gives it the flexibility of lasting arguably indefinitely without the beat and rhythm getting stale.
Lastly, and most importantly is how the racing actually feels and works. First and foremost, you race alone. At least in the "free roam" open world and in the structured single player races. No AI that you have to overtake or defend against. At first I thought this was weird, but their presence (even if you couldn't collide) would be horribly distracting and would detrimentally affect your end time. Next, there is a mind-boggling amount of customization with the game mechanics. If I were you I would switch it to manual (no clutch), and turn off the assists or as low as they can go. Then, I'd go into the free roam world, and just drive around as you bump up the assists to the "sweet spot". If you keep them too strict/low, the game does venture into unenjoyable territory! 
After what seems like 20 or 30 tries I have finally placed 1st in both the races and the season overall for the very first event! I got tons of game left to grind through and I'm having a blast! It can be challenging, but that's all part of the Art of Racing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198208818304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1698898175}

author: {'steamid': '76561198145029518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1698414798}
review: My favourite game at the moment.  Even though I'm not a big fan of driving games (Generally was my favourite) this was easy to pick up and play. It was a bit of a challenge to get used to the handling - but that's probably just me - and artwork is superbly quirky.  I can't speak for hardcore racing fans, but if, like me, you like to have a quick game here and you don't want a load of complicated options then this is one of the best I've found.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120552405', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1670490422}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965804358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1707871915}
review: This fantastic game is a hidden gem. I've been craving a racing sim for a while but didn't want to invest in a wheel for something that might just be a fad. Art of Rally scratches that itch without the large outlay for a wheel. The vehicle physics are on point, music is top notch and it's so so satisfying to play. Easy to pick up and play but hard to master, it just feels great when you nail a corner. Love this game and is easily my game of the year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025541397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1712441527}
review:
Don't believe the hype; this is a poorly-written game. It has stopped loading/corrupted my save and insists I am launching it for the first time every time now. Since it no longer saves my progress I am unable to advance through the career. Any progress I make during a gaming session is lost the next time I launch it. This is not fun at all.

Graphical performance is poor. I have to play this game on its lowest settings to get 60 fps at 4K while most other games I get 60 fps on Medium to High settings at 4K.

If you do decide to play this game be sure to set the counter-steer to 100% as the questionable default of 150% makes every car suffer from snap oversteer and the game not fun to play when all you do is spin out every corner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051740093', 'num_games_owned': 16449, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1663913572}
review:
A racing game with an outside view only? With abstract gfx and no brand names? No real courses and no real driver names?

Yes, it sounds like something out of a money grabbing coding hell hole. But what started as a "let´s get over with it quickly" test isn´t over after +10 hrs of pure fun! You can feel, hear and see the dev´s love for rally sport. The driving physics are great and the overall experience is better than in most of the other racing games that would have all the things mentioned above. A fine example that concentrating on the things that really count, isn´t just brave but can be very rewarding (if you know what you are doing like Funselektor Labs).

author: {'steamid': '76561198056520267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 250, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1711323900}
review:
Drives like Dirt 2.0's 14 year old nephew (in a good way).

Pretty to look at, to listen to and lots of fun to play.

This feels like a labor of love presented with minimalist art and it works very well.


What impresses me almost as much as the art are the physics.

I've been playing a lot of Dirt 2.0 and the physics in that game are great (aside from some wonky collisions. Seems they focused more on driving physics than collision). Art of Rally's physics feel quite similar. I find myself having to adapt to FWD vs. AWD. 3 corners feel like 3 corners (can't just wing it in there going 80 mph+) and I can feel the weight of the car.

EDIT: Apparently supports racing wheels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990225751', 'num_games_owned': 898, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1607528975}
review: Я наверно, что то не понял в этой игре, но как по мне это редкостная хрень. Не пойму о каком дрифте идет речь в отзывах... Машина не идёт в занос, её тупо сносит с дороги, хоть с клавиатуры, хоть с геймпада. Может дальше на более мощных авто ситуация и меняется, но меня начало вымораживать уже на второй трассе и желания играть дальше нету. Так же игра достаточно требовательна к железу и на максималках выдаёт около 30фпс, что для её уровня графики очень странно.

review: A beautiful little game, although low poly the lighting effects, flow and atmosphere are enchanting. The game is challenging but hugely fun - with the right amount of frustration thrown in to keep you coming back. The Art Of Rally takes you back to when gameplay was priority, rally was king and the default position for the hairs on the back of your neck was upright!

author: {'steamid': '76561198800966495', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2504, 'last_played': 1708691467}
review:
If you want a hardcore rally sim, this isnt it.
This is more of a relaxing driving simulator with great music. 
I usually play it after class and just let my brain autopilot through the game with the music playing with me, or sometimes i just play a stage and take photos. 
Maybe its just a vibing place for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034742505', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1929, 'last_played': 1700731450}
review:
The most fun I've had in a rally game since ever. The soundtrack and art styles are amazing,

But what makes me return to the experience is the gameplay. Every car has a unique feel to it and the stages feel like I'm running them for the first time.

The handling and camera view will take some time to adjust to but it's fine once you get the hang of it.

If you want a break from the realism based rally games of WRC and Dirt Rally then this is the game for you. And at the best time as well, even amidst the buggy, messy launch that is Dirt 5.

Either way this game can be a much more fun alternative to Dirt 5 for about a quarter of the price!
I cannot wait for future updates that will add more cars, location and features.
10.1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000900149', 'num_games_owned': 1924, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1607369543}
review: Has some great style visually and in terms of music, but I constantly feel like instead of a car I'm controlling a horse on ice skates that desperately wants to go any direction but where I'm pointing.  At all times I feel like I'm missing some kind of vital information on how to actually control the car, but the game has never told me what it is and all I can do is completely kill momentum at every turn so I don't careen into a tree, off a cliff, or both.  And that just feels bad in any kind of racing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199066143282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1691583077}
review:
The game is mostly fun. But i remember it being even better. It was way easier to drive cause the cars would not slide out so easily. This made it possible to drive through corners at high speeds without having to drift. But now it feels like the dead zone is so big that the cars are more like boats than rally cars and driving through corners at high speeds is nearly impossible. So finally i want more gameplay settings like dead zone adjustment cause i feel like without it. I can never get nostalgia out of this game again.
Farewell
MrToyuotu

author: {'steamid': '76561198023687749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1682131601}
review:
I don't think I've bought a racing game since Gran Turismo back on the PS1.

But when I heard one of the songs from Art of Rally on youtube, I knew I needed to pick up the killer soundtrack.
Then I looked at some gameplay video, and I knew that I needed to pick the game up for the killer art direction.
Then I play the actual game and find out that the gameplay totally kills it as well!

Arcade style rally racing game with a banging synthwave soundtrack, surprisingly detailed driving physics, and clearly a love for classic rally by the developers? If that sounds appealing to you then you'll probably really dig this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260809493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1698052549}
review:
A very challenging, high skill racing game. I'd recommend to anyone who's willing to put in some time getting good, because you will be pretty terrible at first. When you finally nail a drift, it feels great!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967356151', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 6251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3823, 'last_played': 1704381513}
review:
適度なデフォルメ表示が綺麗なラリーゲーム。
BGMあり、コ・ドライバー無し、セッティング無しと表示だけでなくあくまでラリーを題材としたゲームとしてデフォルメされている。
俯瞰視点なので人を選ぶが、アクセルとブレーキの微妙な加減で車を操るのはabsolute drift譲りで楽しい！
キャリアモードで一通りのグループとコースを体験してからのタイムアタックモードが本編な気がしている。
思った通りに車を操りタイムが縮まるところに楽しさを覚えられればお勧め！

review: Art of Rally is great. I have been having a lot of fun with it, even though I'm not the best. author: {'steamid': '76561198873258098', 'num_games_owned': 4417, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1700312118}
review:
一見ストイックで初見さんお断りに見えて、実は初心者・ヌルゲーマーにもとっても優しいレースゲームに仕上がってます。
レース設定で難易度イージー・車体ダメージなしにすると、完走さえすれば絶対にコースをクリアできるくらいライバルタイムがヌルくなるので、それでのんびりと下手くそなりにレースを楽しみながらどんどん新しい車体やカラーリングをアンロックして先のレースにチャレンジしていくことができます。
クルマの操作感は、最近よくあるローポリのドリフトバリバリのそれで、ほとんどのクルマはハンドブレーキどころかノーマルブレーキをかけても強烈にドリフトします。基本的に常時オーバーステアなので、スピードを落としたりドリフトのタイミングを見極めたりしてそれを抑え込みながら走るのが基本的なレーススタイルになります。見た目のスピード感は控えめなので、じっくりとクルマの挙動をみてドリフトをきれいに決めるところに楽しさを見出すタイプのレースゲームですね。
まだアップデートが続いていてクルマとかも増えてくるみたいなので、楽しみです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198101080904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1615041564}
review:
terrible game. 
-awful optimization
-inconsistent handling physics
-less horizontal grip than on ice
-constant traction control, not allowing you to power through corners or control your slide
-extremely snappy and janky low speed handling
-car appears to be moving at  the same speed at all times, making it impossible to judge corner entry speed

there is NOTHING redeemable about the gameplay of this game. i am so disapointed i gave it the benefit of the doubt based on previous releases and missed out on the return window. this is an embarrassment to my library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121456650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1679814891}
review:
Retrowave, Rotaries and Rally. 
Only thing that could make this game any better is drifitng touge in an AE86 to some Eurobeat... oh wait, this game has that too.

Seriously though, this game has an amazing soundtrack, great yet simple visuals, fantastic locations and decent physics.
It's a fairly laid-back game that can be challenging at times. 
It gives you a brief explanation of each era and each car.

If you like rally racing you'll love this.
