author: {'steamid': '76561198410809627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1670143342}

author: {'steamid': '76561198398739323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1606534461}
review:
I enjoyed the art style, the bit of humor, and the homage to the great rally cars of yesteryear!
It's not a sim, but it's not all arcade-y, it's a pretty decent blend when it comes to the driving aspects. 
Take in the minimalistic yet stunning environments they tailored, the bold colors and body lines they drew from classic rally cars. It was honestly a pleasant experience. 

If you just want to chill and do some challenging but fun racing, I would recommend this title. 
(I got to play it on my PC, but ~my~ Mac OS (Big Sur) was being fickle with it, I had bought it with hopes to play it on the go-ish... but alas, my Mac Book wasn't having it at the time, but hopefully by the time it goes on sale again I/or apple will have figured it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255654499', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1641120070}
review: 정말 재미있는 게임이고, 좋은 게임입니다. 하지만 저만 그런건지 몰라도 독일 맵 도로들 사이드에 붙어있는 돌들이 너무 짜증납니다... 코너를 잘 돌다가도 돌에 받으면 차가 스핀을 해버리는지라...

author: {'steamid': '76561198013575971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1696021615}
review:
C'est bien! Même très bien!
Je ne suis pas spécialement adepte de jeux de voitures, mais celui là m'a tenté par son graphisme, et c'est vraiment beau!
Et les critiques sur steam ont terminé de me convaincre...
C'est tout de même ultra punitif et absolument injouable sans une bonne manette.
Alors, en effet c'est beau, mais quelques bémols, sans beaucoup d'importance, mais quand même:
Heurter (quand je dis heurter c'est plutôt taper dans le tas à plus de 100km/h) un mouton en Sardaigne fait le même effet que prendre un rochet ou une souche: arrêt net et violent, ce qui manque cruellement de réalisme, vous en conviendrez.
Et ,tout de même, toujours en Sardaigne, on traverse un champ d'éolienne en 1969, et ça c'est carrément anachronique non? Sauf erreur de ma part (je ne suis pas spécialiste de l'histoire de la production d'électricité en Méditerranée) les premiers champs d'éoliennes c'est les années 1990 je pense, pour se généraliser avec le 21 siècle. Mais quell idée de coller un truc pareil à l'aube des 70's!  c'est pas sérieux les mecs... sans dék!!!
Je pense qu'on doit pouvoir recenser quelques détails dans le genre, mais  ce sont des détails face aux nombreuses qualités de ce petit bijou d'esthétique et de conduite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998450488', 'num_games_owned': 1337, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1638655337}
review: I was caught by Absolute Drift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412421848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1706932877}
review: This is one of the most fun and challenging racing games I've ever played. You can spend hours mastering a track with a car but when you try the same thing with other car, the experience and the skills you need are completely different, so there is a lot of time you can spend mastering the whole repertory of cars this game has to offer. Needless to say that the music and aesthetic makes this game an actual work of art. If you like racing games, don't miss the chance on paying this one. You'll thank me later ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987440040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1703611002}
review:
The game has a cool feel of rally despite lack of pace notes. Drifting feels good and the cars handle predictably. Only niggles so far with the driving is lack of functional left foot braking in the (one so far) FWD car and the engines feel slightly too peaky. 

However these are the only cons I could dig, and I've really enjoyed my time rallying in this gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971190870', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1606855620}
review:
Nice little rally game with good colorful graphics, a cool soundtrack and fun gameplay. 
The big flaw for me is the number of locations, only 5. So even if I finished the game in 14hrs, I felt like doing the same tracks again and again with slightly more powerful cars very early. 
Still recommend for this price tag !

review: Gorgeous yet simplistic graphics are the major draw to this arcade-y rally game. The music is perfect for the environment also. The vehicle-dynamics are simple but with the reduced terrain physics mean it has a feel of a top-down PS1-era Colin McRae game. Strong recommend as either a) a first rally game or b) a de-stress game for those who want a short break from Dirt Rally.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998343422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1705103107}
review: A game that is more style than substance, but nonetheless brings both to bear. The game play mastery of driving, drifting, shifting, and braking is a simple set of variables with which to explore levels to race against. There's not much more than just driving, arcade-style, in a harder-than-it-seems physics engine. But the shining light is in the style - the graphical style, the musical choices especially, and the "less detail, more aesthetic" art choices that make this game quite chill, even though it's tense, it makes me want a more hardcore racer that isn't so heavily branded. For 2020, art of rally really hits the spot and would recommend playing this between sessions of whatever other gaming behemoth you are trying to tackle.

review:
感じとしては、車のおもちゃを手でつかんでジオラマを走らせてるようなゲーム（上から見下ろす視点しかないためどうしてもそういう感じになってしまう・・・）
シリアスなのは必要ない、ただ軽快な音楽を背景にかるーく走るだけでいいって人向け
車の種類も豊富（キャリアを勝ち続ければ解除されていく）、選べるモードもキャリアだけでなくカスタムレースやタイムトライアルに自由探索など中身もがっつりある
ただ車のセットアップやチューンとかはなく、できることはペイントを変えるくらいなので本格的なナニかが欲しいなら別ゲーを探すべき

author: {'steamid': '76561198034814555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1698586599}
review:
The game is a jewel! 
art of rally is a very nice game. What makes the difference is the gameplay itself. Like an old style racing game, this requires you to practice. You'll need to play with brake and accelerator, the physical engine seems realistic and satisfying. The speed sensation is really there when you pass 100mph. It's challenging and it really makes you want to get better, if you like the whole driving subject.

The ambientation is fine. Cars are graphically essential but precise, there are many of them but the engine sounds are different too and "defining". This is surely a good thing, when you recognise things that are well represented (specially if you are a rally fan).

Tracks are nice, not really "a lot" but a good number on which you can spend many time and for all tastes.

Career mode is a bit "raw". You get to make rallies but there's just one "season" per group of cars. You do that mostly to unlock all cars. Once you did that, you go on time trials and try to beat worldwide opponents and that is ok, but i feel that with a better career mode (like really a "career" with progression through the years, teams, car improvements and stuff) this would be an outstanding game. 

I recommend the game, but it could be greater with more content. I wouldn't mind paying something more for other content like a better career or more complex online events (like worldwide rallies). Apart from this i can't see any other problem in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074650815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1608139385}
review:
Art of Rally e' un gioco differente a qualsiasi altro gioco di rally uscito finora. 
Lo stile grafico e' ottimo, colorato e dettagliato.
Possiamo dire lo stesso anche sulla parte guidata, che e' semplice, ma comunque competitiva.
Le piste son fatte benissimo, oltre ad esser fantastiche esteticamente, anche la parte legata agli angoli risulta fatta alla perfezione. Nessun angolo e' uguale ad uno precedente, cosi' da portarti a prestare attenzione ogni singola volta.
Le macchine sono la parte che preferisco, ritroviamo macchine storiche, ognuna con il proprio stile di guida/velocita' etc
il tutto con una marea di skin totalmente FREE 
Voto: prima volta che apprezzo un gioco di rally, 10/10

review:
A fantastic soundtrack and clean, stylish graphics make this rally racing game a relaxing but competitive racer. The handling and driving is solid and a lot more true-to-life than the graphics would make you think.

All the classic rally cars are included, along with fictionalised tracks from the world's top rally locations.

review: Приятная глазу медитативная игра. Это точно про ралли? Как ни странно, да. Нет тут никакого нервного напряжения до последней секунды, зато есть отличный визуал и приятная музыка. Как будто и правда оказался в той параллельной реальности, где, по словам разработчиков, и проводятся эти раллийные чемпионаты.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167681871', 'num_games_owned': 883, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1662722836}
review: This game is just as much of a gem as the developer's last game, Absolute Drift. The beautiful low-poly aesthetic and engaging synthwave soundtrack makes what is, mechanically, a fairly challenging and punishing game much more relaxing than you might expect. The driving physics, while not a full sim or anything, are grounded in realism and applying real techniques will  benefit you. It kind of feels like a demake of a game like Dirt Rally, which is a really good thing, and fans of those two games will enjoy Art of Rally, especially if they are looking for a game to just relax with, rather than tensing up in frustration after misjudging a turn, coming in too hot and flying into the same tree you hit the last 4 runs. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197970659648', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1704295805}
review:
Très bon jeux.
Loin d'un "petit" jeu de voiture, c'est vraiment un bon jeu de rally.
Vrais sensations de conduites, voitures aux comportements différents suivant le modèle et suivant le terrain.
A essayer d'urgence.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970303977', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1684665310}
review:
Perfectly done.
Everything about this game is incredibly polished,
Don't be deceived by the graphics, which at first glance may look like this is a casual game.
There is depth here in every single aspect.
The handling is sublime, and more reminiscent of the sort of power/control needed in WRC 9/Dirt Rally 2 than you might think.  The cars have real heft, momentum, inertia etc, and as they work up through the gears you feel the increasingly fragile stability.
The cornering is a really fine art (and the game works brilliantly with a controller)  Suffice to say, without the perfect physics the rest of the game wouldn't matter--but the physics are perfect so...
Brilliant selection of locations and tracks-very fleshed out for the price.
Astonishing graphics-the lighting and other effects make this game a feast for the eyes hour after hour.  There are a wide variety of camera angles, but camera '5' for me is lovely. It's reminiscent of the old Amiga racers like super skidmarks and affords a huge view of the world.  I say again, the stylised graphics are not retro-they aren't even like lonely mountains really as the lighting takes them to the next level.
The career structure is simple but lengthy weithout getting dull.  You basically play a set of races for each year, with new generations of cars unlocking every 5 years.  Simple but gives good sense of progress.
The reward comes from not only unlocking new years, but learning where in the global rankingsa you are.  Each race tells you in very simple terms that you are in the top x% of times for that race.
The overall presentation is also beautifully stylish.
Screenshots can't do justice to how much love and attention has gone into every aspect of this game.

What I really love is the purity of the whole thing.  It's a game, playing it is fun, it's uncomplicated by fussy controls or upgrades but with a great depth of control.  You can always do better.  The risk/reward of pushing the cars is just so.

Ok, I like it!  I originally thought the price was a bit high, but having played it I can see that it was worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010320447', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1655515065}
review: Top down racing at its finest! Carrer has 6 major group categories to unlock each split in years of rallying starting in the year 1967 with each year having its random stages and cars just like in a rally mode. Doing those events in carrer mode will unlock more cars better and faster like the GroupB ones. Havnt got there yet it feels great tho to work your way up. The drive feels amazing and it can get challenging but not frustrating. Havnt played a lot with the camera positions but on default it just feels great. There are no car tuning options (personaly i like this a lot) but i would wish for some controller input settings like saturation and deadzones. Huge bonus the visuals! They are stunning similar to Absolute Drift but more colourful. It also has online daily/weekly events :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197994072622', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1701292684}
review:
Summary: Art Of Rally is a hard as you want it to be third person rally sim clothed in a gorgeous flat-poly aesthetic with a classic synthwave soundtrack to set the vibe as you drift round those corners.

Art Of Rally is a third-person rally driving game that hews closer to sim than arcade racer.

The authors have a deep love of the classic rally driving period of the 70s and 80s & it shows: Drive the (lightly disguised) classic cars of the group 2, A and B era & beyond into an alternate future where 800bhp super-rallycars were just the beginning. (All the cars have silly names; guessing which original car they stand in for is a personal mini-game in its own right! (You could cheat by looking up a guide, but what would be the fun in that?) They’re all there: the Ford Cosworth, Lancia Stratos, the wildly overpowered vehicles from BMW, Audi & so on.)

I bet lots of people have bought this game on the strength of the aesthetic alone & they’re not wrong - the game looks gorgeous: something about the way the lighting mixes with the flat-poly design language really hits the spot. But underneath all that lies a rally sim with a driving model that’s much closer to full-sim than arcade racer. It doesn’t go all the way, but there’s enough there that the skill ceiling is high. And yet, at the same time there’s still an arcade sensibility in there somehow; something about burning up the track as the sun sets just feels right somehow. Turn up the fabulous synthwave soundtrack, lean back & drift round those corners with the best.

Art of Rally is simply a blast. What more do you need?

NB. For those who care: there’s no in car-view in this came, nor a close follow third person camera. The high third person view eliminates the need for pace notes & that in turn is what makes the “turn up the music & drive” vibe that the game is going for possible. Sometimes it’s good to have a singular vision & stick to it & this is one of those times - if you want the in-car experience then there’s no shortage of rally sims that will provide it elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272191671', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1657740741}
review: Wer Spaß an Rally Spielen hat und auf nicht die neuste Grafik steht ist bei "Art Of Rally" genau richtig. Liebevoll gestaltetes Spiel mit Suchtfaktor. author: {'steamid': '76561198057010437', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1703680553}
review:
What if Rally Racing never got bogged down by rules and regulations?

That is a question this game answers. Starting out with classic Rally cars of the early 60s such as the iconic Renault Alpine A110, over icons of the sport from the 80s like the Lancia 037 all the way to fictional marvels and powerful AWD beasts, this game takes its players on a journey through the history of rally sport.

The game has a learning curve as steep as the player wants, the AI is quite slow on the lowest and almost unbeatable on the highest - That said, the AI is just a bunch of times that appear on a board. But that doesn't matter. What matters is the driving, this is a racing game, after all. And it feels fantastic. Each car has its own character, they feel different enough for me to pick favorites even after trying each car only once. The handling feels realistic, the cars have palpable weight, and to handle that is the challenge. They sound amazing, and the visual of the game, albeit simple, do the job and the light effects through the trees of Norway as you blast through a Forest going 130 mph still look mesmerizing. That and the plethora of options, customizability of the camera angle, for example, make this game one of the true gems of 2020.

If you like racing, you should consider buying it. If you love racing games, you should definitely buy it. If you love the history of rally, you must buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108658021', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1701031219}
review:
Art Of Rally is the antithesis of modern rally games. Instead of being a white knuckle experience where your co-driver screams instructions at you over the deafening roar of the engine in an attempt to keep you both from eating a tree and dying, it's surprisingly chill. Zen, even. I haven't played a chilled out, casual rally game since DiRT 3. In today's world of sim-focused racing, it's nice to have something like this again.

If you've played Funselektor's previous game, Absolute Drift, you'll be at major advantage here. The cars in this game are just a hair more grippy, but the underlying physics are really similar. I'd actually say that this game is much more forgiving, and outside of drivetrain and vehicle class there's not a whole lot of difference between the cars. Hell, this is the only rally game I've played where I can take a Lancia Stratos (I'm sorry; [i]la wedge[/i]) and confidently chuck it into a slide without having to wonder if my will is up to date. What I'm trying to say is, this game is built for just turning your brain off and relaxing as you chain slides and jumps together, weaving your way through colorful vistas all the while. It's not as engaging as DiRT Rally or Richard Burns, but [i]that's the point.[/i] If you go into this game expecting something realistic you can play with your $1000 Fanatec setup, you're not going to like it. But if you just let Art Of Rally do its thing, it's pretty rewarding in short bursts. Pick it up if you like casually sliding around corners for the fun of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961806515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1606618648}
review:
Can't recommend this game in its current state, which is odd because the developers here made Absolute Drift - a title known for a little more difficulty. Not realizing the same developer created this I immediately saw assets and game mechanics I recognized from Absolute Drift.. 

The different vehicles feel numb and finding the goldilocks zone between under/oversteering is tedious. I really enjoy Absolute Drift, but paying 4 x the price for this when they're reusing assets.. not sure if I'm a fan of that. I like the art style and obvious love for rally and group b but it isn't any fun to actually drive, back to DiRT Rally and AD for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993330316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1702432338}
review:
coming back to it: just absolutely is what it looks like, and for me that is very good. this and forza horizon scratch all my controller racer itches.

music is good, but also just like putting on a playlist and running through stage after stage. physics feel deep and good, lots of cars to drive around at this point, looks pretty, flows like crazy. big yes on this one


bought on a total whim. played a bit of absolute drift, seemed cool but never totally sucked me in.

this seems like an extension of that that's more time trial oriented, and i love it. cars feel very different, tons of classics represented, low price point, really pretty environments. feels like all of the promise of absolute drift realized. really fun, really chill. basically a best-case scenario of what it looks like.

review:
I happened upon this game. The first things I noticed were the music and art style. I've never played a racing game like this. it's simple and when you ace a corner it feels pretty cool. It a provides a good challenge. I see it having a high skill ceiling with the advanced controls.

I've played with a keyboard and had fun with it. I've heard that controller works great as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048557427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1887, 'last_played': 1667014979}
review:
art of rally is more than a simple racing game, it's a passion project that turned into a beautiful work of art.

Like its predecessor, Absolute Drift, this game is a love letter to Motorsport in general. It's fun to play, the soundtrack is incredible and it has a charming and 'chill' visual style. 

I've put a ton of hours into this game and I plan to put even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971257062', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2966, 'last_played': 1667499849}
review:
This is an amazing game made from a position of love both for rally history but also for the meditation of driving. This is my go to game to de-stress or play during lunch, you can get in quickly do a few stages and get out and back to life. The variety of history of cars shows that someone knew rally and wanted to share the love with the rest of us. The soundtrack is amazing, easily the best part of the game and helps push the overall meditation and zen aspect of the game. While many may find the camera angle a bit disorienting to start with, you easily fall into the rhythm of the stages with some practice.

Update: After the Kenya update the game is still awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980023021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4998, 'last_played': 1625793113}
review:
Sup Guys! I finished the career a few days ago, and started doing some time attacks. I think I've driven most every car in the game, and enjoyed it all the way through.

I feel like overall, Fun has done an amazing job capturing the key elements to a sport that can at times be totally out of place. The game ramps the difficulty extremely well by giving you access to stronger and stronger cars, culminating in the renaissance all rally fans know and love—Group B, then taking it an imaginative step further (AND giving us some of the most famous Group A cars ever known to boot!). The handling simulations for Dirt / Gravel / Snow / Rain are all familiar to a long time rally sim fan, and the environments are all crafted to give you a real feeling of the stages run in WRC.

I found the game to be an absolutely beautiful window into the slippery, speedy, astoundingly technical, and often extraordinarily dangerous world all fans of the wider rally world have fallen in love with.

Stand Outs Features:
--Camera Angle: Because we don't have pace notes, I felt the camera did a perfect job giving me the information I want out of notes, but without disturbing the super low-key gameplay.
--Aesthetic: Gosh dang is it good. From the simplified graphics to the square people that run away from (or into) your car, truly amazing.
--Handling / Difficulty: This felt on point to me. Starting, the game felt a bit difficult to control--but it's a rally game. High powered cars on dirt roads are hard to control. 

With time everything felt familiar, and as I broke into Group B / S the cars actually reminded me a lot of what I expect from them, based on my experience with Dirt series, and others that have tried it.Sup Guys! The game ramps the difficulty extremely well by giving you access to stronger and stronger cars, culminating in the renaissance all rally fans know and love—Group B, then taking it an imaginative step further (AND giving us some of the most famous Group A cars ever known to boot!). The handling simulations for Dirt / Gravel / Snow / Rain are all familiar to a long time rally sim fan, and the environments are all crafted to give you a real feeling of the stages run in WRC.

--Aesthetic: Gosh dang is it good. From the simplified graphics to the square people that run away from (or into) your car, truly amazing.
--Handling / Difficulty: This felt on point to me. Starting, the game felt a bit difficult to control--but it's a rally game. High powered cars on dirt roads are hard to control. 

With time everything felt familiar, and as I broke into Group B / S the cars actually reminded me a lot of what I expect from them, based on my experience with Dirt series, and others that have tried it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971598047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1707997081}
review: Oh Yes! Yes!! Yes!!! The feeling when u put down the perfect drift then the turbo whooshes and blows. The gorgeous scenery going by as quickly as you dare. This is a Masterpiece. The psychics are spot on, only criticism is you can brake super late into bends. I'm so excited to unleash the group As only got to group 4's so far and coming 1st most of the time on master skill. Its so so satisfying perfecting the art of rallying. will provide replay for me trying to break into the top leaderboards. Truly Epic!!! time well spent

author: {'steamid': '76561197961388069', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1694634383}
review:

Für längeren Spielspaß ist auf jeden Fall gesorgt.
Ein direkter Multiplayer gegen Freunde wäre noch wünschenswert. Stattdessen gibt es aber immerhin tägliche und wöchentliche Online Events

author: {'steamid': '76561198356078845', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1141, 'last_played': 1700151059}
review: 画面等等都没有什么问题，问题就出在这该死的手感上面，要硬核不迎合的手感，我玩了九千多公里的wrc都没有遇到过这么滑的路面，在一个就是，在下雨天基本没法正常的跑，整台小车就像沾了水的肥皂一样到处乱飘，在撒丁岛下雨简直就是噩梦，随处可见的斜坡让我基本无法正常走出一条直线，再者就是重力，整个游戏的重力写得宛如在月球，只要一个细微的斜坡，你就可以飞出去老远，而且在德国和日本赛段，在下坡时不经意间和围栏蹭一下，你就可以放开双手直接起飞了，希望制作组能够认真的去玩一下自己做的游戏，下雨天滑的，太糟心了，好评给音乐和画面，手感我只能暂时给不及格，整个车为了能够让人轻易的在地上留下胎印，感觉就像把前轮钉死在路面了一样，漂移是漂移起来了，但是基本没法跑快，而且也没有路书这样的提示，对于整个硬核的操作设定来说非常说不过去，而且车辆除了颜色无法对车体进行任何调教，希望能够在后期努力做好吧。这个质量有点对不起这八十多块钱的价格啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561197973577725', 'num_games_owned': 6071, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1632607848}
review: Great little driving game with minimalist styling. Can enjoy casually just driving around or trying your darnedest to clear stages in time or beat your best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980590124', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1606423628}
review: Juegazo con una ambientación y  apartado visual exquisito y una banda sonora a la altura. Un juego de Rally diferente a lo habitual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018222581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 154, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1711668253}
review:
sin da subito si percepisce che i creatori di questo piccolo capolavoro sono appassionatissimi di Rally, pieno di curiosità reali sulle macchine, bellissime location e prove speciali, tante auto leggendarie. Anche le musiche e tutto lo stile è un vero inno ai mitici anni 80. Di questi tempi creare qualcosa dedicato al vero appassionato di rally è veramente raro. Unica pecca a mio parere sono i suoni dell'auto, potevano essere più curati, dato il pacchetto grafico minimale, e per questo fantastico e riuscito nello stile, si poteva creare qualcosa in più nel sound.
Grafica - 8/10
Gameplay - 9/10
Musica - 8/10
Sound - 5/10
Longevità - 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198202083537', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1626586295}
review: Beautiful game, the sound track, cars and the physics are really solid. If you're a rally nerd I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168952164', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1710247694}
review:
I just love it.

I thought it might be boring without other racers on the screen, but it's pretty nice.
You can't play, if you're angry. It has kind of a meditating effect.
It has kind of realistic physics (I don't know to which extend, but would not sort it to arcade), but is easy to learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971520236', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1675616582}
review: A little arcade racer full of nostalgia for the heydays of rally racing. Because they have no licenses to use any of the actual cars/tracks/sponsors they just went with funny nicknames and fake names. It givesthe game a bit of humor and personality. The lowpoly graphics aren't everyone's cup of tea, but I think they're endearing. The free DLC for 4k wallpapers is nice and shows that the devs know exactly what the main attraction of their game is to curious eyes. I am definitely not good at racing games, but the many options to lower the difficulty and free roam mode are good ways to get used to drifting a tiny rally car around dirt tracks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198371018116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1688627857}
review:
온보드 시점이 있었으면 정말 갓갓 게임이었을 듯 함. 
충분히 재미있고 조작이 꽤 어려운 듯
각도 큰 커브가 많기 때문에 의도적으로 오버스티어를 내서 더 크게 꺾어 들어가는 게 공략 포인트인 것 같다. 
비올 때는 적당히 감속 안전운행 하면서 돌아도 평소보다 ai들이 더 못달리는 걸 볼 수 있음. 
개인적으로는 자갈맵이 적당히 잘 미끄러지고 그립도 쫀쫀하게 붙어서 하기 좋은 것 같다. 
리버리가 좀 더 다양했으면 좋겠다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125271909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1674768696}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198018626026', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1712179567}
review:
It is a rally game in soul and spirit, packaged in a beautiful and accessible package.
This is a great homage to classic rally, tho the cars are not "real" it's close enough for you to figure it out. Pair the satisfying driving physics with a great soundtrack and visuals and you get a fun game you can easily play for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115829784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1606527359}
review:
As easy to control as a popsicle on a waterslide. Controls are inconsistent. Pretty sure this could be fixed with 3 hours of forum reading and 4 hours of tweaking and maybe 10 hours of frustrating 'get gud' gameplay but in the end of the day this isn't functional out of the box so i had to refund it almost instantly. Ain't nobody got time for this. 

Amazing how bad it handles and how far the controls are removed from the gorgeous presentation.

Also it's overpriced as hell.

review: This is a pretty damn good rally racing game.  The handling is suprisingly deep, the sound is great, and the art style of the game all impress.  This game is easily better than Dirt 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978670231', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 116, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1712270064}
review: art of rally is basically a fun way of taking a journey through the history of early rallying.  The whole game seems very nice for an arcade style racing game.  There is a good learning curve however, almost like arcade plus.  Graphics are really fitting along with the sound track.  All work for the time period being portrayed.  Control is perfect for this style of game, not too hard, but just the right amount of challenge.  A bonus for me was the daily route and weekly rally.  These really make the game fun as you can compare your time with the other players daily or weekly.  This game was very much worth it at full price so anything cheaper should be an instant pick up for a racing game fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018037315', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1660366383}
review: This is the most satisfying rally game I have ever played. No fiddling about with car settings, no hardcore sim stuff, just blasting cool cars through beautiful scenery with excellent music. Glorious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987284485', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1667510005}
review:
There is this saying “If you see a tree, you going to hit it” and boy, oh boy let me tell you… I saw a forest 
✅⠀Insanely beautiful graphic (or I have a thing for simplicity) 🌸
✅⠀Crowd is moving? WHAT?! HOW?! I didn’t saw that in rally game since… never, I never saw that. Amazing
✅⠀Replay and photo mode is better then 99% of “REAL” racing game out there
✅⠀Soundtrack HOLY SHIT it’s SLAPS
✅⠀Humour in this game is just perfect
✅⠀Physics feels great

⛔️⠀Maybe more cameras?
⛔️⠀Some of the car engines sounds meh

It is so fun I could not step away from the game, great arcade racer
YOU reading this, yes you GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198175440990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1606499559}
review:
Absolutely unplayable without a steering wheel / pedal set. Controller helps, but not much when you enter group b or group s.
Very limited camera angles. Difficult to grasp the speed and momentum when camera is so high up and far away. The physics are on the absurd end of the spectrum, could not get used to it nor the settings dialed in even after 10hrs of gameplay. The game is beautiful, but very demanding in terms of system requirements for what it actually is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278691959', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1633977599}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116522681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1628801521}
review:
Bu sene içimde alevlenen yarış oyunları arzumu daha da pekiştirmeyi başardı art of rally. Rallinin ortaya çıkışından 2000'lere kadar olan macerasını sezonlar eşliğinde bize sunan oyunda ana "event" olan zamanlı yarışlar haricinde pistlerde serbest gezinti de yapmak mümkün. Araçlar lisanlı araçlar değil fakat isimlerinden ve tasarımlarından günümüzdeki karşılığını bulabiliyorsunuz. Oynanış ise ne arcade ne de realistik. Tam ortası ama çok dengeli. Rallli aracı sürdüğünüzü hissedebiliyorsunuz. Genel olarak zorlayıcı bir yapısı var ama gamepad ile bir saat kadar bir sürede alışabildim ben. 

art of rally'de oynanışın önüne geçen muhteşem bir sanat tasarımı var. Fotoğraf Modu'nda sürekli "Bundan da iyi tablo olur ya" ya da  "Yok yok duvar kağıdı daha iyi olur bu" gibi cümleler söylerken buldum. Norveç'in beyazı, Japonya'nın kiraz ağaçları hiç bu kadar cezbedici olmamıştı.

Her şey güzel de art of rally belli bir süre sonra tekrara biniyor maalesef. Kariyerin yaklaşık yarısında neredeyse her şeyi görmüş oluyorsunuz. Sonlara doğru bıkkınlık oluşsa da ağzımda buruk bir tat kalmadığını belirtmem gerek.

Haziran 2022 Editi: İncelemeden sonra geliştirici Funselektor, Endonezya ve Kenya olmak üzere iki yeni ülke ekledi. Ayrıca yeni araçlar da mevcut.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995019009', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1615891945}
review:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF YOU DO NOT ALREADY KNOW HOW TO DRIVE IN RACING GAMES

The learning curve is incredibly steep and frustrating for newer players. It may look arcadey, but the driving system is complex. You WILL have the urge to throw your controller against the wall. At its current state there is also no tutorial to help you out.

That said, it's a very well made game. Just don't buy it thinking it'll be a cool little zen game to relax to. You'll have the exact opposite experience

author: {'steamid': '76561198148792263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1694603811}
review:
Edit: started playing again, the bugs I mentioned are essentially gone to my knowledge. Shit's fun as all hell 

Original:
It is fun, but on some occasions the physics bug out and there are certain conditions that make the physics engine behave weirdly.
If you are planning on buying this game, it is an ARCADE rally game. 
Physics problems such as: if you brush against a wall, you get turned around until you're facing the wall.
When you land there is a seemingly random chance to get turned the opposite direction, and you will most likely accelerate incredibly hard for about half a second.
Those are some examples, I've only found 4 in my playtime, but otherwise it's great fun and the art style is good-looking.
Highly recommended, but has some bugs to watch out for.

review:
I own Dirt 2.0, WRC9, ACC, and I would like to consider myself lean more towards Simulators.. 

But gawd damn this game tickles my silly rally fancy. 
Splendid art style, and a nostalgic feeling towards the old school Death Rally..

Guys, if you just want to have some arcade rally fun, hit sweet drifts, and see how a true group B driver "FLAT OUT's" through the wilderness and gorgeous landscapes.. boy oh boy, the price is right.

And the music is legit too. ;)

Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199042247036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1711599619}
review: This game really scratches an itch for me. I've always been drawn to racing games... I grew up playing Rad Racer, Super Sprint, R.C. Pro Am, Off Road, etc. Later on, I got into games like Top Gear, Virtua Racing, Rush, and Sega Rally. I was a fan of Absolute Drift, so I was anticipating the release of Art of Rally, and it does not disappoint. The game looks great, feels great, It is somehow minimal but still offers a challenging learning curve. The cars are super cool and have unique characteristics, and the groups offer a real feeling of graduation. It's still super fun to drive the slower cars even after driving the "best" ones. I love how tedious the terrain is, keeps you on your toes. I honestly haven't felt this drawn to a virtual driving experience in a long time, and I'm so glad I get to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305888576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1665209657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007126207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1606945247}
review:
Gioco dalla grafica estremamente appagante per quanto semplice ed una colonna sonora rilassante, semplice ed azzeccata.
Il gameplay è più profondo di quanto immaginassi all'inizio,  all'acquisto infatti pensavo fosse un gioco molto semplificato, ma il comportamento delle varie vetture è molto ben caratterizzato, sia per differenze di trazione anteriore e posteriore (sottosterzo e sovrasterzo) che per diversa potenza e comportamento nelle varie condizioni meteo e di terreno.

Una piccola perla, una piacevolissima scoperta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323572324', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1703291545}
review: I got this game three days ago and I am addicted. The trailer made me think it was a mobile style game at first, but I gave it a try and it was not. The amount of detail involved with the design of each car: sound, handling, and visuals is incredible. Every car feels unique and provides a different experience from the last. All of the tracks look beautiful and provides a challenge. Not to mention that aside from the 50 courses provided, you can free roam each of the four locations which is a wonderful feature. It is tons of fun to drift my favorite (unlicensed, but undoubtedly recognizable) classic rally cars through the four locations. Overall, this is by far the best game I have played this year and the most unique rally game I will probably ever play. I too thought the $30 price tag was a bit much, but I can assure you for the quality of the game and the enjoyment you'll get out of it is 100% worth it. This game is 11/10 props to funselektor. Also the sound track is pure gold!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067948444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1712468920}
review:
art of rally, i've been keeping an eye on this game for a while now and to no surprise it has exceeded what I was expecting.

Beautiful scenery of each rally stage and the music just sets the mood in just right. Every stage has its own challenges and so does every car you choose to drive.

If you like a challenge there's always the weekly and daily stages which you can compete against other players for the fastest time with the selected car.

Dont want a challenge? Perfectly fine, enjoy cruising around in freeplay unlocking collectibles or just doing stages for fun.

Definitely a game you can play to sit back and relax too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050845006', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1702948095}
review:
The most zen and the most white-knuckle driving experience you can have with a controller. Feels like the baby of Micro Machines with Dirt Rally. Absolutely recommended.

Visual style is whimsical and unique. Cars look authentic to their real world counterparts while still looking like a toy. Scenery is gorgeous and colorful, without compromising visual clarity. Music is chill and zen, perfect for disappearing into the background while you focus on the track. Car sounds are loud and authentic, and a joy to hear while you're tearing through the gravel.

The driving physics are tight and responsive, not being too difficult that you can't control with a gamepad, or too simplified; real driving concepts and techniques still apply here. Hit the brakes on a straight line, control the weight shift of the car, don't accelerate too hard so you don't oversteer, hit the handbrake on tight corners to throw the car around. Feels like absolute joy to get things right and carry speed through the corners. This game made me wish Dirt 4 had these physics.

Car progression is lovely too, as you go through the career mode you unlock increasingly faster cars, until you get to the fabled Group B. Each new class can be picked up in just a couple stages, and by the next rallies the speed will feel natural to you. Try out different cars, they all feel different and unique in driving style.

Overall, a joy to play and an absolute recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034561945', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1606428182}
review:
Ein tolles Spiel, das vor allem durch seine Atmosphäre, Fahrphysik und Lernkurve überzeugt. 

Die visuelle Umsetzung, der Synthiewave-Soundtrack und der Fuhrpark aus Rallye-Klassikern sorgt für ein sehr stimmiges Gesamtbild. 
Das Fahrverhalten der Autos ist recht anspruchsvoll. Bis man den Dreh (im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes) raus hat, braucht es einige Übung, aber dann macht es umso mehr Freude, mit dem Audi Quattro oder Peugeot 504 um die Serpentinen zu driften!
Die Karten sind im Großen und Ganzen wunderschön gestaltet. In den japanischen Bergen zwischen blühenden Kirschbäumen, norwegischen Eislandschaften oder inmitten deutscher Weinberge umherzufahren, man muss aufpassen, sich nicht durch die Panoramen ablenken zu lassen. Einzig die Sardinien-Karte finde ich etwas karg und eintönig gestaltet.
Das minimalistische und unaufdringliche Menü-Design ist angenehm und lenkt den Fokus voll auf das eigentliche Spielgeschehen. 

Das einzige Manko ist m.E. sind lediglichdie  fünf verschiedenen Karten, auf denen man fahren kann. Die einzelnen Etappen (jede Karte umfasst zehn verschiedene Etappen, wobei es im Prinzip sogar nur fünf verschiedene Etappen gibt, die dann jeweils "vorwärts" und "rückwärts" gefahren werden) wiederholen sich dadurch recht schnell. Zwar sorgen die verschiedenen Wetter-Szenarien hierbei noch für etwas Abwechslung, trotzdem wären insgesamt mehr Karten wünschenswert gewesen. 

FAZIT:  "art of rally"fängt die "Essenz" des Rallye-Sports perfekt ein. Eine gewisse Frusttoleranz sollte aufgrund des anspruchsvollen Fahrverhaltens der Autos aber vorausgesetzt werden. 

Anmerkung: Als Achievement-Sammler finde ich es schade, dass es für eines der Achievements nötig ist, 1000 (!) Etappen zu fahren -  somit rücken die 100% Komplementierungsrate in weite Ferne

author: {'steamid': '76561198011845466', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1667129358}
review:
Absolutely lovely game. Great selection of cars, all areas seem unique in a way and the arcady collectibles reminiscent of THPS help scratch that nostalgia itch.

review:
Rally.
I started playing Colin McRae Rally 1 for the PS1 when I was little and stayed interested in Rally until now, when I heard from this game. Then I became obsessed. review: Absolute banger of a game. The driving physics are perfect to chain a swooping drift through the gorgeous tracks, with the best game soundtrack I've ever heard urging you on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015573824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1709140368}
review:
Lots of love for the devs. you can feel the love for the rallysport in this game. 
It's harder than it looks. You don't do the setups for the cars but the handling feels a lot more sim-ish than anticipated. The look is beatiful and the soundtrack is awesome (80s synth). There are a lot of cars to unlock (recognizable rallycars from the 60s-90s), and every car feels slightly different. You also feel the differences in roadsurfaces.
So far I played 5h in the career mode and didn't reach 50%, and after finished i probably will still try to beat my records. So there is enough content to justify the pricetag (~20€). 

9/10 - would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198001444047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1706091041}
review:
It's a very nice game, though really not well optimized. It runs slower than Forza Horizon 4 or Dirt Rally 2.0 on a fairly powerful machine, and given what's on screen, this thing should fly. 
Also it would be nice to know the position and which % you are while racing (optional).
Another complaint is that while stages / countries should be random (right?), I've done Japan a whole lot more than any other circuit so far, like 50-60% of the time in the last 4 rallies.
Other than that, the difference in gameplay between the different cars is very welcome (and well made), but some of them are almost undriveable. I love a challenge, but sometimes it gets a bit too frustrating (Stratos in a rainy day, anyone?) for a game that should be "zen".

I agree with most of the reviews about the aesthetics and sound (both are great), even if I'm not a super fan of the extra liveries.

A nice little game, but I find other games more satisfying from a driving perspective. I find this one doesn't really know if it's arcade or a simulation, since some things are really not realistic (collisions) while others are really demanding, and personally, I have a hard time getting the "feeling" of how some cars have to be driven (and usually I'm quite good at that in all the other driving games I've played in the last 20 years).

Anyway, recommended, I still come back from more, so it's not bad!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129312780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1601104494}
review:
Jeu hyper sexy avec une très belle marge de progression. Du fun mais aussi pointu et peut vite devenir compétitif. 
La BO est plaisante. Art of rally se pose comme une alternative crédible aux fans du genre et pourra plaire aux nostalgiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041621712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1803, 'last_played': 1682658015}
review: A fantastic game to chill and zone out to between the sputtering of engines and the upbeat soundtrack. Cars have weight and at first feels like you're fighting them to gain control. Turns also struggle to feel great at first with all the assists on, but as you get better and start to ease off of the default control assistance, the experience gets more relaxing as you get better at drifting.

review: Art of Rally may seen like a very arcadey game from a distance, but the driving mechanics are filled to the core with techniques that are needed in rally driving, definitelly a game way more satisfying with assists turned off. author: {'steamid': '76561198042468025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1705207577}
review:
[b]リラックスしてできる良いゲームです。[/b]

　これまでは半重力だったりブーストでかっ飛ばしたりする種類のレースゲームを主にプレイしていました。
　現実世界の車の知識はほとんどありません。
　ですがこのゲームは車を走らせることの楽しさ、そして難しさを教えてくれます。

　メニュー周りからレース中の風景まで、とても単純ながら美しいデザインでまとまっていて素敵です。
　音楽もレースゲームらしさを備えつつ主張しすぎない良い塩梅です。
　おかげで視覚と聴覚へのノイズが少なくなり、レースゲームという形の禅をもたらすのです。多分。

　そしてフォトモードも搭載されています。レース中にもこの風景撮りたいなあと思ってしまいポーズをかけてフォトモードを起動しがちですが、ゴール後のリプレイ映像からでもしっかりフォトモードに移行できます。ありがたい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198077386112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1703941122}
review:
В этом городе сотни тысяч улиц. Вы назначаете мне время и место встречи.
Я даю вам окно в пять минут. В эти пять минут я весь ваш, чтобы не произошло. Всё что случится до и после этих пяти минут — меня уже не волнует. Я не беру в руки оружия. Я — водитель. Вы поняли?

review: Нереальное сочетание отличной музыки, интересного и приятного глазу дизайна на пару с увлекательным геймплеем. Здесь есть чем заняться, здесь можно проходить карьеру или просто кататься на открытых картах и искать секретки, которые пришли сюда из "Тони Хока". Стоит своих денег до самой последней копеечки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119920741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1688548664}
review: Обычно не пишу обзоры, но это отдельный случай. Игра порадовала гемпелеем, в который автор вложил душу. Отдельно хочу отметить отличный саундтрек.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993169749', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1606388927}
review: There's a lovely moment when, after many hours of banging into fences and failing to brake properly, you achieve a perfect drift around a corner into a crowd of onlookers.  Seeing them scatter as the smoke and dust kick up from the tires, as you desperately try to nail at least one of them before exiting the corner and revving on is wonderful.  Nice music too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110220944', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1606375474}
review:
只看了一眼就买了。就这美术风格，这操作手感，绝对是精品游戏。

但我是真的不会玩儿啊，这也太难了吧，对于一个完全不懂漂移的人来说。

可能这注定是是那种 “会了就是会了，不会就是不会” 的东西。

我是真的想把它玩儿好啊！这么美的赛道高手跑起来得有多流畅多好看啊。

但自己横冲直撞毫无章法地瞎摸索注定是没有收获的。

谁能教教我？真的。怎么玩儿好漂移？求助！

author: {'steamid': '76561198276868589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1693958358}

Honestly, these games don't come around often.

Artstyle/graphics: Fuckin Banger

author: {'steamid': '76561198035108794', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1614419582}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985483260', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1700308211}
review:
Truly a work of love for Rally Car Racing! 
Playing this game takes me back to days and nights watching the Lancia 037, the Fiat 131 Abarth and the Quattro, flying through dirt and tarmac. Graphics are stylish and render a sense of speed; sound is amazing with engine revving and screaming as you put the pedal to the metal.
If you love Rally Racing, you will love this game.

review:

Great, simple graphics with modern-tech take. The game play is addicting and has the same hook a rally-sim might have. review: This is the isometric rally game every single person who calls them self a race fan needs. The physics feel amazing, the art style is beautiful, the soundtrack is on point, and the car selection is hard to top. Funselektor absolutely knocked it out of the park with this one, and I bought this one on launch day with zero hesitation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108396444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1704749215}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035947091', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1693915987}
review:
It's a simplified rally experience with a different perspective (literally). It's like micro machines for big boys.

For me this is mostly a kind of zen game where I can zone out and do a bit of racing to kill time. There's some progression with unlocking cars and eras of rally, as well as a free roam mode that I haven't really played much of (I'll say why later).
You can tell with this game that Funselektor used their experience developing Absolute Drift when making this game. The cars in this game like to drift more than anything, which is good on the one hand, but not so much on another (again, more on this in a bit).

The game also has some nice details like a description of each rally era that gives the player more of an idea of how the sport evolved. Something that higher profile games ignore in my experience. They're too busy showing off the graphics and the simulation to be bothered giving you more of an experience with the sport itself.

You also notice that the fans and spectators are literally on the track. A bit of a callback to how in your face the sport was. Crowds of people would part like the Red Sea before Moses, and this game actually shows this in any capacity at all.

With the crowds however begins the drawbacks of the game, and I'm going to emphasise these more because I'm more of a critical person and I want to see this game get even better.

The crowds of spectators will often not move until your car brushes them aside. And while this is more an expected consequence of them being present, the spectators do sometimes block obstacles from view, such as the tombstones in Germany and the hay bales. There's also a place in one of the towns in Sardinia where they will float up to the rooftops of 2-story buildings when they move out of the way. It's funny at first, but seems like the devs got lazy there. Normally the spectators know what a wall is.

Next, and probably more importantly, is the driving physics. They're not perfect. Drifting is fine and cool and good and nice and all. But it's a bit too easy and you find the cars will oversteer all the time. Understeer doesn't exist in this game at all.
Steering is especially pronounced as the course changes inclination. Driving over a crest works about as expected, but driving through a dip increases the grip and steering sensitivity to rediculous amounts. Several times what you would expect. Couple this with the already oversteer-heavy controls, and going through dips becomes almost uncontrollable.

Now after you go through a dip, you'll probably go off the course and crash. But instead of crashing harder consistently causing more damage, and light bumps causing light damage, the damage system seems to be all over the place. I have it set on the hardest setting and I have many times hit a rock or railing at high speed and done no damage. Conversely I've lightly bumped into obstacles overcooking a turn and had my car start smoking. There's also never damage applied to more than one subsystem at a time. It always seems to pile up on one part per crash.

Also, I think you can pop tires. I believe it happened to me a couple times before release when I was playing the demo. I don't remember that happening at all to me post-release. Nothing seems to affect the car's performance other than suspension damage either. You can be spewing black smoke and still feel just as fast. Or even fire in one case.

The vehicle customisation in the game is alright. But there are [i]way[/i] too many camo skins. Rally cars don't get painted with camo. They just feel lazy and I don't like using any of them. There needs to be skins of actual liveries used in the actual sport. Not full detail of course, but I need to actually want to use these skins that I'm trying to unlock. Either that or they need to be cool like some neon livery that actually glows or something, not just a random pattern that was copy-pasted on.

Now. Something that the game really needs that would make me want to play Freeroam mode is multiplayer. And this is something that higher-profile games don't do well, so it's something that I was hoping to see. Leaderboards are for hardcore players and unless you're speedrunning they're not going to see any use. This is a chill game where a leaderboard doesn't make a lot of sense. I would much rather cruise around the free-roam maps with a few buddies or go head-to-head in rally races with or without collisions.

Also workshop support or DLC eras with cars. I need my Fiesta R2 and R3.

Overall it's a really good rally game that does something different. It's not as focus-intense as some other rally games while giving you enough realism to make it less bland. There are of course areas where it could be improved and I want to see it improved. I really enjoy it, and it would be great if didn't simply remain as just a simple rally game/sandbox just because it isn't made by Codemasters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010924653', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1646947517}
review: I nominated this for "The Best Game You Suck At" award- and for good reason. I love this game. the dynamic music, the landscape, the cars, the little references everywhere, its beautiful and stupendous. I also have not yet been able to go around a corner yet. I have probably over thousand hours between Forza Horizions 2, 3, 4, Forza 4, 6, and 8, not to mention various other racing games. I need you to understand how much experience I have with these games when I say once again I have not taken a corner with a Finnish flair to it. I love this game, but I have no idea how to play it properly. Buy this game. Go sideways. Watch your Finnish relatives smile from on high. (Yes, all your Finnish ancestors are dead. If this game is anything to go by, they flew through the pearly games sideways, smoking, and smiling, just like I soon will...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198193781958', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1624195182}
review: The scenery is gorgeous, the soundtrack is perfect, and the driving mechanics is both fun and challenging. You can try and be competitive and you'll enjoy it, but you can also just chill and have a zen moment or two while driving about. It truly is a wonderful game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211290313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1710550405}
review:
Un juego bastante interesante que combina lo minimalista con la historia del rally. 
No solo se trata de correr la pista y ya, la conducción a medida que avanzas la historia de cada grupo se torna más díficil, es un juego de meditación y práctica, además de mencionar que la banda sonora es bastante buena y adoc a cada mapa que te puede tocar e incluso el juego contiene un gestor de reparación para los rallys que contienen más etapas. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197968809754', 'num_games_owned': 4047, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1601511099}
review:
A scapito della grafica (molto artistica, ma non relistica) e della camera ad inseguimento dall'alto, questo gioco non è un semplice arcade da gustarsi a testa spenta, ma un gioco di rally che si prende molto sul serio.

Il gioco non è semplice, è impegnativo, soprattutto man mano che la potenza sale e le curve si stringono. Non dico che sia un simulatore, ma di sicuro premia se si usa lo stile di guida rallistico giusto... e al contrario punisce se lo si prende sottogamba.

Se potessi aggiungere qualcosa, renderei i nomi delle auto editabili, in modo che il player possa mettere i nomi veri dei modelli, che sono riconoscibilissimi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076416795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1630267845}
review:
Particularmente soy fan del rally por ende tenia que probar este juego, visualmente es una joya, los colores, los escenarios sobre todo cuando vas avanzando y ciertas zonas tienen un efecto de desenfoque eso es un buen toque.
la jugabilidad es buena claro que algo complicada al principio hasta que logras acostumbrarte, no hay muchos juegos de carreras como este, es totalmente recomendable, esta completo.

review:
It was an instant buy for me, which I don't usually do and I didn't regret it. It's an absolute love letter to rallying, with both iconic and lesser known cars, lots of in-jokes, fun handling, clean visuals and a thumpin' soundtrack.

It's good value proposition, so there is no reason not to, especially if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001962592', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2407, 'last_played': 1608047708}
review:
Pontos Positivos
-Gráficos bonitos e detalhados
-Boa quantidade de veiculos
-Pistas detalhadas e divertidas
-Tempo bom pra conclusão do modo carreira +- 20 horas

Pontos Negativos
-Desempenho um pouco abaixo do esperado, não consegui jogar no máximo
-Embora você não sinta o layout das pistas se repetindo, com o cenário em volta é o contrário, não há muita variação.
-Podia ter um multiplayer online

Jogo muito divertido e muito bem feito, recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126304471', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1610125839}
review:
Art of Rally - Un indé décalé 

A l’apparence très simpliste, ce jeu indé de type arcade vous offre la balance parfaite entre compétition et détente. La bande sonore est somptueuse et l’envie de bruler du pneu est à son paroxysme.

Article complet : https://infinity-area.com/article-art-of-rally-un-inde-decale

author: {'steamid': '76561198121890812', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1628753143}
review: Honestly the second i saw this on sale, I was in a place between games, but boy was i surprised. The soundtrack alone is a masterpiece, and the way the game does handling and needing practice to get a location down, is great. You do have a map but its only useful for remembering where you've been. But the kicker is that it wont keep track of that, I also like that the maps for races are randomly generated, makes it way more realistic, part of rally to me is not knowing what the next turn feels like until your on it, and this game captures that. Its to me a passion that the devs have for racing and i'm glad they showed it to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963814759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3494, 'last_played': 1669977174}
review:
First of all, big props to the developers for making an arcade rally game. I am looking for something like this since the good old Sega Rally, I would say.

[b]Positive:[/b]
+ Huge variety of rally cars and classes (Gr. 2, 3, 4, A. B. S) plus some special vehicles
+ Great soundtrack
+ Great sound design, car sounds are great
+ Great car handling for an arcade game. The cars behave differently enough to feel actually a difference in handling of each car, even if it is ever so slightly within one car class.
+ I personally like the look of the game very much, but not everyone might do so.

[b]Neutral/decent:[/b]
* There could be more stages and countries/areas for my taste. But as far as I understood the communication from the developer, they might add to that in the future.

[b]Negative/Issues:[/b]
- Sometimes, the cars behave a bit weird, especially if they are coming of a jump. On landing, the car might suddenly steer to the left or right, even without steering input. Seldomly, they also "sink" a bit into the ground or "bounce" oddly of the road surface.
- The AI times are based off the record times from actual players, which leads to some weird time differences on different stages, especially on higher difficulty levels. On a dry stage, you might struggle to beat the AI, while on snowy or rainy stages, you'll suddenly beat the AI by miles. This can also vary, depending on the country where the stage is situated. This definitely needs some improvement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075644125', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1699823461}
review: Art of Rally is a very relaxing game. Whenever I'm just chatting with friends or in a super chill mood and just want to listen to music, this is my new game. Car control requires just enough skill so it doesn't get boring, but is easy enough to let you zone out a little and not feel like you have to be really focused.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988760445', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2190, 'last_played': 1638466327}
review:
I beta tested this game for few years thanks to a free key by the dev, and the game was permanent to my account, given feedback, I only got around to finishing it officially now, I must say, the experience was worth it. Let's get to the details why this game is amongst, if not, the best indie racing masterpiece.

Art of Rally is a spiritual successor to Absolute Drift, another game made by funselektor and instead of drifting around tracks, warehouses and the likes, you can still somewhat drift but, you get to drive rally cars from the past, raging from Group 2 cars to the legendary Group B car, to the semi-newer legendary Group A ones, legends like Colin McRae's Impreza - the fujin or Tommi Makkinen's Lancer - the max attack. And synthwave banging in your ears. And by synthwave, I mean by lots of it. If this game won't make you an avid fan of it, I don't know what will.

The game is set on a top down view again but not into an isometric view, you have slight more freedom to look from the top and semi-behind the car, kinda like in a helicopter-style of view when you look from a TV of the actual rally going which is a decent touch. The reason for this, the game is an indie game and doesn't feature voices so no such thing as coordinates what's left and what's right. You have to take advantage of the top down camera to see the road and the turns ahead of you which is adding an arcade feeling to it which I like. Others might not.

Now, speaking of sounds, each car have been given unique sounds and impressively, they do sound VERY REAL. It is insane how amazing they sound. The brakes even glow if you look hard enough to the car. It's details like that that add that extra touch to the game.

If you haven't been convinced yet about the game, give the demo a short, through Finland and McRae's legendary Group B car - the 6R4. If you want to support a great indie racing game, please, buy art of rally AND it's soundtrack. You don't wanna miss out on this game.

One of the best racing games in a long time, and I damn well mean it. It even got free updates contained cars and Kenya. What are you waiting for? Get out there in your rally car, get it dirty and crack some records, make your country proud of your accomplishments!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073178969', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1704749010}
review:
I really enjoy this game, way more than I expected. The physics are very pleasing, the amount of content, both tracks, cars, weather conditions, free-roam maps, and more, is very generous for the price. The physics model and adjustable difficulty will allow any player to be challenged, or alternatively, have an easy and relaxing time playing the game. Considering all the cars have real world counterparts, but are themselves license-friendly models, I wasn't expecting much from the sound, but I was pleasantly surprised. Overall, a fabulous little game.

Nominated for the 'Sit back and relax' award.

review: This is a fantastic top-down driving game. The cars are varied and fun to drive. But most importantly this game is stunningly beautiful. There are constant new surprises. review: The best single player game I've played in years (and that's coming from a guy that hates racing games)! If you love rallying then you will love this game. author: {'steamid': '76561198320272684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1705578409}
review: Easily one of if not the best racing title in recent years. The artistic style, the music, the car selection, the physics, are all outstanding. I could recommend this game to anyone interested in cars, be it in rally or not (I had very little rally knowledge prior to playing). The game has some minor issues such as some flashing textures on some maps and some lag spikes, but these are very rare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797914713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1643406958}
review: spettacolo se unissero la fisica di art rally a dirt rally verrebbe un giocone ,e ci metto pure i tempi assurdi che fa l IA nelle fasi avanzate in dirt...che anche se fai tutto prfetto se ti va bene fai il 5 posto e a livello facile... e non è giusto oltre che scorretto nei confronti dei giocatori...Questa è una piccola perla fatta con il cuore e la passione per questo sport lo consiglio a tutti neofiti e non ..io sono innamorato di questa poesia di gioco che ha nel cuore tutta la passione possibile.Bravi cosi si fanno i giochi complimenti e ancore più complimenti perchè siete uno studio indie che supera di gran lunga i aaa con semplicita e tanto VERO gameplay. voto 9...non do 10 perchè mi sarebbe piaciuta anche una visuale dalla cabina anche se poco dettagliata andava bene ,ma capisco che è una scelta stilistica e l accetto..

author: {'steamid': '76561197987483074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1700308411}
review: While waiting for the more competitive Circuit Superstars to arrive in the neglected top down racer world, i pickedup this one. And I have to say it is actually pretty good and fun to play. It all about controlling the dynamic weight distribution by brake and throttle to drift consistently around the corners in a colorful landscape. Once you got used to shifting the weights of your car,  it becomes a flow like experience driven by nice synth wave soundtrack. Physics feels good and predictable and allows you to push the car to the limit. But I really miss something like a ghost or at least on track time difference to you record.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086662205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1699387193}
