author: {'steamid': '76561198113928474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1621020281}
review: art of rally is surely going to be one of those gems people miss out on, but those who find it love and cherish it. Unique style in a genre dominated by harsh, critical reality, brings a fresh breath of air to rally gaming. The art style is absolutely AMAZING! It's stylish, colorful, soft tone brings an easy on the eye experience that I think all users will find highly pleasing leaving you wanting to keep going just on the curiosity to see what else this studio has in the bag for the Art in this game. Soundtrack features a very fitting electro featured in their trailers that fits the mood of game very well and blends into the driving and scenery the way you would find in most area to area arcade games. To top it all off is the driving physics of the game. I personally play everything from Gran Turismo, Dirt Rally, Forza Motorsport to Test drive Unlimited, Forza Horizon and the list goes on and on. This game oddly comes off as simple when you first start but once you get in the world and start handling the vehicles i'd say it matches somewhere between Dirt Rally and Forza Horizon 4 with the sim handling set up. Its a very good mix that doesn't make it impossible to get into but offers a feel good challenge when you nail a tight bend or float around a crowd of leaping pogo sticks. No matter what you cup of tea is when it comes to racing games art of rally is a MUST BUY just for the unique experience alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081009029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1705113711}
review: Excelente jogo !!! Vale cada centavo :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198257810525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1694715007}
review:
Pretty fun casual racer. The art style is nice but also probably the reason why there are no little bumps and crests on the roads, it's all very flat except for the huge jumps. The road textures in general are very boring to look at. 
The car handling feels surprisingly good, although very slippery . There's a good selection of cars that to a some extent feel and sound different with their own characteristics. 
Overall art of rally leaves me thinking all the wasted potential it has. Grittier and rougher roads, better suspension system and physical damage would make a big difference.  Still fun to play with a game pad and the photography mode is amazing.  8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198018862001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1686080844}
review: Très bon petit jeu. Bien plus complexe qu'il n'y parait de loin. Très jolis graphiques et contenu plus que correct. Il serait sympathique de rajouter des ghosts afin de mieux comprendre nos erreurs et possibilités d'améliorations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002545469', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1685272916}
review:
I haven't played much of it yet but from what i've played I can confirm many of the reviews that state "Looks simple and basic, but feels challenging". That's a big compliment to the devs. Usually it's "What you see is what you get." In art of rally you get something that you don't see in the screenshots and trailers: A great handling model, beautiful tracks while it's much more challenging and deep than you might think. This game has been made with passion and by people who clearly seem to know a thing or two about rally racing.

It's not 100% my cup of tea as i prefer to enjoy pure arcade racers (Dirt 5 at the moment) so i might not play much of it, but if you like a good challenge, look no further. It's a surprisingly well crafted indie title. Even if i end up refunding it as it's not 100% for me, i want to recommend it to pure rally fans and everyone who has a weak spot for leaderboard challenges and artsy visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198875145221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1709194608}
review:
ラリーゲーム系が好きなら、買って遊んでみる価値のあるゲームです。
しかし、見下ろして運転する必要があるので好みが分かれる所です。スライド量をコントロールして運転できるようなるには慣れが必要ですね。かなり先まで道が見えるので、運転者視点がメインのラリーゲームと違い、ビギナーでも上手く運転できるのではないでしょうか。（見通しの悪いコーナーはあるので注意が必要）

挙動について
グラフィックとは違い、駆動方式の挙動やエンジンの特性を反映したものになっています。ただ、小さなギャップでも簡単にジャンプするので注意が必要です。エンジン音もとても良い音という訳ではありませんが、聞いていて心地良いサウンドで、運転操作に応じて効果音（ミスファイア等）が発生するので本格的です。背景に流れる音楽も癖がなくオンにしていても楽しめます。

敵車について
難易度Normalでプレイしましたが、私の腕では簡単に全てのステージを1位を取ることはできませんでした。ただ、総合優勝するのは比較的容易だと思います。リスタートなしでイベントを終えるとボーナスがあるといったゲーム的要素もあるのでほど良い面白さがあります。

車をアンロックするにはコツコツ走る必要がありますが、普通のレースゲームには収録されていない車種もあるので、長く楽しめる作品ではないでしょうか。DirtRally2.0のようなストイックさは無いけれど、本格的に車を運転する楽しみがあるゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197963059450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1672875456}
review: Thought the reviews may be a bit too positive. Then I played the game. The music is dope and the art is simple yet dope! The controls take a bit tweaking to get to your preference, very easy to do. I recommend a controller to play, I haven't used the KB+M, but I can imagine it being very difficult with KB+M. The game is fairly challenging, but I am terrible at driving games in general. I also found Bubbles's Little Green Bastard Truck so, 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103863604', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1691127520}
review: Absolutely love this game! The aesthetic of the minimalistic UI paired with the feel of the cars... Oh man. If you enjoy driving and/or racing games this is definitely worth checking out 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198073961133', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1169, 'last_played': 1647174456}
review:
Without a doubt one of the greatest videogames I have ever had the privilege to play. The atmosphere, visuals, controls, sound, music, performance is all perfect and combine together to make an experience that is absolutely seamless and genuinely fulfils its name by going beyond being just a game and entering the realm of a work of art.

I am a huge fan of rallying, both the present form of the sport and its entire historical lifetime, so the content of the game I can confidently say is made by people who are genuinely interested in, and genuinely dedicated to replicating, the historic feel of 1960s-1990s rallying. The wide range of cars and locations are beautifully accurate and encapsulate both the genuine articles as well as the popular fan conscience of what they should feel, look, and be like - it's a masterful balance that is no mean feat to pull off.

The game is designed for keyboard or controller use, but I use a Logitech G29 steering wheel and the game handles it perfectly anyway - cars control very well and with sufficient time tweaking the controls to fit my needs I am very confident in throwing them sideways into corners or even using more advanced techniques like clutch kicking or stomping the accelerator entering a turn to throw the rear end out much like in the real-world equivalent.

The soundtrack I love enough that I bought the album on Bandcamp from the game's musician's account directly, it's a brilliant homage to 80s synth and electronic music - the game's sounds outside of the music such as car noises are spot-on too, it properly feels like you have hundreds of horsepower at your beck and call.

Performance-wise I have had zero issues - I run the game on a slightly older but still decent PC, with an i5-6600K CPU and an original GTX 1070, and I would comfortably say despite it no longer being particularly high-end, the game is not resource-demanding in the slightest and these two components easily run well above what the game requires.

Overall, as I have reached the last two years of Group A in the game's career mode and polished off finding all the collectables in freeroam mode, I feel I can greatly recommend this game to anyone looking for a highly enjoyable racing / rallying game that recreates a golden era of motorsport, doesn't need simulator levels of expense and preparation, yet is also looking for something to enjoy putting a bit of work into to progress with. It has been a fabulous experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970744680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1702706264}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032740557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1610709143}
review:
What a beautiful game. A great reminiscence to the time when rally games didn't have cutting edge graphics and hundreds of licensed cars - but were actually tons of fun.

Add an almost meditative experience here, as Art of Rally's race tracks and sound tracks melt into a flow that manages to both push your adrenaline and calm you down at the same time. Definitely a recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994794367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1645888968}
review: Fantastic game!! Nice graphics, cool soundtrack and a great selection of cars that are satisfying to drive. Very fun yet challenging. I like!

author: {'steamid': '76561198387933719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1606181795}
review:
its a simple rally game with good music, and gameplay, even if its just rallying with different cars with different paints. You arent short of cars to pick from either! You go all the way up to Group A cars, along with some side cars, like vans, a huge truck, a log carrier, and a little 3 wheeler! 

if you like rallying from a topdown-ish like camera, and a simple poly like style similar to #drive, then you'll enjoy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198297317032', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1705967074}
review: An amazing little game. If you're a fan of rally or racing in general, pick it up it's worth it!! I played the demo when it came out. Great controls and easy to pick up, the visual style is unique for this genre and super pleasing, and the sound design is chef's kiss. Buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989535096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1628936686}
review:
It's quite nostalgic, from collecting letters (Skate and earlier games), collecting music cassettes (JSR, JSRF), driving and collecting (San Francisco Rush). So that brings a smile.
Then the graphics, they are really gorgeous, especially with the evening lighting. The sound and music are both excellent (there's a soundtrack to buy after all) which do help you lose yourself in the game.
The gameplay is excellent too, control is a little tricky on certain corners and over jumps, but I think you can get gud. And they didn't put that tree there for me not to hit.
It's so good, thoroughly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098000425', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1700372667}
review:
First off. This game features some of the most beloved companies, Exhaust, Oil and Righto.

If you enjoy Sim racing as much as I do, don't get upset if you fall in Love and your significant gets jealous Full clutch dumps with proper e-brake and fantastic "borderline Sim" handling. It is just fantastic as long as you turn abs and traction stability stuff completely off, turn up the difficulty.

If you enjoy Arcade racing or Relaxing games, this is absolutely for you. The graphic design and art in general is minimalistic and incredible, depth of field is just yummy. Hours of Incredible music by Tatreal, check out his bandcamp. You can buy the entire soundtrack from him for a fraction of the price in HQ formats, Support. Just leave the settings on play on not to difficult and enjoy the ride.

This game is theraputic for Casual racers and gamers of any age.
And for Hardcore sim racers this game is theraputic for other reasons, you know what I mean.

Beautiful Audio. The Vehicle selection is just pure Yes. Courses are amazing and well thought out, Prettiest game of 2020.
Hardcore enough for the Pros and Chill enough for the Casual.
I cannot recommend this game enough!

11/10

Ripping down country road 
Bunch of spectators blocking road
They disperse, I smash into wall
I should have slowed down
They were happily in front of the turn I could not see
This is awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198289723686', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1606137054}
review:
在选择旗帜的地方，这个游戏把中国、香港和台湾并列起来，并且命名为国家。就这一点，我就直接差评了！！
然后是机翻的问题，把手动挡写成手册，绝对是机翻的。

总之，要不你就把国家写成国家和地区，要不你就去掉香港和台湾，要不就拜拜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055130000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1688807807}
review:
Samir, you'll break the car! Please, Samir! :)

This game is great. The design style rocks, there is a surprising amount of content, the blurbs (and car names) are hilarious, the music is spot on, the driving is just complicated enough (although the group b cars are a handful - that's how they should be :) An easy game to jump into, a difficult game to master.

The only niggle I've found so far are the occasional frame drops (something to do with the vegetation; the developer is on it, I gather*), and some tracks might feature weird, nearly invisible corners you'll bump into.

*It's the damn trees! In rally, trees really aren't your friends :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034777114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1634968978}
review:
Honest review by a professional Rally Racer:

This game does things a little different than other titles that simply offer a rally driving experience.
Art of Rally does simply what the title offers; Art.
The art style in this game is awesome. It's colourful, detailed and relaxing.
The driving is also awesome in this game, while simple, it's still challenging.
No corner is the same, each time I am spit out reacting differently.

The cars are also very well put together in this title. Down to iconic machines with legendary liveries.
Sound effects are excellent. Small details like exhaust flames are included as well.

The music in this game is fun yet relaxing.

All in all, I would rate this game an 11/10.

Also, I am not a professional Rally Racer. I do live in Canada though and drive with all the other idiots on the road during snow storms so I would say I am the next closest thing to a professional driver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041187732', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 4680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1711069325}
review:
This game is SO damn good. I cannot believe this game is less than $40. The physics are awesome, the learning curve is somewhat steep, and it is incredibly satisfying when you have a good run. 

Love at first sight. I absolutely recommend this game to anyone who wants to just relax and drive to a chill groove. The soundtrack is as incredible as the game itself. I cannot find anything I dislike about this game, that's a first for me in a very, very long time. If you're considering buying this game, just do it and save yourself the regret of waiting. It's so fun. 

I hope some day they implement a legitimate co-op/multiplayer mode for the lulz, what a riot that would be.

EDIT: THEY ADDED KENYA AND HONESTLY THE UPDATE IS PERFECT HOW DOES THIS GAME GET SO MUCH BETTER EVERY TIME THEY UPDATE IT

EDIT 2: OH MY FUCKIGN GOD INDONESIA WAS JUST ANNOUNCED.

author: {'steamid': '76561199003649532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 40, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1712502167}
review:
I've dabbled in my rally games, it's my favorite racing genre. I'm not great, but loved playing everything from RalliSport Challenge on the og PS against my brother, to Dirt 2.0 on PC. I saw this on sale today never knowing the game existed... and it is absolutely worth the $20 (hindsight, it's worth the $25 at regular).

It's relaxing, which sounds weird for a racing game, but this just feels so clean and smooth and flowy. It feels less like a racing game and more like an adventure.

Physics-based, good sound design, awesome visuals, good mix of arcade feel w/ drifting, easy to get a feel for, and it has my Swedish brick in it. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198053887547', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1606092389}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993956149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1707619140}
review:
I received this game as a birthday gift. Disappointing game after playing Absolute Drift (predecessor game, same company) to 100% a few years back (still no custom map support really?).

Handling (I play on keyboard) feels awful on 90% of vehicles. It's laughable how easily you can slip and slide off of tarmac whereas you can drive perfectly fine off the road (even in snow). It just doesn't feel right (or mad coz bad). If you ever redline, friction just ceases to exist. Good luck braking at top gear without spinning out (some cars / terrains are alright). I've found by going off the road (which applies an instant decrease to speed and acceleration because stay on the road? lol) to be a more effective measure than using the car's brakes. Questionable game design but I sort of understand it.

The game also teleports you back to the road with a time penalty when it deems you are driving too fast off the road. This wouldn't really be a problem but it is automatic and inconsistent. Sometimes I fly off the road and it doesn't teleport me. At other times i brake off the road slowly and get teleported when I am barely off the road. Don't try cutting hairpin turns too deeply either. This is a frustrating mechanic and it would be nice if it could be disabled (manual relocation only).

Another annoying part of this game is crashing (more of a mad-coz-bad segment here). Any sort of crashing and suddenly your speed goes to zip. The engine just turns off because you bumped into a barrier or a hay stack side-on for a moment. In other games you can still accelerate and recover. Spinning out because of a dumb cornering yet still driving out of it calm and collected was a fun highlight of playing some other car games (dirt rally, furidashi, assetta corsa, etc). Here you can't. This game you also can't brake and accelerate at the same time. Crash and you have to wait a penalized few seconds to start accelerating back to speed again. If you don't crash you're fine though, but this still seems wonky to me.

Playing through the story-mode was also a huge chore. Everytime you finish a long rally session your forced to go through this "unlocking" screen that you can't skip. Your forced to listen to some children scream "Yay~~~~~~" with some party poppers going off EVERYTIME you unlock a new car, decal (most look terrible or average), etc. This was the one of the more frustrating things I've encountered in a game; just spamming buttons to try to skip an excruciatingly long and unnecessary game segment (and you can't alt-tab out of the game to wait it out). I play a story mode rally and get punished for it with multiple unlocks and multiple cheers. Obnoxious. Very terrible game design choice IMO.

Lastly, I was expecting a rally-ish game but I have to adjust my driving drastically compared to some other games like Dirt Rally. The handling while driving and friction of the road feels off. Cars also can accelerate through gears ridiculously fast. This shouldn't be that big of a deal being more of an Arcadey car game but I feel like it falls short of expectations.

Overall I'd rate this game a 2.5/5. Game felt more frustrating than pleasant to play. However, there were a few "heavier" cars to play that felt better to play (more friction) so it wasn't entirely bad. I wouldn't recommend this game to anybody since I did not enjoy most of the 17 hours of playtime. However, if you like a form-over-function type of game and don't mind figuring out the different physics perhaps this game may be for you. I'm quite glad I chose to wait on this purchase because I would've felt much more bitter if I spent my money on this game.

Disclaimer: There are some good aspects of the game. It looks pleasant for the most part, although some maps have some weird stuff going on like tombstone-shaped road barriers in the German maps. That's about all I can come up with. Oh, running over the A.I. crowds can be sorta fun. Usually they magically dash at lightning speed out of the way of your 80-100mph car but occasionally you can hit some of them.

review:
Never played a racing game that had such lousy, unenjoyable and unrewarding controls from the get-go.

Will it get better with time and practice? Probably. But for a game that's relying on its aesthetics and soundtrack to sell itself as a light and accessible arcade racer, it just feels like it fails at what it's supposed to be doing. I haven't been this disappointed ten minutes into a game in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969559604', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1628856551}
review:
Good racer. In a time in my life where I really only spend time on games that are the ones that really demand your full attention (read: the real triple-A games that come out each year) it was surprising to me that I kept coming back to this time after time until I finished the career mode. I got really good at it, too.

Now, I had bought and overall disliked this developer's previous game, Absolute Drift, years ago. But I gave this one a shot and really enjoyed it. I will say that this game may look pretty plain and simple, but it isn't the lightest when it comes to hardware, really making my five year old 4790K and GTX 980Ti really show their age - it probably has higher demands than even Dirt Rally 2.0, though don't quote me on that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969617634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3110, 'last_played': 1636602673}
review: A fantastic tribute to classic rallying. The graphics are simple, bright and purposeful, the car physics are great (especially after you've tweaked the controls to your liking) and the homages to the rallying greats are spot-on. I'm not even that good at racing games but I'm constantly trying to beat my best times or learn how to get through stages that much faster because it's so much fun. The photo mode is great and I love getting snaps of great moments though I wish you could also record short clips. This is a fantastic game for anyone who loves rallying and might also want to play a racing sim that just has a unique feel and aesthetic.

review:
[h1]Игрушечный Colin McRae Rally.[/h1]

art of rally - это признание в любви истории ралли.
Игра дарит приятные впечатления комфортным вождением, симпатичным визуальном и общей "ламповостью" игры. Если ты ищешь что-нибудь необычное в жанре раллийных гонок – скорее всего это то, что тебе нужно.
И, конечно же, вы будете наслаждаться великолепной low-poly графикой, и не один раз захотите остановиться и запечатлеть красивый кадр в фоторежиме.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143942624', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1700403409}
review:
While it may lack in locations this game is fantastic.
Visually it's absolutely beautiful yet simple. The sound track is so chill and fits the aesthetic perfectly. Then the game it self, with a large selection of cars that all feel different it can be a challenging game, but not something you would find yourself getting annoyed at.
I've spent so much time in the photomode and going through replays.
Like i said at the beginning could possibly do with some more locations, while each location has multiple configurations there is only 5 countries.
Other than that small gripe I'd recommend this to any fan of racing games, Drift or dirt. Especially if they enjoy the group b cars

author: {'steamid': '76561197970326025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1640993621}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966197080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 17808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3108, 'last_played': 1648146805}
review:
Despite the arcade art style, the [u][b]physics[/b][/u] in this game is of [u][b]simulation[/b][/u] level.

I play a lot of rally simulation games like DiRT Colin Mcrae, Richard Burns Rally (RSRBR). And the physics in Art of Rally is indeed simulation oriented. You can feel the grip of each wheel, the weight of the car shifting around during cornering, the difference horsepower output at different engine rev speed, etc.

However, despite being simulation oriented, Art of Rally is [u][b]a light game[/b][/u]. It does not have all those car modification such as suspension tuning, gear box tuning, and everything. [u][b]Art of Rally provides you an easy way into simulation rally with its pre-tuned cars[/b][/u]. It is very enjoyable to go into some light simulation rally in Art of Rally, but if you aim to play some heavy rally game with extensive tuning, then RBR or DiRT might be better for you.

A good thing about Art of Rally is that you don't have to use a wheel to play this game, [u]keyboard with default setting is good enough to enjoy it.[/u] [i](Though wheel is definitely a must if you want to top the leader board)[/i]

[hr][/hr]

Take the physics part aside, the [u][b]art style[/b][/u] in this game is just [u][b]fabulous and fantastic[/b][/u]. It is called "Art of Rally" for a good reason.

Instead of the boredom in most other simulation games, the art style in Art of Rally gives you a relaxation and zen-like feeling. It makes you feel like an artist, painting a beautiful curve when you drift.
The music is also absolutely fantastic. My words cannot describe how good the music is, but you can read other reviews to get a sense of how to music feels. It is just very zen-like and meditational.

[u][b]This game makes rally an art[/b][/u].

[hr][/hr]

Physics: Good [i](simulation oriented physics)[/i]
Art style: Fabulous

The positive reviews are real~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198324221931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 23, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1712168689}
review:
this game slaps. its got good music, pretty visuals, and good gameplay. its a little choppy on my macbook, but its a macbook, what did you expect?

Edit: Still playing this game, it's still good. The updates always make it better (and run better AFAIK). Playing with a controller is better for sure but still could use some things fixed like accelerator curve and being able to steer at minute angles. also if you play on a lower-end macbook (im on a 12-inch 2016 macbook), whenever there's a lot of trees it gets really choppy and theres a bad frame delay so everything feels floaty (pls fix)

but the lag on my garbage laptop considered, this game is still amazing, runs suprisingly well (40FPS on finland maps, still has annoying frame delay)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027662110', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1691157873}
review:
[22.03.2021]
The last update seems to have come with major stability improvements! Thanks! I can finally play this game jittery free! Full on recommondation.
[07.12.2020]
The latest update seems to have improved the performance quiet a bit. However there are still jitters. I still recommend you try the demo first before buying the game.
[15.11.2020]
As good as this game is gameplay wise and artistically I cannot give out a recommondation just yet. This game is in desperate need for optimization as I (and judging from other community posts, not only AMD) and many others are experiencing massive lag spikes almost every 2 to 3 seconds making this game frustrating as all heck. (AMD 5700 XT, i7-4770 CPU, 16GB of RAM). I hope the devs can get this issue sorted soon but for now I have to take a break from it until patches are released.
Don't get me wrong this game is lovely and I really want to play it. Your experience may vary. For now I would test the game out on your machine before you buy it. Get it through other means like library share with a friend to make sure this game runs smoothly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025901385', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1694097080}
review:
I definitely recommend this fun and somewhat casual rally game.  I don't consider myself a sim-racer but I have been playing game series like Forza, Dirt, Burnout and Flatout for years.  This game lies somewhere in-between arcade and sim with a less-than-serious aesthetic but surprisingly engaging driving.  The handling reminds me of the original Flatout in that it is not a full simulation yet demands reasonable driving input.  Be careful or you will crash, unlike something like Burnout where you just apply full left or right and scrape the wall.  A lot of people compare art of rally to Dirt Rally, but I feel that Dirt Rally is much more of a simulator than this game is.  The biggest downside to art of rally is the high camera angle which makes judging elevation changes or crests kind of hard.

Anyway, if you wish the '80s and Group B never ended than buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198428745520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1699075415}
review:
The car sounds are great. The little historical blurbs that describe each car are interesting and funny. The game is very satisfying to learn. If you don't play driving games (you should) you might have a hard time driving at first.
I love this game, it doesn't take itself too seriously, but it's a serious game. Nice work.
